name: nf-core airrflow
text_content:
Tool Name: nf-core airrflow
Description: nf-core/airrflow is a bioinformatics best-practice pipeline to analyze B-cell or T-cell repertoire sequencing data. The input data can be targeted amplicon bulk sequencing data of the V, D, J and C regions of the B/T-cell receptor with multiplex PCR or 5' RACE protocol, single-cell VDJ sequencing using the 10xGenomics libraries, or assembled reads (bulk or single-cell). It can also extract BCR and TCR sequences from bulk or single-cell untargeted RNAseq data. It makes use of the Immcantation toolset as well as other AIRRseq analysis tools. The pipeline is built using Nextflow, a workflow tool to run tasks across multiple compute infrastructures in a very portable manner. It uses Docker/Singularity containers making installation trivial and results highly reproducible.
Functions: Local alignment
Topics: Allergy, clinical immunology and immunotherapeutics, Immunoinformatics, Immunology, Immunoproteins and antigens, Phylogenetics, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Single-cell sequencing
Homepage: https://nf-co.re/airrflow/4.3.0/
Documentation: https://nf-co.re/airrflow

name: metaGEM
text_content:
Tool Name: metaGEM
Description: Reconstruction of genome scale metabolic models directly from metagenomes.

A Snakemake-based workflow to generate high quality metagenome assembled genomes from short read paired-end data, reconstruct genome scale metabolic models, and perform community metabolic interaction simulations on high performance computing clusters.

metaGEM integrates an array of existing bioinformatics and metabolic modeling tools using Snakemake, for the purpose of interrogating social interactions in bacterial communities of the human gut microbiome. From WMGS datasets, metagenome assembled genomes (MAGs) are reconstructed, which are then converted into genome-scale metabolic models (GEMs) for in silico simulations of cross feeding interactions within sample based communities. Additional outputs include abundance estimates, taxonomic assignment, growth rate estimation, pangenome analysis, and eukaryotic MAG identification.
Functions: Metabolic network modelling, Modelling and simulation, Sequence assembly
Topics: Endocrinology and metabolism, Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, Sequence assembly, Workflows
Homepage: https://github.com/franciscozorrilla/metaGEM
Documentation:

name: OpenMS
text_content:

Includes over 200 standalone (TOPP) tools that can be combined to a workflow with the integrated workflow editor TOPPAS. Raw and intermediate mass spectrometry data can be visualised with the included viewer TOPPView.
Functions: Annotation, Chromatographic alignment, Comparison, Data handling, Deisotoping, Formatting, Isotope-coded protein label, Label-free quantification, Labeled quantification, Mass spectra calibration, Mass spectrum visualisation, Parsing, Peak detection, Peptide identification, Prediction and recognition (protein), Protein feature detection, Protein identification, Protein quantification, Retention time prediction, Spectral analysis, Splitting, Standardisation and normalisation, Target-Decoy, iTRAQ
Topics: Metabolomics, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment
Homepage: http://www.openms.de
Documentation: http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/pub/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/index.html

text_content:
Tool Name: neXtProt
Description: neXtProt was an innovative knowledge platform dedicated to human proteins. This resource contained a wealth of high-quality data on all the human proteins that are produced by the 20'000 protein-coding genes found in the human genome. The content of neXtProt was continuously extended so as to provide many more carefully selected data sets and analysis tools. neXtProt data and tools have been archived.

text_content:
Tool Name: Spacedust
Description: Spacedust is a modular toolkit for identification of conserved gene clusters among multiple genomes based on homology and conservation of gene neighborhood. Spacedust adapts the fast and sensitive structure comparisons of Foldseek and homology search capabilities of MMseqs2. It introduces a novel approach of aggregating sets of homologous hits between pairs of genomes and identifies cluster of hits with conserved gene neighborhood between each using agglomerative hierarchical clustering algorithm.

The data are complemented with self-performed annotation methods, i.e. BLAST vs. all enzyme annotations from Swiss-Prot and BrEPS enzyme pattern recognition.

It uses the SILVA rDNA databases, taxonomies, and alignments as a reference. It facilitates the classification of rDNA reads and provides a wealth of results (tables, graphs and sequence files) for download.

text_content:
Tool Name: Marine Metagenomics Portal
Description: The Marine Metagenomics Portal (MMP) hosts the marine databases MarRef, MarDB, MarFun, and SalDB. These databases provide the marine scientific community with openly accessible, comprehensive microbial genomics and metagenomics resources, including high-quality, manually curated sequences. The user-friendly web interface allows visitors to easily navigate and refine searches within the contextual databases and offers additional BLAST searches, visualizations, downloads, and workflows (via META-pipe).

name: PHIStruct
text_content:
Tool Name: PHIStruct
Description: PHIStruct is a phage-host interaction prediction tool that uses structure-aware protein embeddings to represent the receptor-binding proteins (RBPs) of phages. 

By incorporating structure information, it presents improvements over using sequence-only protein embeddings and feature-engineered sequence properties — especially for phages with RBPs that have low sequence similarity to those of known phages.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Bioinformatics, Computational biology, Machine learning, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Proteomics, Virology
Homepage: https://github.com/bioinfodlsu/PHIStruct
Documentation: https://github.com/bioinfodlsu/PHIStruct

name: PHIEmbed
text_content:
Tool Name: PHIEmbed
Description: PHIEmbed is a phage-host interaction prediction tool that uses protein language models to represent the receptor-binding proteins of phages. It presents improvements over using handcrafted (manually feature-engineered) sequence properties and eliminates the need to manually extract and select features from phage sequences.

Topics: Bioinformatics, Computational biology, Machine learning, Proteins, Proteomics, Sequence analysis, Virology

Documentation: https://github.com/bioinfodlsu/phage-host-prediction

name: MMseqs2
text_content:
Tool Name: MMseqs2
Description: MMseqs2 (Many-against-Many sequence searching) is a software suite to search and cluster huge protein and nucleotide sequence sets. MMseqs2 is open source GPL-licensed software implemented in C++ for Linux, MacOS, and (as beta version, via cygwin) Windows. The software is designed to run on multiple cores and servers and exhibits very good scalability. MMseqs2 can run 10000 times faster than BLAST. At 100 times its speed it achieves almost the same sensitivity. It can perform profile searches with the same sensitivity as PSI-BLAST at over 400 times its speed.

MMseqs2 includes Linclust, the first clustering algorithm whose runtime scales linearly With Linclust we clustered 1.6 billion metagenomic sequence fragments in 10 h on a single server to 50% sequence identity.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence clustering, Sequence similarity search, Taxonomic classification
Topics: Gene and protein families, Metagenomics, Nucleic acids, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Taxonomy
Homepage: https://mmseqs.com
Documentation: https://github.com/soedinglab/MMseqs2/blob/master/README.md

text_content:

name: SCOPE
text_content:
Tool Name: SCOPE
Description: Set of programs aimed at identifying novel cis-regulatory elements from groups of upstream sequences. It does not have any nuisance parameters so does not require the user to guess what the results might be. It is also very robust to noisy data and is still 50% as accurate even in the presence of 4-fold noise. It can also identify other genes in the genome that might be coregulated with the original gene set.
Functions: Over-representation analysis, Regulatory element prediction, Sequence motif discovery, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Gene expression, Gene regulation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://genie.dartmouth.edu/scope/

It can help characterize 3&apos, and 5&apos, termini of cDNA inserts by detecting sequence features such as vector fragments, adapter/linker sequences, insert-flanking restriction endonuclease recognition sites, and polyA or polyT tails.

text_content:
Tool Name: Grammar String
Description: Novel representation of noncoding RNA secondary structure. By encoding both the sequence and secondary structure of ncRNAs in a string, ncRNA structural alignment is converted to sequence alignment. The software package provides an ncRNA consensus secondary structure derivation tool.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction, Sequence alignment, Structure alignment
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.cse.msu.edu/~achawana/grammar-string/
Documentation: http://www.cse.msu.edu/~achawana/grammar-string/index.htm

name: ImpG-Summary
text_content:
Tool Name: ImpG-Summary
Description: Software package implementing methods for imputation from summary statistics and accompanying data. The software takes as input 1000 Genomes reference haplotypes and summary association statistics at a typed set of SNPs from a GWAS or meta-analysis. It outputs summary association statistics at all 1000 Genomes variants.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA polymorphism, GWAS study, Genomics, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bogdan.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/software/impg/
Documentation: http://bogdan.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2013/07/ImpG_v1.0_User_Manual_31July13.pdf

name: INSECT
text_content:
Tool Name: INSECT
Description: Easy-to-use and powerful web server for biologists analysing genomic sequence data for in silico cis-regulatory modules prediction and analysis.
Functions: Gene regulatory network analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.ibioba-mpsp-conicet.gov.ar/INSECT2/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.ibioba-mpsp-conicet.gov.ar/INSECT2/help.php

name: ILbind
text_content:
Tool Name: ILbind
Description: Consensus predictor that combines the two complementary inverse ligand binding predictors implemented using FINDSITE and SMAP and Support Vector Machines.
Functions: Protein interaction prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein interactions, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://biomine.cs.vcu.edu/servers/ILbind/
Documentation: http://biomine.cs.vcu.edu/servers/ILbind/#Help

name: ATRHunter
text_content:
Tool Name: ATRHunter
Description: Software that finds and displays approximate tandem repeats (ATR) in DNA sequences. An approximate tandem repeat (ATR) in a genomic sequence is a string of nucleotides repeated consecutively at least twice with some small differences between the repeated copies.
Functions: Repeat sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.cs.technion.ac.il/labs/cbl/atrhunter/ATRinformation.htm
Documentation: http://www.cs.technion.ac.il/labs/cbl/atrhunter/ATRinformation.htm

name: PsRNA
text_content:
Tool Name: PsRNA
Description: Identify putative sRNA regions through the information retrieved from the sRNA of interest.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioserver1.physics.iisc.ernet.in/psrna/
Documentation: http://bioserver1.physics.iisc.ernet.in/cgi-bin/psrna/PsRNA-documentation.pdf

name: Amordad
text_content:
Tool Name: Amordad
Description: Database engine for comparing metagenomic data at massive scale. It first obtains the sequence signature of metagenomes and organizes them as points in high dimensional space.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Topics: Metagenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://smithlabresearch.org/software/amordad/
Documentation: https://github.com/smithlabcode/Amordad

name: PRBP
text_content:
Tool Name: PRBP
Description: Platform for prediction of RNA binding proteins using sequence information.
Functions: Protein interaction prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Proteins, RNA
Homepage: http://www.cbi.seu.edu.cn/PRBP/
Documentation: http://www.cbi.seu.edu.cn/PRBP/instructions.php

name: POPISK
text_content:
Tool Name: POPISK
Description: Support vector machine and weighted degree string kernel to predict immunogenicity of HLA-A2 binding peptides.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Immunology, Protein properties
Homepage: http://140.113.239.45/POPISK/
Documentation: http://140.113.239.45/POPISK/help.php

name: QUERY_WIN
text_content:
Tool Name: QUERY_WIN
Description: Retrieval program with a graphical user interface for ACNUC databases . It can query any ACNUC database, e.g., for nucleotide of protein sequences.
Functions: Database search
Topics: Nucleic acids, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/software/query_win.html
Documentation: http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/software/doclogi/docacnuc/acnucwin/acnwian/aquerywin.html

name: PTest
text_content:
Tool Name: PTest
Description: Software for case-control genetic association studies in human gene mapping. The software is based on single-SNP p-values resulting from an association test, for example, the chi-square test comparing genotype or allele frequencies in cases and controls.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Mapping, Pathology
Homepage: http://www.jurgott.org/linkage/PTest.html
Documentation: http://www.jurgott.org/linkage/PTest.html

name: LabCaS
text_content:
Tool Name: LabCaS
Description: New computational approach for accurate prediction of the calpain substrate cleavage sites from amino acid sequences.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: Machine learning, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/LabCaS/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/LabCaS/Readme.htm

name: AmphoraNet
text_content:
Tool Name: AmphoraNet
Description: Webserver implementation of the AMPHORA2 workflow for phylogenetic analysis of metagenomic shotgun sequencing data and genomic data.
Functions: Genome assembly, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Metagenomics, Phylogenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://pitgroup.org/amphoranet/
Documentation: https://pitgroup.org/amphoranet/

name: HOMA
text_content:
Tool Name: HOMA
Description: Web-based interface that can create homology models of a protein with unknown structure (the target or query protein) based on a homologous protein with known structure (the template protein).
Functions: Protein modelling
Topics: Molecular modelling, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www-nmr.cabm.rutgers.edu/HOMA/
Documentation: http://www-nmr.cabm.rutgers.edu/HOMA/

name: POPTREE
text_content:
Tool Name: POPTREE
Description: Program for making population trees from allele frequency data.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: Phylogenetics, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.kms.ac.jp/~genomelb/takezaki/poptree2/index.html
Documentation: http://www.kms.ac.jp/~genomelb/takezaki/poptree2/userguide.pdf

name: PlantPAN
text_content:
Tool Name: PlantPAN
Description: Database-assisted system for recognizing combinatorial cis-regulatory elements with distance constraint in plant co-expressed genes.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Plant biology, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://plantpan2.itps.ncku.edu.tw/
Documentation: http://plantpan2.itps.ncku.edu.tw/index.html#guide

name: Pro-Coffee
text_content:
Tool Name: Pro-Coffee
Description: Multiple aligner specifically designed for homologous promoter regions.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Proteins, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/do:procoffee
Documentation: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/tutorial.html

name: Rcount
text_content:
Tool Name: Rcount
Description: Software for simple and flexible RNA-Seq read counting. It allows the user to assign priorities to certain feature types (e.g. higher priority for protein-coding genes compared to rRNA- coding genes) or to add flanking regions.
Functions: RNA-seq read count analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.botinst.uzh.ch/research/development/grossnik/rcount.html
Documentation: https://github.com/MWSchmid/Rcount

name: QMLGalaxyPortal
text_content:
Tool Name: QMLGalaxyPortal
Description: Quick and easy way to check the status of biomedical research on Galaxy and review your history.
Functions: Data handling
Topics: Biomedical science, Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/Tarostar/QMLGalaxyPortal
Documentation: https://github.com/Tarostar/QMLGalaxyPortal/blob/master/GalaxyPortalUserGuide.pdf?raw=true

name: PseKNC
text_content:
Tool Name: PseKNC
Description: Represent a DNA or RNA sequence with a discrete model or vector yet still keep considerable sequence order information, particularly the global or long-range sequence order information, via the physicochemical properties of its constituent oligonucleotides.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/pseknc/default.aspx
Documentation: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/pseknc/readme.html

name: PhosNetConstruct
text_content:
Tool Name: PhosNetConstruct
Description: Tool to predict novel phosphorylation networks based on the preference of certain kinase families to phosphorylate specific functional protein families (domains). It identifies the potentially phosphorylated proteins from a given set of proteins and predicts target kinases which in turn would phosphorylate these identified phosphoproteins based on their domain compositions.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.nii.ac.in/phosnetconstruct.html
Documentation: http://202.54.249.142/~nikhil/network_reconstruction/index.html

name: BlockLogo
text_content:
Tool Name: BlockLogo
Description: Web-server application for the visualization of protein and nucleotide fragments, continuous protein sequence motifs, and discontinuous sequence motifs using calculation of block entropy from multiple sequence alignments.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: Gene and protein families, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://research4.dfci.harvard.edu/cvc/blocklogo/index.php
Documentation: http://research4.dfci.harvard.edu/cvc/blocklogo/HTML/instructions.php

name: BYPASSR
text_content:
Tool Name: BYPASSR
Description: Implementation of a new method for inferring branch lengths and site-specific substitution rates from nucleotide sequences. It makes use of the Bayesian Markov Chain Monte Carlo method and of the uniformization (randomization) technique to calculate sequence substitution probabilities in complicated DNA substitution models such as general time reversible model (GTR).
Functions: DNA substitution modelling
Topics: DNA, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.cmt.ua.ac.be/lcovaci/lucian/ligia/bypassr.html
Documentation: http://www.cmt.ua.ac.be/lcovaci/lucian/ligia/bypassr/docs/Manual.pdf

name: CCCPP
text_content:
Tool Name: CCCPP
Description: This software computes the void parts of the proteins, i.e. cavities, channels and pockets.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://petitjeanmichel.free.fr/itoweb.petitjean.freeware.html#CCCPP
Documentation: http://petitjeanmichel.free.fr/itoweb.download.cccpp.readme

name: PrimerDesign-M
text_content:
Tool Name: PrimerDesign-M
Description: Primer design for highly variable sets of aligned sequences. It includes design requirements for next-generation sequences (NGS) including 454 sequences. It can also be used for primer and probe design for PCR, Sanger sequencing, and other systems with custom barcodes and DNA handles for universal primer annealing. The tool will design several alternative primer sets, whenever possible.
Functions: PCR primer design, Primer and probe design
Topics: DNA, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.hiv.lanl.gov/content/sequence/PRIMER_DESIGN/primer_design.html
Documentation: https://www.hiv.lanl.gov/content/sequence/PRIMER_DESIGN/help.html

name: iRNA-Methyl
text_content:
Tool Name: iRNA-Methyl
Description: This web-server was developed to identify the N6-methyladenosine (m6A). It was observed by the rigorous cross-validation test on the benchmark dataset that the accuracy achieved by the predictor in identifying m6A was 65.59%.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/iRNA-Methyl
Documentation: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/iRNAMethyl/readme

name: iCataly-PseAAC
text_content:
Tool Name: iCataly-PseAAC
Description: Web server that could predict methylation sites in proteins. With the assistance of FKNN, the highlight of this tool is to employ amino acid sequence features extracted by incorporating the sequence evolution information into PseAAC via a grey system model (Grey-PSSM).
Functions: Protein feature detection
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/iCataly-PseAAC
Documentation: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/iCataly/iCata_readme.html

name: CaLecPred
text_content:
Tool Name: CaLecPred
Description: The web-server was developed to identify cancerlectin based on the sequence information.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Gene and protein families, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/CalecPred
Documentation: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/CalecPred

name: AllergenFP
text_content:
Tool Name: AllergenFP
Description: Bioinformatics tool for allergenicity prediction based on a novel descriptor fingerprint approach.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Computational biology, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.ddg-pharmfac.net/AllergenFP/
Documentation: http://www.ddg-pharmfac.net/AllergenFP/method.html

name: ANACONDA
text_content:
Tool Name: ANACONDA
Description: Software package specially developed for the study of genes’ primary structure. It uses gene sequences downloaded from public databases, as FASTA and GenBank, and it applies a set of statistical and visualization methods in different ways, to reveal information about codon context, codon usage, nucleotide repeats within open reading frames (ORFeome) and others.
Functions: Coding region prediction, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Statistical inference
Topics: DNA, Gene expression
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.ua.pt/software/anaconda/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.ua.pt/software/anaconda/

name: ProInflam
text_content:
Tool Name: ProInflam
Description: Webserver for the prediction of proinflammatory antigenicity of peptides and proteins.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence similarity search
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins
Homepage: http://metabiosys.iiserb.ac.in/proinflam/index.html
Documentation: http://metabiosys.iiserb.ac.in/proinflam/guide.php

name: GRate
text_content:
Tool Name: GRate
Description: Software for relative rate tests with groups supporting all models of nucleotide substitution known by PAUP*.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Sequence analysis, Taxonomy
Homepage: http://bioinfweb.info/Software/GRate
Documentation: http://bioinfweb.info/Software/GRate

name: 2D-MH
text_content:
Tool Name: 2D-MH
Description: Web-server for generating graphic representation of protein sequences based on the physicochemical properties of their constituent amino acids.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/pplot/2D-MH
Documentation: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/pplot/2D-MH

name: QTL-ALL
text_content:
Tool Name: QTL-ALL
Description: QTL linkage analysis program. It calculates a wide variety of QTL linkage statistics for nuclear families. Score statistics are emphasized, as are statistics appropriate for ascertained (nonpopulation) samples such as concordant and discordant sibling pairs. Currently, only sib-pair and sibship data are supported, but we plan to extend the capability to arbitrary pedigrees soon.
Functions: Linkage analysis
Topics: Genetics, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://watson.hgen.pitt.edu/register/
Documentation: https://watson.hgen.pitt.edu/pub/qtlall/QTLALL_1.0.1_User_Guide.pdf

name: RAMACO
text_content:
Tool Name: RAMACO
Description: Software tool for computing rare maximal exact matches between multiple sequences. A rare match between k sequences S1,…,Sk is a string that occurs at most ti-times in the sequence Si, where the ti > 0 are user-defined thresholds.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Sequence comparison
Topics: DNA, Molecular genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/forschung/arbeitsgruppe-genominformatik/software/ramaco.html
Documentation: http://www.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/forschung/arbeitsgruppe-genominformatik/software/ramaco.html

name: BioPig
text_content:
Tool Name: BioPig
Description: Framework for genomic data analysis using Apache Pig and Hadoop.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Data architecture, analysis and design, Genomics
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/a/lbl.gov/biopig/
Documentation: https://sites.google.com/a/lbl.gov/biopig/

name: 3USS
text_content:
Tool Name: 3USS
Description: Web-server developed with the aim of retrieving 3’UTR genomic coordinates and nucleotide sequences of the transcripts assembled by standard RNA-seq analysis protocols.
Functions: Data retrieval, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Genomics, Nucleic acids, RNA, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://circe.med.uniroma1.it/3uss_server/
Documentation: http://circe.med.uniroma1.it/3uss_server/help.php

name: PVAAS
text_content:
Tool Name: PVAAS
Description: Tool to identify single nucleotide variants that associated with aberrant alternative splicing from RNA-seq data.
Functions: Splicing model analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA splicing, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://pvaas.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://pvaas.sourceforge.net/#usage

name: ProDA
text_content:
Tool Name: ProDA
Description: Protein multiple aligner that automatically finds domain structures of sequences with shuffled and repeated domain architectures.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://proda.stanford.edu/
Documentation: http://proda.stanford.edu/manual.pdf

name: PHYSICO
text_content:
Tool Name: PHYSICO
Description: UNIX based Standalone Procedure for Computation of Physicochemical, Window-dependent and Substitution Based Evolutionary Properties of Protein Sequences along with Automated Block Preparation Tools.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein properties, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/physico2/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/physico2/files/

name: Prelude Fugue
text_content:
Tool Name: Prelude Fugue
Description: Predict the local structure of a protein in terms of backbone dihedral angle domains, identify sequence regions that form early during folding, and locate structural weaknesses, defined as regions whose sequence is not optimal with respect to the tertiary fold.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://babylone.ulb.ac.be/Prelude_and_Fugue/
Documentation: http://babylone.ulb.ac.be/Prelude_and_Fugue/

name: Quat-2L
text_content:
Tool Name: Quat-2L
Description: Predict the quaternary structural attribute of a protein according to its sequence information alone.
Functions: Protein quaternary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/Quat-2L
Documentation: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/Quaternary/readme_FD2.html

name: Zisland Explorer
text_content:
Tool Name: Zisland Explorer
Description: Tool for detected genomic islands by combining the homogeneity and heterogeneity properties.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cefg.uestc.edu.cn/Zisland_Explorer/
Documentation: http://cefg.uestc.edu.cn/Zisland_Explorer/guide.html

name: Possum
text_content:
Tool Name: Possum
Description: Predict cis-elements in DNA sequences using the standard method of Position Specific Scoring Matrices. It measures the resemblance of every sequence fragment to the chosen cis-element matrices by calculating log-likelihood ratio scores (base e), and returns high-scoring sequence fragments.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://zlab.bu.edu/~mfrith/possum/
Documentation: https://zlab.bu.edu/~mfrith/possum/#instructions

name: MicroErrorAnalyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: MicroErrorAnalyzer
Description: Computer program  for analysing the genotyping errors of microsatellites in parentage exclusion analysis.
Functions: Genotyping, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Genotyping experiment
Homepage: http://www.zsl.org/science/software/microerroranalyzer
Documentation: https://www.zsl.org/science/software/microerroranalyzer

name: RopeBWT2
text_content:
Tool Name: RopeBWT2
Description: A tool for constructing the FM-index for a collection of DNA sequences. It works by incrementally inserting one or multiple sequences into an existing pseudo-BWT position by position, starting from the end of the sequences.
Functions: Genome indexing
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/lh3/ropebwt2
Documentation: https://github.com/lh3/ropebwt2

name: SMRT Analysis
text_content:
Tool Name: SMRT Analysis
Description: Abioinformatics software suite for analyzing single molecule, real-time DNA sequencing data from Pacific Biosciences.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Data visualisation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.pacb.com/products-and-services/analytical-software/smrt-analysis/
Documentation: http://www.pacb.com/support/software-downloads/

name: Maxflow
text_content:
Tool Name: Maxflow
Description: A greedy algorithm, using a novel consistency score to estimate the relative likelihood of alternative paths of transitive alignment. In contrast to traditional profile models of amino acid preferences, MaxFlow models the probability that two positions are structurally equivalent and retains high information content across large distances in sequence space.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://ekhidna.biocenter.helsinki.fi/gtg/start
Documentation: http://ekhidna.biocenter.helsinki.fi/downloads/maxflow

name: (PS)2 - v3
text_content:
Tool Name: (PS)2 - v3
Description: Automated homology modeling server. The method uses an effective consensus strategy by combining PSI-BLAST, IMPALA, and T-Coffee in both template selection and target-template alignment. The final three dimensional structure is built using the modeling package MODELLER.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://ps2v3.life.nctu.edu.tw/
Documentation: http://ps2v3.life.nctu.edu.tw/help.php

name: TCGA-Assembler
text_content:
Tool Name: TCGA-Assembler
Description: An open-source, freely available tool that automatically downloads, assembles, and processes public The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) data, to facilitate downstream data analysis by relieving investigators from the burdens of data preparation.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Genomics, Oncology, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.compgenome.org/TCGA-Assembler/
Documentation: http://www.compgenome.org/TCGA-Assembler/

name: Frag r Us
text_content:
Tool Name: Frag r Us
Description: Web application designed to sample alternative protein backbone conformations in loop regions using the geometrical constrains of smotifs.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.bioinsilico.org/FRAGRUS/
Documentation: http://www.bioinsilico.org/FRAGRUS/help.html

name: MIDAs
text_content:
Tool Name: MIDAs
Description: Software designed to compute the theoretical isotopic distribution for molecules of known elemental composition. It computes for a molecule simultaneously two isotopic distributions: the coarse-grained isotopic distribution and the fine-grained isotopic distribution.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Biochemistry, Molecular biology, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/CBBresearch/Yu/midas/index.html
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/CBBresearch/Yu/downloads/MIDAs.html

name: Rust-Bio
text_content:
Tool Name: Rust-Bio
Description: This library makes many algorithms and data structures that are useful for bioinformatics available for the Rust language.
Functions: Pairwise sequence alignment, Variant pattern analysis
Topics: Bioinformatics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://rust-bio.github.io/
Documentation: https://rust-bio.github.io/

name: Pafig
text_content:
Tool Name: Pafig
Description: Based on support vector machines, exploited 41 physicochemical properties to identify the specific regions associated with fibrillar aggregates.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Infectious disease, Pathology, Protein disordered structure, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.mobioinfor.cn/pafig/index.htm
Documentation: http://www.mobioinfor.cn/pafig/quickhelp.htm

name: eProbalign
text_content:
Tool Name: eProbalign
Description: eProbalign computes maximal expected accuracy multiple sequence alignments from partition function posterior probabilities. eProbalign also provides a platform to visualize the alignment, generate images, and manipulate the output.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Imaging, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://probalign.njit.edu/probalign/login
Documentation:

name: PLAST-ncRNA
text_content:
Tool Name: PLAST-ncRNA
Description: PLAST-ncRNA is an online tool for aligning distantly similar non-coding RNA sequences to a genome using the Probalign program. Useful for detection of potential homologous ncRNA sequences in large genomes.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Genome alignment, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://plastrna.njit.edu
Documentation:

name: assp
text_content:
Tool Name: assp
Description: Assess  Secondary Structure Prediction takes a multiple protein sequence alignment and estimates the range in accuracy that one can expect for a “perfect” secondary structure prediction made using the alignment.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/downloads/assp/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/downloads/assp/

name: BSpred
text_content:
Tool Name: BSpred
Description: Neural network based algorithm for predicting binding site of proteins from amino acid sequences. The algorithm was extensively trained on the sequence-based features including protein sequence profile, secondary structure prediction, and hydrophobicity scales of amino acids.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/BSpred/
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/papers/2011_3_support.pdf

name: pKNOT-v2
text_content:
Tool Name: pKNOT-v2
Description: pKNOT (Protein Knot) is a tool that can detect knots in proteins as well as providing information on knotted proteins in PDB. pKNOT-v2 has been updated with a homology modeling tool such that the server can now accept protein sequences in addition to 3D structures or PDB IDs and return knot analysis.
Functions: Protein folding analysis, Protein modelling, Protein structure analysis, Structure visualisation
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://pknot.life.nctu.edu.tw/
Documentation:

name: Alias
text_content:
Tool Name: Alias
Description: A tool for converting identifiers in which multiple aliases are used to refer to sequences. Also available as a stand-alone tool.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Topics: Database management, Literature and language, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://cbi.labri.fr/outils/alias/
Documentation:

name: PDBselect
text_content:
Tool Name: PDBselect
Description: PDBselect is a list of representative protein chains with low mutual sequence identity selected from the protein data bank (PDB) to enable unbiased statistics. PDBfilter-select is an online service to generate user-defined selections.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Protein modelling (side chains), Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis, Sequence generation (protein)
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Zoology

name: GCView

Tool Name: GCView
Description: GCView facilitates the analysis of the genomic context of a query protein. It uses protein homology to assign corresponding genomic context.

Topics: Genomics, Molecular modelling, Proteins
Homepage: http://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/gcview
Documentation:

name: KinDOCK
text_content:
Tool Name: KinDOCK
Description: KinDOCK is a tool for the analysis of ATP-binding sites of protein kinases based on a structural library of protein kinase-ligand complexes extracted from the Protein Data Bank (PDB).

Topics: Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://abcis.cbs.cnrs.fr/kindock/
Documentation:

name: APPEX
text_content:
Tool Name: APPEX
Description: Web-based platform to perform survival analysis, particularly, to support identifying molecular signatures significantly associated with cancer patients’ outcome. It provides various analysis methods to discover genes or any other molecules associated with survival of cancer patients.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Oncology, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.appex.kr/appex/
Documentation: http://www.appex.kr/appex/document/appex_document.html#_Toc361763818

name: GxGscan
text_content:
Tool Name: GxGscan
Description: Performs the two-step GxG test to detect GxG interactions in a genome-wide association study
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence annotation
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://biostats.usc.edu/software
Documentation: http://biostats.usc.edu/DownloadGxGScan.html

name: ACID
text_content:
Tool Name: ACID
Description: The Array Clone Information Database (ACID) is a searchable resource for information about human, mouse, and rat cDNA clones. Each clone contains information about the assigned UniGene cluster(s), location in the full-length transcript, assigned gene ontology terms and position in the genome assembly.
Functions: Clustering, Genome assembly, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequence tag mapping
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Microarray experiment, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://bioinfo.thep.lu.se/acid.html
Documentation:

name: Software.ncrna.org
text_content:
Tool Name: Software.ncrna.org
Description: A suite of tools for analyzing non-coding RNA sequences on the basis of their secondary structures. Tools include those for structural multiple sequence alignments, structural pairwise sequence alignments and structural motif finding.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment, Pairwise structure alignment, RNA secondary structure alignment
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: https://www.ncrna.org/softwares/
Documentation:

name: MIGenAS Toolkit
text_content:
Tool Name: MIGenAS Toolkit
Description: Max-Planck Integrated Gene Analysis System (MIGenAS)  provides access to many different bioinformatics software tools and databases for sequence similarity searching, multiple sequence alignments, phylogenetic analysis, and protein structure prediction.  Users can also configure meta-tools as a pipeline of individual tools and intermediate filters.
Functions: DNA substitution modelling, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment analysis, Sequence similarity search, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: https://www.migenas.mpg.de/home/index.jsp
Documentation:

name: REPRO
text_content:
Tool Name: REPRO
Description: The web application is able to recognise distant repeats in a single query sequence. The technique relies on a variation of the Smith-Waterman local alignment strategy to find non-overlapping top-scoring local alignments, followed by a graph-based iterative clustering procedure to delineate the repeat set(s) based on consistency of the pairwise top-alignments.
Functions: Local alignment, Repeat sequence detection
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/reprowww/
Documentation: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/reprowww/info.php

name: DUET
text_content:
Tool Name: DUET
Description: Web server for an integrated computational approach for studying missense mutations in proteins.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Protein folding, stability and design, Proteins
Homepage: http://bleoberis.bioc.cam.ac.uk/duet/
Documentation: http://biosig.unimelb.edu.au/duet/static/help/duet_help.pdf

name: Mulan
text_content:
Tool Name: Mulan
Description: Performs local multiple DNA sequence alignments of finished and draft-quality sequences. It identifies transcription factor binding sites evolutionarily conserved across multiple species.
Functions: Local alignment, Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Evolutionary biology, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://mulan.dcode.org/
Documentation: https://mulan.dcode.org/mulanInstructions.php

name: MirTrios
text_content:
Tool Name: MirTrios
Description: Web server to accurately detect de novo mutations (DNMs) based on Expectation-maximization (EM) model. mirTrios also surports identification of rare inherited mutations, known diagnostic variants, as well as the prioritisation of novel and promising candidate genes.
Functions: Polymorphism detection, Read mapping, Variant calling
Topics: Genetic variation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://centre.bioinformatics.zj.cn/mirTrios/
Documentation: http://centre.bioinformatics.zj.cn/mirTrios/

name: MGIP
text_content:
Tool Name: MGIP
Description: Suite of computational tools for the analysis of multilocus sequence typing data. Input DNA sequence files are analyzed to provide allele calls, and to characterize the specific sequence type and clonal complex of the Neisseria meningitidis strain.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Variant calling
Topics: DNA, Informatics, Public health and epidemiology, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://mgip.biology.gatech.edu
Documentation: http://mgip.biology.gatech.edu/ODfaq/

name: MCPep
text_content:
Tool Name: MCPep
Description: The MCPep server for Monte Carlo simulations of peptide-membrane interactions
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Molecular modelling, Protein interactions, Structural biology
Homepage: http://bental.tau.ac.il/MCPep/
Documentation: http://bental.tau.ac.il/MCPep/faq.html

name: LocalMove
text_content:
Tool Name: LocalMove
Description: Monte-Carlo approach to the problem of finding best-fitting lattice models for biopolymers. Through a sequence of local moves, e.g. local backbone modifications, it walks through the conformational space, looking for a configuration as close as possible to the input 3D model, while keeping his points on-lattice. After a user-defined condition is triggered, the experiment stops and the currently best model can be retrieved as a PDB file.
Functions: Molecular model refinement
Topics: Molecular dynamics, Molecular modelling, RNA, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/localmove/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/localmove/manual.html

name: GenomeScan
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomeScan
Description: Program for identifying the exon-intron structures of genes in genomic DNA sequences from a variety of organisms, with a focus on human and other vertebrates.  The algorithm combines two principal sources of information: 1) models of exon-intron and splice signal composition; and 2) sequence similarity information such as BLASTX hits.
Functions: Splicing model analysis
Topics: DNA, Gene structure, RNA splicing, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genes.mit.edu/genomescan/
Documentation: http://genes.mit.edu/genomescan/Documentation

name: Footer
text_content:
Tool Name: Footer
Description: Analyse a pair of homologous mammalian DNA sequences (i.e. human and mouse/rat) for high probability binding sites of known transcription factors. A set of Position-Specific Scoring Matrices (PSSM) has been carefully constructed from mammalian transcription factor binding sites deposited in TRANSFAC database.
Functions: cis-regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, DNA binding sites, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://biodev.hgen.pitt.edu/Footer/
Documentation: http://biodev.hgen.pitt.edu/Footer/Footer_documentation.html

name: FOLDALIGN
text_content:
Tool Name: FOLDALIGN
Description: Pairwise local and global structural alignment of RNA sequences.
Functions: Global structure alignment, Local structure alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://rth.dk/resources/foldalign/
Documentation: https://rth.dk/resources/foldalign/doc/index.html

name: COUGER
text_content:
Tool Name: COUGER
Description: Framework for identifying co-factors associated with uniquely-bound genomic regions.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Computational biology, DNA, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://couger.oit.duke.edu
Documentation: http://couger.oit.duke.edu/documentation/

name: OpenHUSAR
text_content:
Tool Name: OpenHUSAR
Description: Open HUSAR (Heidelberg Unix Sequence Analysis Resources) contains suite of bioinformatics pipelines including tasks oriented to protein annotation by homology (ProtSweep), by domain analysis (DomainSweep), and by secondary structure elements (2Dsweep).

Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://genius.embnet.dkfz-heidelberg.de/menu/cgi-bin/w2h-open/w2h.open/w2h.startthis?SIMGO=w2h.welcome
Documentation:

name: DILIMOT
text_content:
Tool Name: DILIMOT
Description: Discovery of Linear Motifs (DILIMOT) is a server for finding short (3-8 amino acids) over-represented peptide patterns in a set of proteins.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein interactions, Small molecules
Homepage: http://dilimot.embl.de/
Documentation:

name: SurvMicro
text_content:
Tool Name: SurvMicro
Description: A free and easy-to-use web tool that assesses miRNA signatures from publicly available miRNA profiles using multivariate survival analysis.
Functions: miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Oncology, RNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformatica.mty.itesm.mx:8080/Biomatec/Survmicro.jsp
Documentation: http://bioinformatica.mty.itesm.mx:8080/Biomatec/Survmicro.jsp

name: IPGWAS
text_content:
Tool Name: IPGWAS
Description: Integrated pipeline for rational quality control and association analysis of genome-wide genetic studies.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: GWAS study, Genetics, Genomics
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/ipgwas/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/ipgwas/

name: Pathoscope
text_content:
Tool Name: Pathoscope
Description: Takes a next-generation sequencing reads from a mixture sample of multiple strains of genomes and it predicts which genomes potentially belongs there. Different from most of approach including composition method or similarity search with a daunting task of de novo assembly, the software applies the propagation of evidence in the Bayesian framework to an initial alignment result and reassign an correct membership of mapping by using the expectation and maximization algorithm.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequence assembly, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/pathoscope/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/pathoscope/files/pathoscope2.0_v0.02_tutorial.pdf/download

name: TargetProfiler
text_content:
Tool Name: TargetProfiler
Description: A novel miRNA target prediction tool that utilizes a probabilistic learning algorithm in the form of a hidden Markov model trained on experimentally verified miRNA targets.
Functions: miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mirna.imbb.forth.gr/Targetprofiler.html
Documentation: http://mirna.imbb.forth.gr/Targetprofiler.html

name: Mattbench
text_content:
Tool Name: Mattbench
Description: Protein structural alignment benchmark that may be used to test and refine protein sequence aligners.
Functions: Structure alignment
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Structural biology
Homepage: http://bcb.cs.tufts.edu/mattbench/Mattbench.html
Documentation: http://bcb.cs.tufts.edu/mattbench/Mattbench.html

name: TargetS
text_content:
Tool Name: TargetS
Description: A novel computational approach for predicting miRNA targets with the target sites located along entire gene sequences, which permits finding additional targets that are not located in the 3′ un-translated regions.
Functions: miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, RNA
Homepage: http://liubioinfolab.org/targetS/mirna.html
Documentation: http://liubioinfolab.org/targetS/mirna.html

name: MEAdmix
text_content:
Tool Name: MEAdmix

Homepage: http://www.zsl.org/science/software/meadmix
Documentation: https://www.zsl.org/science/software/meadmix

name: MitoTool
text_content:
Tool Name: MitoTool
Description: Web-based bioinformatics platform, provides a convenient, user-friendly interface for handling human mtDNA sequence data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Cell biology, DNA, Human biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.mitotool.org/
Documentation: http://www.mitotool.org/manual.html

name: SeqCalc
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqCalc
Description: This tool assists the research personnel in computational sequence analysis and automated experimental calculations.

Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: https://code.google.com/p/seqcalc/
Documentation: https://code.google.com/archive/p/seqcalc/

name: MetaQuery
text_content:
Tool Name: MetaQuery
Description: Web application for rapid and quantitative analysis of specific genes in the human gut microbiome.
Functions: Quantification, Sequence annotation
Topics: Genetics, Microbial ecology, Microbiology
Homepage: http://metaquery.docpollard.org/
Documentation: http://metaquery.docpollard.org/cgi-bin/about.py

name: SSP
text_content:
Tool Name: SSP
Description: An algorithm that combines chemical shifts from different nuclei into a score, which reflects the expected fraction of α- or β-structure.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Biochemistry, Molecular dynamics, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://abragam.med.utoronto.ca/~JFKlab/
Documentation: http://abragam.med.utoronto.ca/~JFKlab/

name: STACCATO
text_content:
Tool Name: STACCATO

Documentation: http://bioinfo3d.cs.tau.ac.il/staccato/

name: SBSPKS
text_content:

Homepage: http://www.nii.ac.in/~pksdb/sbspks/homepage.html
Documentation: http://www.nii.ac.in/~pksdb/sbspks/homepage.html

name: SSpro
text_content:
Tool Name: SSpro

Homepage: http://scratch.proteomics.ics.uci.edu/
Documentation: http://scratch.proteomics.ics.uci.edu/explanation.html#SSpro

name: MDD-SOH
text_content:
Tool Name: MDD-SOH

Homepage: http://csb.cse.yzu.edu.tw/MDDSOH/
Documentation: http://csb.cse.yzu.edu.tw/MDDSOH/introduction.php

name: LIPO
text_content:
Tool Name: LIPO
Description: This tool can analyse polypeptide sequences encoded within the genome of Gram-negative bacteria and report the sequences with a possible lipo-box. The lipo-box is recognised on the basis of given the critera.

Topics: Microbiology, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis

Documentation: http://services.cbu.uib.no/tools/lipo

name: PFP
text_content:
Tool Name: PFP

Topics: Function analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://kiharalab.org/web/pfp.php
Documentation: http://kiharalab.org/web/pfp.php

name: FUSION
text_content:
Tool Name: FUSION
Description: Fragment-free probabilistic graphical model for conformational sampling in continuous space and assess its accuracy using ‘blind’ protein targets with a length up to 250 residues from the CASP11 structure prediction exercise.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://protein.rnet.missouri.edu/FUSION/
Documentation: http://protein.rnet.missouri.edu/FUSION/tutorial.php

name: PoPS
text_content:
Tool Name: PoPS
Description: Computational tool for modeling and predicting protease specificity. It provides a novel method for building computational models of protease specificity, which while still being based on these amino acid sequences, can be built from any experimental data or expert knowledge available to the user.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein interactions, Protein properties
Homepage: http://pops.csse.monash.edu.au/
Documentation: http://pops.csse.monash.edu.au/faq.php

name: NSITE
text_content:
Tool Name: NSITE
Description: Programs that perform searches for statistically significant (non-random) motifs of known human, animal and plant one-box and composite REs in a single genomic sequence, in a pair of aligned homologous sequences and in a set of functionally related sequences, respectively.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Gene regulation, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.softberry.com/freedownloadhelp/nsite/description.html
Documentation: http://www.softberry.com/freedownloadhelp/nsite/description.html

name: TreeGibbsSampler
text_content:
Tool Name: TreeGibbsSampler
Description: Software for identifying motifs by simultaneously using the motif overrepresentation property and the motif evolutionary conservation property. It identifies motifs without depending on pre-aligned orthologous sequences, which makes it useful for the extraction of regulatory elements in multiple genomes of both closely related and distant species.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://hulab.ucf.edu/software
Documentation: http://hulab.ucf.edu/software

name: RNAalishapes
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAalishapes
Description: A tool for secondary structure prediction, using shape abstraction. Input is a multiple sequence alignment. Pseudoknots are not considered at all.
Functions: RNA structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bibiserv2.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/rnaalishapes
Documentation: http://bibiserv2.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/rnaalishapes?id=rnaalishapes_manual_manual

name: Wregex
text_content:
Tool Name: Wregex
Description: Software tool for amino acid motif searching using weighted regular expression and regular expressions with a Position-Specific Scoring Matrix
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://wregex.ehubio.es/
Documentation: http://ehubio.ehu.eus/wregex/

name: SUMOAMVR
text_content:
Tool Name: SUMOAMVR
Description: Web server for prediction of sumoylation related amino acid variations that affect sumoylation sites or enzymes involved in the process of connectivity.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/SUMOAMVR_Home.aspx
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/SUMOAMVR_Help.aspx

name: NPACT
text_content:
Tool Name: NPACT
Description: Computational and graphical representation tool for gene identification and sequence annotation. Identifies sequence segments of any length with statistically-significant 3-base compositional periodicities and associated with ORF structures .
Functions: Annotation, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Model organisms, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://genome.ufl.edu/npact/
Documentation: http://genome.ufl.edu/npact/about

name: Signal-CF
text_content:
Tool Name: Signal-CF
Description: Automated method for predicting signal peptide sequences and their cleavage sites in eukaryotic and bacterial protein sequences
Functions: Protein cleavage site prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Protein signal peptide detection
Topics: Protein binding sites, Protein sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/Signal-CF/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/Signal-CF/SignalCFReadme.htm

name: SuccFind
text_content:
Tool Name: SuccFind
Description: Novel succinylation site online prediction tool which is constructed to predict the lysine succinylation sites based on two major categories of characteristics: sequence-derived features and evolutionary-derived information of sequence and via an enhanced feature strategy for further optimizations.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein modifications, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/SuccFind.aspx
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/SuccFind_Help.aspx

name: Genoinfer
text_content:
Tool Name: Genoinfer
Description: Genotype inference method that reduces the number of genotyping reactions and increases the power of genome-wide association studies.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetics, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genoinfer.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://genoinfer.sourceforge.net/

name: RAPID
text_content:
Tool Name: RAPID
Description: Server providing fast and accurate sequence based prediction of protein disorder content.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein disordered structure, Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://biomine.cs.vcu.edu/servers/RAPID/
Documentation: http://biomine.cs.vcu.edu/servers/RAPID/

name: Signal-3L
text_content:
Tool Name: Signal-3L
Description: Automated method for predicting signal peptide sequences and their cleavage sites in eukaryotic and bacterial protein sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein signal peptide detection
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/Signal-3L/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/Signal-3L/Signal3LReadme.htm

name: NPS
text_content:
Tool Name: NPS
Description: Interactive Web server dedicated to protein sequence analysis and available for the biologist community.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://npsa-pbil.ibcp.fr/cgi-bin/npsa_automat.pl?page=/NPSA/npsa_server.html
Documentation: https://npsa-prabi.ibcp.fr/cgi-bin/npsa_automat.pl?page=/NPSA/npsa_server.html

name: SULDEX
text_content:
Tool Name: SULDEX
Description: The packages is designed to use high throughput sequencing to simultaneously analyze binding dissociation constants for large repertoires of sequences.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.evolutionarygenomics.com/ProgramsData/SULDEX/SULDEX.html
Documentation: http://www.evolutionarygenomics.com/ProgramsData/SULDEX/Usage.txt

name: TepiTool
text_content:
Tool Name: TepiTool
Description: The tool provides prediction of peptides binding to MHC class I and class II molecules.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction
Topics: Protein binding sites, Protein sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://tools.iedb.org/tepitool/
Documentation: http://tools.iedb.org/tepitool/help/

name: MDIV
text_content:
Tool Name: MDIV
Description: MDIV is a program that will simultaneously estimate divergence times and migration rates between two populations under the infinite sites model and under a finite sites model (HKY). The program can be used to test if there is evidence for migration between two populations or evidence for shared recent common ancestry. In addition, you get maximum likelihood estimates of the demographic parameters.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Genetics, Population genetics
Homepage: http://people.binf.ku.dk/rasmus/webpage/mdiv.html
Documentation: http://people.binf.ku.dk/rasmus/webpage/program_files/mdiv/readme.txt

name: iTagPlot
text_content:
Tool Name: iTagPlot
Description: Tool to accurately compute and interactively visualize tag density (read coverage)from genomic sequencing data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/itagplot/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/itagplot/

name: GAP
text_content:
Tool Name: GAP
Description: Distinguish between amyloid fibril-forming and amorphous ß-aggregating hexapeptides with almost 100 percent accuracies in validation tests performed using non-redundant datasets.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.iitm.ac.in/bioinfo/GAP/
Documentation: https://www.iitm.ac.in/bioinfo/GAP/

name: Forcefield_PTM
text_content:
Tool Name: Forcefield_PTM
Description: Set of self-consistent AMBER forcefield parameters for frequently occurring post-translational modifications (PTMs).
Functions: Protein property calculation, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Protein modifications, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://selene.princeton.edu/FFPTM/
Documentation: http://selene.princeton.edu/FFPTM/files/instructions.txt

name: NUCGEN
text_content:
Tool Name: NUCGEN
Description: Reads wedge (or local doublet) and basepair parameters calculates local helical parameters from local doublet parameters, then applies the base-pair and helical parameters to succesive  basepairs after transforming the already generated ones to bring the topmost one in the (x-y) plane.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://nucleix.mbu.iisc.ernet.in/nucgen/index.htm
Documentation: http://nucleix.mbu.iisc.ernet.in/nucgen/news.htm

name: GONe
text_content:
Tool Name: GONe
Description: User-friendly, Windows-based program for estimating effective size (Ne) in populations with overlapping generations. It uses the Jorde-Ryman modification to the temporal method to account for age-structure in populations.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Population genetics
Homepage: http://bcrc.bio.umass.edu/pedigreesoftware/node/9
Documentation: http://bcrc.bio.umass.edu/pedigreesoftware/node/9

name: FSFinder
text_content:
Tool Name: FSFinder
Description: Software that searches the genomic sequences or mRNA sequences for frameshifting sites. It is capable of finding -1 frameshift sites for most known genes and +1 frameshift sites for two genes: protein chain release factor (prfB ) and ornithine decarboxylase antizyme (oaz ).
Functions: Frameshift detection
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://wilab.inha.ac.kr/fsfinder2/
Documentation: http://165.246.44.42/FSFinder2/usage_menu.htm

name: PEAS
text_content:
Tool Name: PEAS
Description: Provides the average user who is working on SNP data the basic analysis tools, and make it possible to analysis large SNP data set for those people who do not write programs. It focuses on population genetic analysis of SNP data and most commonly used SNP data operations.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Genetics
Homepage: http://www.picb.ac.cn/PGG/resource.php
Documentation: http://www.picb.ac.cn/PGG/resource.php

name: UniAlign
text_content:
Tool Name: UniAlign
Description: Protein pairwise structure alignment algorithm that incorporates additional evolutionary information captured in the form of sequence similarity, sequence profiles, and residue conservation.
Functions: Pairwise structure alignment
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sacan.biomed.drexel.edu/unialign
Documentation: http://sacan.biomed.drexel.edu/unialign/

name: LTR_STRUC
text_content:
Tool Name: LTR_STRUC
Description: New data-mining program that scans nucleotide sequence files for LTR retrotransposons and analyzes any resulting hits. Input files can be in fasta or NCBI flat file format.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: DNA, Data mining, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.mcdonaldlab.biology.gatech.edu/ltr_struc.htm
Documentation: http://www.mcdonaldlab.biology.gatech.edu/ltr_struc.htm

name: ThreaDom
text_content:
Tool Name: ThreaDom
Description: A template-based algorithm for protein domain boundary prediction. Given a protein sequence, ThreaDom first threads the target through the PDB library to identify protein template that have similar structure fold. A domain conservation score (DCS) will be calculated for each residue which combines information from template domain structure, terminal and internal gaps and insertions. Finally, the domain boundary information is derived from the DCS profile distributions.
Functions: Protein fold recognition
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/ThreaDom/
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/ThreaDom/

name: SiTaR
text_content:
Tool Name: SiTaR
Description: Novel tool for transcription factor binding site prediction.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition, Transcription factor binding site prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://sbi.hki-jena.de/sitar/index.php
Documentation: https://sbi.hki-jena.de/sitar/index.php

name: SFESA
text_content:
Tool Name: SFESA
Description: A tool to refine pairwise protein sequence alignment, with a combination of sequence and structural scoring by locally shifting secondary structure elements.
Functions: Pairwise sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://prodata.swmed.edu/sfesa/sfesa.php
Documentation: http://prodata.swmed.edu/sfesa/sfesa_help.html

name: Gener
text_content:
Tool Name: Gener
Description: Tool for performing reductions on DNA-strands based on a strand-displacement algebra.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction
Topics: DNA, Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.cosbi.eu/research/prototypes/gener
Documentation: http://www.cosbi.eu/stories/prototypes/downloads/Gener/gener_ug.pdf

name: ThermoPred
text_content:
Tool Name: ThermoPred
Description: Sequence-based predictor for identifying thermophilic proteins.
Functions: Protein property calculation
Topics: Function analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/ThermoPredv1
Documentation: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/ThermoPred/readme

name: TetraMito
text_content:
Tool Name: TetraMito
Description: Sequence-based predictor for identifying submitochondria location of proteins.
Functions: Protein subcellular localisation prediction
Topics: Protein targeting and localisation, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/TetraMito
Documentation: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/subMito/readme

name: mtDNAprofiler
text_content:
Tool Name: mtDNAprofiler
Description: Web program which enables users to analyze and compare mtDNA sequences whether they are indicated as FASTA format or as a difference to revised Cambridge Reference Sequence (rCRS).
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence comparison
Topics: Cell biology, DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mtprofiler.yonsei.ac.kr/
Documentation: http://mtprofiler.yonsei.ac.kr/

name: RL-CSA
text_content:
Tool Name: RL-CSA
Description: A tool for regular-language constrained pairwise global sequence alignment.
Functions: Global structure alignment
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.cs.bgu.ac.il/~negevcb/RL-CSA/
Documentation: https://www.cs.bgu.ac.il/~negevcb/RL-CSA/doc/index.html

name: SEGMER
text_content:
Tool Name: SEGMER
Description: A segmental threading algorithm designed to recoginzing substructure motifs from the Protein Data Bank (PDB) library.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structural motif recognition
Topics: Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Sequencing
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/SEGMER/
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/SEGMER/

name: GeneScreen
text_content:
Tool Name: GeneScreen
Description: Tool for high-throughput detection and annotation of rare sequence variants. Although analysis of sequence electropherograms can be done by eye, this is very laborious and error-prone, especially when analyzing large volumes of data.
Functions: SNP detection
Topics: DNA, DNA mutation
Homepage: http://dna.leeds.ac.uk/genescreen/
Documentation: http://dna.leeds.ac.uk/genescreen/guide/

name: pAliKiss
text_content:
Tool Name: pAliKiss
Description: Predicts RNA secondary structures for fixed RNA multiple sequence alignments, with special attention for pseudoknotted structures.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://bibiserv2.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/palikiss
Documentation: http://bibiserv2.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/palikiss?id=palikiss_palikiss_manual_manual

name: SubPhosPred
text_content:
Tool Name: SubPhosPred
Description: Web server that could predict phosphosrylation sites in different subcellular compartments (SCs) of homo sapiens, which combines a novel discrete wavelet transform (DWT) strategy with support vector machine (SVM) approach to identify phosphorylation sites for different SCs in human.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/SubPhosPred.aspx
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/SubPhosHelp.aspx

name: GeNOSA
text_content:
Tool Name: GeNOSA
Description: Several tools to perform reconstruction of gene regulatory networks from microarray data and connectivity information.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction
Topics: Gene regulation, Microarray experiment, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Systems biology
Homepage: http://140.113.239.45/GeNOSA/
Documentation: http://140.113.239.45/GeNOSA/

name: FiToM
text_content:
Tool Name: FiToM
Description: Computer program for the detection of binding sites in DNA or RNA sequences. It implements several methods described in the literature to compute an approximation of binding affinity for a particular site based on a collection of binding sequences provided by the user.
Functions: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, RNA, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://erilllab.umbc.edu/research/software/fitom/
Documentation: http://erilllab.umbc.edu/research/software/fitom/

name: Tango
text_content:
Tool Name: Tango
Description: A computer algorithm for prediction of aggregating regions in unfolded polypeptide chains. The model used here, is designed to predict cross-beta aggregation in peptides and denatured proteins and consists of a phase-space encompassing the random coil and 4 possible structural states: beta-turn, alpha-helix, beta-sheet aggregation and alpha-helical aggregation.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://tango.crg.es/
Documentation: http://tango.crg.es/Tango_Handbook.pdf

name: SUBWAI
text_content:
Tool Name: SUBWAI
Description: Protein structure prediction program based on threading strategy with SPAD.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://kiharalab.org/subalignment/
Documentation: http://kiharalab.org/subalignment/

name: MemType-2L
text_content:
Tool Name: MemType-2L
Description: 2-layer predictor for predicting membrane protein types, the first layer will predict whether the query sequence belongs to membrane proteins or not; and the second layer aims to predict exactly the membrane protein types when the output of the first layer is “membrane proteins”.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/MemType/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/MemType/Readme.htm

name: TADtree
text_content:
Tool Name: TADtree
Description: An algorithm the identification of hierarchical topological domains in Hi-C data.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Applied mathematics, Genomics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.brown.edu/projects/tadtree/
Documentation: http://compbio.cs.brown.edu/projects/tadtree/

name: XHM
text_content:
Tool Name: XHM
Description: Tool for assessment of the reliability of hybridization signals by detecting potential cross-hybridizations on DNA microarrays.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: DNA, Microarray experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinfo.no/tools/xhm/
Documentation: http://services.cbu.uib.no/tools/xhm/xhmdocs

name: EPCES
text_content:
Tool Name: EPCES
Description: EPCES (Epitopes ConsEnsus Scoring) is a new antigen Epitope Prediction method from six different scoring functions – residue epitope propensity, conservation score, side-chain energy score, contact number, surface planarity score, and secondary structure composition.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein surfaces
Homepage: http://sysbio.unl.edu/EPCES
Documentation:

name: EPAD
text_content:
Tool Name: EPAD
Description: EPAD is an innovative position-specific distance-dependent statistical potential for protein structure and functional study. EPAD has different energy profiles for the same type of atom pairs, depending on their sequence positions.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure
Homepage: http://ttic.uchicago.edu/~jinbo/software/EPAD_guide.html
Documentation:

name: STON
text_content:
Tool Name: STON
Description: A new algorithm to find aligned residues in two proteins with desired rmsd value.
Functions: Protein structure comparison
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bs.ipm.ir/softwares/ston/
Documentation: http://bioinf.cs.ipm.ir/softwares/ston/help.html

name: mEAT
text_content:
Tool Name: mEAT
Description: MicroRNA Enrichment Analysis Tool
Functions: miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Immunoprecipitation experiment, RNA, Sequencing
Homepage: https://ohlerlab.mdc-berlin.de/software/PAR-CLIP_motif_analysis_tool_87/
Documentation: https://ohlerlab.mdc-berlin.de/software/PAR-CLIP_motif_analysis_tool_87/

name: MicroDrop
text_content:
Tool Name: MicroDrop
Description: Program that estimates allelic dropout rates from nonreplicated microsatellite genotype data. MicroDrop uses the estimated dropout rates to provide imputed data sets that sample missing genotypes (and replace some homozygous genotypes) using an allele frequency model with or without Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Genetics, Genotype and phenotype
Homepage: http://www.stanford.edu/group/rosenberglab/microdrop.html
Documentation: https://web.stanford.edu/group/rosenberglab/software/MicroDrop_Manual.pdf

name: PeptideLocator
text_content:
Tool Name: PeptideLocator
Description: For users interested in identifying bioactive peptides within a protein sequence. PeptideLocator was trained on a set of non-redundant protein sequences conatining known bioactive peptides.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://bioware.ucd.ie/~compass/biowareweb/Server_pages/biopred.php
Documentation: http://bioware.ucd.ie/~compass/biowareweb/Server_pages/biopred.php

name: MFDp
text_content:
Tool Name: MFDp
