Description: Combines per-residue disorder probabilities predicted by MFDp with per-sequence disorder content predicted by DisCon, and applies novel post-processing filters to provide disorder predictions with improved predictive quality.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Pathology, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://biomine-ws.ece.ualberta.ca/MFDp2/index.php
Documentation: http://biomine.cs.vcu.edu/servers/MFDp2/help.html#top

name: Forcefield_NCAA
text_content:
Tool Name: Forcefield_NCAA
Description: Set of self-consistent AMBER forcefield parameters for non-canonical amino acids. It allows you to design and derivatize peptides containing NCAAs for use as drugs.
Functions: Protein modelling, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://selene.princeton.edu/FFNCAA/
Documentation: http://selene.princeton.edu/FFNCAA/files/instructions.txt

name: RNAConSLOpt
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAConSLOpt
Description: A program for predicting consensus stable local optimal structures (represented by stack configurations) for aligned RNA sequences. It can be used to predict consensus alternate structures for riboswitches.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAConSLOpt/
Documentation: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAConSLOpt/

name: THREADER
text_content:
Tool Name: THREADER
Description: A software of threading which is an approach to fold recognition which used a detailed 3-D representation of protein structure. The idea was to physically “thread” a sequence of amino acid side chains onto a backbone structure (a fold) and to evaluate this proposed 3-D structure using a set of pair potentials and (importantly) a separate solvation potential.
Functions: Protein fold recognition
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bioinf.cs.ucl.ac.uk/?id=747
Documentation: http://bioinfadmin.cs.ucl.ac.uk/downloads/threader/manual.pdf

name: MS_Align
text_content:
Tool Name: MS_Align
Description: Software of comparison of minisatellites.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.atgc-montpellier.fr/ms_align/
Documentation: http://www.atgc-montpellier.fr/ms_align/usersguide.php

name: SCANPS
text_content:
Tool Name: SCANPS
Description: Web server for iterative protein sequence database searching by dynamic programming. Sensitivity and selectivity outperform PSI-BLAST. The server allows a range of different protein sequence databases to be searched including the SCOP database of protein domains.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein fold recognition, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence database search, Sequence similarity search
Topics: Molecular dynamics, Protein folds and structural domains, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/www-scanps
Documentation:

name: SeqSolve
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqSolve
Description: Simple analysis of Next Generation Sequencing data.
Functions: Ab-initio gene prediction, Validation
Topics: ChIP-seq, RNA splicing, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.asebio.com/en/member_product_item.cfm?iid=64
Documentation:

name: SARA-Coffee
text_content:
Tool Name: SARA-Coffee
Description: A structure based multiple RNA aligner. This is a new algorithm that joins the pairwise RNA structure alignments performed by SARA with the multiple sequence T-Coffee framework. SARA-Coffee is part of the T-Coffee distribution.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/do:saracoffee
Documentation: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/tutorial_saracoffee.html

name: diffReps
text_content:
Tool Name: diffReps
Description: This software is developed to find different peaks in ChIP-seq. It scans the whole genome using a sliding window, performing millions of statistical tests and report the significant hits. It takes into account the biological variations within a group of samples and uses that information to enhance the statistical power. Considering biological variation is of high importance, especiallly for in vivo brain tissues.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Genomics, Sample collections
Homepage: https://github.com/shenlab-sinai/diffreps
Documentation: https://github.com/shenlab-sinai/diffreps

name: SPOT-Struct-RNA
text_content:
Tool Name: SPOT-Struct-RNA
Description: SPOT-Struct-RNA is a sofware for RNA-binding protein prediction from 3D structure
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: RNA
Homepage: http://sparks-lab.org/yueyang/server/SPOT-Struct-RNA/
Documentation:

name: Geno2pheno
text_content:
Tool Name: Geno2pheno
Description: Web server for the prediction of HIV phenotypic drug resistance and coreceptor usage from genotype.
Functions: Virulence prediction
Topics: DNA, Drug discovery, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.geno2pheno.org/
Documentation: http://www.geno2pheno.org/index.php

name: MethGo
text_content:
Tool Name: MethGo
Description: Simple and effective tool designed for the analysis of data from whole genome bisulfite sequencing (WGBS) and reduced representation bisulfite sequencing (RRBS).
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://paoyangchen-laboratory.github.io/methgo/
Documentation: https://methgo.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: SUPER-FOCUS
text_content:
Tool Name: SUPER-FOCUS
Description: An agile homology-based approach using a reduced SEED database to report the subsystems present in metagenomic samples and profile their abundances.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: DNA, Metagenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://edwards.sdsu.edu/superfocus/
Documentation: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/edwardslabtools

name: biojs-alg-seqregion
text_content:
Tool Name: biojs-alg-seqregion
Description: Object and function to deal with a sequence region (reg:start-end).
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/homonecloco/biojs-alg-seqregion
Documentation: https://github.com/homonecloco/biojs-alg-seqregion

name: biojs-vis-sequence
text_content:
Tool Name: biojs-vis-sequence
Description: Display sequence.
Functions: Sequence visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://github.com/ljgarcia/biojs-vis-sequence
Documentation: https://github.com/ebi-uniprot/biojs-vis-sequence

name: biocGraph
text_content:
Tool Name: biocGraph
Description: This package provides examples and code that make use of the different graph related packages produced by BioConductor.
Functions: Expression data visualisation, Genotyping
Topics: Gene expression, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/biocGraph.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/biocGraph.html

name: biojs-vis-sam
text_content:
Tool Name: biojs-vis-sam
Description: Visualiser for the SAM format.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/homonecloco/biojs-vis-sam
Documentation: https://github.com/homonecloco/biojs-vis-sam

name: HMMcopy
text_content:
Tool Name: HMMcopy
Description: Corrects GC and mappability biases for readcounts (i.e. coverage) in non-overlapping windows of fixed length for single whole genome samples, yielding a rough estimate of copy number for further analysis.  Designed for rapid correction of high coverage whole genome tumour and normal samples.
Functions: Sequencing error detection
Topics: Data quality management, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/HMMcopy.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/HMMcopy.html

name: seqlm
text_content:
Tool Name: seqlm
Description: An R package for identification of differentially methylated regions (DMRs) from high density chip, for example Illumina 450K, data.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/raivokolde/seqlm
Documentation: https://github.com/raivokolde/seqlm

name: GenomeTester
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomeTester
Description: Analyse whether PCR primers have excessive number of binding sites in large genomes, how many PCR products would be amplified in the reaction and where are they located.
Functions: Sequence database search, Virtual PCR
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/genometester
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/genometester/

name: Plast
text_content:
Tool Name: Plast
Description: Parallel Local Alignment Search Tool for Database Comparison.
Functions: Local alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.irisa.fr/symbiose/projects/plast/
Documentation: https://plast.inria.fr/

name: secureSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: secureSeq
Description: A suite of secure sequencing analysis tools.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.hcbravo.org/projects/secureseq/
Documentation: http://www.hcbravo.org/projects/secureseq/

name: GIREMI
text_content:
Tool Name: GIREMI
Description: Method that can identify RNA editing sites using one RNA-seq data set without requiring genome sequence data.
Functions: Sequence editing
Topics: Genetics, RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://www.ibp.ucla.edu/research/xiao/GIREMI.html
Documentation: https://www.ibp.ucla.edu/research/xiao/GIREMI.html

name: Fizzy
text_content:
Tool Name: Fizzy
Description: Feature subset selection tool that uses FEAST in the background to run feature selection on biological data formats.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/EESI/Fizzy
Documentation: https://github.com/EESI/Fizzy/blob/master/README.md

name: NOVA
text_content:
Tool Name: NOVA
Description: Program designed to analysis complexome profiling data.
Functions: Data handling, Sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatik.uni-frankfurt.de/tools/nova/index.php
Documentation: http://www.bioinformatik.uni-frankfurt.de/tools/nova/index.php

name: wKinMut
text_content:
Tool Name: wKinMut
Description: Integrated framework for the analysis and interpretation of the consequences of variants in the human kinome.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Gene and protein families, Genomics, Proteins
Homepage: http://kinmut2.bioinfo.cnio.es/KinMut2
Documentation: http://kinmut2.bioinfo.cnio.es/tutorial

name: VNTRfinder
text_content:
Tool Name: VNTRfinder
Description: The program enables the detection of sequence length variation between arrays of inter-specific or intra-specific tandem repeats. In the absence of comparable sequences to explore observed variation, predictions are provided describing which tandem repeats are more likely to be variable, to help guide and focus further experimental evaluation.
Functions: Repeat sequence detection
Topics: DNA, Genetic variation, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/a/codushlaine.com/colm-o-dushlaine/Data
Documentation: https://sites.google.com/a/codushlaine.com/colm-o-dushlaine/Data

name: OligoCounter
text_content:
Tool Name: OligoCounter
Description: Java command line program which counts overrepresented 8-14bp oligonucleotides in DNA sequences. These oligos can be useful in visualising small genomes on a global basis (see figure below), investigating repeats at certain regions, and for attributing short reads (for example from metagenomics) to a sequenced genome.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: DNA, Metagenomics, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://webhost1.mh-hannover.de/davenport/oligocounter/index.html
Documentation: http://webhost1.mh-hannover.de/davenport/oligocounter/dat/oligocounter_manual.pdf

name: SCCT
text_content:
Tool Name: SCCT
Description: Computational software developed to detect recent positive selection using deep sequencing data. It’s robust to various demographic events and also robust to the variations of mutation rates and recombination rates.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: DNA mutation, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/wavefancy/scct
Documentation: https://github.com/wavefancy/scct

name: GPUmotif
text_content:
Tool Name: GPUmotif
Description: GPU-accelerated ultra-fast and energy-efficient motif analysis program.
Functions: Sequence motif analysis
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/gpumotif/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/gpumotif/

name: SIGMA
text_content:
Tool Name: SIGMA
Description: A novel sequence similarity-based approach for strain-level identification of genomes from metagenomic analysis for biosurveillance.
Functions: Gene expression profiling
Topics: DNA, Metagenomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sigma.omicsbio.org/
Documentation: http://sigma.omicsbio.org/instructions-5/

name: Ginkgo
text_content:
Tool Name: Ginkgo
Description: Agent-based forward-time simulation to produce gene genealogies and incidence (occurrence) data for multiple populations of multiple species in a spatially-explicit and environmentally-heterogenous framework.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: DNA, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://phylo.bio.ku.edu/ginkgo/index.html
Documentation: http://phylo.bio.ku.edu/ginkgo/running.html

name: GBIRP
text_content:
Tool Name: GBIRP
Description: Program to compare the genotypes of many pairs of people, and identify pairs of people who may be related to each other.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinf.wehi.edu.au/software/GBIRP/main.html
Documentation: http://bioinf.wehi.edu.au/software/GBIRP/main.html

name: XPARAL
text_content:
Tool Name: XPARAL
Description: Program which computes a parameterized alignment of two sequences, displaying all of the optimal alignments for the two sequences when the costs of substitutions, gaps and insertions or deletions are varied. The user provides as input two sequences, an alignment type (global, local, end-gap free and substring), and selects which two of the alignment costs to vary.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.cs.ucdavis.edu/~gusfield/xparall/index.html
Documentation: http://web.cs.ucdavis.edu/~gusfield/xparall/index.html

name: Genomizer
text_content:
Tool Name: Genomizer
Description: Platform independent Java program for the analysis of genome wide association experiments. The software implements the workflow of an association experiment, including data management, single-point and haplotype analysis, “lead” definition, and data visualization.
Functions: Genome visualisation, Sequence analysis
Topics: GWAS study, Genetics
Homepage: http://www.ikmb.uni-kiel.de/resources/download-tools/software/genomizer
Documentation: http://www.ikmb.uni-kiel.de/resources/download-tools/software/genomizer

name: MRPrimerW
text_content:
Tool Name: MRPrimerW
Description: Server that performs complete homology testing, supports batch design of primers for multi-target qPCR experiments, and ranks the resulting primers to return the top-1 best primers to the user.
Functions: PCR primer design
Topics: PCR experiment, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mrprimerw.com/
Documentation: http://mrprimerw.com/

name: Rouge
text_content:
Tool Name: Rouge
Description: A sister database of HUGE protein database which has accumulated the results of comprehensive sequence analysis of human long cDNAs (KIAA cDNAs). The database has been created to publicize the information obtained from mouse homologues of the KIAA cDNAs (mKIAA cDNAs).
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Model organisms, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.kazusa.or.jp/rouge/
Documentation: http://www.kazusa.or.jp/rouge/

name: svviz
text_content:
Tool Name: svviz
Description: Visualizes high-throughput sequencing data relevant to a structural variant. Only reads supporting the variant or the reference allele will be shown.
Functions: Sequence visualisation
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://svviz.github.io/svviz/
Documentation: http://svviz.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install.html

name: repfdr
text_content:
Tool Name: repfdr
Description: A tool for replicability analysis for genome-wide association studies.
Functions: Statistical inference
Topics: DNA replication and recombination, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/repfdr/index.html
Documentation: https://github.com/shay-y/repfdr

name: metaDBSite
text_content:
Tool Name: metaDBSite
Description: Meta web server to predict DNA-binding residues for DNA-binding proteins. It integrates the prediction results from six available online web servers: DISIS, DNABindR, BindN, BindN-rf, DP-Bind and DBS-PRED and it solely uses sequence information of proteins.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: DNA binding sites, Proteins
Homepage: http://projects.biotec.tu-dresden.de/metadbsite/
Documentation: http://projects.biotec.tu-dresden.de/metadbsite/

name: PALEOMIX
text_content:
Tool Name: PALEOMIX
Description: User-friendly package designed for Unix-like systems and largely automates the analyses related to whole genome re-sequencing. It is compatible with a full range of sequence data and performs a series of user-defined analyses, including read trimming, collapsing of overlapping mate-pairs, read mapping, PCR duplicate removal, SNP calling, and metagenomic profiling.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, SNP detection, Sequence trimming
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://geogenetics.ku.dk/publications/paleomix
Documentation: http://geogenetics.ku.dk/publications/paleomix

name: SHEAR
text_content:
Tool Name: SHEAR
Description: A tool for next-generation sequencing data analysis that predicts sequence variations, accounts for heterogeneous variants by estimating their representative percentages, and generates personal genomic sequences to be used for downstream analysis.
Functions: Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://vk.cs.umn.edu/SHEAR/
Documentation: http://vk.cs.umn.edu/SHEAR/

name: SNPAAMapper
text_content:
Tool Name: SNPAAMapper
Description: A downstream variant annotation program that can effectively classify variants by region (e.g. exon, intron, etc), predict amino acid change type (e.g. synonymous, non-synonymous mutation, etc), and prioritize mutation effects (e.g. CDS versus 5’UTR, etc).
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Sequence annotation
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Mapping
Homepage: http://isu.indstate.edu/ybai2/SNPAAMapper2/index.html
Documentation: http://isu.indstate.edu/ybai2/SNPAAMapper2/index.html

name: ModBase
text_content:
Tool Name: ModBase
Description: Three-dimensional protein models calculated by comparative modelling.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://modbase.compbio.ucsf.edu/modbase-cgi/index.cgi
Documentation: http://modbase.compbio.ucsf.edu/modbase-cgi/display.cgi?type=help&server=modbase

name: GenBank nucleotide sequence database
text_content:
Tool Name: GenBank nucleotide sequence database
Description: A comprehensive database of public nucleotide sequences for more than 300 000 organisms named, from small and large-scale sequencing projects. Data exchange with the European Molecular Biology Laboratory Nucleotide Sequence Database in Europe and the DNA Data Bank of Japan ensures worldwide coverage.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/
Documentation:

name: Entrez Protein Clusters
text_content:
Tool Name: Entrez Protein Clusters
Description: A collection of related protein sequences (clusters) consists of proteins derived from the annotations of whole genomes, organelles and plasmids. It currently limited to Archaea, Bacteria, Plants, Fungi, Protozoans, and Viruses.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Gene and protein families, Phylogenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sites/entrez?db=proteinclusters
Documentation: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/proteinclusters/help/

name: PyBamView
text_content:
Tool Name: PyBamView
Description: Python-based application that allows you to view BAM sequence alignments through your web browser.
Functions: Sequence visualisation
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/mgymrek/pybamview
Documentation: https://github.com/mgymrek/pybamview

name: Simcluster
text_content:
Tool Name: Simcluster
Description: A package for clustering analysis of transcript enumeration data on the simplex space.
Functions: Gene expression clustering
Topics: Gene expression, Sequence analysis, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://xerad.systemsbiology.net/simcluster/
Documentation: http://xerad.systemsbiology.net/simcluster/tutorial.html

name: Tedna
text_content:
Tool Name: Tedna
Description: A lightweight de novo transposable element assembler. It assembles the transposable elements directly from the raw reads.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://urgi.versailles.inra.fr/Tools/Tedna
Documentation: https://urgi.versailles.inra.fr/content/download/2962/25436/file/tedna_doc.pdf

name: SePIA
text_content:
Tool Name: SePIA
Description: Comprehensive RNA Sequencing workflow for standardizing Processing, Integration, and Analysis of large-scale sequencing data. It provides a systematic, pipeline architecture to manage, individually analyze, and integrate both small-RNA and RNA data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: RNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://anduril.org/sepia/
Documentation: http://anduril.org/sepia/doc.html

name: PBOOST
text_content:
Tool Name: PBOOST
Description: GPU based tool for parallel permutation tests in genome-wide association studies.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Genomics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.ust.hk/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.ust.hk/

name: OVPDT
text_content:
Tool Name: OVPDT
Description: Ordered Subset – Variable Threshold – Pedigree Disequilibrium Test,  a family-based association test using both common and rare variants and accounting for directions of effects for sequencing data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/ovpdt/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/ovpdt/

name: Comprehensive yeast genome database (CYGD)
text_content:
Tool Name: Comprehensive yeast genome database (CYGD)
Description: Information on the molecular structure and functional network of the entirely sequenced, well-studied model eukaryote, the budding yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae. In addition the data of various projects on related yeasts are used for comparative analysis.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Comparative genomics, Model organisms, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks
Homepage: http://www.helmholtz-muenchen.de/en/ibis/institute/groups/fungal-microbial-genomics/resources/cygd/index.html
Documentation: https://www.helmholtz-muenchen.de/ibis/institute/groups/fungal-microbial-genomics/resources/cygd/index.html

name: SigniSite
text_content:
Tool Name: SigniSite
Description: Identification of residue level genotype phenotype correlation in protein multiple sequence alignments by identifying amino acid residues significantly associated with the phenotype of the data set.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cbs.dtu.dk/services/SigniSite/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/SigniSite/instructions.php

name: OligoWiz
text_content:
Tool Name: OligoWiz
Description: Intelligent design of oligonucleotides for DNA microarrays.
Functions: Microarray probe design
Topics: Data architecture, analysis and design
Homepage: http://cbs.dtu.dk/services/OligoWiz/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/OligoWiz/

name: MaxMod
text_content:
Tool Name: MaxMod
Description: Standalone Graphical User Interface (GUI) of the MODELLER program which combines profile Hidden Markov Model (profile HMM) method with Clustal Omega for the construction of protein homology models.
Functions: Protein modelling
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.immt.res.in/maxmod/
Documentation: http://www.immt.res.in/maxmod/doc.htm

name: ReUPRed
text_content:
Tool Name: ReUPRed
Description: A novel method for the fast automatic prediction of repeat units and repeat classification using an extensive Structure Repeat Unit Library (SRUL) derived from RepeatsDB.
Functions: Repeat sequence detection
Topics: Gene expression, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://protein.bio.unipd.it/reupred/
Documentation: http://protein.bio.unipd.it/reupred/

name: FeatureP
text_content:
Tool Name: FeatureP
Description: Comparative analysis of protein sequences derived from the same transcript by alternative splicing, genome variation data (SNPs) or protein families from one or more organisms.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://cbs.dtu.dk/services/EPipe/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/EPipe/instructions.php

name: Tapir
text_content:
Tool Name: Tapir
Description: This service is like a DNA search engine.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/webtools/tapir/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/webtools/tapir/

name: VarDom
text_content:
Tool Name: VarDom
Description: Composition and classification analysis of the malaria antigen family PfEMP1.
Functions: Database search, Sequence classification
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cbs.dtu.dk/services/VarDom/
Documentation: http://toolname.org/docs

name: QCALL
text_content:
Tool Name: QCALL
Description: SNP detection and genotyping from low-coverage sequencing data on multiple diploid samples.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, SNP detection
Topics: Genetic variation, Genomics
Homepage: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/
Documentation:

name: CopySeq
text_content:
Tool Name: CopySeq
Description: A computataional approuch for the inference of copy-number genotypes from personal genome sequencing data.
Functions: Copy number estimation, Genetic variation analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA structural variation, Genotype and phenotype, Human genetics, Personalised medicine, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.embl.de/%7Ekorbel/CopySeq/
Documentation:

name: BRCA-diagnostic
text_content:
Tool Name: BRCA-diagnostic
Description: A software for testing known mutations in BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes from a whole genome sequencing data.
Functions: Polymorphism detection, Sequence alignment, Sequence annotation
Topics: Genetic variation, Genomics, Oncology, Personalised medicine, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.cbcb.umd.edu/software/BRCA-diagnostic/
Documentation:

name: Slider
text_content:
Tool Name: Slider
Description: A suite of java classes which provides alignment of Illumina Sequence analyser reads. For alignment it uses base probabilities instead of sequences. It also enambles SNP prediction.
Functions: SNP detection, Sequence alignment, Variant calling
Topics: DNA mutation, DNA polymorphism, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.bcgsc.ca/platform/bioinfo/software/slider
Documentation:

name: SAAP-BS
text_content:
Tool Name: SAAP-BS
Description: Streamlined Analysis and Annotation Pipeline for Reduced Representation Bisulfite Sequencing) offers an end-to-end solution for analyzing and interpreting next-generation methylation sequencing data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence annotation
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformaticstools.mayo.edu/research/saap-rrbs/
Documentation: http://bioinformaticstools.mayo.edu/research/saap-rrbs/

name: VarioBox
text_content:
Tool Name: VarioBox
Description: Desktop tool for the annotation, analysis and comparison of human genes. Variant annotation data are obtained from WAVe, protein metadata annotations are gathered from PDB and UniProt, and sequence metadata is obtained from Locus Reference Genomic (LRG) and RefSeq databases.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequence annotation, Sequence comparison
Topics: Data visualisation, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.ua.pt/software/variobox/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.ua.pt/software/variobox/

name: STRIKE
text_content:
Tool Name: STRIKE
Description: A program to evaluate protein multiple sequence alignments using a single protein structure.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.tcoffee.org/Projects/strike/index.html
Documentation: http://www.tcoffee.org/Projects/strike/index.html

name: RNAsnoop
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAsnoop
Description: A tool especially designed to search for putative interactions between a H/ACA snoRNA stem and a list of target sequence. It implements a dynamic programming algorithm that computes thermodynamically optimal H/ACA-RNA interactions in an efficient scanning variant.
Functions: Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/~htafer/RNAsnoop/RNAsnoop.html
Documentation: http://www.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/~htafer/RNAsnoop/RNAsnoop.html

name: FRAGSION
text_content:
Tool Name: FRAGSION
Description: Database-free method to efficiently generate protein fragment library by sampling from an Input-Output Hidden Markov Model.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://sysbio.rnet.missouri.edu/FRAGSION/
Documentation: http://sysbio.rnet.missouri.edu/FRAGSION/MANUAL

name: TAEC
text_content:
Tool Name: TAEC
Description: A new homology-based approach for taxonomic analysis, utilizes the similarity in the genomic sequence in addition to the result of an alignment tool.
Functions: Taxonomic classification
Topics: DNA, Evolutionary biology, Genomics, Taxonomy
Homepage: http://cals.arizona.edu/~anling/software.htm
Documentation: https://cals.arizona.edu/~anling/software.htm

name: Sambamba
text_content:
Tool Name: Sambamba
Description: This tool is a high performance modern robust and fast tool (and library), written in the D programming language, for working with SAM, BAM and CRAM formats.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.open-bio.org/wiki/Sambamba
Documentation: https://github.com/lomereiter/sambamba

name: PCI
text_content:
Tool Name: PCI
Description: Calculates the barcode gap probability of correct identification (PCI) of species.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Species frequency estimation
Topics: Biodiversity, DNA, Ecology, Evolutionary biology
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/CBBresearch/Spouge/html_ncbi/html/software/program.html?uid=17
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/CBBresearch/Spouge/html_ncbi/html/barcode_pci/pci.html

name: BiCluE
text_content:
Tool Name: BiCluE
Description: Bi-clustering software for solving the weighted/unweighted bi-cluster editing problem. It provides exact as well as heuristic algorithms.
Functions: Gene expression clustering, Gene expression profiling
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://biclue.compbio.sdu.dk
Documentation: https://biclue.compbio.sdu.dk/

name: MrBUMP
text_content:
Tool Name: MrBUMP
Description: A set of scripts for molecular replacement. It searches for homologous structures, creates a set of suitable search models from template structures, does molecular replacement and tests the solutions.
Functions: Aggregation, Molecular replacement, Protein modelling, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein structure analysis, X-ray diffraction
Homepage: http://www.ccp4.ac.uk/MrBUMP/
Documentation: http://www.ccp4.ac.uk/MrBUMP/

name: Sequence Maneuverer
text_content:
Tool Name: Sequence Maneuverer
Description: The tool efficiently extracts sequences from large datasets with few simple steps. It can efficiently extract multiple sequences of any desired length from a genome of any organism.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence database search
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://ww3.comsats.edu.pk/bio/SequenceManeuverer.aspx
Documentation: http://ww3.comsats.edu.pk/bio/SequenceManeuverer.aspx

name: MicrobeGPS
text_content:
Tool Name: MicrobeGPS
Description: Bioinformatics tool for the analysis of metagenomic sequencing data. The goal is to profile the composition of metagenomic communities as accurately as possible and present the results to the user in a convenient manner.
Functions: Community profiling
Topics: Metagenomics, Microbiology, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/microbegps/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/microbegps/

name: Whiteboard
text_content:
Tool Name: Whiteboard
Description: Class library implemented in C++, allowing for easy graphing any kind of data into any format. It provides all basic tool sets for drawing simple objects, as well as color manipulation methods, a rich set of compound graphs, and documentation.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: Bioinformatics, Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://whiteboard-class.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://whiteboard-class.sourceforge.net/whiteboard_index.html

name: GRIT
text_content:
Tool Name: GRIT
Description: Tool for transcript discovery and quantification via the integrated analysis of CAGE, RAMPAGE, RNAseq, and poly(A)-seq data
Functions: Alignment, Sequence assembly
Topics: Gene transcripts, RNA-Seq, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.statmap-bio.org/
Documentation: http://www.statmap-bio.org/SERVER_README

name: lol
text_content:
Tool Name: lol
Description: Various optimization methods for Lasso inference with matrix warpper.
Functions: Optimisation and refinement
Topics: Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/lol.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/lol.html

name: logicFS
text_content:
Tool Name: logicFS
Description: Identification of interactions between binary variables using Logic Regression. Can, e.g., be used to find interesting SNP interactions. Contains also a bagging version of logic regression for classification.
Functions: SNP detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/logicFS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/logicFS.html

name: CNTools
text_content:
Tool Name: CNTools
Description: This package provides tools to convert the output of segmentation analysis using DNAcopy to a matrix structure with overlapping segments as rows and samples as columns so that other computational analyses can be applied to segmented data.
Functions: Sequence conversion
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CNTools.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CNTools.html

name: Linnorm
text_content:
Tool Name: Linnorm
Description: R package for the analysis of RNA-seq, scRNA-seq, ChIP-seq count data or any large-scale count data. It transforms such datasets for parametric tests. Also the following pipelines are implemented: 1. Cell subpopluation analysis and visualization using PCA clustering, 2. Differential expression analysis or differential peak detection using limma, 3. Highly variable gene discovery and visualization, 4. Gene correlation network analysis and visualization. 5. Hierarchical clustering and plotting.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Linnorm.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Linnorm.html

name: ATCOECIS
text_content:
Tool Name: ATCOECIS
Description: Identify coexpressed genes or gene coexpression neighborhoods associated with cis-regulatory motifs or GO categories.
Functions: Gene expression clustering, Gene to pathway mapping, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/ATCOECIS/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/ATCOECIS/faq.htpl

name: taxator-tk
text_content:
Tool Name: taxator-tk
Description: Algorithm and the accompanying software, which performs taxonomic sequence assignment by fast approximate determination of evolutionary neighbors from sequence similarities.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Taxonomic classification
Topics: Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis, Taxonomy
Homepage: https://github.com/fungs/taxator-tk
Documentation: https://github.com/fungs/taxator-tk/blob/master/INSTALL.md

name: rMAPS
text_content:
Tool Name: rMAPS
Description: A web server that systematically generates RNA-maps for the analysis of RNA-binding proteins (RBPs) binding sites which have position-dependent functions.
Functions: Differential binding analysis, Sequence motif analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Proteins, RNA
Homepage: http://rmaps.cecsresearch.org/
Documentation: http://rmaps.cecsresearch.org/Help/UserGuide

name: keggorthology
text_content:
Tool Name: keggorthology
Description: Graphical representation of the Feb 2010 KEGG Orthology. The KEGG orthology is a set of pathway IDs that are not to be confused with the KEGG ortholog IDs.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/keggorthology.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/keggorthology.html

name: iSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: iSeq
Description: This package uses Bayesian hidden Ising models to identify IP-enriched genomic regions from ChIP-seq data. It can be used to analyze ChIP-seq data with and without controls and replicates.
Functions: Enrichment analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/iSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/iSeq.html

name: inveRsion
text_content:
Tool Name: inveRsion
Description: Package to find genetic inversions in genotype (SNP array) data.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/inveRsion.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/inveRsion.html

name: SpliceDisease DB
text_content:
Tool Name: SpliceDisease DB
Description: Linking RNA splicing and disease. Database that collects and curates data of RNA Splicing mutation and disease. The RNA Splicing mutations include cis-acting mutations that disrupt splicing and trans-acting mutations that affecting RNA-dependent functions that cause disease.
Functions: Exonic splicing enhancer prediction, Sequence merging, Splice site prediction, Splice transcript prediction, Splicing model analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, Genetic variation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Pathology, RNA splicing
Homepage: http://202.38.126.151:8080/SDisease/
Documentation:

name: MMDB
text_content:
Tool Name: MMDB
Description: Database of molecular modelling of 3-D structures; experimentally determined structures only.
Functions: Molecular model refinement, Protein modelling, Sequence similarity search, Structural similarity search
Topics: Molecular modelling, Small molecules, Structural biology, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Structure/MMDB/mmdb.shtml
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Structure/MMDB/mmdb.shtml

name: LOCPRED
text_content:
Tool Name: LOCPRED
Description: Tool for local structure prediction from protein sequence using a structural alphabet approach.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.dsimb.inserm.fr/~debrevern/TOOLS/LOCPRED/index.html
Documentation: http://www.dsimb.inserm.fr/~debrevern/TOOLS/LOCPRED/EXPL/index.html

name: RTanalyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: RTanalyzer
Description: It looks for a target site duplication, a polyA in 3′ and an endonuclease cleavage site in 5′ to calculate an overall score of retrotransposition. The tool will be useful for indepth analysis of non-autonomous retrotransposons in sequenced mammals to help us understand retrotransosition in our evolutionary tree.
Functions: Transposon prediction
Topics: DNA, Mobile genetic elements, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://biotools.riboclub.org/cgi-bin/RTAnalyzer/index.pl
Documentation: http://biotools.riboclub.org/cgi-bin/RTAnalyzer/index.pl?page=help#SECTION1

name: ParTIES
text_content:
Tool Name: ParTIES
Description: Designed for Paramecium species, that (i) identifies eliminated sequences, (ii) measures their presence in a sequencing sample and (iii) detects rare elimination polymorphisms.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Model organisms, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/oarnaiz/ParTIES
Documentation: https://github.com/oarnaiz/ParTIES/blob/master/user_manual.pdf

name: GATB
text_content:
Tool Name: GATB
Description: C++ library of high level functions designed to benefit from recent advances in NGS data structures for handling huge datasets of sequencing data.
Functions: Genome assembly, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Data management, Sequencing
Homepage: http://gatb.inria.fr/
Documentation: https://gatb.inria.fr/gatb-global-architecture/

name: GenomeMasker
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomeMasker
Description: Mask the entire human genome for non-unique primers within 6 hours and find locations of all binding sites for 10 000 designed primer pairs within 10 minutes. Additionally, it predicts all alternative PCR products from large genomes for given primer pairs.
Functions: PCR primer design, Sequencing quality control
Topics: DNA, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/?page_id=167
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/?page_id=167

name: GESS
text_content:
Tool Name: GESS
Description: Novel computational method for de novo detection of skipping event sites from raw RNA-seq reads without prior knowledge of gene annotations, as well as for determining the dominant isoform generated from such sites.
Functions: Splicing model analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA splicing, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://compbio.uthscsa.edu/GESS_Web/
Documentation: http://compbio.uthscsa.edu/GESS_Web/

name: Fitmunk
text_content:
Tool Name: Fitmunk
Description: Framework for fitting conformations on a fixed backbone into electron density.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://witold.med.virginia.edu/fitmunk/server/
Documentation: https://fitmunk.bitbucket.io/?

name: Satellog
text_content:
Tool Name: Satellog
Description: Database for the identification and prioritization of satellite repeats in disease association studies.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Polymorphism detection, Repeat sequence analysis, Repeat sequence detection, Repeat sequence organisation analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, GWAS study, Genetic variation, Pathology, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://satellog.bcgsc.ca/
Documentation: http://satellog.bcgsc.ca/documentation.php

name: GenePalette
text_content:
Tool Name: GenePalette
Description: Genome sequence visualization and navigation. Users can download from NCBI’s GenBank database large or small segments of genome sequence from a variety of organisms preserving the gene annotation that is associated with that sequence. Sequence elements of interest (transcription factor binding sites, etc. can be searched for and identified in the loaded sequence, and then clearly visualized within a colorful graphical representation of gene organization.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.genepalette.org
Documentation: http://www.genepalette.org/documentation.html

name: RNA-eXpress
text_content:
Tool Name: RNA-eXpress
Description: A user friendly solution to extract and annotate biologically important transcripts from next generation RNA sequencing data. This approach complements existing gene annotation databases by ensuring all transcripts present in the sample are considered for further analysis.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Mapping, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.rnaexpress.org/
Documentation: https://rnaexpress.erc.monash.edu.au/documentation.php

name: MethylViewer
text_content:
Tool Name: MethylViewer
Description: This tool was developed from CpGviewer such that the program can now analyse up to four different methylation sites such as CpG, GpC, CpNpG or any four user defined sites. If a non-native DNA methylase is used to modify chromatin-bound DNA, the methylation pattern can be used to identify the binding sites of DNA-binding proteins.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA binding sites, DNA structural variation, Epigenetics, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: http://dna.leeds.ac.uk/methylviewer/
Documentation: http://dna.leeds.ac.uk/methylviewer/guide/

name: INTERFEROME
text_content:
Tool Name: INTERFEROME
Description: Open access database of types I, II and III Interferon regulated genes collected from analysing expression data sets of cells treated with IFNs. This database integrates expression information with annotation, ontology, orthologue sequences from 37 species, tissue expression patterns and gene regulatory information.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression clustering, Gene expression profiling, Gene regulatory network analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Gene regulation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.interferome.org/
Documentation: http://www.interferome.org/interferome/site/showHelp.jspx

name: LmCGST
text_content:
Tool Name: LmCGST
Description: Bioinformatic pipeline that takes in raw next-generation sequencing reads, calculates a subject HCC profile, compares it to an expandable database, assigns a sequence type, and performs a phylogenetic analysis.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Infectious disease, Microbiology, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/lmcgst/?source=navbar
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/lmcgst/?source=navbar

name: gboosting
text_content:
Tool Name: gboosting
Description: R package for conducting GWAS with survival outcomes using Boosting and FDR control methods.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, GWAS study, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/site/bestumich/issues
Documentation: https://docs.google.com/viewer?a=v&pid=sites&srcid=ZGVmYXVsdGRvbWFpbnxiZXN0dW1pY2h8Z3g6ZTQ5OWNjNjczNjQ3YWNj

name: SubChlo
text_content:
Tool Name: SubChlo
Description: Computational system for predicting protein subchloroplast locations from its primary sequence. It can locate the protein whose subcellular location is chloroplast in one of the four parts: envelope (which consists of outer membrane and inner membrane), thylakoid lumen, stroma and thylakoid membrane.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein subcellular localisation prediction
Topics: Plant biology, Protein targeting and localisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfo.au.tsinghua.edu.cn/software/subchlo/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.au.tsinghua.edu.cn/software/subchlo/

name: Codon Usage Database
text_content:
Tool Name: Codon Usage Database
Description: Find GC content and frequency of codon usage for any organism that has a sequence in GenBank.
Functions: Codon usage analysis, Codon usage fraction calculation, Codon usage table comparison, Codon usage table generation
Topics: Database management, Experimental design and studies, Gene expression, Model organisms, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.kazusa.or.jp/codon/
Documentation: http://www.kazusa.or.jp/codon/

name: vt
text_content:
Tool Name: vt
Description: Variant tool set that discovers short variants from Next Generation Sequencing data.
Functions: Variant calling
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: http://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/Vt
Documentation: https://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/Vt

name: SPADS
text_content:
Tool Name: SPADS
Description: A population genetics software computing several summary statistics from populations or groups of populations, and implementing two clustering algorithms to study the genetic structure of populations. It has been specifically developed for the analysis of DNA sequences. The first aim of SPADS is to compute, on real datasets, the summary statistics computed by PhyloGeoSim on each simulated datasets.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Statistical inference
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Population genetics, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://ebe.ulb.ac.be/ebe/SPADS.html
Documentation: http://ebe.ulb.ac.be/ebe/SPADS_files/SPADS_1.0_manual_221116.pdf

name: MethylAction
text_content:
Tool Name: MethylAction
Description: R package for detecting differentially methylated regions (DMRs) from enrichment-based techniques for sequencing DNA methlyation genome-wide.
Functions: Whole genome methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Pathology
Homepage: http://jeffbhasin.github.io/methylaction/
Documentation: http://www.jeffbio.com/methylaction/docs/

name: TargetS
text_content:
Tool Name: TargetS
Description: Nnew ligand-specific template-free predictor for targeting protein-ligand binding sites from primary sequences.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction
Topics: Protein binding sites, Protein interactions, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn:8080/TargetS/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn:8080/TargetS/

name: Kaks_Calculator
text_content:
Tool Name: Kaks_Calculator
Description: Adopts model selection and model averaging to calculate nonsynonymous (Ka) and synonymous (Ks) substitution rates, attempting to include as many features as needed for accurately capturing evolutionary information in protein-coding sequences. In addition, several existing methods for calculating Ka and Ks are also incorporated into KaKs_Calculator.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA mutation, Evolutionary biology, Genetic variation, Population genetics
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/kakscalculator2/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/kakscalculator2/

name: Argot 2.5
text_content:
Tool Name: Argot 2.5
Description: An enhancement of previous server Argot2 able to quickly process thousands of sequences for functional inference.
Functions: Protein function prediction
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.medcomp.medicina.unipd.it/Argot2-5/
Documentation: http://www.medcomp.medicina.unipd.it/Argot2-5/help.php

name: PalCheck
text_content:
Tool Name: PalCheck
Description: Java program that supports both online palindrome pattern matching and online multiple palindrome pattern matching.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://toc.yonsei.ac.kr/OMPPM/
Documentation: http://toc.yonsei.ac.kr/OMPPM/readme.txt

name: Multiz
text_content:
Tool Name: Multiz
Description: Computer program which builds a threaded blockset under the assumption that all matching segments occur in the same order and orientation in the given sequences; inversions and duplications are not addressed.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.bx.psu.edu/miller_lab/
Documentation: http://www.bx.psu.edu/miller_lab/dist/tba_howto.pdf

name: ngsTools
text_content:
Tool Name: ngsTools
Description: Collection of programs for population genetics analyses from NGS data, taking into account its statistical uncertainty. The methods implemented in these programs do not rely on SNP or genotype calling, and are particularly suitable for low sequencing depth data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Population genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/mfumagalli/ngsTools
Documentation: https://github.com/mfumagalli/ngsTools/blob/master/README.md

name: RNAexpNumNbors
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAexpNumNbors
Description: This tool can compute the expected number of neighbors, or expected network degree, of an input RNA sequence.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/RNAexpNumNbors/index.spy
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/RNAexpNumNbors/index.spy?tab=main

name: MethylSig
text_content:
Tool Name: MethylSig
Description: R package for analyzing whole-genome bisulfite sequencing (bis-seq), reduced representation bisulfite sequencing (RRBS), or enhanced RRBS experiments.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sartorlab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/node/17
Documentation: https://github.com/sartorlab/methylSig/blob/master/README.md

name: SPRINT
text_content:
Tool Name: SPRINT
Description: A parallel framework for R. It provides an easy access to high performance computing for the analysis of high throughput post genomic data using the statistical programming language R.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Genomics, Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.r-sprint.org/
Documentation: https://www.ed.ac.uk/pathway-medicine/our-research/dpmgroups/ghazal-group/pathway-informatics/sprint/sprint

name: SplicingTypesAnno
text_content:
Tool Name: SplicingTypesAnno
Description: Annotates four major splicing types by RNA-Seq data, including intron retention, exon skipping, alternative donor site, and alternative acceptor site. As a post-processing tool for alignment files, it annotates the alternative splicing types with details at the intron or exon level.
Functions: Sequence annotation, Splicing model analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA splicing, RNA-Seq
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/splicingtypes/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/splicingtypes/

name: SIMreg
text_content:
Tool Name: SIMreg
Description: A tool to perform maker-set association analysis. Association analysis at gene, pathway, or exon levels (here by marker-set analysis) hold great promise in evaluating modest etiological effects of genes with GWAS or sequence data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: GWAS study, Gene transcripts, Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks
Homepage: http://www4.stat.ncsu.edu/~jytzeng/software.php
Documentation: http://www4.stat.ncsu.edu/~jytzeng/software_simreg.php

name: MitoToolPy
text_content:
Tool Name: MitoToolPy
Description: Designed for data analysis of mitochondrial DNA of eight domestic animals, including cattle, chicken, dog, horse, goat, pig, sheep and yak.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Cell biology, DNA, Zoology
Homepage: http://www.mitotool.org/mp.html#intro
Documentation: https://github.com/kizcas/MitoToolPy/blob/master/README.md

name: SWCuda
text_content:
Tool Name: SWCuda
Description: This allows to perform alignments between one or more sequences and a database (all the sequences, even in the DB, are intended to be proteinic). It is implemented in the recently released CUDA programming environment by NVidia.
Functions: Local alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.cribi.unipd.it/cuda/swcuda.html
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.cribi.unipd.it/cuda/documentation.html

name: Sann
text_content:
Tool Name: Sann
Description: A web server for prediction of protein solvent accessibility by nearest neighbor method.
Functions: Accessible surface calculation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://lee.kias.re.kr/~newton/sann/
Documentation: http://lee.kias.re.kr/~newton/sann/

name: TarPmiR
text_content:
Tool Name: TarPmiR
Description: A miRNA-mRNA binding sites prediction tool, which can utilize miRNA-mRNA binding experiment data such as CLASH (cross-linking ligation and sequencing of hybrids) .
Functions: miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://hulab.ucf.edu/research/projects/miRNA/TarPmiR/
Documentation: http://hulab.ucf.edu/research/projects/miRNA/TarPmiR/download/README.txt

name: Genomon ITDetector
text_content:
Tool Name: Genomon ITDetector
Description: Software package for internal tandem duplication detection from cancer genome sequencing data.
Functions: Repeat sequence detection
Topics: DNA, DNA mutation, Oncology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/ken0-1n/Genomon-ITDetector
Documentation: https://github.com/ken0-1n/Genomon-ITDetector/blob/master/README.md

name: WordCluster
text_content:
Tool Name: WordCluster
Description: Algorithm to detect clusters of DNA words (k-mers), or any other genomic element, based on the distance between consecutive copies and an assigned statistical significance.
Functions: k-mer counting
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinfo2.ugr.es/wordCluster/wordCluster.php
Documentation: http://bioinfo2.ugr.es/wordCluster/help.php

name: SSW
text_content:
Tool Name: SSW
Description: A fast implementation of the Smith-Waterman algorithm whose API that can be flexibly used by programs written in C, C++ and other languages.
Functions: Data handling, Sequence alignment
Topics: Data governance, Genomics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sample collections
Homepage: http://blog.gkno.me/post/42508822069/ssw-library
Documentation: https://github.com/mengyao/Complete-Striped-Smith-Waterman-Library

name: SABLE
text_content:
Tool Name: SABLE
Description: This server can be used for predicting real valued relative solvent possibilities of amino acid residues in proteins, and for improved prediction of secondary structures using evolutionary profiles and predicted relative solvent accessibility of an amino acid residue as a fingerprint of the overall packing.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://sable.cchmc.org/
Documentation: http://sable.cchmc.org/sable_doc.html

name: Maligner
text_content:
Tool Name: Maligner
Description: Tool for aligning molecular or insilico restriction maps to a reference map.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/LeeMendelowitz/maligner
Documentation: https://github.com/LeeMendelowitz/maligner/blob/master/README.md

name: NUPARM-Plus
text_content:
Tool Name: NUPARM-Plus
Description: Program for analysis of sequence dependent variations in nucleic apdb_id (DNA & RNA) double helices.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://nucleix.mbu.iisc.ernet.in/nuparm/
Documentation: http://nucleix.mbu.iisc.ernet.in/nuparm/help.html

name: R Cloud Workbench
text_content:
Tool Name: R Cloud Workbench
Description: Workbench for remote access to R/Bioconductor on EBI's cluster.
Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/rcloud/
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: SplicingCompass
text_content:
Tool Name: SplicingCompass
Description: The tool predicts genes that are differentially spliced between two different conditions using RNA-seq data. The software is based on geometric angles between high dimensional read count vectors and is able to predict genes that undergo differential splicing from next generation RNA sequencing data.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis, Splicing model analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA splicing, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.ichip.de/software/SplicingCompass.html
Documentation: http://www.leibniz-hki.de/files/content/institut/oeffentliche_ressourcen/software/SplicingCompass/SplicingCompassTutorial.pdf

name: RNApathfinder
text_content:
Tool Name: RNApathfinder
Description: A web server to compute near-optimal folding pathways between two given secondary structures for a given RNA sequence. Since this problem is known to be NP-complete, our main algorithm, RNAtabupath uses the TABU local search heuristic. The web server includes both downloadable source code for several algorithms, as well as a web engine to compute pathways. Intended applications concern folding pathways for RNA conformational switches.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/RNApathfinder/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/RNApathfinder/index.spy?tab=main

name: GIDetector
text_content:
Tool Name: GIDetector
Description: Software that is used to detect genomic islands in prokaryotic genomes. It collects prokaryotic genome data from public websites based on users’ specification, analyzes genome features using multiple sources, including embedded third-party software Alien_hunter and REPuter, and predict genomic islands based on our trained models, which are decision-tree based ensemble classifiers.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www5.esu.edu/cpsc/bioinfo/software/GIDetector/
Documentation: http://www5.esu.edu/cpsc/bioinfo/software/GIDetector/faq.html

name: reLATE
text_content:
Tool Name: reLATE
Description: Search every one of 168,297 protein sequences from 8826 animals, plants and microorganisms and return the protein that contains the closest match to the letters of your sequence.
Functions: Sequence similarity search
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/cgi-bin/decode/relate.cgi
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: Genome-wide Evaluation
text_content:
Tool Name: Genome-wide Evaluation
Description: Genome-wide evaluation under a multiple variance component model by using the maximum likelihood (ML) method and the MCMC implemented Bayesian method.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Machine learning, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://statgen.ucr.edu/software.html
Documentation: http://statgen.ucr.edu/software.html

name: MICA-aligner
text_content:
Tool Name: MICA-aligner
Description: New short-read aligner that is optimized in view of MIC’s limitation and the extra parallelism inside each MIC core.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/aquaskyline/MICA-aligner
Documentation: https://github.com/aquaskyline/MICA-aligner/blob/master/README

name: LncRNA-ID
text_content:
Tool Name: LncRNA-ID
Description: New tool that calculates the coding potential of a transcript using a machine learning model (random forest) based on multiple features including sequence characteristics of putative open reading frames, translation scores based on ribosomal coverage, and conservation against characterized protein families.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, Machine learning, RNA
Homepage: https://github.com/zhangy72/LncRNA-ID
Documentation: https://github.com/zhangy72/LncRNA-ID/blob/master/README.md

name: UProC
text_content:
Tool Name: UProC
Description: The toolbox implements a novel algorithm (“Mosaic Matching”) for large-scale sequence analysis and is now available in terms of an open source C library. It is up to three orders of magnitude faster than profile-based methods and achieved up to 80% higher sensitivity on unassembled short reads (100 bp) from simulated metagenomes.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence classification
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein properties, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://uproc.gobics.de/
Documentation: http://uproc.gobics.de/readme.html

name: deCODE
text_content:
Tool Name: deCODE
Description: Change the letters of your name to the closest DNA bases, search every one of 168,297 protein sequences from 8826 animals, plants and microorganisms and return to you, the protein that contains the closest match to the letters of your name.
Functions: Sequence similarity search
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/cgi-bin/decode/decode.cgi
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: Scorecons
text_content:
Tool Name: Scorecons
Description: A program to score residue conservation in a multiple sequence alignment.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/thornton-srv/databases/cgi-bin/valdar/scorecons_server.pl
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: TreeFam
text_content:
Tool Name: TreeFam
Description: Search of TreeFam's HMM collection, allows query sequence to be aligned (MAFFT) and inserted into tree (RAxML) to significantly matching models.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree generation, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Gene and protein families, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.treefam.org/search
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: webPRANK
text_content:
Tool Name: webPRANK
Description: Multiple sequence alignment tool.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/goldman-srv/webprank/
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: LigSearch
text_content:
Tool Name: LigSearch
Description: Identifies small molecules likely to bind to given protein.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction
Topics: Protein interactions, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/thornton-srv/databases/LigSearch
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: SAS
text_content:
Tool Name: SAS
Description: Annotation of protein sequence with structural info from similar proteins in the PDB.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Sequence similarity search
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/thornton-srv/databases/sas
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: PoreLogo
text_content:
Tool Name: PoreLogo
Description: An automated tool for the visualization of sequence and conservation of pore-lining residues in transmembrane protein structures.
Functions: Sequence visualisation, Transmembrane protein visualisation
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/thornton-srv/software/PoreLogo/
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: SUPRB
text_content:
Tool Name: SUPRB
Description: A threading strucuture prediction algorithm which employs suboptimal alignments.
Functions: Protein structure prediction, Sequence alignment
Topics: Proteins, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://kiharalab.org/suprb/
Documentation: http://kiharalab.org/suprb/

name: SlideSort-BPR
text_content:
Tool Name: SlideSort-BPR
Description: The tool is based on a fast algorithm for all-against-all comparisons of short reads and theoretical analyses of the number of neighboring reads.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: DNA, Oncology, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/ewijaya/slidesort-bpr
Documentation: https://github.com/ewijaya/slidesort-bpr

name: STAMP
text_content:
Tool Name: STAMP
Description: A package for the alignment of protein sequences based on three-dimensional (3D) structure. It provides not only multiple alignments and the corresponding `best-fit’ superimpositions, but also a systematic and reproducible method for assessing the quality of such alignments.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Structure alignment
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequencing, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/software.html#3Dstructure
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/downloads/stamp/

name: HPG Aligner
text_content:
Tool Name: HPG Aligner
Description: Ultrafast and highly sensitive Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) read mapping.
Functions: Alignment, Mapping
Topics: DNA, Mapping, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://docs.bioinfo.cipf.es/projects/hpg-aligner/wiki
Documentation: http://docs.bioinfo.cipf.es/projects/hpg-aligner/wiki#Tutorial

name: GeneParser
text_content:
Tool Name: GeneParser
Description: Identify and determine the fine structure of protein genes in genomic DNA sequences.
Functions: Gene prediction
Topics: DNA, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://stormo.wustl.edu/src/GenParser/
Documentation: http://stormo.wustl.edu/src/GenParser/

name: SiteSampler
text_content:
Tool Name: SiteSampler
Description: Java application that can sample the sites of a sequence alignment to produce replicate data sets.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis (site correlation)
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/simon-ho/sitesampler/
Documentation: https://github.com/simon-ho/sitesampler/

name: TriLoNet
text_content:
Tool Name: TriLoNet
Description: Java software package created to construct rooted level-1 phylogenetic networks from aligned DNA sequence data.
Functions: Generation
Topics: DNA, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://www.uea.ac.uk/computing/TriLoNet
Documentation: https://www.uea.ac.uk/computing/TriLoNet

name: ViVan
text_content:
Tool Name: ViVan
Description: Complete pipeline facilitating the identification, characterization and comparison of sequence variance in deep sequenced virus populations.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis, Virology
Homepage: http://vivan.tau.ac.il/index.php
Documentation: http://vivan.tau.ac.il/index.php

name: SLiQ
text_content:
Tool Name: SLiQ
Description: A set of simple linear inequalities derived from the geometry of contigs on the line, can be used to predict the relative positions and orientations of contigs from individual mate pair reads and thus produce a contig digraph.
Functions: Genome assembly
Topics: DNA binding sites, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.rutgers.edu/Software/SLiQ/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.rutgers.edu/Software/SLiQ/

name: LOX
text_content:
Tool Name: LOX
Description: Program that employs Markov Chain Monte Carlo to estimate level of expression from census sequencing data sets with multiple treatments or samples.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Sequencing
Homepage: http://medicine.yale.edu/lab/townsend/sand/index.aspx#page1
Documentation: http://medicine.yale.edu/lab/townsend/sand/LOXTutorial_203634_284_24790.pdf

name: GERMLINE
text_content:
Tool Name: GERMLINE
Description: Program for discovering long shared segments of Identity by Descent (IBD) between pairs of individuals in a large population. It takes as input genotype or haplotype marker data for individuals (as well as an optional known pedigree) and generates a list of all pairwise segmental sharing.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Genetics, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www1.cs.columbia.edu/~gusev/germline/
Documentation: http://www1.cs.columbia.edu/~gusev/germline/#usage_binoutput

name: SCI-PHY
text_content:
Tool Name: SCI-PHY
Description: A software of tree construction and subfamily detection.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Phylogenetics, Phylogenomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://phylogenomics.berkeley.edu/software
Documentation: http://phylogenomics.berkeley.edu/software

name: 1000Genomes Variation Pattern Finder
text_content:
Tool Name: 1000Genomes Variation Pattern Finder
Description: Identify variation patterns in a chromosomal region of interest for different individuals.
Functions: Variant pattern analysis
Topics: Genetic variation
Homepage: http://browser.1000genomes.org/tools.html
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: TiPs
text_content:
Tool Name: TiPs
Description: This database collects predicted drug targets in 150 pathogen species. The structural details of the drug mode of binding are also provided. Predictions are made using the information coming from drug-target three-dimensional complexes and by exploiting the homology relationships of known drug targets with pathogen proteins. Predicted pathogen targets are further annotated with sequence, structural and functional information.
Functions: Structure database search
Topics: Cheminformatics, Model organisms, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.biocomputing.it/tips
Documentation: http://circe.med.uniroma1.it/tips/help.php

name: DIGIT
text_content:
Tool Name: DIGIT
Description: A database of immunoglobulin variable domain sequences and related search and modelling tools.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Sequence annotation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.biocomputing.it/digit/
Documentation: http://circe.med.uniroma1.it/digit/about.php

name: WEP
text_content:
Tool Name: WEP
Description: The web resource which performs a complete WES pipeline and provides easy access through interface to intermediate and final results.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.cineca.it/wep
Documentation: https://bioinformatics.cineca.it/wep/

name: NGSmethDB
text_content:
Tool Name: NGSmethDB
Description: Database that contains methylation data derived from next-generation sequencing (NGS). Two cytosine methylation contexts (CpG and CAG/CTG) are considered. Through a browser interface, the user can search for methylation states in a set of tissues, retrieve methylation values for a set of tissues in a given chromosomal region, or display the methylation of promoters among different tissues. The database is currently populated with human, mouse and Arabidopsis data.
Functions: CpG island and isochore detection, Data retrieval, Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioinfo2.ugr.es/NGSmethDB/gbrowse/
Documentation: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NGSmethDB

name: CDDB
text_content:
Tool Name: CDDB
Description: Database for comprehensive results on the conformational dynamics of high molecular weight proteins and protein assemblies. Analysis is performed using a coarse-grained computational approach that is applied to most structures present in the electron microscopy data bank (EMDB). Results include equilibrium thermal fluctuations and elastic strain energy distributions that identify protein domains flexibility, functional-transitions associated domains, and correlations in molecular motions.
Functions: Molecular dynamics, Protein flexibility and motion analysis, Protein molecular weight calculation, Sequence assembly
Topics: Electron microscopy, Imaging, Molecular dynamics, Protein folds and structural domains, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.cdyn.org
Documentation: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conformational_dynamics_data_bank

name: ODB
text_content:
Tool Name: ODB
Description: Contains all known and conserved operons in completely sequenced genomes.
Functions: Clustering, Enrichment analysis, Operon drawing, Operon prediction, PCR primer design
Topics: Database management, Gene expression, Gene structure, Genomics, Model organisms
Homepage: http://operondb.jp/
Documentation: http://operondb.jp/help

name: clst
text_content:
Tool Name: clst
Description: Package for modified nearest-neighbor classification based on calculation of a similarity threshold distinguishing within-group from between-group comparisons.
Functions: Genotyping, Single particle alignment and classification
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/clst.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/clst.html

name: CINdex
text_content:
Tool Name: CINdex
Description: The package addresses important area of high-throughput genomic analysis. It allows the automated processing and analysis of the experimental DNA copy number data generated by Affymetrix SNP 6.0 arrays or similar. It calculates the chromosome instability index to quantitatively characterize genome-wide DNA copy number alterations. This package calculates not only overall genomic instability, but also instability in terms of copy number gains and losses at the chromosome and cytoband level.
Functions: Copy number estimation, Genotyping
Topics: Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CINdex.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CINdex.html

name: cghMCR
text_content:
Tool Name: cghMCR
Description: This package provides functions to identify genomic regions of interests based on segmented copy number data from multiple samples.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Genomics, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cghMCR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cghMCR.html

name: CGHcall
text_content:
Tool Name: CGHcall
Description: Calls aberrations for array CGH data using a six state mixture model as well as several biological concepts that are ignored by existing algorithms. Visualization of profiles is also provided.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Oncology
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CGHcall.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CGHcall.html

name: iCheck
text_content:
Tool Name: iCheck
Description: QC pipeline and data analysis tools for high-dimensional Illumina mRNA expression data.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, RNA, Sequencing
