Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/iCheck.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/iCheck.html

name: Repetita
text_content:
Tool Name: Repetita
Description: Protein solenoid repeat detection from sequence.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://protein.bio.unipd.it/services
Documentation: http://protein.bio.unipd.it/services

name: CCPROMISE
text_content:
Tool Name: CCPROMISE
Description: Perform Canonical correlation between two forms of high demensional genetic data, and associate the first compoent of each form of data with a specific biologically interesting pattern of associations with multiple endpoints. A probe level analysis is also implemented.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CCPROMISE.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CCPROMISE.html

name: CancerSubtypes
text_content:
Tool Name: CancerSubtypes
Description: This tool integrates the current common computational biology methods for cancer subtypes identification and provides a standarized framework for cancer subtypes analysis based on genomic datasets.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Genomics, Oncology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CancerSubtypes.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CancerSubtypes.html

name: BiSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: BiSeq
Description: This package provides useful classes and functions to handle and analyze targeted bisulfite sequencing (BS) data such as reduced-representation bisulfite sequencing (RRBS) data. In particular, it implements an algorithm to detect differentially methylated regions (DMRs). The package takes already aligned BS data from one or multiple samples.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiSeq.html

name: BioSeqClass
text_content:
Tool Name: BioSeqClass
Description: Extracting Features from Biological Sequences and Building Classification Model.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BioSeqClass.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BioSeqClass.html

name: BiocParallel
text_content:
Tool Name: BiocParallel
Description: This package provides modified versions and novel implementation of functions for parallel evaluation, tailored to use with BioConductor objects.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiocParallel.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiocParallel.html

name: RNA helicase database
text_content:
Tool Name: RNA helicase database
Description: Integrates information on RNA helicases. The database allows retrieval of comprehensive information on sequence, structure and on biochemical and cellular functions of all RNA helicases from the most widely used model organisms Escherichia coli, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Caenorhabditis elegans, Drosophila melanogaster, mouse and human. The database is structured according to the most recent helicase classification into helicase superfamilies and families, emphasizes phyologenetic relations.
Functions: Data retrieval, Query and retrieval, Structural similarity search, Structure database search
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Model organisms, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://www.rnahelicase.org
Documentation:

name: KAPPA
text_content:
Tool Name: KAPPA
Description: Sequence search program dedicated to the discovery and clustering of proteins defined by a key aminoacid pattern.
Functions: Clustering, Prediction and recognition
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/kappa-sequence-search/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/kappa-sequence-search/

name: Maxcounts
text_content:
Tool Name: Maxcounts
Description: Novel approach to estimate gene expression from RNA-seq data that reduces length bias. Once reads have been aligned to a reference genome or transcriptome, using any alignment tool, the expression of a genomic feature, such as a gene, transcript or exon, can be estimated as the maximum read coverage along its sequence. The method is available as a patch for bedtools.
Functions: RNA-seq read count analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sysbiobig.dei.unipd.it/?q=Software#MAXCOUNTS
Documentation: http://sysbiobig.dei.unipd.it/?q=Software#MAXCOUNTS

name: FunPat
text_content:
Tool Name: FunPat
Description: R package designed to provide: a useful tool to analyze time series genomic data; a computational pipeline which integrates gene selection, clustering and functional annotations into a single framework to identify the main temporal patterns associated to functional groups of differentially expressed genes; an easy way to exploit different types of annotations from currently available databases; a user-friendly organization and visualization of the outcome.
Functions: RNA-seq time series data analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sysbiobig.dei.unipd.it/?q=Software#FunPat
Documentation: http://sysbiobig.dei.unipd.it/?q=Software#FunPat

name: Cscan
text_content:
Tool Name: Cscan
Description: Web resource that includes a large collection of genome-wide ChIP-Seq experiments performed on TFs, histone modifications, RNA polymerases and others. Enriched peak regions from the ChIP-Seq experiments are crossed with the genomic coordinates of a set of input genes, to identify which of the experiments present a statistically significant number of peaks within the input genes’ loci.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Sequence database search (by property)
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.beaconlab.it/cscan
Documentation: http://159.149.160.88/cscan/help.html

name: RNAprofile
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAprofile
Description: An algorithm that takes as input a set of unaligned RNA sequences expected to share a common motif, and outputs the regions that are most conserved throughout the sequences, according to a similarity measure that takes into account both the sequence of the regions and the secondary structure they can form according to base-pairing and thermodynamic rules.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.beaconlab.it/modtools
Documentation: http://159.149.160.51/modtools/

name: Tabusearch
text_content:
Tool Name: Tabusearch
Description: A sofrware for DNA sequencing by hybridization with isothermic libraries.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bio.cs.put.poznan.pl/programs/5191f1e39dfb89a857000001
Documentation: http://bio.cs.put.poznan.pl/research_fields/5193ee2f9dfb89b38b000001

name: RNAscf
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAscf
Description: A program for RNA consensus folding for a set of unaligned RNA sequences.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAscf/
Documentation: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAscf/

name: CiF
text_content:
Tool Name: CiF
Description: Fusarium-ID, Fusarium Comparative Genomics Platform (FCGP) and Fusarium Community Platform (FCP). The Fusarium-ID archives phylogenetic marker sequences from most known species along with information associated with characterized isolates and supports strain identification and phylogenetic analyses. FCGP presents computed characteristics of multiple gene families and functional groups. The Cart/Favorite function allows users to collect sequences from Fusarium-ID and the FCGP and analyze them.
Functions: Genome visualisation, PCR primer design, Phylogenetic tree analysis (gene family prediction)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Model organisms, Phylogenetics, Small molecules, Zoology
Homepage: http://www.fusariumdb.org/
Documentation:

name: HoloVir
text_content:
Tool Name: HoloVir
Description: A robust and flexible data analysis pipeline that provides an optimised and validated workflow for taxonomic and functional characterisation of viral metagenomes.
Functions: Annotation
Topics: Systems biology
Homepage: https://github.com/plaffy/HoloVir
Documentation: https://github.com/plaffy/HoloVir/blob/master/README.md

name: Patrocles
text_content:
Tool Name: Patrocles
Description: Compiles DNA sequence polymorphisms (DSPs) that are predicted to perturb miRNA-mediated gene regulation.
Functions: Gene expression QTL analysis, Gene prediction, Genotyping, Pathway or network prediction, SNP detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene regulation, Genetic variation, Model organisms
Homepage: http://www.patrocles.org
Documentation: https://orbi.uliege.be//bitstream/2268/82703/1/baurain_denis_patrocles_berlin2008.pdf

name: LogOddsLogo
text_content:
Tool Name: LogOddsLogo
Description: Web based application designed to make the generation of sequence logos from biological sequence alignments simple.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/CBBresearch/Yu/logoddslogo/index.html
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/CBBresearch/Yu/logoddslogo/manual.html

name: GOplot
text_content:
Tool Name: GOplot
Description: R package for implementation of multilayered visualizations for enhanced graphical representation of functional analysis data.
Functions: Expression data visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://wencke.github.io/
Documentation: https://wencke.github.io/

name: SnS-Align
text_content:
Tool Name: SnS-Align
Description: A tool developed in perl, used to align the protein sequences by combining sequence and structure information at an instance. Given a protein sequence of an organism, the tool is used to identify its homologue(s) in the evolutionarily distant organisms, which might not be found from either sequence alone or structure alone comparisons.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Structure alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Proteins, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.ccmb.res.in/rakeshmishra/snsalign-tool.html
Documentation: http://www.ccmb.res.in/rakeshmishra/snsalign-tool.html

name: PANNZER
text_content:
Tool Name: PANNZER
Description: Fully automated service for functional annotation of prokaryotic and eukaryotic proteins of unknown function. The tool is designed to predict the functional description (DE), EC numbers and GO classes.
Functions: Annotation
Topics: Function analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://ekhidna.biocenter.helsinki.fi/pannzer
Documentation: http://ekhidna.biocenter.helsinki.fi/pannzer/Method.html

name: MPAgenomics
text_content:
Tool Name: MPAgenomics
Description: A package for multi-patients analysis of genomic markers. It is devoted to (i) efficient segmentation and (ii) genomic marker selection from multi-patient copy number and SNP data profiles.
Functions: Annotation, Gene expression analysis, Gene set testing, Microarray probe design, Nucleic acid feature detection, Sequence feature comparison
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Gene expression, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://modal.lille.inria.fr/wikimodal/
Documentation: https://modal.lille.inria.fr/wikimodal/doku.php

name: leBIBIpqp
text_content:
Tool Name: leBIBIpqp
Description: The BioInformatics Prokaryotes Quick Phylogeny is designed to reconstruct the phylogeny of an Archaea or a Bacteria from its nucleic acid sequence. It is also giving the useful informations if species identification is needed.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree visualisation, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis, Sequence database search
Topics: Model organisms, Phylogeny
Homepage: https://umr5558-bibiserv.univ-lyon1.fr/lebibi/lebibi.cgi
Documentation: https://umr5558-bibiserv.univ-lyon1.fr/BIBIDOCNEW/index.html#lebibi-qbpp-documentation

name: MACSIMS
text_content:
Tool Name: MACSIMS
Description: Multiple alignment-based information management system that combines the advantages of both knowledge-based and ab initio sequence analysis methods.
Functions: Sequence annotation, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation
Homepage: http://www.lbgi.fr/~julie/MACSIMS/
Documentation: http://www.lbgi.fr/~julie/MACSIMS/Documentation/

name: biojs-stat-seqs
text_content:
Tool Name: biojs-stat-seqs
Description: A module to analyze multiple seqs (information content, frequency, ...).
Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/greenify/biojs-stat-seqs
Documentation: https://github.com/greenify/stat.seqs#operations

name: methylFlow
text_content:
Tool Name: methylFlow
Description: Software of cell-specific methylation pattern reconstruction from high-throughput bisulfite-converted DNA sequencing.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/hcorrada/methylFlow
Documentation: https://github.com/hcorrada/methylFlow/blob/master/README.md

name: Genomorama
text_content:
Tool Name: Genomorama
Description: Software program for interactively displaying multiple genomes and identifying potential DNA hybridization sites for assay design.
Functions: Genome visualisation
Topics: DNA, Data visualisation, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://public.lanl.gov/jgans/genomorama/
Documentation: http://public.lanl.gov/jgans/genomorama/genomorama_doc.html

name: Genetree
text_content:
Tool Name: Genetree
Description: Software for the estimation of mutation, migration and growth rates, and ancestral inference such as the time to the most recent common ancestor of a sample of DNA sequences.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree generation
Topics: DNA, DNA mutation, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/~griff/software.html
Documentation: http://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/~griff/software.html

name: MIM
text_content:
Tool Name: MIM
Description: Calculates a measure of sequence specificity called Motif Independent Metric.
Functions: Sequence motif analysis
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bcb.dfci.harvard.edu/~gcyuan/software.html
Documentation: https://github.com/lucapinello/mim

name: MAPGAPS
text_content:
Tool Name: MAPGAPS
Description: Uses a set of multiply-aligned profiles both as a query to detect and classify related sequences and as a template to multiply-align the sequences.
Functions: Classification, Sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mapgaps.igs.umaryland.edu/
Documentation: http://mapgaps.igs.umaryland.edu/readme

name: MUSI
text_content:
Tool Name: MUSI
Description: Tool for uncovering multiple peptides and nucleic acids binding specificities from sequence data. MUSI provides a simple interface for processing short peptides or nucleic acid sequence data. Starting from a set of sequences observed to bind to a given target, it automatically generates an optimal number of motifs based on the different specificity patterns present in the data.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: DNA binding sites, Protein binding sites, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.kimlab.org/software/musi
Documentation: http://www.kimlab.org/software/musi

name: VisRD
text_content:
Tool Name: VisRD
Description: Software package allowing graphical inspection of the phylogenetic content of a sequence alignment, that is primarily intended for detection of recombination and recombination breakpoints.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree visualisation, Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.uea.ac.uk/computing/phylogenetics-software-visrd
Documentation: http://www.uea.ac.uk/documents/429378/432070/Visrd_manual.pdf/e9d46b2b-36b2-4b0b-8d67-740fec420827

name: GAMETES
text_content:
Tool Name: GAMETES
Description: User-friendly software package and algorithm which generates complex biallelic single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) disease models for simulation studies.
Functions: SNP detection
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/gametes/?source=navbar
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/gametes/?source=navbar

name: GAML
text_content:
Tool Name: GAML
Description: Prototype genome assembly tool based on maximizing likelihood of the assembly in a model encompaasing error rate, insert length and other features of indvidual sequencing technologies.
Functions: Genome assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: http://compbio.fmph.uniba.sk/gaml/
Documentation: https://github.com/usamec/gaml

name: ViSpA
text_content:
Tool Name: ViSpA
Description: It implements a novel viral assembling and frequency estimation methods. This software uses a simple error correction, viral variants assembling based on maximum-bandwidth paths in weighted read graphs and frequency estimation via Expectation Maximization on all reads.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Virology
Homepage: http://alan.cs.gsu.edu/NGS/?q=content/vispa
Documentation: http://alan.cs.gsu.edu/NGS/sites/default/files/readme_vispa_mosaik.txt

name: MFLINK
text_content:
Tool Name: MFLINK
Description: Simple program which automates setting up likelihood calculations for linkage analysis using a variety of different transmission models, and then collating the results in order to produce a (nearly) model free lod score.
Functions: Linkage analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.davecurtis.net/dcurtis/software.html
Documentation: http://www.davecurtis.net/dcurtis/software.html

name: NBSPred
text_content:
Tool Name: NBSPred
Description: Support vector machine-based high throughput pipeline for plant resistance protein NBSLRR (nucleotide binding site-leucine-rich repeats) prediction.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Plant biology, Protein binding sites
Homepage: http://soilecology.biol.lu.se/nbs/
Documentation: http://soilecology.biol.lu.se/nbs/index.php?page=home

name: IVA
text_content:
Tool Name: IVA
Description: IVA is a de novo assembler designed to assemble virus genomes that have no repeat sequences, using Illumina read pairs sequenced from mixed populations at extremely high and variable depth.
Functions: Repeat sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://sanger-pathogens.github.io/iva/
Documentation: https://github.com/sanger-pathogens/iva/wiki

name: glmgraph
text_content:
Tool Name: glmgraph
Description: R package for variable selection and predictive modeling of structured genomic data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/glmgraph/index.html
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/glmgraph/glmgraph.pdf

name: SCONE
text_content:
Tool Name: SCONE
Description: This tool reports position-specific measures of conservation.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Sequencing
Homepage: http://genetics.bwh.harvard.edu/scone/
Documentation: http://genetics.bwh.harvard.edu/scone/dist/files/HOW-TO

name: GAMP
text_content:
Tool Name: GAMP
Description: Conduct “global analysis” of DNA methylation data, particularly from the Illumina 450k Infinium platform. Instead of examining the effect of individual CpGs, the idea is to compare the overall profile or distribution of CpG measurements across individuals.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://research.fhcrc.org/wu/en/software.html#GAMP
Documentation: http://research.fhcrc.org/content/dam/stripe/wu/files/GAMP/GAMP-manual.pdf

name: GIV
text_content:
Tool Name: GIV
Description: Display the locations of genomic islands in a genome, as well as the corresponding supportive feature information for GIs.
Functions: Genome visualisation
Topics: DNA, Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www5.esu.edu/cpsc/bioinfo/software/GIV
Documentation: http://www5.esu.edu/cpsc/bioinfo/software/GIV/GIV_Manual.pdf

name: TriageTools
text_content:
Tool Name: TriageTools
Description: A collection of tools for partitioning raw data (fastq reads) from high-throughput sequencing projects.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/triagetools/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/triagetools/wiki/Home/

name: WormGender
text_content:
Tool Name: WormGender
Description: Open-source software which designed for accurate quantification of sex ratio in Caenorhabditis elegans.  The software functions include, i) automatic recognition and counting of adult hermaphrodites and males, ii) a manual inspection feature that enables manual correction of errors, and iii) flexibility to use new training images to optimize the software for different imaging conditions.
Functions: Quantification
Topics: Computational biology, Sequence analysis, Zoology
Homepage: http://www.quantworm.org/
Documentation: http://www.quantworm.org/

name: ModeRNA
text_content:
Tool Name: ModeRNA
Description: Program for comparative modeling of RNA 3D structures.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genesilico.pl/moderna/
Documentation: http://genesilico.pl/moderna/

name: A_Purva
text_content:
Tool Name: A_Purva
Description: Contact Map Overlap maximization (CMO) solver. Given two protein structures represented by two contact maps, it computes the amino-acid alignment which maximize the number of common contacts.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://tools.genouest.org/data/apurva/manual.pdf
Documentation: http://tools.genouest.org/data/apurva/manual.pdf

name: Tuiuiu
text_content:
Tool Name: Tuiuiu
Description: Filter designed for multiple repeats and for dealing with error rates greater than 10% of the repeats length.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://training.genouest.org/claroline/claroline/learnPath/learningPathList.php?cidReset=true&cidReq=TUIUIU
Documentation: http://training.genouest.org/claroline/claroline/learnPath/learningPathList.php?cidReset=true&cidReq=TUIUIU

name: moduleorganizer
text_content:
Tool Name: moduleorganizer
Description: Software package proposing a synthetic view of a set of DNA sequences by providing both a segmentation of them into domains and a classification on the basis of these domains.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.genouest.org/spip.php?page=outils&id_rubrique=113&lang=en
Documentation: http://www.genouest.org/spip.php?page=outils&id_rubrique=113&lang=en

name: showalign WS (husar)

Tool Name: showalign WS (husar)

name: KBWS

Tool Name: KBWS

Documentation: http://www.g-language.org/wiki/kbws_readme

name: G-language API
text_content:
Tool Name: G-language API
Description: Set of Perl libraries for genome sequence analysis.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.g-language.org/wiki/rest
Documentation: http://www.g-language.org/wiki/rest

Tool Name: G-language Genome Analysis Environment WS

Documentation: http://ws.g-language.org/gdoc/

name: targetHub

Homepage: http://app1.bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/tarhub/_design/basic/docs.html
Documentation: http://app1.bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/tarhub/_design/basic/docs.html

text_content:
Tool Name: NCBI Assembly Archive

Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
