Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/assembly/?view=taxonomy_tree

name: UniMoG
text_content:
Tool Name: UniMoG
Description: Software tool unifying five genome rearrangement distance models: double cut and join (DCJ), restricted DCJ, Hannenhalli and Pevzner (HP), inversion only and translocation only. It allows computing all of these five distances between pairs of genomes represented as sequences of oriented common blocks.
Functions: Sequence composition calculation
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bibiserv.techfak.uni-bielefeld.de/dcj/
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/dcj?id=dcj_manual

name: MASE
text_content:
Tool Name: MASE
Description: Tool designed to simplify the manipulation of aligned sequence sets. It contains functionality for many of the common tasks related to this goal. In addition, mase was designed with a very modular approach, making additions or modifications to the code straightforward.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.girinst.org/downloads/software/mase/
Documentation: http://www.girinst.org/downloads/software/mase/

name: mtDNA-Server
text_content:
Tool Name: mtDNA-Server
Description: Free mtDNA NGS analysis pipeline including heteroplasmy detection and haplogroup-based contamination deconvolution.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Cell biology, DNA, Human biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://mtdna-server.uibk.ac.at/
Documentation: https://mtdna-server.uibk.ac.at/index.html#!pages/help

name: Mutanalyst
text_content:
Tool Name: Mutanalyst
Description: Online tool for assessing the mutational spectrum of epPCR (error-prone PCR) libraries with poor sampling.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA mutation, Data quality management, PCR experiment
Homepage: http://www.mutanalyst.com/
Documentation: http://www.mutanalyst.com/

name: FUGUE
text_content:
Tool Name: FUGUE
Description: Program for recognizing distant homologues by sequence-structure comparison. It utilizes environment-specific substitution tables and structure-dependent gap penalties, where scores for amino acid matching and insertions/deletions are evaluated depending on the local environment of each amino acid residue in a known structure.
Functions: Protein comparison, Protein modelling, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Proteins, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://mizuguchilab.org/fugue/
Documentation: http://mizuguchilab.org/fugue/documentation.html

name: MotifDetector
text_content:
Tool Name: MotifDetector
Description: Designed to find motifs in multiple DNA sequences.The software uses the randomized algorithm to find good seeds and uses the improved EM algorithm to do local search.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.cs.cityu.edu.hk/~lwang/software/motif/index.html
Documentation: http://www.cs.cityu.edu.hk/~lwang/software/motif/index.html

name: GETUTR
text_content:
Tool Name: GETUTR
Description: Landscape of 3′ UTR from RNA-seq data. It has three steps: preprocessing, smoothing and normalization.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://big.hanyang.ac.kr/GETUTR/
Documentation: http://big.hanyang.ac.kr/GETUTR/

name: UPB
text_content:
Tool Name: UPB
Description: UPB is an Urinary Protein Biomarker database to collect existing studies of urinary protein biomarkers from published literature.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Biomarkers, Experimental design and studies
Homepage: http://59.108.16.249/biomarker/web/indexdb
Documentation: http://59.108.16.249/biomarker/web/indexdb

name: Peptide Match
text_content:
Tool Name: Peptide Match
Description: Quickly retrieve all occurrences of a given query peptide from UniProt Knowledgebase (UniProtKB) with isoforms.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence composition calculation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://research.bioinformatics.udel.edu/peptidematch/docs/userguide.htm#single_rest
Documentation: http://research.bioinformatics.udel.edu/peptidematch/docs/userguide.htm#single_rest

name: SeqDepot
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqDepot
Description: Novel database that focuses solely on two primary goals: (i) assimilating known primary sequences with predicted feature data and (ii) providing the most simple and straightforward means to procure and readily use this information.
Functions: Data retrieval, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://seqdepot.net/
Documentation: http://seqdepot.net/

name: TFmodellerServiceService
text_content:
Tool Name: TFmodellerServiceService
Description: The program scans a protein sequence P against a library of protein-DNA complexes and builds comparative models of P if good templates are found.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://maya.ccg.unam.mx/~tfmodell/tutorial.html
Documentation: http://maya.ccg.unam.mx/~tfmodell/tutorial.html

name: methVisual
text_content:
Tool Name: methVisual
Description: This package allows the visualization of DNA methylation data after bisulfite sequencing.
Functions: Methylation analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methVisual.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methVisual.html

name: metaSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: metaSeq
Description: The probabilities by one-sided NOISeq are combined by Fisher's method or Stouffer's method.
Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/metaSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/metaSeq.html

name: MSAprobs
text_content:
Tool Name: MSAprobs
Description: Multiple alignment algorithm for protein sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://msaprobs.sourceforge.net/homepage.htm#latest
Documentation: http://msaprobs.sourceforge.net/homepage.htm#latest

name: FASTM API (EBI)
text_content:
Tool Name: FASTM API (EBI)
Description: Includes FASTF, that compares an ordered peptide mixture, as would be obtained by Edman degradation of a CNBr cleavage of a protein, against a protein database; FASTM, that compares an ordered set of peptides to a protein sequence database or an ordered set of oligonucleotides to a nucleotide sequence database; and FASTS, that compares a set of short peptide fragments, as would be obtained from mass-spec. analysis of a protein, against a protein database.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/sss/fastm_rest
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/sss/fastm_rest

name: Cn3D
text_content:
Tool Name: Cn3D
Description: Web browser helper application that simultaneously displays 3-D structure, sequence, and alignment.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Structure alignment, Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Structure/CN3D/cn3d.shtml
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Structure/CN3D/cn3d.shtml

name: VarDetect
text_content:
Tool Name: VarDetect
Description: A stand-alone nucleotide variation exploratory tool that automatically detects nucleotide variation from fluorescence based chromatogram traces.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www4a.biotec.or.th/GI/tools/vardetect
Documentation: http://www4a.biotec.or.th/GI/tools/vardetect

name: Virtual Pharmacist
text_content:
Tool Name: Virtual Pharmacist
Description: Web tool that interprets personal genome for the impact of genetic variation on drug response. It can take variants data (VCF format), microarray SNP genotyping data and high-throughput sequencing data as input, and report to the users how the variants in their personal genomes impact their drug response, including drug efficacy, dosage and toxicity.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Genotyping experiment, Pharmacogenomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.sustc-genome.org.cn/vp/
Documentation: http://www.sustc-genome.org.cn/vp/user_guide.php

name: Genome Classifier
text_content:
Tool Name: Genome Classifier
Description: Python/pyrex implementation of the Bayesian classifier of genomic signatures.
Functions: Sequence classification, Sequence comparison
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Mathematics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sandberg.cmb.ki.se/genomeclass/
Documentation: http://sandberg.cmb.ki.se/genomeclass/

name: optnetaligncpp
text_content:
Tool Name: optnetaligncpp
Description: A multiobjective memetic algorithm for the problem of PPI network alignment that uses extremely efficient swap-based local search, mutation, and crossover operations to create a population of alignments.
Functions: Pathway or network analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Systems biology
Homepage: https://github.com/crclark/optnetaligncpp
Documentation: https://github.com/crclark/optnetaligncpp/blob/master/README.md

name: FMTP
text_content:
Tool Name: FMTP
Description: Software tool to compute the MTP of a physical map based purely on restriction fingerprint data (and the contigs). It completely ignores the ordering of clones obtained by the physical map algorithm.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.mscs.mu.edu/~bozdag/FMTP/index.html
Documentation: http://www.mscs.mu.edu/~bozdag/FMTP/index.html

name: MSITE
text_content:
Tool Name: MSITE
Description: Program designed to analyse structural data of liganded and unliganded proteins.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Small molecules, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://biocomp.chem.uw.edu.pl/tools/msite
Documentation: http://biocomp.chem.uw.edu.pl/tools/msite

name: ForeSeqs
text_content:
Tool Name: ForeSeqs
Description: Predict missing sequences and branch lengths in phylogenomic data.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Phylogenomics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/ddarriba/ForeSeqs
Documentation: https://github.com/ddarriba/ForeSeqs/blob/master/Makefile.am

name: GenePainter
text_content:
Tool Name: GenePainter
Description: Standalone tool for mapping gene structures onto protein multiple sequence alignments (MSA). Gene structures, as provided by WebScipio, are aligned with respect to the exact positions of the introns (down to nucleotide level) and intron phase. Output can be viewed in various formats, ranging from plain text to graphical output formats.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, Genetics, Molecular genetics, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.motorprotein.de/genepainter.html
Documentation: http://www.motorprotein.de/genepainter/help

name: SOCKET
text_content:
Tool Name: SOCKET
Description: The tool finds the Knobs-into-Holes mode of packing between alpha-helices which is characteristic of coiled coils. It unambiguously defines the beginning and end of coiled-coil motifs in protein structures and assigns a heptad register to the sequence, highlighting the core-residues with a RasMol script if required.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://coiledcoils.chm.bris.ac.uk/socket/
Documentation: http://coiledcoils.chm.bris.ac.uk/socket/README

name: stretcher-api (EBI)
text_content:
Tool Name: stretcher-api (EBI)
Description: Pairwise sequence alignment of DNA or protein sequences using Myers and Miller global alignment.
Functions: Pairwise sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/psa/emboss_stretcher_rest
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/psa/emboss_stretcher_rest

name: Kaling API (EBI)
text_content:
Tool Name: Kaling API (EBI)
Description: Fast and accurate multiple sequence alignment algorithm for DNA and protein sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/msa/kalign_rest
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/msa/kalign_rest

name: Mview API (EBI)
text_content:
Tool Name: Mview API (EBI)
Description: Re-format the results of a sequence database search (BLAST, FASTA, etc) or a multiple alignment (MSF, PIR, CLUSTAL, etc) adding optional HTML markup to control colouring and web page layout.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/msa/mview_rest
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/msa/mview_rest

name: Phobius API
text_content:
Tool Name: Phobius API
Description: Transmembrane topology and signal peptides prediction from the amino acid sequence of a protein.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction
Topics: Function analysis, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein secondary structure
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/pfa/phobius_rest
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/pfa/phobius_rest

name: InterProScan WS (EBI)
text_content:
Tool Name: InterProScan WS (EBI)
Description: Tool that combines different protein signature recognition methods into one resource. It is a reimplementation of the traditional InterProScan 4.x series and adds features such as pathway annotations and signal peptide and transmembrane prediction using Phobius.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/pfa/iprscan5_rest
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/pfa/iprscan5_rest

name: Orione
text_content:
Tool Name: Orione
Description: Specialized domain server for integrative analysis of NGS microbial data, that covers the whole life cycle of microbiology research data, bringing together all the tools to perform steps such as quality check, alignment, assembly, scaffolding and annotation.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://orione.crs4.it
Documentation: https://orione.crs4.it/

name: cummeRbund
text_content:
Tool Name: cummeRbund
Description: Allows for persistent storage, access, exploration, and manipulation of Cufflinks high-throughput sequencing data. In addition, provides numerous plotting functions for commonly used visualizations.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cummeRbund.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cummeRbund.html

name: crisprseekplus
text_content:
Tool Name: crisprseekplus
Description: Bioinformatics platform containing interface to work with offTargetAnalysis and compare2Sequences in the CRISPRseek package, and GUIDEseqAnalysis.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/crisprseekplus.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/crisprseekplus.html

name: MBAmethyl
text_content:
Tool Name: MBAmethyl
Description: This package provides a function for reconstructing DNA methylation values from raw measurements. It iteratively implements the group fused lars to smooth related-by-location methylation values and the constrained least squares to remove probe affinity effect across multiple sequences.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Gene regulation, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MBAmethyl.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MBAmethyl.html

name: SeaView
text_content:
Tool Name: SeaView
Description: Multiplatform graphical user interface designed to facilitate alignment and phylogenic tree building from molecular sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Phylogenetic tree editing, Phylogenetic tree generation (from molecular sequences), Phylogenetic tree visualisation, Sequence alignment editing, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://doua.prabi.fr/software/seaview
Documentation: http://doua.prabi.fr/main/index

name: 959 Nematode Genomes
text_content:
Tool Name: 959 Nematode Genomes
Description: A community-curated semantic wiki to coordinate the sequencing efforts of individual labs to collectively sequence 959 genomes spanning the phylum Nematoda. The main goal of the wiki is to track sequencing projects that have been proposed, are in progress, or have been completed.
Functions: Genome annotation, Genome assembly, Genotyping, Query and retrieval, Sequence coordinate conversion
Topics: Genomics, Model organisms, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Zoology
Homepage: http://www.nematodes.org/nematodegenomes/index.php/Main_Page
Documentation:

name: CORREP
text_content:
Tool Name: CORREP
Description: Multivariate correlation estimation and statistical inference.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CORREP.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CORREP.html

name: cogena
text_content:
Tool Name: cogena
Description: Workflow for co-expressed gene-set enrichment analysis. It aims to discovery smaller scale, but highly correlated cellular events that may be of great biological relevance. A novel pipeline for drug discovery and drug repositioning based on the workflow is proposed. Particularly, candidate drugs can be predicted based on the gene expression of disease-related data, or other similar drugs can be identified based on the gene expression of drug-related data.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cogena.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cogena.html

name: LOLA
text_content:
Tool Name: LOLA
Description: Provides functions for testing overlap of sets of genomic regions with public and custom region set (genomic ranges) databases. This make is possible to do automated enrichment analysis for genomic region sets, thus facilitating interpretation of functional genomics and epigenomics data.
Functions: Sequence database search
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/LOLA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/LOLA.html

name: SRAMP
text_content:
Tool Name: SRAMP
Description: A useful tool to predict m6A modification sites on the RNA sequences
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: RNA, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.cuilab.cn/sramp
Documentation: http://www.cuilab.cn/sramp

name: UNPHASED
text_content:
Tool Name: UNPHASED
Description: Application for performing genetic association analysis in nuclear families and unrelated subjects. It implements maximum-likelihood inference on haplotype and genotype effects while allowing for uncertain phase and missing genotypes.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/site/fdudbridge/software/unphased-3-1
Documentation: https://sites.google.com/site/fdudbridge/software/unphased-3-1

name: W-ChIPeaks
text_content:
Tool Name: W-ChIPeaks
Description: This employs a probe-based or bin-based enrichment threshold to define peaks and applies statistical methods to control the false discovery rate for identified peaks.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://compbio.uthscsa.edu/W-ChIPeaks/
Documentation: http://compbio.uthscsa.edu/W-ChIPeaks/help.shtml

name: ParDRe
text_content:
Tool Name: ParDRe
Description: De novo parallel tool to remove duplicated and near-duplicated reads through the clustering of Single-End or Paired-End sequences from fasta or fastq files.
Functions: Sequence editing
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/pardre/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/pardre/

name: Sprites
text_content:
Tool Name: Sprites
Description: A sv caller that specializes in detecting deletion from low-coverage sequencing data. It works by identifying split reads from alignments based on soft-clipping information.
Functions: Gene prediction, Genetic variation analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/zhangzhen/sprites
Documentation: https://github.com/zhangzhen/sprites

name: GeIST
text_content:
Tool Name: GeIST
Description: Identify integrations of DNA elements on a genome-wide scale.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Virology
Homepage: http://research.nhgri.nih.gov/software/GeIST/
Documentation: https://github.com/mlafave/GeIST

name: TreeRefiner
text_content:
Tool Name: TreeRefiner
Description: Aan efficient program for refining multiple alignment of genomic sequences based on a phylogenetic tree. It has demonstrated significant improvements in the accuracy of alignments generated by several popular aligners.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis, Sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://treerefiner.stanford.edu/
Documentation: http://treerefiner.stanford.edu/manual.pdf

name: OBITools
text_content:
Tool Name: OBITools
Description: Set of python programs developed to simplify the manipulation of sequence files. They were mainly designed to help us for analyzing Next Generation Sequencer outputs (454 or Illumina) in the context of DNA Metabarcoding.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://git.metabarcoding.org/obitools/obitools/wikis/home
Documentation: http://metabarcoding.org//obitools/doc/welcome.html#installing-the-obitools

name: GenoWAP
text_content:
Tool Name: GenoWAP
Description: Post-GWAS prioritization method that integrates genomic functional annotation and GWAS test statistics. After prioritization, real disease-associated loci become easier to be identified.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Pathway or network analysis
Topics: GWAS study, Genetics, Pathology, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://genocanyon.med.yale.edu/GenoWAP
Documentation: http://genocanyon.med.yale.edu/GenoWAP

name: GHap
text_content:
Tool Name: GHap
Description: R package was designed to call haplotypes from phased marker data.
Functions: Linkage analysis
Topics: Genetics, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/GHap/index.html
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/GHap/vignettes/GHap_vignette.pdf

name: MPEx
text_content:
Tool Name: MPEx
Description: Tool for exploring the topology and other features of membrane proteins by means of hydropathy plots based upon thermodynamic and biological principles.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://blanco.biomol.uci.edu/mpex/
Documentation: http://blanco.biomol.uci.edu/mpex/

name: MaSC
text_content:
Tool Name: MaSC
Description: Perl implementation of our MaSC approach to estimating fragment length from short-read high-throughput sequencing data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.perkinslab.ca/Software.html
Documentation: http://www.perkinslab.ca/sites/perkinslab.ca/files/README_0.TXT

name: RNArobo
text_content:
Tool Name: RNArobo
Description: An RNA structural motif search tool. Itcan search sequence databases in FASTA format for a motif defined by a descriptor, which can specify primary and secondary structure constraints.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://compbio.fmph.uniba.sk/rnarobo/
Documentation: http://compbio.fmph.uniba.sk/rnarobo/rnarobo-readme.pdf

name: Overall LD
text_content:
Tool Name: Overall LD
Description: Program to assess the overall Linkage Disequilibrium (LD) over several markers and assess the LD between groups of markers.
Functions: Linkage disequilibrium calculation
Topics: Genetics, Population genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://zhaocenter.org/software/#Population_Genetics
Documentation: http://zhaocenter.org/software/#Population_Genetics

name: TagGD
text_content:
Tool Name: TagGD
Description: A fully-customisable, fast and accurate software package that can generate thousands of barcodes satisfying user-defined constraints and can guarantee full demultiplexing accuracy.
Functions: Community profiling
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/pelinakan/UBD.git
Documentation: https://github.com/pelinakan/UBD

name: mkdom
text_content:
Tool Name: mkdom
Description: Program we use routinely to build each new release of ProDom, Protein domain families automatically generated from protein databases. It relies on the assumption that the shortest amino acid sequence corresponds to a single domain, and may be used as a query to screen the database with the psi-blast program, in order to cluster homologous domains.
Functions: Local alignment
Topics: Database management, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://prodom.prabi.fr/prodom/xdom/welcome.html
Documentation: http://prodom.prabi.fr/prodom/xdom/mkdom2.html

name: PCAdapt
text_content:
Tool Name: PCAdapt
Description: Software to detect footprints of local adaptation in population genetics data set.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Genetics, Genomics, Population genetics
Homepage: http://membres-timc.imag.fr/Nicolas.Duforet-Frebourg/PCAdapt.html
Documentation: http://membres-timc.imag.fr/Michael.Blum/PCAdapt.html

name: NPLB
text_content:
Tool Name: NPLB
Description: Efficient, organism-independent method for characterizing such diverse architectures directly from experimentally identified genome-wide TSSs, without relying on known promoter elements.
Functions: Promoter prediction
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://nplb.ncl.res.in/
Documentation: http://nplb.ncl.res.in/help.html

name: McQFold
text_content:
Tool Name: McQFold
Description: Program for MCMC-sampling secondary structures with pseudoknots for a given RNA sequence.
Functions: RNA secondary structure analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://www-stud.informatik.uni-frankfurt.de/~metzler/McQFold/
Documentation: http://www-stud.informatik.uni-frankfurt.de/~metzler/McQFold/README

name: NLDMseq
text_content:
Tool Name: NLDMseq
Description: Bioinformatics tool for expression calculation at both gene and isoform levels from RNA-seq data by considering isoform- and exon-specific read sequencing rate.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://github.com/PUGEA/NLDMseq
Documentation: https://github.com/PUGEA/NLDMseq/blob/master/README.md

name: NLR-parser
text_content:
Tool Name: NLR-parser
Description: Tool to rapidly annotate the NLR (nucleotide-binding leucine-rich repeat) complement from sequenced plant genomes.
Functions: Annotation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Pathology, Plant biology
Homepage: https://github.com/steuernb/NLR-Parser
Documentation: https://github.com/steuernb/NLR-Parser/blob/master/README.md

name: MapView
text_content:
Tool Name: MapView
Description: An information-rich short reads alignment viewer with genetic detection capability for next-generation sequencing technologies. It supports a compact alignment view for both single-end and pair-end short reads, multiple navigation and zoom modes, and multi-thread processing. It offers automated genetic variation detection.
Functions: Data handling, Genetic variation analysis, Multiple sequence alignment, Read mapping
Topics: Computational biology, Gene expression, Genetic variation, Genetics, Mapping
Homepage: http://evolution.sysu.edu.cn/mapview/
Documentation:

name: Eponine
text_content:
Tool Name: Eponine
Description: Probabilistic method for detecting transcription start sites (TSS) in mammalian genomic sequence, with good specificity and excellent positional accuracy.
Functions: Copy number estimation, DNA transcription, Enrichment analysis, Promoter prediction
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Human biology, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/resources/software/eponine/
Documentation:

name: SA-Search
text_content:
Tool Name: SA-Search
Description: Tool which first converts a PDB structure file into a one-dimensional representation using a structural alphabet, and then searches for similarities using standard methods for sequence alignment.
Functions: Protein modelling, Protein structure comparison, Sequence similarity search, Structural similarity search
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bioserv.rpbs.jussieu.fr/cgi-bin/SA-Search
Documentation:

name: EUGENE HOM
text_content:
Tool Name: EUGENE HOM
Description: Gene prediction software for eukaryotic organisms based on comparative analysis. The data is currently tuned for plant sequences of up to 400kb.
Functions: Gene prediction, Splice site prediction, Splicing model analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, Model organisms, Plant biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genopole.toulouse.inra.fr/bioinfo/eugene/EuGeneHom/cgi-bin/EuGeneHom.pl
Documentation:

name: StructureLab
text_content:
Tool Name: StructureLab
Description: A computational system which has been developed to permit the use of a broad array of approaches to the analysis of the structure of RNA. The goal of the development is to provide a large set of tools that can be well integrated with experimental biology to aid in the process of the determination of the underlying structure of RNA sequences.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Structure analysis
Homepage: https://binkley2.ncifcrf.gov/users/bshapiro/structurelab/structureLab.html
Documentation: https://binkley2.ncifcrf.gov/users/bshapiro/software.html

name: FlowerPower
text_content:
Tool Name: FlowerPower
Description: Clustering algorithm designed for the identification of global homologs. It employs an iterative approach to clustering sequences. However, rather than using a single HMM or profile to expand the cluster, this tool identifies subfamilies using the SCI-PHY algorithm and then selects and aligns new homologs using subfamily hidden Markov models. It is shown to outperform BLAST, PSI-BLAST and the UCSC SAM-Target 2K methods.
Functions: Sequence clustering
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://phylogenomics.berkeley.edu/software
Documentation: http://phylogenomics.berkeley.edu/software

name: Periscope
text_content:
Tool Name: Periscope
Description: Constructed based on the rising popularity of periplasmic expression, this tool is a sequence-based predictor with a two-stage architecture that estimates the expression level and yield of soluble protein in the periplasm of E. coli.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Sequence analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Microbiology, Protein expression
Homepage: http://lightning.med.monash.edu/periscope/
Documentation: http://lightning.med.monash.edu/periscope/introduction.jsp

name: MatureBayes
text_content:
Tool Name: MatureBayes
Description: Tool for finding mature miRNA within a miRNA precursor sequence using a Naive Bays classifier.
Functions: miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA
Homepage: http://mirna.imbb.forth.gr/MatureBayes.html
Documentation: http://mirna.imbb.forth.gr/MatureBayes.html

name: MODELESTIMATOR
text_content:
Tool Name: MODELESTIMATOR
Description: Estimates amino acid replacement rates from an input of aligned sequences.
Functions: Structure analysis
Topics: Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.csc.kth.se/~arve/code/modelestimator/
Documentation: https://github.com/arvestad/modelestimator/blob/master/README.md

name: UPIC
text_content:
Tool Name: UPIC
Description: A decision tool for the cost-effective design of DNA fingerprinting/genotyping experiments using simple-sequence/tandem repeat (SSR/STR) markers.
Functions: Primer and probe design
Topics: DNA, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ars.usda.gov/Main/docs.htm?docid=18376
Documentation: https://www.ars.usda.gov/southeast-area/stoneville-ms/genomics-and-bioinformatics-research/docs/bioinformatics/

name: MoSDi
text_content:
Tool Name: MoSDi
Description: Contains a lot of sequence analysis algorithms, including methods for motif statistics, exact motif discovery, analysis of pattern matching algorithms, etc.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/tobiasmarschall/mosdi
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/tobiasmarschall/mosdi/src

name: Telescoper
text_content:
Tool Name: Telescoper
Description: A local assembly algorithm designed for short-reads from NGS platforms such as Illumina. The reads must come from two libraries: one short insert, and one long insert.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/p/telescoper/wiki/Home/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/telescoper/wiki/Home/

name: SELECTpro
text_content:
Tool Name: SELECTpro
Description: A novel structure-based model selection method derived from an energy function comprising physical, statistical, and predicted structural terms. Novel and unique energy terms include predicted secondary structure, predicted solvent accessibility, predicted contact map, beta-strand pairing, and side-chain hydrogen bonding.
Functions: Protein modelling
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.igb.uci.edu/~baldig/selectpro.html
Documentation: http://www.igb.uci.edu/~baldig/selectpro_help.html

name: SuiteMSA
text_content:
Tool Name: SuiteMSA
Description: A java-based application that provides unique MSA viewers. Users can directly compare multiple MSAs and evaluate where the MSAs agree (are consistent) or disagree (are inconsistent).
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinfolab.unl.edu/~canderson/SuiteMSA/
Documentation: http://bioinfolab.unl.edu/~canderson/SuiteMSA/

name: GADS
text_content:
Tool Name: GADS
Description: Software for Genetic Analyses of quantitative traits Distributed with Spike on the base of large pedigrees without loops.
Functions: Linkage analysis
Topics: Genetics, Population genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mga.bionet.nsc.ru/soft/index.html
Documentation: http://mga.bionet.nsc.ru/soft/index.html

name: GenoExp
text_content:
Tool Name: GenoExp
Description: Web tool for predicting gene expression levels from single nucleotide polymorphisms.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Gene expression, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genie.weizmann.ac.il/pubs/GenoExp/
Documentation: https://genie.weizmann.ac.il/pubs/GenoExp/predict.php

name: gCUP
text_content:
Tool Name: gCUP
Description: Rapid GPU-based HIV-1 coreceptor usage prediction for next-generation sequencing.
Functions: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.uni-due.de/~hy0546/gCUP/
Documentation: https://www.uni-due.de/~hy0546/gCUP/

name: Sephiroth
text_content:
Tool Name: Sephiroth
Description: A disulfide connectivity pattern predictor based on evolutionary information retrieved from Multiple Sequence Alignments (MSAs).
Functions: Disulfide bond prediction
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://ibsquare.be/sephiroth
Documentation: http://ibsquare.be/sephiroth

name: Gecko
text_content:
Tool Name: Gecko
Description: The software allows for the systematic detection of gene cluster conservation in a large number of genomes. The enhancement over the original Gecko tool is the use of set-distance based gene cluster models that allow for the detection of gene clusters with diverse conservation patterns including gaps and missing genes in cluster occurrences. It is also tolerant of errors in gene homology assignment.
Functions: Functional clustering
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bibiserv.techfak.uni-bielefeld.de/gecko/
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/gecko?id=gecko_manual

name: Splicing Express
text_content:
Tool Name: Splicing Express
Description: A software suite for alternative splicing analysis using next-generation sequencing data.
Functions: Splicing model analysis
Topics: DNA, RNA splicing, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics-brazil.org/splicingexpress
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/jekroll/splicingexpress

name: Vect
text_content:
Tool Name: Vect
Description: Visual extraction conversion program that provides biomedical researches with minimal computer programming background a way to generate data extraction and conversion programs. It provides a convenient graphical user interface that allows using common point and click methods to extract and arrange data in the way that is useful to their purposes and then provides the computer program to generate such results on other documents with the same formatting.
Functions: Service composition
Topics: Computational biology, Omics, Sequence analysis, Software engineering
Homepage: http://www.complex.iastate.edu/download/Vect/
Documentation: http://complexcomputation.org/download/Vect/index.html

name: scLVM
text_content:
Tool Name: scLVM
Description: Modelling framework for single-cell RNA-seq data that can be used to dissect the observed heterogeneity into different sources, thereby allowing for the correction of confounding sources of variation.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/PMBio/scLVM
Documentation: https://github.com/PMBio/scLVM

name: Migraine
text_content:
Tool Name: Migraine
Description: Implements coalescent algorithms for maximum likelihood analysis of population genetic data. The data currently  handled are allelic counts but sequences will be handled in the forthcoming version.
Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Genetics, Population genetics
Homepage: http://kimura.univ-montp2.fr/~rousset/Migraine.htm
Documentation: http://kimura.univ-montp2.fr/~rousset/Migraine.htm

name: GeoMeTree
text_content:
Tool Name: GeoMeTree
Description: Python program to compute the geodesic path between two phylogenetic trees.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree comparison
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.cibiv.at/software/geometree/
Documentation: http://www.cibiv.at/software/geometree/GeoMeTree.pdf

name: sBWT
text_content:
Tool Name: sBWT
Description: A Burrows–Wheeler transformation BWT based fast indexer/aligner specialized in parallelized indexing and searching for Next Generation Sequencing data.
Functions: Genome indexing, Sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://jhhung.github.io/sBWT/
Documentation: http://jhhung.github.io/sBWT/

name: RVS
text_content:
Tool Name: RVS
Description: A novel likelihood-based method for genetic association with NGS data from external control groups. The tool substitutes genotype calls by their expected values given observed sequence data and implements a robust variance estimate for the score statistic.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://strug.ccb.sickkids.ca/rvs/index.html
Documentation: http://strug.ccb.sickkids.ca/rvs/index.html

name: GIST
text_content:
Tool Name: GIST
Description: Pplatform for scientific users to predict GIs (Genomic Islands ). This software package includes five commonly used tools, AlienHunter, IslandPath, Colombo SIGI-HMM, INDeGenIUS and Pai-Ida. It also includes an optimization program EGID that ensembles the result of existing tools for more accurate prediction.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: DNA, Molecular genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www5.esu.edu/cpsc/bioinfo/software/GIST/
Documentation: http://www5.esu.edu/cpsc/bioinfo/software/GIST/GIST_User_Manual.pdf

name: RvTests
text_content:
Tool Name: RvTests
Description: A flexible software package for genetic association studies. It is designed to support unrelated individual or related (family-based) individuals. Both quantitative trait and binary trait are supported
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Human genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://zhanxw.github.io/rvtests/
Documentation: http://zhanxw.github.io/rvtests/#introduction

name: GISMO
text_content:
Tool Name: GISMO
Description: Bayesian Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampler for protein multiple sequence alignment (MSA).
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Data management, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://gismo.igs.umaryland.edu/
Documentation: http://gismo.igs.umaryland.edu/downloads/readme

name: VPLG
text_content:
Tool Name: VPLG
Description: This uses a graph-based model to describe the structure of proteins on the super-secondary structure level. A protein-ligand graph is computed from the atomic coordinates in a PDB file and the secondary structure assignments of the DSSP algorithm. In this graph, vertices represent secondary structure elements (SSEs, e.g. usually alpha helices and beta sheets) or ligand molecules while the edges model contacts and spatial relations between them.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein binding sites, Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatik.uni-frankfurt.de/tools/vplg/index.html
Documentation: http://www.bioinformatik.uni-frankfurt.de/tools/vplg/index.html#Documentation

name: SNPTools
text_content:
Tool Name: SNPTools
Description: A suite of tools that enables integrative SNP analysis in next generation sequencing data with large cohorts. It not only calls SNP in a population with high sensitivity and accuracy, but also employs a novel imputation engine to achieve highly accurate genotype calls in an efficient way.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, SNP detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.hgsc.bcm.edu/software/snptools
Documentation: https://www.hgsc.bcm.edu/sites/default/files/software/SNPTools/SNPTools.txt

name: gNOME
text_content:
Tool Name: gNOME
Description: Interactive whole-genome analysis pipeline to prioritize disease-linked variants, genes, and pathways.
Functions: Variant calling
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Pathology, Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://gnome.tchlab.org/
Documentation: http://gnome.tchlab.org/

name: pfsearch
text_content:
Tool Name: pfsearch
Description: Replaces the original pfsearch program distributed with the pftools. It uses modern CPU instructions to exploit the capabilities of multicore processors and a new heuristic filter to rapidly score and select possible candidate matches.
Functions: Database search
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://web.expasy.org/pftools/#pfsearchV3
Documentation: http://web.expasy.org/pftools/#Documentation

name: HPG pore
text_content:
Tool Name: HPG pore
Description: Toolkit to explore and analyze nanopore sequencing data that can run both on a single computer and on the Hadoop distributed computing framework.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/opencb/hpg-pore/wiki
Documentation: https://github.com/opencb/hpg-pore/wiki

name: WGBSSuite
text_content:
Tool Name: WGBSSuite
Description: Flexible stochastic simulation tool that generates single-base resolution DNA methylation data genome-wide.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Sequencing, Simulation experiment
Homepage: http://www.wgbssuite.org.uk/
Documentation: http://www.wgbssuite.org.uk/

name: Aquaria
text_content:
Tool Name: Aquaria
Description: Simplifying the generation of insight from protein structures through structure visualisation, annotated with protein features; loads sequence-to-structure alignments from the PSSH2 database, sequence features from UniProt and Interpro and user defined features on demand from JSON files; there is also a WebAPI (see ...).
Functions: Protein structure prediction, Sequence database search, Sequence visualisation, Structure database search, Structure visualisation
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://aquaria.ws
Documentation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FAQ3yVGYSzY&feature=youtu.be

name: FSDA
text_content:
Tool Name: FSDA
Description: Alternative framework for identifying sub-chromosomal copy number variations in a fetal genome.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Nucleic acids
Homepage: https://github.com/compbio-UofT/FSDA
Documentation: https://github.com/compbio-UofT/FSDA/blob/master/README.md

name: GeneMatcher
text_content:
Tool Name: GeneMatcher
Description: Web site designed to enable connections between clinicians and researchers from around the world who share an interest in the same gene or genes.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Molecular genetics, Nucleic acids
Homepage: https://www.genematcher.org/
Documentation: https://www.genematcher.org/help/api

name: PROFacc
text_content:
Tool Name: PROFacc
Description: Solvent accessibility predictor.
Functions: Accessible surface calculation
Topics: Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://ppopen.informatik.tu-muenchen.de/
Documentation: https://predictprotein.org

name: LocTree3
text_content:
Tool Name: LocTree3
Description: Prediction of protein subcellular localization in 18 classes for eukaryota, 6 for bacteria and 3 for archaea.
Functions: Protein subcellular localisation prediction
Topics: Cell biology, Protein properties, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://rostlab.org/services/loctree3/
Documentation: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Loctree3

name: ELMInstanceMapper
text_content:
Tool Name: ELMInstanceMapper
Description: Map ELM predictions of a query sequence to known annotated ELM instances.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://api.bioinfo.no/wsdl/ELMInstanceMapper.wsdl
Documentation: http://api.bioinfo.no/wsdl/ELMInstanceMapper.wsdl

name: ELMMatcher
text_content:
Tool Name: ELMMatcher
Description: Mapping of ELM (Eucaryotic Linear Motifs) motifs to a query sequence.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://api.bioinfo.no/wsdl/ELMMatcher.wsdl
Documentation: http://api.bioinfo.no/wsdl/ELMMatcher.wsdl

name: LocNES
text_content:
Tool Name: LocNES
Description: Support Vector Machine (SVM) predictor that locates classical nuclear export signals (NESs) in CRM1 cargoes. Export-Karyopherinβ CRM1 recognizes hundreds of broadly functioning proteins. Most CRM1 cargoes contain the classical NES (also known as leucine-rich NESs), a peptide with 8-15 amino acids, regularly spaced with conserved hydrophobic residues.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Proteins
Homepage: http://prodata.swmed.edu/LocNES/LocNES.php
Documentation: http://prodata.swmed.edu/LRNes/predictNES/documentation.php

name: SNPGenie
text_content:
Tool Name: SNPGenie
Description: A program to estimate evolutionary parameters from pooled next-generation sequencing (NGS) data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Evolutionary biology, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/hugheslab/snpgenie
Documentation: https://github.com/chasewnelson/snpgenie

name: SeqMule
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqMule
Description: An automated pipeline to generate variant calls from FASTQ or BAM files, using more than 10 popular alignment and variant calling tools.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence alignment, Sequence visualisation, Variant calling
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://seqmule.openbioinformatics.org/en/latest/
Documentation: http://seqmule.openbioinformatics.org/en/latest/

name: RNF
text_content:
Tool Name: RNF
Description: A generic format for assigning names to simulated Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) reads.
Functions: Read pre-processing
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://karel-brinda.github.io/rnftools/
Documentation: http://rnftools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: FuMa
text_content:
Tool Name: FuMa
Description: Program that reports identical fusion genes based on gene-name annotations.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Prediction and recognition
Topics: DNA, Gene structure, Genetics, RNA
Homepage: https://github.com/ErasmusMC-Bioinformatics/fuma
Documentation: https://github.com/ErasmusMC-Bioinformatics/fuma/blob/master/README.md

name: OAT
text_content:
Tool Name: OAT
Description: Uses OrthoANI to measure overall similarity between two genome sequences.
Functions: Genome comparison
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ezbiocloud.net/sw/oat
Documentation: https://www.ezbiocloud.net/tools/orthoani

name: rHAT
text_content:
Tool Name: rHAT
Description: A seed-and-extension-based noisy long read alignment tool. It is suitable for aligning 3rd generation sequencing reads which are in large read length with relatively high error rate, especially Pacbio’s Single Molecule Read-time (SMRT) sequencing reads.
Functions: Genome alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/derekguan/rHAT
Documentation: https://github.com/derekguan/rHAT

name: MutualFold
text_content:
Tool Name: MutualFold
Description: Application to next-generation sequencing based RNA structure probing.
Functions: RNA secondary structure analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://genome.ucf.edu/MutualFold/
Documentation: http://genome.ucf.edu/MutualFold/

name: omiRas
text_content:
Tool Name: omiRas
Description: Web server for the annotation, comparison and visualization of interaction networks of non-coding RNAs derived from small RNA-Sequencing experiments of two different conditions.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene expression, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://tools.genxpro.net/omiras/
Documentation: http://tools.genxpro.net/omiras/workflow/

name: Wasabi
text_content:
Tool Name: Wasabi
Description: Tool for visualisation and manipulation of rich MSAs and a graphical interface to command-line programs.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Evolutionary biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://wasabiapp.org/
Documentation: http://wasabiapp.org/about/

name: PCSCS
text_content:
Tool Name: PCSCS
Description: Theoretical power calculator for D2 and D2*. The sofware facilitates the use of D2 or D2* for sequence or genome comparison and for evaluation of statistical power for detecting the relationship between the sequences.
Functions: Comparison, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA, Data quality management, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://meta.cmb.usc.edu/d2/
Documentation: http://meta.cmb.usc.edu/d2/doc/help.htm

name: TRUST
text_content:
Tool Name: TRUST
Description: Method for ab-initio determination of internal repeats in proteins. The high sensitivity and accuracy of the method is achieved by exploiting the concept of transitivity of alignments.
Functions: Repeat sequence detection
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/trustwww/
Documentation: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/trustwww/

name: N-score
text_content:
Tool Name: N-score
Description: Wavelet analysis based model for predicting nucleosome positions from DNA sequence information.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bcb.dfci.harvard.edu/~gcyuan/software.html
Documentation: http://bcb.dfci.harvard.edu/~gcyuan/software.html

name: RNAMotifScan
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAMotifScan
Description: A tool for automatic comparing and searching for RNA tertiary motifs using secondary structural alignment. It takes into consideration the isosteric (both canonical and non-canonical) base-pairs and multi-pairings in RNA tertiary motifs.
Functions: Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAMotifScan/
Documentation: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAMotifScan/

name: MQscore
text_content:
Tool Name: MQscore
Description: Program which can be useful for parametric linkage analysis of quantitative traits on the base of large pedigrees without loops.
Functions: Linkage analysis
Topics: Genetics, Population genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mga.bionet.nsc.ru/soft/mqscore/
Documentation: http://mga.bionet.nsc.ru/soft/mqscore/

name: GEOSS
text_content:
Tool Name: GEOSS
Description: Complete system used to store and analyze gene expression data. It has a relational database, a web interface, and an analysis suite. There is also a repository for each user’s files, and a comprehensive security system. The program is intended to be a multiuser archive for gene chip data, as well as a friendly, powerful analysis tool for end users. It includes workflow management features for the microarray center, and for the individual research labs.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://va-genex.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://va-genex.sourceforge.net/

name: RNASeqPowerCalculator
text_content:
Tool Name: RNASeqPowerCalculator
Description: The tool captures the dispersion in the data and can serve as a practical reference under the budget constraint of RNA-Seq experiments.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www2.hawaii.edu/~lgarmire/RNASeqPowerCalculator.htm
Documentation: http://www2.hawaii.edu/~lgarmire/RNASeqPowerCalculator.htm

name: Ribostral
text_content:
Tool Name: Ribostral
Description: A user-friendly framework for analyzing, evaluating and viewing RNA sequence alignments with at least one available atomic resolution structure. It is the first of its kind that makes direct and easy- to-understand superposition of the isostericity matrices of basepairs observed in the structure onto sequence alignments, easily indicating allowed and unallowed substitutions at each BP position.
Functions: Alignment, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rna.bgsu.edu/ribostral/
Documentation: http://rna.bgsu.edu/ribostral/Help/help.html

name: SVseq
text_content:
Tool Name: SVseq
Description: An improved approach for accurate and efficient calling of structural variations with low-coverage sequence data.  It calls both deletions and insertions.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: DNA, DNA mutation, Genetics
Homepage: http://www.engr.uconn.edu/~jiz08001/svseq2.html
Documentation: http://www.engr.uconn.edu/~jiz08001/software/SVseq2/README.TXT

name: Telometric
text_content:
Tool Name: Telometric
Description: A software package that enables users to assess the sizes and distribution of telomeric fragments represented in autoradiograph images of agarose gels. The hybridization from multiple matching telomeric probes is corrected for and simple statistics and plots are generated for each selected lane.
Functions: Image analysis, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Biological imaging, DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.fccc.edu/software/OpenSource/telometric/telometric.shtml
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.fccc.edu/software/OpenSource/telometric/telometric-1.2Guide.pdf

name: GASS
text_content:
Tool Name: GASS
Description: This tool searches for given active site 3D templates in unknown proteins.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Structure analysis
Topics: Enzymes, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://homepages.dcc.ufmg.br/~glpappa/gass/
Documentation: http://homepages.dcc.ufmg.br/~glpappa/gass/

name: PRED-TAT
text_content:
Tool Name: PRED-TAT
Description: PRED-TAT is a tool that takes a protein sequence as input and discriminating Sec from Tat signal peptides and predicting their cleavage sites.
Functions: Protein cleavage site prediction, Protein signal peptide detection, Transmembrane protein analysis, Transmembrane protein prediction
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.compgen.org/tools/PRED-TAT
Documentation: http://www.compgen.org/tools/PRED-TAT

name: PSSpred
text_content:
Tool Name: PSSpred
Description: A simple neural network training algorithm for accurate protein secondary structure prediction. It first collects multiple sequence alignments using PSI-BLAST. Amino-acid frequence and log-odds data with Henikoff weights are then used to train secondary structure, separately, based on the Rumelhart error backpropagation method. The final secondary structure prediction result is a combination of 7 neural network predictors from different profile data and parameters.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/PSSpred/
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/PSSpred/

name: TM-score
text_content:
Tool Name: TM-score
Description: Is an algorithm to calculate the similarity of topologies of two protein structures. It can be exploited to quantitatively access the quality of protein structure predictions relative to native. Because TM-score weights the close matches stronger than the distant matches, TM-score is more sensitive than root-mean-square deviation (RMSD).
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/TM-score/
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/TM-score/

name: PSS-SQL
text_content:
Tool Name: PSS-SQL
Description: Allows searching a database in order to identify proteins having secondary structure similar to the structure specified by the user in a PSS-SQL query.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://zti.polsl.pl/dmrozek/science/pss-sql.htm
Documentation: http://www.zti.aei.polsl.pl/w3/dmrozek/science/pss-sql.htm

name: KNetFold
text_content:
Tool Name: KNetFold
Description: New software for predicting the consensus secondary structure for a given alignment of RNA sequences. It uses an innovative classifier system (a hierarchical network of k-nearest neighbor classifiers) to compute for each pair of alignment positions a “base pair” or “no base pair” prediction.
Functions: RNA structure prediction, Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: RNA, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: https://binkley2.ncifcrf.gov/users/bshapiro/knetfold/kNetFold.html
Documentation:

name: PBSIM
text_content:
Tool Name: PBSIM
Description: PacBio sequencers produced two types of characteristic reads: CCS (short and low error rate) and CLR (long and high error rate), both of which could be useful for de novo assembly of genomes. This tool simulates those PacBio reads by using either a model-based or sampling-based simulation.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://code.google.com/p/pbsim/
Documentation: https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/29/1/119/273243

name: RSSS
text_content:
Tool Name: RSSS
Description: Comparative study of RNA-seq analysis strategies.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/boboppie/RSSS
Documentation: https://github.com/boboppie/RSSS

name: snp.plotter
text_content:
Tool Name: snp.plotter
Description: R package that creates publishable-quality plots of p-values using single SNP and/or haplotype data. Main features of the package include options to display a linkage disequilibrium (LD) plot and the ability to plot multiple sets of results simultaneously. Plots can be created using global and/or individual haplotype p-values along with single SNP p-values.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/cannin/snp_plotter
Documentation: https://github.com/cannin/snp_plotter

name: TransGeneScan
text_content:
Tool Name: TransGeneScan
Description: Software tool for finding genes in assembled transcripts from metatranscriptomic sequences.
Functions: Gene prediction
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://github.com/COL-IU/TransGeneScan
Documentation: https://github.com/COL-IU/TransGeneScan

name: HyperGeny
text_content:
Tool Name: HyperGeny
Description: HYPERbolic phyloGENY viewer allows hyperbolic visualisation of very large tree structures.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/software/details/HyperGeny
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/software/details/HyperGeny

name: FunSiP
text_content:
Tool Name: FunSiP
Description: A modular and extensible classifier for the prediction of functional sites in DNA.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/supplementary_data/mibel/FunSiP/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.psb.ugent.be/supplementary_data/mibel/FunSiP/

Topics: Sequence analysis

Documentation: http://www.biobix.be/research/downloads/mam-pipeline/

name: CAFA
text_content:
Tool Name: CAFA
Description: Capillary Automated Footprinting Analysis algorithms. The use of capillary electrophoresis with fluorescently labeled nucleic acids revolutionized DNA sequencing, effectively fueling the genomic revolution. We present an application of this technology for the high-throughput structural analysis of nucleic acids by chemical and enzymatic mapping (‘footprinting’).
Functions: Nucleic acid structure analysis
Topics: Enzymes, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids
Homepage: https://simtk.org/home/cafa
Documentation: https://simtk.org/docman/?group_id=263

name: VirVarSeq
text_content:

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/virtools/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/virtools/wiki/Home/

name: FIRE-pro
text_content:

Homepage: https://tavazoielab.c2b2.columbia.edu/FIRE-pro/
Documentation: https://tavazoielab.c2b2.columbia.edu/FIRE-pro/tutorial.html

name: iPAGE
text_content:
Tool Name: iPAGE

Homepage: https://tavazoielab.c2b2.columbia.edu/iPAGE/
Documentation: https://tavazoielab.c2b2.columbia.edu/iPAGE/tutorial.html

name: AptaCluster
text_content:
Tool Name: AptaCluster
Description: Allows for an efficient clustering of whole HT-SELEX aptamer pools; a task that could not be accomplished with traditional clustering algorithms due to the enormous size of such datasets.
Functions: Clustering
Topics: Computer science, Data management, Sequence analysis

Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/CBBresearch/Przytycka/index.cgi#aptaclustermanual

name: COLOMBO
text_content:
Tool Name: COLOMBO

Functions: Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/research/185810.html
Documentation: https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/research/185810.html

name: SPPG
text_content:
Tool Name: SPPG

Documentation:

name: Ensembl query-based biclustering
text_content:
Tool Name: Ensembl query-based biclustering

Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.intec.ugent.be/kmarchal/Supplementary_Information_DeSmet_2011/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.intec.ugent.be/kmarchal/Supplementary_Information_DeSmet_2011/

name: DISTILLER
text_content:

Topics: Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.intec.ugent.be/kmarchal/Supplementary_Information_Lemmens_2008/Index.html
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.intec.ugent.be/kmarchal/Supplementary_Information_Lemmens_2008/Index.html

name: Halvade
text_content:

name: FLAD
text_content:
Tool Name: FLAD

name: My Forensic Loci queries
text_content:
Tool Name: My Forensic Loci queries

name: The Flux Simulator
text_content:

text_content:

Documentation: http://sammeth.net/confluence/display/ASTA/2+-+Download

name: gff2aplot
text_content:
Tool Name: gff2aplot
Description: Program to visualize the alignment of two sequences together with their annotations. Input for the program consists of single or multiple files in GFF-format which specify the alignment coordinates and annotation features of both sequences. Output is in format of any size. The features to be displayed are highly customizable to meet user specific needs. The program serves to generate print-quality images for comparative genome sequence analysis.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://big.crg.cat/services/gff2aplot
Documentation: http://genome.crg.es/software/gfftools/GFF2APLOT.html#DOWNLOADING

name: SECISearch3  Seblastian
text_content:
Tool Name: SECISearch3  Seblastian
Description: In this web server we provide public access for two new computational methods for selenoprotein identification and analysis. This tool replaces its predecessor SECISearch as a tool for prediction of eukaryotic SECIS elements and becomes a new method for selenoprotein gene detection that predicts selenoprotein sequences encoded upstream of SECIS elements. It is able to both identify known selenoproteins and predict new selenoproteins.
Functions: Genome annotation
Topics: Computational biology
Homepage: http://seblastian.crg.es/
Documentation: http://big.crg.cat/services/secisearch3seblastian

name: IPSA
text_content:
Tool Name: IPSA
Description: The integrative pipeline for splicing analyses: 1) Quantifies splice junctions and splice boundaries; 2) Calculates splicing indices, exon- and intron-centric; 3) Analyzes micro-exons and local splice-graph structure.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acids
Homepage: https://github.com/pervouchine/ipsa-full
Documentation: https://github.com/pervouchine/ipsa-full/blob/master/latex/sjpipeline.pdf

name: IRBIS
text_content:
Tool Name: IRBIS
Description: A computational pipeline for detecting conserved complementary regions in unaligned orthologous sequences.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/pervouchine/irbis/
Documentation: https://github.com/pervouchine/irbis/blob/master/Manual/irbis-manual.pdf

name: Strelka
text_content:
Tool Name: Strelka
Description: Strelka is an analysis package designed to detect somatic SNVs and small indels from the aligned sequencing reads of matched tumor-normal samples.
