Topics: Genetic variation
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/site/strelkasomaticvariantcaller/
Documentation: https://bansal-lab.github.io/software/crisp.html

name: CRISP
text_content:
Tool Name: CRISP
Description: Identifies rare and common variants in pooled sequencing data
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://bansal-lab.github.io/software/crisp.html
Documentation: https://bansal-lab.github.io/software/crisp.html

name: Bison
text_content:
Tool Name: Bison
Description: Bison allows users with access to a computer cluster to rapidly align whole-genome bisulfite sequencing or RRBS reads. It can align both directional and non-directional libraries and uses bowtie2.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Methylation analysis, Read mapping
Topics: Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/dpryan79/bison
Documentation: https://github.com/dpryan79/bison

name: GENE-Counter
text_content:
Tool Name: GENE-Counter
Description: GENE-counter is a computational pipeline for analyzing RNA-Sequencing (RNA-Seq) data for differential gene expression.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/genecounter/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/genecounter/files/DOCUMENTS/

name: scan-x
text_content:
Tool Name: scan-x
Description: scan-x is a software tool designed to find motifs within any sequence data set. The first large scale scan was performed using all available human, mouse, fly and yeast phosphorylation and acetylation data to perform a scan for undiscovered modification sites.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Model organisms
Homepage: http://scan-x.med.harvard.edu/scan-x.html
Documentation: http://scan-x.med.harvard.edu/scan-x.html

name: iSMP-Grey
text_content:
Tool Name: iSMP-Grey
Description: The web-server iSMP-Grey was establish for identifying uncharacterized proteins as secretory proteins of malaria parasite or not according to their evolutionary information in form of position specific scoring matrix (PSSM).
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/iSMP-Grey
Documentation: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/secretory/readme.html

name: sRNA workflow
text_content:
Tool Name: sRNA workflow
Description: Analysis workflow for plant sRNA sequencing data.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Sequence classification, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Gene regulation, Nucleic acids
Homepage: https://github.com/forestbiotech-lab/sRNA-workflow
Documentation: https://github.com/forestbiotech-lab/miRPursuit#references

name: Pyicoteo
text_content:
Tool Name: Pyicoteo
Description: Suite of tools for the analysis of high-throughput sequencing data. It can be used to analyzed CLIP-seq and ChIP-seq data, as well as to calculate the differential enrichment of CLIP-seq, ChIP-seq and other types of datasets between two conditions, with or without replicates. It also includes a number of useful tools for the transformation and manipulation of genomic-based datasets.
Functions: Clustering, Statistical calculation
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/regulatorygenomicsupf/pyicoteo
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/regulatorygenomicsupf/pyicoteo/wiki/Home

name: HydDB
text_content:
Tool Name: HydDB
Description: Provides access to an accurate classifier for hydrogenase sequences and a curated database of hydrogenases by known type.
Functions: Data retrieval
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://services.birc.au.dk/hyddb
Documentation: https://services.birc.au.dk/hyddb/

name: GlobPlotter
text_content:
Tool Name: GlobPlotter
Description: Performs intrinsic protein disorder, domain and globularity prediction.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://globplot.embl.de
Documentation: http://globplot.embl.de/webservice/globplot.wsdl

name: eegc
text_content:
Tool Name: eegc
Description: This package evaluates cellular engineering processes for direct differentiation of stem cells or conversion (transdifferentiation) of somatic cells to primary cells based on high throughput gene expression data screened either by DNA microarray or RNA sequencing. It performs DE analysis for each pair-wise sample comparison to identify and evaluate the transcriptional differences.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Genetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/eegc.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/eegc.html

name: MPFE
text_content:
Tool Name: MPFE
Description: Estimate distribution of methylation patterns from a table of counts from a bisulphite sequencing experiment given a non-conversion rate and read error rate.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MPFE.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MPFE.html

name: MotIV
text_content:
Tool Name: MotIV
Description: This package makes use of STAMP for comparing a set of motifs to a given database (e.g. JASPAR). It can also be used to visualize motifs, motif distributions, modules and filter motifs.
Functions: Sequence motif comparison
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MotIV.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MotIV.html

name: ProteinVolume
text_content:
Tool Name: ProteinVolume
Description: ProteinVolume (PV) is a Java program that calculates the components of the solvent-excluded (geometric) volume of a protein: van der Waals and void volume.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://gmlab.bio.rpi.edu/
Documentation: https://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12859-015-0531-2#Sec2

name: Differential RNA-seq pipeline
text_content:
Tool Name: Differential RNA-seq pipeline
Description: RNA-seq pipeline for differential gene expression analysis (paired-end, pooled samples, animals). Illumina RNA Sequencing differential expression analysis pipeline between two collections of eukaryote samples. The collections represents the two conditions being compared, and the datasets in each collection is defined by the user.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, RNA-seq read count analysis, Read mapping, Splicing model analysis
Topics: Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://galaxy-ntnu.bioinfo.no/toolshed_nels
Documentation:

name: MeDuSa
text_content:
Tool Name: MeDuSa
Description: Algorithm for genome scaffoldin which exploits information obtained from a set of genomes from related organisms to determine the correct order and orientation of the contigs. It formalizes the scaffolding problem by means of a combinatorial optimization formulation on graphs and implements an efficient constant factor approximation algorithm to solve it. It does not require either prior knowledge on the microrganisms dataset under analysis or the availability of paired end read libraries.
Functions: Genome assembly
Topics: Comparative genomics, Structural genomics
Homepage: http://combo.dbe.unifi.it/medusa
Documentation: https://github.com/combogenomics/medusa/blob/master/README.md

name: SWIPE
text_content:
Tool Name: SWIPE
Description: Tool for performing rapid local alignment searches in amino acid or nucleotide sequence databases. It is a highly optimized implementation of the Smith-Waterman algoritm using SIMD parallel computing technology available on common CPUs.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Molecular biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://dna.uio.no/swipe
Documentation: http://bmcbioinformatics.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2105-12-221

name: Swarm
text_content:
Tool Name: Swarm
Description: A robust and fast clustering method for amplicon-based studies. The purpose of this tool is to provide a novel clustering algorithm that handles massive sets of amplicons.
Functions: Sequence clustering
Topics: Biodiversity, Microbiology, Molecular biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/torognes/swarm
Documentation: http://dx.doi.org/10.7717/peerj.593

name: SWIFT
text_content:
Tool Name: SWIFT
Description: Program for fast local alignment search, guaranteeing to find epsilon-matches between two sequences. An epsilon-match is a local alignment above a given length with an error rate of at most epsilon.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/swift
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/swift

name: PoSSuMsearch2
text_content:
Tool Name: PoSSuMsearch2
Description: Significant speedup of database searches with HMMs by search space reduction with PSSM family models.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/possumsearch2
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/possumsearch2

name: PoSSuMsearch
text_content:
Tool Name: PoSSuMsearch
Description: This tool find matches of PSSM in large databases. Our approach preprocesses the search space and builds an enhanced suffix array which is stored on file. Since ESAsearch benefits from small alphabets, we present a variant operating on sequences recoded according to a reduced alphabet. We also address the problem of non-comparable PSSM-scores by developing a method which allows to efficiently compute a matrix similarity threshold for a PSSM, given an E-value or a P-value.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/possumsearch
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/possumsearch

name: JAli
text_content:
Tool Name: JAli
Description: Alignment method for comparing a protein sequence to a protein family, represented by a multiple alignment. It can also be used for sensitive protein database searches. The algorithm is a generalization of the Smith-Waterman algorithm.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/jali
Documentation: http://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/jali?id=jali_view_manual

name: GUUGle
text_content:
Tool Name: GUUGle
Description: RNA secondary structure analysis often requires searching for potential helices in large sequence data. We present a utility program that efficiently locates potential helical regions under RNA base pairing rules, which include Watson-Crick as well as G-U pairs. It accepts a target and a query set of sequences, and determines all exact matches under RNA rules between target and query sequences that exceed a specified length.
Functions: Sequence database search, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/guugle
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/guugle?id=guugle_manual

name: RNAhybrid
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAhybrid
Description: Tool for finding the minimum free energy hybridization of a long and a short RNA. The hybridization is performed in a kind of domain mode, ie. the short sequence is hybridized to the best fitting part of the long one. The tool is primarily meant as a means for microRNA target prediction.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid structure prediction, Sequence database search (by property)
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/rnahybrid
Documentation: http://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/rnahybrid?id=rnahybrid_manual_manual

name: Ernwin
text_content:
Tool Name: Ernwin
Description: A tool for predicting coarse grain RNA tertiary structures. Create models of the tertiary structure of RNA molecules starting from the secondary structure. The resulting models contain the positions of the helices and loops in 3D.
Functions: RNA structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/pkerpedjiev/ernwin
Documentation: https://github.com/pkerpedjiev/ernwin

name: Livermore Metagenomics Analysis Toolkit
text_content:
Tool Name: Livermore Metagenomics Analysis Toolkit
Description: Efficiently assign taxonomic labels to as many reads as possible in very large metagenomic datasets and report the taxonomic profile of the input sample. The quick 'single pass' analysis of every read allows read binning to support additional more computationally expensive analysis such as metagenomic assembly or sensitive database searches on targeted subsets of reads. Its approach is kmer-based.
Functions: Taxonomic classification
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://computation.llnl.gov/projects/livermore-metagenomics-analysis-toolkit
Documentation: http://computation.llnl.gov/projects/livermore-metagenomics-analysis-toolkit

name: TOPCONS
text_content:
Tool Name: TOPCONS
Description: Consensus prediction of membrane protein topology.
Functions: Transmembrane protein analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://topcons.cbr.su.se/
Documentation: http://topcons.cbr.su.se/pred/help/

name: LearnCoil
text_content:
Tool Name: LearnCoil
Description: The LearnCoil Histidase Kinase program uses an iterative learning algorithm to detect possible coiled-coil domains in histidase kinase receptors.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://groups.csail.mit.edu/cb/learncoil/webcoil.html
Documentation: http://cb.csail.mit.edu/cb/learncoil/webcoil.html

name: DDNA
text_content:
Tool Name: DDNA
Description: DDNA is a software for interaction energy between protein and DNA
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: DNA
Homepage: http://sparks-lab.org/yueyang/DFIRE/ddna3-DB-service.php
Documentation: http://sparks-lab.org/Softwares-Services_files/notices.htm

name: motifRG
text_content:
Tool Name: motifRG
Description: Tools for discriminative motif discovery using regression methods.
Functions: Regression analysis, Sequence motif discovery
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/motifRG.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/motifRG.html

name: mosaics
text_content:
Tool Name: mosaics
Description: This package provides functions for fitting MOSAiCS-HMM, an statistical framework to analyze one-sample or two-sample ChIP-seq data of transcription factor binding and histone modification.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Gene regulation, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/mosaics.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/mosaics.html

name: MLSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: MLSeq
Description: This package applies several machine learning methods, including SVM, bagSVM, Random Forest and CART, to RNA-Seq data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MLSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MLSeq.html

name: STING Millenium
text_content:
Tool Name: STING Millenium
Description: STING is a suite of tools for the analysis of protein sequence, structure, stability and function - and the relationships between them.
Functions: Protein function analysis, Protein secondary structure analysis, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://sms.cbi.cnptia.embrapa.br/SMS/STINGm/
Documentation: http://sms.cbi.cnptia.embrapa.br/SMS/STINGm/

name: EBSEA
text_content:
Tool Name: EBSEA
Description: Calculates differential expression of genes based on exon counts of genes obtained from RNA-seq sequencing data.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/EBSEA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/EBSEA.html

name: SIRW
text_content:
Tool Name: SIRW
Description: SIRW is a web interface to SIR (Simple Indexing and Retrieval System). It combines the ability to search protein/nucleotide databases with keywords and a sequence motif.

Homepage: http://sirw.embl.de/
Documentation: http://sirw.embl.de/help.html

name: siRNAdb
text_content:
Tool Name: siRNAdb
Description: This resource includes siSearch, AOSearch, and a siRNAdb which provides a platform for mining an siRNA database, and searching for non-specific matches to your siRNA (small interfering RNAs).
Functions: Database search, Sequence database search, Sequence database search (by property), siRNA binding specificity prediction, siRNA duplex prediction
Topics: Database management, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sirna.cgb.ki.se/
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15608162

name: ALTER
text_content:
Tool Name: ALTER
Description: ALTER is a program-oriented web tool for the conversion between DNA and protein alignments.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment conversion
Topics: DNA, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sing.ei.uvigo.es/ALTER/
Documentation: http://sing.ei.uvigo.es/ALTER/help/ALTER-UserGuide.htm

name: Sequedex
text_content:
Tool Name: Sequedex
Description: Sequedex classifies short reads for phylogeny and function at high speed
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequence annotation
Topics: Genomics, Metagenomics, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://sequedex.lanl.gov
Documentation: http://sequedex.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: SCR_FIND
text_content:
Tool Name: SCR_FIND
Description: SCR_FIND is a tool to analyze structurally conserved regions (SCRs) from superimposed structures and multiple sequence alignments.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Multiple structure alignment, Protein structural motif recognition, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://schubert.bio.uniroma1.it/scr_find.html
Documentation: http://schubert.bio.uniroma1.it/pymod/documentation.html

name: CAMPO
text_content:
Tool Name: CAMPO
Description: CAMPO is a tool to analyze conserved regions from a multiple sequence alignment
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein structural motif recognition, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://schubert.bio.uniroma1.it/campo.html
Documentation: http://schubert.bio.uniroma1.it/pymod/documentation.html

name: rVista
text_content:
Tool Name: rVista
Description: This tool combines TFBS predictions, sequence comparisons and cluster analysis to identify noncoding DNA regions that are evolutionarily conserved and present in a specific configuration within genomic sequences. The newly developed version 2.0 of the tool can process alignments generated by both the zPicture and blastz alignment programs or use pre-computed pairwise alignments of several vertebrate genomes available from the ECR Browser and GALA database.
Functions: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://rvista.dcode.org/
Documentation: https://rvista.dcode.org/instr_rVISTA.html

name: CentroidHomfold-LAST
text_content:
Tool Name: CentroidHomfold-LAST
Description: CentroidHomfold-LAST predicts the secondary structure of an RNA sequence using automatically collected homologous sequences.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein secondary structure, RNA, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rtools.cbrc.jp/centroidhomfold/
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2703931/

name: CentroidFold
text_content:
Tool Name: CentroidFold
Description: Recognizing the growing role for non-coding RNAs (ncRNAs) in cells, the CentroidFold web server predicts RNA secondary structure from input sequence data (single or multiple alignments).
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein secondary structure, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rtools.cbrc.jp/centroidfold/
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2703931/

name: PETfold and PETcofold
text_content:
Tool Name: PETfold and PETcofold
Description: The PETfold and PETcofold web servers for the analysis of multiple RNA sequences for common RNA structure and for RNA-RNA interaction sites. Analysis is based on probablistic evolutionary an thermodynamic models.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA structure prediction
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rth.dk/resources/petfold/
Documentation: https://rth.dk/pages/about.php

name: BioProspector
text_content:
Tool Name: BioProspector
Description: Server which scans upstream of genes in the same gene expression cluster for regulatory sequence motifs using a Gibbs sampling strategy.  The Markov background model is used for non-motif bases, improving specificity of predicted motif locations.
Functions: Gene expression clustering, Gene expression profiling, Gene prediction, Sequence motif recognition, Statistical calculation
Topics: Gene expression, Gene regulation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://robotics.stanford.edu/~xsliu/BioProspector/
Documentation: http://robotics.stanford.edu/~xsliu/BioProspector/

name: DNAcopy
text_content:
Tool Name: DNAcopy
Description: Implements the circular binary segmentation (CBS) algorithm to segment DNA copy number data and identify genomic regions with abnormal copy number.
Functions: Copy number estimation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DNAcopy.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DNAcopy.html

name: FusionSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: FusionSeq
Description: Identifies fusion transcripts from paired end RNA-Seq data.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Gene structure, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://rnaseq.gersteinlab.org/fusionseq/
Documentation: http://archive.gersteinlab.org/proj/rnaseq/fusionseq/

name: SCAMPI
text_content:
Tool Name: SCAMPI
Description: Prediction of membrane protein topology from first principles.
Functions: Transmembrane protein analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://scampi.cbr.su.se/
Documentation: http://scampi.cbr.su.se/pred/help/

name: RNALogo
text_content:
Tool Name: RNALogo
Description: RNALogo is a tool for graphical representation of features within multiple RNA sequence alignments and their consensus RNA secondary structures. Each RNA family in Rfam has been graphically evaluated for a logo.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure visualisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rnalogo.mbc.nctu.edu.tw/
Documentation: http://rnalogo.mbc.nctu.edu.tw/documentation.html

name: RetroTector
text_content:
Tool Name: RetroTector
Description: A rational tool for analysis of retroviral elements in small and medium size vertebrate genomic sequences.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://retrotector.neuro.uu.se/
Documentation: http://retrotector.neuro.uu.se/docs/

name: OligoWalk
text_content:
Tool Name: OligoWalk
Description: OligoWalk is an online sever for designing efficient siRNA targeting a given mRNA sequence. By calculating thermodynamic features of sense-antisense hybidization, OligoWalk predicts the free energy changes of oligonucleotides binding to a target RNA.
Functions: siRNA binding specificity prediction, siRNA duplex prediction
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Small molecules
Homepage: http://rna.urmc.rochester.edu/servers/oligowalk
Documentation: http://rna.urmc.rochester.edu/servers/oligowalk2/help.html

name: PQPQ
text_content:
Tool Name: PQPQ
Description: Matlab code and test data for protein quantification by peptide quality control.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://forshed.se/jenny/index.php?n=Research.SoftwareAmpCode
Documentation: http://forshed.se/jenny/index.php?n=Research.SoftwareAmpCode

name: NNDB
text_content:
Tool Name: NNDB
Description: The Nearest Neighbor Database (NNDB) is a web-based resource for disseminating parameter sets for predicting nucleic acid secondary structure stabilities. For each set of parameters, the database includes the set of rules with descriptive text, sequence-dependent parameters in plain text and html, literature references to experiments and usage tutorials. Also covered are parameters for predicting RNA folding free energy and enthalpy changes.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid structure prediction, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rna.urmc.rochester.edu/NNDB
Documentation: http://rna.urmc.rochester.edu/NNDB/help.html

name: PON-P2
text_content:
Tool Name: PON-P2
Description: Predicts the pathogenicity of amino acid substitutions.
Functions: Virulence prediction
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://structure.bmc.lu.se/PON-P2/
Documentation: http://structure.bmc.lu.se/PON-P2/instructions.html/

name: PON-Diso
text_content:
Tool Name: PON-Diso
Description: A method to predict changes in disorder regions contained in protein caused by amino acid substitutions.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://structure.bmc.lu.se/PON-Diso/
Documentation: http://structure.bmc.lu.se/PON-Diso/instructions.html

name: OnD-CRF
text_content:
Tool Name: OnD-CRF
Description: Predicting order and disorder in proteins using conditional random fields.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://babel.ucmp.umu.se/ond-crf/
Documentation: http://babel.ucmp.umu.se/ond-crf/about.php

name: OCTOPUS
text_content:
Tool Name: OCTOPUS
Description: Prediction of membrane protein topology and signal peptides.
Functions: Transmembrane protein analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://octopus.cbr.su.se/
Documentation: http://octopus.cbr.su.se/index.php?about=help

name: Vienna RNA Websuite
text_content:
Tool Name: Vienna RNA Websuite
Description: Vienna RNA Websuite is a comprehensive collection of tools for folding, design and analysis of RNA sequences. Tools include folding of single and aligned sequences, prediction of RNA-RNA interactions, design of sequences with a given structure, analysis of folding landscapes and structural RNA alignments using LocARNA.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA structure prediction, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rna.tbi.univie.ac.at/
Documentation: http://rna.tbi.univie.ac.at/#intro

name: FISH - sequence search
text_content:
Tool Name: FISH - sequence search
Description: Family Identification with Structure Anchored Hidden Markov Models.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://babel.ucmp.umu.se/fish/hmmpfam.htm
Documentation: http://babel.ucmp.umu.se/fish/about.php

name: FISH - profile search
text_content:
Tool Name: FISH - profile search
Description: Family Identification with Structure Anchored Hidden Markov Models.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://babel.ucmp.umu.se/fish/hmmsearch.php
Documentation: http://babel.ucmp.umu.se/fish/about.php

name: LocTree2
text_content:
Tool Name: LocTree2
Description: Framework to predict localization in life's three domains, including globular and membrane proteins (3 classes for archaea; 6 for bacteria and 18 for eukaryota). The resulting method, works well even for protein fragments. It uses a hierarchical system of support vector machines that imitates the cascading mechanism of cellular sorting.The method also accurately distinguishes membrane and non-membrane proteins.
Functions: Protein subcellular localisation prediction
Topics: Cell biology, Protein properties, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Loctree2
Documentation: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Loctree2

name: META-GECKO
text_content:
Tool Name: META-GECKO
Description: Set of post-processing tools aimed at improving the taxonomical classification and at providing additional information to enhance metagenomics analyses. The developed tools provide additional proofs in the presence of low-abundant species, information of the mapping quality in coding and noncoding regions, etc.
Functions: Taxonomic classification
Topics: Metagenomics
Homepage: http://bitlab-es.com/gecko/template.php#META-GECKO
Documentation: http://bitlab-es.com/gecko/template.php#META-GECKO

name: Primaclade
text_content:
Tool Name: Primaclade
Description: Accepts a multiple species nucleotide alignment file as input, iteratively runs the Primer3 application for each sequence, and then collates the results to identify a set of polymerase chain reaction (PCR) primers that will bind across the alignment.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, PCR primer design, Primer removal, Sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, PCR experiment, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://primaclade.org/cgi-bin/primaclade.cgi
Documentation: http://primaclade.org/introduction.html

name: MGFR
text_content:
Tool Name: MGFR
Description: The package is designed to detect marker genes from RNA-seq data.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MGFR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MGFR.html

name: methylumi
text_content:
Tool Name: methylumi
Description: This package provides classes for holding and manipulating Illumina methylation data. Based on eSet, it can contain MIAME information, sample information, feature information, and multiple matrices of data. An "intelligent" import function, methylumiR can read the Illumina text files and create a MethyLumiSet. methylumIDAT can directly read raw IDAT files from HumanMethylation27 and HumanMethylation450 microarrays. Normalization, background correction, and quality control are also included.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylumi.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylumi.html

name: RNApasta
text_content:
Tool Name: RNApasta
Description: A utility for collecting statistics from aligned and structurally annotated RNA sequences. It is a java utility intended to work with RNA structural alignments, including the motifs of stem-loops and pseudoknots. It can perform a variety of statistical analyses, and has editing capabilities intended to be useful with alignments that contain variable data such as the presence or absence of stem-loops or pseudoknots across sequences.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://rna-informatics.uga.edu/malmberg/rlmlab/index.php?s=1&n=5&r=0
Documentation: http://rna-informatics.uga.edu/malmberg/rlmlab/index.php?s=1&n=5&r=0

name: GCORE
text_content:
Tool Name: GCORE
Description: Efficient family-based gene-gene interaction test for trios.
Functions: Gene to pathway mapping
Topics: Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/gscore/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/gscore/

name: Sailfish
text_content:
Tool Name: Sailfish
Description: A software tool that implements a novel, is an alignment-free algorithm for the estimation of isoform abundances directly from a set of reference sequences and RNA-seq reads.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~ckingsf/software/sailfish/
Documentation: http://sailfish.readthedocs.io/en/master/

name: GIIRA
text_content:
Tool Name: GIIRA
Description: GIIRA is a gene prediction method that identifies potential coding regions exclusively based on the mapping of reads from an RNA-Seq experiment.
Functions: Gene prediction
Topics: Mapping, RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/giira/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/giira/

name: nucular
text_content:
Tool Name: nucular
Description: Program that splits extended pedigrees into nuclear families, with the option of recoding all sibs as half-sibs with distinct mothers of fathers.
Functions: Linkage analysis
Topics: Genetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mlemire.freeshell.org/nucular.README
Documentation: http://mlemire.freeshell.org/nucular.README

name: RefineHMM
text_content:
Tool Name: RefineHMM
Description: This tool refines an original hidden Markov model (HMM) to find an optimal fit against the evolutionary group that the HMM models, and it does this using through iterative database searches and incremental subsequent adaptation of the seed set.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/refinehmm/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/refinehmm/

name: rvsel
text_content:
Tool Name: rvsel
Description: A R package for rare variants selection with sequence data. The most outome-related rare variants are selected within a gene or a genetic region. The selection procedure is based on the power set of the subset of the rare variants.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.columbia.edu/~sw2206/softwares.htm
Documentation: http://www.columbia.edu/~sw2206/softwares/rvsel-manual.pdf

name: RNAMotifScanX
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAMotifScanX
Description: RNAMotifScanX is a motif search tool based on a base-interaction graph alignment algorithm.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAMotifScanX/
Documentation: http://genome.ucf.edu/RNAMotifScanX/

name: SEQPower
text_content:
Tool Name: SEQPower
Description: A tool that provides statistical power analysis and sample size estimation for sequence-based association studies.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: GWAS study, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.org/spower/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.org/spower/docs

name: VarSifter
text_content:
Tool Name: VarSifter
Description: Graphical java program designed to display, sort, filter, and generally sift variation data from massively parallel sequencing experiments.It is designed to read exome-scale variation data in either a tab-delimited text file with header, or an uncompressed VCF file (see User Guide for details.) These files should be pre-generated with desired annotation information one would like to view.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://research.nhgri.nih.gov/software/VarSifter/
Documentation: https://github.com/teerjk/VarSifter

name: JAWAMix5
text_content:
Tool Name: JAWAMix5
Description: Out-of-core open-source toolkit for association mapping using high-throughput sequence data.
Functions: Linkage analysis, Mapping
Topics: Genetics, Mapping, Population genetics
Homepage: http://code.google.com/p/jawamix5/
Documentation: https://code.google.com/archive/p/jawamix5/

name: PRANK API
text_content:
Tool Name: PRANK API
Description: A probabilistic multiple alignment program for DNA, codon and amino-acid sequences. It’s based on a novel algorithm that treats insertions correctly and avoids over-estimation of the number of deletion events. In addition, PRANK borrows ideas from maximum likelihood methods used in phylogenetics and correctly takes into account the evolutionary distances between sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence comparison
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/msa/prank_rest
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/services/msa/prank_rest

name: CPHmodels-3.0
text_content:
Tool Name: CPHmodels-3.0
Description: A web server predicting protein 3D structure by use of single template homology modeling.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein fold recognition, Protein modelling, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/CPHmodels/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/CPHmodels/instructions.php

name: TreeDet
text_content:
Tool Name: TreeDet
Description: Tree Determinant (TreeDet) is a tool for predicting functional residues in protein sequence alignments.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Residue interaction prediction, Sequence alignment
Topics: Function analysis, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequencing, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://treedetv2.bioinfo.cnio.es/treedet/index.html
Documentation:

name: TranslatorX
text_content:
Tool Name: TranslatorX
Description: TranslatorX is a web-server designed to align protein coding nucleotide sequences based on their corresponding amino acid translations rather than nucleotide alignments.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment conversion
Topics: Protein expression, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Small molecules
Homepage: http://translatorx.co.uk
Documentation: http://pc16141.mncn.csic.es/translatorx_help.html

name: TraFaC
text_content:
Tool Name: TraFaC
Description: TraFaC (Transcription Factor Binding Site Comparison) is a tool that identifes regulatory regions using a comparative sequence analysis approach.
Functions: Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA binding sites, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://trafac.cchmc.org/trafac/index.jsp
Documentation: https://www.cincinnatichildrens.org/research/divisions/b/bmi

name: Meta-BASIC
text_content:
Tool Name: Meta-BASIC
Description: A tool for detecting distant homologues using meta-profiles which combine both sequence positional variability and secondary structure.
Functions: Protein secondary structure analysis, Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structure comparison
Topics: Protein secondary structure
Homepage: http://basic.bioinfo.pl/
Documentation:

name: TREE-PUZZLE
text_content:
Tool Name: TREE-PUZZLE
Description: Tree-puzzle is a program that constructs phylogenetic trees from sequence alignments using the maximum likelihood method.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree generation, Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods), Phylogenetic tree generation (parsimony methods), Phylogenetic tree generation (quartet methods), Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.tree-puzzle.de/
Documentation: http://www.tree-puzzle.de/#description

name: gcrma
text_content:
Tool Name: gcrma
Description: Background adjustment using sequence information.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/gcrma.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/gcrma.html

name: Ta-si prediction
text_content:
Tool Name: Ta-si prediction
Description: ta-siRNA (trans-acting short interfering RNA): prediction of phased ta-siRNAs in plant sRNA datasets.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA
Homepage: http://srna-workbench.cmp.uea.ac.uk
Documentation: http://srna-workbench.cmp.uea.ac.uk/ta-si-prediction-2/

name: STADEN
text_content:
Tool Name: STADEN
Description: Includes GAP4, GAP5, SPIN, TREV, and numerous smaller tools.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://staden.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://staden.sourceforge.net/documentation.html

name: BoNB
text_content:
Tool Name: BoNB
Description: Software for genetic marker selection and subjects classification from the simultaneous analysis of genome-wide SNP data. It is based on the Naive Bayes classification framework, enriched by three main features: bootstrap aggregating of an ensemble of Naive Bayes classifiers, a novel strategy for ranking and selecting the attributes used by each classifier in the ensemble and a permutation-based procedure for selecting significant biomarkers.
Functions: Genetic mapping
Topics: Biomarkers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sysbiobig.dei.unipd.it/?q=Software#Bonb
Documentation:

name: PyroNoise
text_content:
Tool Name: PyroNoise
Description: Clustering of pyrosequencing (454) data with noise model (AmpliconNoise) and chimaera removal (Perseus) for sequence diversity analysis.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data quality management
Homepage: http://userweb.eng.gla.ac.uk/christopher.quince/Software/PyroNoise.html
Documentation: http://userweb.eng.gla.ac.uk/christopher.quince/Software/PyroNoise.html

name: ERDS
text_content:
Tool Name: ERDS
Description: ERDS is a free, open-source software, designed for detection of copy number variants (CNVs) on human genomes from next generation sequence data. It uses paired Hidden Markov models (PHMM) based on the expected distribution of read depth of short reads and the presence of heterozygous sites. ERDS is NOT good for whole exome data.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Statistical calculation, Variant calling
Topics: Genetic variation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.utahresearch.org/mingfuzhu/erds/
Documentation:

name: MPI Toolkit
text_content:
Tool Name: MPI Toolkit
Description: Max-Planck Institute Bioinformatics Toolkit provides access to many different bioinformatics software tools and databases for sequence similarity searching, multiple sequence alignments, phylogenetic analysis, and protein structure prediction.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction, Sequence similarity search, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de
Documentation:

name: TMSOC
text_content:
Tool Name: TMSOC
Description: The Transmembrane helix: Simple Or Complex (TMSOC) webserver identifies the simple and complex transmembrane helices in a protein sequence. Simple TM helices are then masked prior to sequence similarity searches to decrease the false discovery rate of similarity searches.
Functions: Sequence masking, Sequence similarity search, Structural similarity search, Transmembrane protein analysis, Transmembrane protein prediction
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Protein folds and structural domains, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://tmsoc.bii.a-star.edu.sg
Documentation: http://tmsoc.bii.a-star.edu.sg/download/README

name: LTR_Finder
text_content:
Tool Name: LTR_Finder
Description: LTR_Finder (Long Terminal Repeat Finder) is an efficient program for finding full-length LTR retrotransposons in genome sequences.
Functions: Repeat sequence analysis, Repeat sequence detection
Topics: Genomics, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://tlife.fudan.edu.cn/ltr_finder/
Documentation:

name: Metagenome-Kin
text_content:
Tool Name: Metagenome-Kin
Description: Metagenome@Kin is an automated high throughput sequencing data analysis tool for the 16S/28S/ITS rRNA genes. It measures the composition and diversity of microbial and fungal species in natural environments.
Functions: Species frequency estimation, Statistical calculation
Topics: Metagenomics
Homepage: http://www.w-fusionus.com/metagenome-kin
Documentation:

name: SAVoR
text_content:
Tool Name: SAVoR
Description: SAVoR webserver allows the user to visualize RNA-seq data and other genomic annotations on RNA secondary structures. SAVoR is designed to help researchers visualize sequencing data in the context of RNA secondary structures. Useful if you want to see the distribution of smRNA-seq reads along a microRNA precursor, how a set of SNPs might impact RNA structure, or in a control vs. treatment sequencing experiments you would like to see regions of enrichment along an RNA structure.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure visualisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, RNA-Seq, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://tesla.pcbi.upenn.edu/savor
Documentation: http://tesla.pcbi.upenn.edu/savor/

name: R-Coffee
text_content:
Tool Name: R-Coffee
Description: The R-Coffee web server uses pairwise or multiple sequence alignment methods to produce multiple alignments of non-coding RNA sequences, incorporating predicted or known secondary structures.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment, Pairwise structure alignment, RNA secondary structure alignment
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/do:rcoffee
Documentation: http://tcoffee.crg.cat/apps/tcoffee/tutorial.html

name: SALAMI
text_content:
Tool Name: SALAMI
Description: The SALAMI web server searches the protein data bank (PDB) for structures similar to input coordinates of a protein chain. Output is provided in a simple structure viewer with details of the sequence, structural similarity and sequence alignments.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence similarity search, Structural similarity search, Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://flensburg.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/~wurst/salami/
Documentation:

name: WHAT IF
text_content:
Tool Name: WHAT IF
Description: PDB Related Datbases present a series of databases that run parallel to the PDB. DSSP holds the secondary structure of the proteins. PDBREPORT holds reports on the structure quality and lists errors. HSSP holds a multiple sequence alignment for all proteins. The PDBFINDER holds easy to parse summaries of the PDB file content. PDB_REDO holds re-refined, and often improved, copies of all structures solved by X-ray.
Functions: Protein secondary structure analysis, Protein secondary structure assignment, Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://swift.cmbi.ru.nl/servers/html/index.html
Documentation: http://swift.cmbi.ru.nl/servers/html/index.html

name: The Protein Crystallisation Construct Designer
text_content:
Tool Name: The Protein Crystallisation Construct Designer
Description: Protein Crystallographic Construct Design (Protein CCD) is a meta-web server that facilitates the design of several truncated constructs of a protein using experimental data or sequence analysis tools. From input DNA sequence, information on disorder, coiled coils, transmembrane segments, domains and domain linkers are collected from secondary structure prediction servers. Users can select starts and ends for protein constructs and ProteinCCD wil design suitable PCR primers.
Functions: PCR primer design, Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction (coils)
Topics: Probes and primers, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein secondary structure, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://xtal.nki.nl/ccd
Documentation: https://ccd.rhpc.nki.nl/help

name: CARRIE
text_content:
Tool Name: CARRIE
Description: Server which analyzes microarray and promoter sequence data associated with a response to a specific stimulus.  After analysis a potential transcriptional regulatory network is created.  CARRIE also determines which transcription factors were likely involved in regulation and which genes they regulated.
Functions: Gene regulatory network analysis, Pathway or network prediction, trans-regulatory element prediction
Topics: Gene expression, Gene regulation, Microarray experiment, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://zlab.bu.edu/CARRIE-web
Documentation: https://zlab.bu.edu/CarrieServer/html/carrie.readme.shtml

name: pevoSOAR
text_content:
Tool Name: pevoSOAR
Description: pvSOAR takes a PDB ID or structure file as input, and searches for other proteins with surface regions that are similar to the query structure.
Functions: Database search, Molecular surface calculation, Query and retrieval, Sequence similarity search, Structural similarity search
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Small molecules
Homepage: http://sts.bioe.uic.edu/pevosoar/
Documentation:

name: Cluster Buster
text_content:
Tool Name: Cluster Buster
Description: Cluster Buster is a tool that finds clusters of pre-specified motifs in DNA sequences.
Functions: Clustering, Document clustering, Functional clustering, Sequence cluster visualisation, Sequence clustering
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://zlab.bu.edu/cluster-buster/
Documentation: https://zlab.bu.edu/cluster-buster/download.html

name: zPicture and multi-zPicture
text_content:
Tool Name: zPicture and multi-zPicture
Description: zPicture (pairwise alignment) and multi-zPicture (multiple alignment) are web-based sequence alignment tools based on the blastz alignment program. Alignments from zPicture can be automatically submitted to rVista.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Model organisms, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://zpicture.dcode.org/
Documentation: https://zpicture.dcode.org/zpInstructions.html

name: Seq2HLA
text_content:
Tool Name: Seq2HLA
Description: seq2HLA is a computational tool to determine Human Leukocyte Antigen (HLA) directly from existing and future short RNA-Seq reads. 
It takes standard RNA-Seq sequence reads in fastq format as input, uses a bowtie index comprising known HLA alleles and outputs the most likely HLA class I and class II types, a p-value for each call, and the expression of each class.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Read mapping
Topics: Mapping, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/sebastian_boegel/seq2hla
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/sebastian_boegel/seq2hla/wiki/Home

name: CGView
text_content:
Tool Name: CGView
Description: The CGView Server generates graphical maps of circular genomes that can be used to visualize sequence conservation in the context of sequence features, imported analysis results, open reading frames and base composition plots. The server uses BLAST to compare the primary sequence of up to three genomes or sequence sets, aiding in the identification of conserved genome segments, instances of horizontal transfer or visualization of genome segments from newly obtained sequence reads.
Functions: Mapping, Read mapping, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping, Visualisation
Topics: Genomics, Mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: http://stothard.afns.ualberta.ca/cgview_server/
Documentation: http://stothard.afns.ualberta.ca/cgview_server/examples.html

name: Consensus
text_content:
Tool Name: Consensus
Description: The Consensus server aligns a sequence to a structural template using a consensus of 5 different alignment methods.  A measure of reliability is produced for each alignment position in order to predict the suitability of regions for comparative modelling.
Functions: Protein modelling, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment validation, Structure alignment
Topics: Molecular modelling, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://stormo.wustl.edu/consensus/
Documentation: http://stormo.wustl.edu/consensus/html/Docs/cons_doc.html

name: Staden Package
text_content:
Tool Name: Staden Package
Description: UNIX-based tools for sequence assembly, mutation detection and sequence analysis; free for non-commercial use. Note that Staden development and support have ceased due to lack of funding, despite widespread use.
Functions: Gene prediction, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequence comparison
Topics: DNA, DNA binding sites, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://staden.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://staden.sourceforge.net/documentation.html

name: ViralFusionSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: ViralFusionSeq
Description: Accurately discover viral integration events and fusion transcripts by the use of soft-clipping information, read-pair analysis, and targeted de novo assembly
Functions: Read mapping, Read pre-processing, Sequence alignment, Sequence assembly
Topics: Gene structure, Genomics, Mapping, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/viralfusionseq/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/viralfusionseq/files/?source=navbar

name: ZINBA
text_content:
Tool Name: ZINBA
Description: Identifies genomic regions enriched in a variety of ChIP-seq and related next-generation sequencing experiments
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://code.google.com/archive/p/zinba/
Documentation: https://code.google.com/archive/p/zinba/wikis

name: SeqCons
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqCons
Description: SeqCons is an open source consensus computation program for Linux and Windows. The algorithm can be used for de novo and reference-guided sequence assembly.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/gkno/seqan/tree/master/core/apps/seqcons
Documentation:

name: Bismark
text_content:
Tool Name: Bismark
Description: Bismark is a tool to map bisulfite treated sequencing reads and perform methylation calling in a quick and easy-to-use fashion.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Methylation analysis, Read mapping
Topics: Epigenetics, Epigenomics, Genomics
Homepage: https://github.com/FelixKrueger/Bismark
Documentation: https://github.com/FelixKrueger/Bismark/tree/master/Docs

name: SRMA
text_content:
Tool Name: SRMA
Description: Short Read Micro re-Aligner for next-generation high throughput sequencing data.
Functions: Localised reassembly
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/srma/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/srma/wiki/Home/

name: SHRiMP
text_content:
Tool Name: SHRiMP
Description: Assembles to a reference sequence. Developed with Applied Biosystem's colourspace genomic representation in mind. Authors are Michael Brudno and Stephen Rumble at the University of Toronto. Works with data in letterspace (Roche, Illumina), colourspace (AB) and Helicos space.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/compbio-UofT/shrimp
Documentation: https://github.com/compbio-UofT/shrimp/blob/master/README

name: PanGEA
text_content:
Tool Name: PanGEA
Description: Tool which enables a fast and user-friendly analysis of allele specific gene expression using the 454 technology.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Local alignment, Polymorphism detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Gene expression, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.kofler.or.at/bioinformatics/PanGEA
Documentation: http://www.kofler.or.at/bioinformatics/PanGEA/Manual/index.html

name: Omixon Variant Toolkit
text_content:
Tool Name: Omixon Variant Toolkit
Description: These tools are designed to help clinical, diagnostic and research labs to efficiently get the maximum accuracy and precision from their targeted NGS data.
Functions: Read mapping, Sequence alignment, Sequence assembly
Topics: Comparative genomics, Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.omixon.com
Documentation: https://www.omixon.com/support-and-resources/

name: Life Science Knowledge Bank (LSKB)
text_content:
Tool Name: Life Science Knowledge Bank (LSKB)
Description: Comprehensive drug discovery and genomic research workbench, knowledgebase and data management system.
Functions: Pathway or network analysis, SNP detection, Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Workflows
Homepage: http://www.lskb.w-fusionus.com
Documentation: http://www.lskb.w-fusionus.com/

name: Ingenuity Variant Analysis
text_content:
Tool Name: Ingenuity Variant Analysis
Description: A web application that helps researchers studying human disease to identify causal variants.
Functions: Variant classification
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Exome sequencing, Genomics, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://www.ingenuity.com/products/ingenuity_variant_analysis.html
Documentation: https://www.qiagenbioinformatics.com/products/ingenuity-variant-analysis/

name: Haplowser
text_content:
Tool Name: Haplowser
Description: Comparative haplotype browser for personal genome and metagenome.
Functions: Haplotype mapping, Visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://haplowser-free-download.softwares7.com/
Documentation: http://haplowser-free-download.softwares7.com/

name: FusionAnalyser
text_content:
Tool Name: FusionAnalyser
Description: Graphical, event-driven tool dedicated to the identification of driver fusion rearrangements in human cancer through the analysis of paired-end high-throughput transcriptome sequencing data. Requires short, paired-end sequences.
Functions: Annotation, Gene expression profiling, Gene prediction, Read mapping
Topics: Gene structure, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.ngsbicocca.org/html/fusionanalyser.html
Documentation: http://www.ngsbicocca.org/html/how_it_works_fa.html

name: MiRanalyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: MiRanalyzer
Description: Web-server for identifying and analyzing miRNA in NGS sequencing experiments.
Functions: Global alignment, Sequence database search, miRNA expression analysis, microRNA detection
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Machine learning, Mapping, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioinfo2.ugr.es/miRanalyzer/miRanalyzer.php
Documentation:

name: focalCall
text_content:
Tool Name: focalCall
Description: Detection of genomic focal aberrations in high-resolution DNA copy number data.
Functions: Copy number estimation
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/focalCall.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/focalCall.html

name: DNAA
text_content:
Tool Name: DNAA
Description: Software for analysis of Next-Generation Sequencing data.
Functions: Modelling and simulation, Sequencing quality control, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA structural variation, Epigenetics
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/dnaa/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/dnaa/wiki/Home/

name: Cistrome
text_content:
Tool Name: Cistrome
Description: A web-based application with an analysis platform for CHIP-chip/seq and gene expression microarray data.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Peak calling, Sequence motif discovery, Statistical calculation
Topics: Gene expression, Immunoprecipitation experiment, Transcriptomics, Workflows
Homepage: http://www.cistrome.org/Cistrome/Cistrome_Project.html#
Documentation: https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/

name: CEQer
text_content:
Tool Name: CEQer
Description: Graphical, event-driven tool for copy number abnormalities/allelic-imbalance coupled analysis of whole-exome sequencing data. By using case-control matched exome data, it performs a comparative digital exonic quantification to generate CNA data and couples this information with exome-wide LOH and allelic imbalance detection.
Functions: Quantification, Sequence analysis, Sequence comparison, Variant calling
Topics: Exome sequencing, Genetic variation, Genomics
Homepage: http://www.ngsbicocca.org/html/ceqer.html
Documentation: http://www.ngsbicocca.org/html/how_it_works_ceqer.html

name: Breakway
text_content:
Tool Name: Breakway
Description: Suite of programs that take aligned genomic data and report structural variation breakpoints.
Functions: SNP detection, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA structural variation, Genetic variation, Genomics, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/breakway/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/breakway/wiki/Home/

name: Array Suite
text_content:
Tool Name: Array Suite
Description: Array Studio is a complete analysis and visualization package for NextGen sequencing data, as well as other -OMIC data types. Array Server is a backend enterprise server for storage and analysis of -OMIC and NextGen sequencing data.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Read mapping
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: http://www.omicsoft.com/array-studio/
Documentation: http://www.arrayserver.com/wiki/index.php?title=Array_Suite_Wiki

name: MethylCoder
text_content:
Tool Name: MethylCoder
Description: Pipeline for fast, simple processing of BiSulfite-treated reads into methylation data. Includes scripts for analysis and visualization. In addition to a binary output, the direct output of methylcoder is a text file that indicates per-nucleotide methylation context (CG/CHG/CHH) and methylation levels (both coverage and C-T conversions)
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Read mapping
Topics: Epigenetics, Epigenomics, Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/brentp/methylcode
Documentation: https://github.com/brentp/methylcode/blob/master/README.rst

name: INTREPID
text_content:
Tool Name: INTREPID
Description: The INTREPID web server predicts functionally important residues in proteins such as catalytic residues. Users input protein sequence. Residues predicted to be functionally important are displayed on homologous 3D structures if available.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein model validation, Protein modelling, Protein structure prediction, Residue interaction prediction
Topics: Function analysis, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: https://github.com/berkeleyphylogenomics/intrepid
Documentation: https://github.com/benedictpaten/pecan/blob/master/README.md

name: PECAN
text_content:
Tool Name: PECAN
Description: Alignment method practical for large genomic sequences.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/benedictpaten/pecan
Documentation: https://github.com/benedictpaten/pecan/blob/master/README.md

name: SeqBuster
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqBuster
Description: SeqBuster, a web-based bioinformatic tool offering a custom analysis of deep sequencing data at different levels, with special emphasis on the analysis of miRNA variants or isomiRs and the discovering of new small RNAs.
Functions: Read mapping
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://github.com/lpantano/seqbuster
Documentation: https://github.com/lpantano/seqbuster/wiki

name: Swift
text_content:
Tool Name: Swift
Description: Primary Data Analysis for the Illumina Solexa Sequencing Platform.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/new299/swift
Documentation: https://github.com/new299/swift/tree/master/documentation

name: MFEprimer-2.0
text_content:
Tool Name: MFEprimer-2.0
Description: MFEprimer-2.0 webserver tool evaluates the specificity of PCR primers. It allows users to check primer specificity against genomic DNA and mRNA/cDNA sequence databases. Important characteristics such as sequence, melting temperature and size of amplicon are reported on.
Functions: PCR primer design, Primer and probe design, Primer removal, Virtual PCR
Topics: Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Probes and primers, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/quwubin/MFEprimer
Documentation: https://github.com/quwubin/MFEprimer/blob/master/README.md

name: FACS
text_content:
Tool Name: FACS
Description: Rapid and accurate classification of sequences as belonging or not belonging to a reference sequence.
Functions: Sequence classification
Topics: Metagenomics, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/SciLifeLab/facs
Documentation: https://github.com/SciLifeLab/facs/blob/master/README.md

name: FAST: Fast Analysis of Sequences Toolbox
text_content:
Tool Name: FAST: Fast Analysis of Sequences Toolbox
Description: The FAST Analysis of Sequences Toolbox (FAST) is a set of Unix tools (for example fasgrep, fascut, fashead and fastr) for sequence bioinformatics modeled after the Unix textutils (such as grep, cut, head, tr, etc).
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/tlawrence3/FAST
Documentation: https://github.com/tlawrence3/FAST/tree/master/doc

name: PARalyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: PARalyzer
Description: Tool to analyze cross-linking and immunoprecipitation data (CLIP)
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: Immunoprecipitation experiment, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://ohlerlab.mdc-berlin.de/software/PARalyzer_85/
Documentation: https://ohlerlab.mdc-berlin.de/files/duke/PARalyzer/README.txt

name: PBIL
text_content:
Tool Name: PBIL
Description: Pole Bio-Informatique Lyonnais (PBIL) provides access to sequence databanks (EMBL, GenBank, SWISS-PROT, PIR) and to many tools of nucleic acid and protein sequence analyses.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence comparison
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure prediction
Homepage: https://prabi.ibcp.fr/htm/site/web/home
Documentation: http://antheprot-pbil.ibcp.fr/anthe_histo.php?evene=3D%20viewer

name: CHOP
text_content:
Tool Name: CHOP
Description: CHOP takes a protein sequence as input, and returns a list of protein sequence fragments with homology to PDB and Pfam domains and to proteins from the SWISS-PROT database.
Functions: Protein fold recognition, Protein modelling, Protein sequence analysis, Protein sequence cleavage, Sequence comparison
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/CHOPPER
Documentation: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Debian_repository#Installing_a_package_step_by_step

name: UniqueProt
text_content:
Tool Name: UniqueProt
Description: UniqueProt creates representative protein sequence sets by eliminating sequence redundancy based on sequence similiarity.  This tool needs to be downloaded and run locally on your own machine.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein sequence cleavage, Sequence comparison, Sequence redundancy removal
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Uniqueprot
Documentation: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Packages

name: odseq
text_content:
Tool Name: odseq
Description: Performs outlier detection of sequences in a multiple sequence alignment using bootstrap of predefined distance metrics. Outlier sequences can make downstream analyses unreliable or make the alignments less accurate while they are being constructed. This package implements the OD-seq algorithm for aligned sequences and a variant using string kernels for unaligned sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence comparison
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/odseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/odseq.html

name: nucleoSim
text_content:
Tool Name: nucleoSim
Description: This package can generate a synthetic map with reads covering the nucleosome regions as well as a synthetic map with forward and reverse reads emulating next-generation sequencing. The user has choice between three different distributions for the read positioning: Normal, Student and Uniform.
Functions: DNA mapping
Topics: DNA binding sites, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/nucleoSim.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/nucleoSim.html

name: NGScopy
text_content:
Tool Name: NGScopy
Description: Provides a quantitative caller for detecting copy number variations in next generation sequencing (NGS), including whole genome sequencing (WGS), whole exome sequencing (WES) and targeted panel sequencing (TPS). The caller can be parallelized by chromosomes to use multiple processors/cores on one computer.
Functions: Copy number estimation
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/NGScopy.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/NGScopy.html

name: UnderlyingApproach
text_content:
Tool Name: UnderlyingApproach
Description: Alignment-Free Phylogeny of Whole Genomes using Underlying Subwords.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/underlying.html
Documentation: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/underlying.html

name: FastEP
text_content:
Tool Name: FastEP
Description: Fast Computation of Entropic Profiles for the Detection of Conservation in Genomes
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/FastEP.html
Documentation: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/FastEP.html

name: PRED-LIPO
text_content:
Tool Name: PRED-LIPO
Description: PRED-SIGNAL is a tool that takes a Gram-positive bacteria protein sequence as input and predicts the probability of it being a lipoprotein signal peptides
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein signal peptide detection
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compgen.org/tools/PRED-LIPO
Documentation: http://www.compgen.org/tools/PRED-LIPO

name: STRAP
text_content:
Tool Name: STRAP
Description: The Structural Alignment Program for Proteins (STRAP) is a java-based program that can be run over the web using a Java Web Start enabled browser or downloaded and run as a stand-alone application. Alignments can be done using one of several methods, including ClustalW, JAligner and T_coffee. STRAP is also able to incorporate structure information and interfaces with programs such as Pymol and Rasmol. There is also a tutorial included.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Multiple structure alignment, Protein secondary structure comparison, Structure alignment
Topics: Gene and protein families, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.org/strap/
Documentation: http://www.bioinformatics.org/strap/security.html

name: SEQATOMS
text_content:
Tool Name: SEQATOMS
Description: SEQATOMS is a web tool for identifying missing regions in PDB sequence. To visualize these regions in their sequence context, a BLAST interface is used that is able to show the lower-case masked regions in the output (hits in the BLAST output are replaced with the corresponding subsequence from the original FASTA files).
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis, Sequence masking
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.nl/tools/seqatoms
Documentation:

name: geecc
text_content:
Tool Name: geecc
Description: Use log-linear models to perform hypergeometric and chi-squared tests for gene set enrichments for two (based on contingency tables) or three categories (contingency cubes). Categories can be differentially expressed genes, GO terms, sequence length, GC content, chromosomal position, phylostrata, divergence-strata, etc.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Data quality management, Gene expression
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/geecc.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/geecc.html

name: CNPBayes
text_content:
Tool Name: CNPBayes
Description: Bayesian hierarchical mixture models for batch effects and copy number.
Functions: Copy number estimation, Modelling and simulation, Statistical inference
Topics: Data mining, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CNPBayes.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CNPBayes.html

name: genotypeeval
text_content:
Tool Name: genotypeeval
Description: Takes in a gVCF or VCF and reports metrics to assess quality of calls.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data quality management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/genotypeeval.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/genotypeeval.html

name: simpleaffy
text_content:
Tool Name: simpleaffy
Description: Provides high level functions for reading Affy .CEL files, phenotypic data, and then computing simple things with it, such as t-tests, fold changes and the like. Makes heavy use of the affy library. Also has some basic scatter plot functions and mechanisms for generating high resolution journal figures.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Pairwise sequence alignment, Scatter plot plotting
Topics: Data visualisation, Microarray experiment
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/simpleaffy.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/simpleaffy.html

name: rnaSeqMap
text_content:
Tool Name: rnaSeqMap
Description: A library provides classes and functions to analyze the RNA-sequencing data using the coverage profiles in multiple samples at a time.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/rnaSeqMap.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/rnaSeqMap.html

name: ZOOM
text_content:
Tool Name: ZOOM
Description: A software for mapping the human genome reads from Illumina/Solexa sequencing to the reference human genome.
Functions: Read mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequence feature detection
Topics: Applied mathematics, Genomics, Human genetics, Mapping
Homepage: http://www.bioinfor.com/zoom-1-3-gui-release-next-gen-seq/
Documentation: http://www.bioinfor.com/user-manual/

name: INFO-RNA
text_content:
Tool Name: INFO-RNA
Description: INFO-RNA is a server for the design of RNA sequences that fold into a given pseudo-knot free RNA secondary structure.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure visualisation, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein folds and structural domains, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/INFO-RNA/start.html
Documentation: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/Help.jsp?toolName=INFORNA

name: occugene
text_content:
Tool Name: occugene
Description: Statistical tools for building random mutagenesis libraries for prokaryotes. The package has functions for handling the occupancy distribution for a multinomial and for estimating the number of essential genes in random transposon mutagenesis libraries.
Functions: Coding region prediction, Regression analysis
Topics: Microbiology, Model organisms
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/occugene.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/occugene.html

name: BSgenome
text_content:
Tool Name: BSgenome
Description: Infrastructure shared by all the Biostrings-based genome data packages.
Functions: Loading, Sequence analysis, Sequence masking
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BSgenome.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BSgenome.html

name: AnnotationDbi
text_content:
Tool Name: AnnotationDbi
Description: Provides user interface and database connection code for annotation data packages using SQLite data storage.
Functions: Database search, Sequence annotation
Topics: Data integration and warehousing, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/AnnotationDbi.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/AnnotationDbi.html

name: annotate
text_content:
Tool Name: annotate
Description: Using R enviroments for annotation.
Functions: Database search, Sequence annotation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/annotate.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/annotate.html

name: annmap
text_content:
Tool Name: annmap
