Description: Provides annotation mappings for Affymetrix exon arrays and coordinate based queries to support deep sequencing data analysis. Database access is hidden behind the API which provides a set of functions such as genesInRange(), geneToExon(), exonDetails(), etc. Functions to plot gene architecture and BAM file data are also provided. Underlying data are from Ensembl.
Functions: Sequence annotation
Topics: Data visualisation, Nucleic acids
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/annmap.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/annmap.html

name: SPLINTER
text_content:
Tool Name: SPLINTER
Description: This software provides tools to analyze alternative splicing sites, interpret outcomes based on sequence information, select and design primers for site validiation and give visual representation of the event to guide downstream experiments.
Functions: Primer and probe design, Splicing model analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Gene expression, RNA splicing, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SPLINTER.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SPLINTER.html

name: MBttest
text_content:
Tool Name: MBttest
Description: This high power, high conservativeness of FDR estimation and high stability method is suit-able to transcriptomic data, tag data, SAGE data (count data) from small samples or a few replicate libraries. It can be used to identify genes, mRNA isoforms or tags differentially expressed between two conditions.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MBttest.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MBttest.html

name: InPAS
text_content:
Tool Name: InPAS
Description: Alternative polyadenylation (APA) is an important post-transcriptional regulation mechanism which occurs in most human genes. This tool facilitates the discovery of novel APA sites from RNAseq data by leveraging cleanUpdTSeq to fine tune identified APA sites.
Functions: PolyA signal detection, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/InPAS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/InPAS.html

name: GLAD
text_content:
Tool Name: GLAD
Description: Analysis of array CGH data : detection of breakpoints in genomic profiles and assignment of a status (gain, normal or loss) to each chromosomal regions identified.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GLAD.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GLAD.html

name: traseR
text_content:
Tool Name: traseR
Description: Performs GWAS trait-associated SNP enrichment analyses in genomic intervals using different hypothesis testing approaches, also provides various functionalities to explore and visualize the results.
Functions: Pathway or network analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, GWAS study, Genetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/traseR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/traseR.html

name: MethTargetedNGS
text_content:
Tool Name: MethTargetedNGS
Description: Perform step by step methylation analysis of Next Generation Sequencing data.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MethTargetedNGS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MethTargetedNGS.html

name: GreyListChIP
text_content:
Tool Name: GreyListChIP
Description: Identify regions of ChIP experiments with high signal in the input, that lead to spurious peaks during peak calling. Remove reads aligning to these regions prior to peak calling, for cleaner ChIP analysis.
Functions: Genome annotation
Topics: ChIP-seq, Oncology
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GreyListChIP.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GreyListChIP.html

name: gmapR
text_content:
Tool Name: gmapR
Description: GSNAP and GMAP are a pair of tools to align short-read data. This package provides convenience methods to work with GMAP and GSNAP from within R. In addition, it provides methods to tally alignment results on a per-nucleotide basis using the bam_tally tool.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Read mapping
Topics: Mapping, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/gmapR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/gmapR.html

name: BBCAnalyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: BBCAnalyzer
Description: This package visualizes the relative or absolute number of bases, deletions and insertions at defined positions in sequence alignment data available as bam files in comparison to the reference bases. Markers for the relative base frequencies, the mean quality of the detected bases, known mutations or polymorphisms and variants called in the data may additionally be included in the plots.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BBCAnalyzer.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BBCAnalyzer.html

name: bamsignals
text_content:
Tool Name: bamsignals
Description: This package allows to efficiently obtain count vectors from indexed bam files. It counts the number of reads in given genomic ranges and it computes reads profiles and coverage profiles. It also handles paired-end data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bamsignals.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bamsignals.html

name: mBPCR
text_content:
Tool Name: mBPCR
Description: Estimates the DNA copy number profile by detecting regions with copy number changes.
Functions: Copy number estimation
Topics: Microarray experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/mBPCR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/mBPCR.html

name: XBSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: XBSeq
Description: This algorithm establishes an statistical model based on the assumption that observed signals are the convolution of true expression signals and sequencing noises. The mapped reads in non-exonic regions are considered as sequencing noises that follow a Poisson distribution. Given measureable observed and noise signals from RNA-seq data, true expression signals can be identified, assuming that they are governed by the negative binomial distribution.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/XBSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/XBSeq.html

name: SICtools
text_content:
Tool Name: SICtools
Description: This package is to find SNV/Indel differences between two bam files with near relationship in a way of pairwise comparison thourgh each base position across the genome region of interest. The difference is inferred by fisher test and euclidean distance, the input of which is the base count (A,T,G,C) in a given position and read counts for indels that span no less than 2bp on both sides of indel region.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: Oncology, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SICtools.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SICtools.html

name: PWMEnrich
text_content:
Tool Name: PWMEnrich
Description: A toolkit of high-level functions for DNA motif scanning and enrichment analysis built upon Biostrings. The main functionality is PWM enrichment analysis of already known PWMs (e.g. from databases such as MotifDb), but the package also implements high-level functions for PWM scanning and visualisation. The package does not perform "de novo" motif discovery, but is instead focused on using motifs that are either experimentally derived or computationally constructed by other tools.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PWMEnrich.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PWMEnrich.html

name: PREDA
text_content:
Tool Name: PREDA
Description: Package for the position related analysis of quantitative functional genomics data.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Functional genomics, Oncology, Quantitative genetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PREDA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PREDA.html

name: PLPE
text_content:
Tool Name: PLPE
Description: This package performs tests for paired high-throughput data.
Functions: Gene set testing
Topics: Data architecture, analysis and design, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PLPE.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PLPE.html

name: ALEXA-Seq
text_content:
Tool Name: ALEXA-Seq
Description: Alternative Expression Analysis by massively parallel RNA sequencing
Functions: RNA-Seq quantification
Topics: RNA splicing
Homepage: http://www.alexaplatform.org/alexa_seq/downloads.htm
Documentation: http://www.alexaplatform.org/alexa_seq/source_code/ALEXA-Seq_Manual_v.1.17.pdf

name: methylMnM
text_content:
Tool Name: methylMnM
Description: To give the exactly p-value and q-value of MeDIP-seq and MRE-seq data for different samples comparation.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylMnM.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylMnM.html

name: GenoGAM
text_content:
Tool Name: GenoGAM
Description: This package allows statistical analysis of genome-wide data with smooth functions using generalized additive models based on the implementation from the R-package 'mgcv'. It provides methods for the statistical analysis of ChIP-Seq data including inference of protein occupancy, and pointwise and region-wise differential analysis. Scaling of generalized additive model fitting to whole chromosomes is achieved by parallelization over overlapping genomic intervals.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenoGAM.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenoGAM.html

name: genoCN
text_content:
Tool Name: genoCN
Description: Simultaneous identification of copy number states and genotype calls for regions of either copy number variations or copy number aberrations.
Functions: Genotyping, Sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/genoCN.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/genoCN.html

name: GenomicInteractions
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomicInteractions
Description: R package for handling Genomic interaction data, such as ChIA-PET/Hi-C, annotating genomic features with interaction information and producing various plots/statistics.
Functions: Genome annotation, Protein interaction analysis
Topics: Protein interactions, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicInteractions.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicInteractions.html

name: facopy
text_content:
Tool Name: facopy
Description: Package for fine-tuned cancer CNA association modeling. Association is measured directly at the genomic features of interest and, in the case of genes, downstream gene-set enrichment analysis can be performed thanks to novel internal processing of the data. The software opens a way to systematically scrutinize the differences in CNA distribution across tumoral phenotypes, such as those that relate to tumor type, location and progression.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Oncology, Phenomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/facopy.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/facopy.html

name: EMDomics
text_content:
Tool Name: EMDomics
Description: Algorithm used to perform a supervised multi-class analysis to measure the magnitude and statistical significance of observed continuous genomics data between groups. Traditional methods use significance tests based on summary statistics of the distributions. This approach lacks power to identify differences between groups with high levels of intra-group heterogeneity. The algorithm transforms one distribution into another, providing the overall difference in shape between two distributions.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/EMDomics.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/EMDomics.html

name: DMRcaller
text_content:
Tool Name: DMRcaller
Description: Uses Bisulfite sequencing data in two conditions and identifies differentially methylated regions between the conditions in CG and non-CG context. The input is the CX report files produced by Bismark and the output is a list of DMRs stored as GRanges objects.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMRcaller.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMRcaller.html

name: conumee
text_content:
Tool Name: conumee
Description: This package contains a set of processing and plotting methods for performing copy-number variation (CNV) analysis using Illumina 450k or EPIC methylation arrays.
Functions: Copy number estimation
Topics: Epigenetics, Microarray experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/conumee.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/conumee.html

name: CancerMutationAnalysis
text_content:
Tool Name: CancerMutationAnalysis
Description: This package implements gene and gene-set level analysis methods for somatic mutation studies of cancer. The gene-level methods distinguish between driver and passenger genes, and incorporate a two-stage study design. The gene-set methods implement a patient-oriented approach, which calculates gene-set scores for each sample, then combines them across samples; a gene-oriented approach which uses the Wilcoxon test is also provided for comparison.
Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Genetic variation, Oncology, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CancerMutationAnalysis.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CancerMutationAnalysis.html

name: BubbleTree
text_content:
Tool Name: BubbleTree
Description: CNV analysis in groups of tumor samples (Publication Pending).
Functions: Copy number estimation, Sample comparison, Variant calling
Topics: Oncology, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BubbleTree.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BubbleTree.html

name: BEclear
text_content:
Tool Name: BEclear
Description: This tool provides some functions to detect and correct for batch effects in DNA methylation data. Its core function is based on latent factor models and can also be used to predict missing values in any other matrix containing real numbers.
Functions: Methylation analysis, Optimisation and refinement
Topics: Data quality management, Epigenetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BEclear.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BEclear.html

name: BEAT
text_content:
Tool Name: BEAT
Description: Model-based analysis of single-cell methylation data.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BEAT.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BEAT.html

name: BaseSpaceR
text_content:
Tool Name: BaseSpaceR
Description: A rich R interface to Illumina's BaseSpace cloud computing environment, enabling the fast development of data analysis and visualisation tools.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis, Software engineering
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BaseSpaceR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BaseSpaceR.html

name: BADER
text_content:
Tool Name: BADER
Description: For RNA sequencing count data, this tool fits a Bayesian hierarchical model. Its algorithm returns the posterior probability of differential expression for each gene between two groups A and B. The joint posterior distribution of the variables in the model can be returned in the form of posterior samples, which can be used for further down-stream analyses such as gene set enrichment.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, RNA-seq read count analysis
Topics: RNA-Seq, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BADER.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BADER.html

name: BaalChIP
text_content:
Tool Name: BaalChIP
Description: This package offers functions to process multiple ChIP-seq BAM files and detect allele-specific events. Computes allele counts at individual variants (SNPs/SNVs), implements extensive QC steps to remove problematic variants, and utilizes a bayesian framework to identify statistically significant allele-specific events. It is able to account for copy number differences between the two alleles, a known phenotypical feature of cancer samples.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Data quality management, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BaalChIP.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BaalChIP.html

name: Affymetrix NetAffx Analysis Center
text_content:
Tool Name: Affymetrix NetAffx Analysis Center
Description: Allows correlation of GeneChip array results with array design and annotation information; provides access to array content information, including probe sequences and gene annotations; free registration is required.
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene functional annotation, Microarray probe design, Sequence annotation
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Probes and primers, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.affymetrix.com/analysis/index.affx
Documentation: http://www.affymetrix.com/support/help/index.affx

name: SuperPose
text_content:
Tool Name: SuperPose
Description: SuperPose is a tool for superpositions of protein structures.  SuperPose generates sequence alignments, structure alignments, PDB coordinates and RMSD statistics, difference distance plots, and images of the superimposed molecules.
Functions: Global structure alignment, Protein secondary structure comparison, Sequence alignment, Structure alignment
Topics: Imaging, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://wishart.biology.ualberta.ca/SuperPose/
Documentation: http://wishart.biology.ualberta.ca/SuperPose/help.html

name: PREDITOR
text_content:
Tool Name: PREDITOR
Description: PREDITOR predicts torsion angles in proteins from NMR chemical shift data and sequence homology.  PREDITOR combines sequence alignment methods with advanced chemical shift analysis techniques to generate its torsion angle predictions.
Functions: Protein geometry calculation, Protein geometry validation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: MRI, NMR, Protein modifications, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://wishart.biology.ualberta.ca/shiftor/cgi-bin/preditor_current.py
Documentation: http://wishart.biology.ualberta.ca/shiftor/help/

name: PROTEUS2
text_content:
Tool Name: PROTEUS2
Description: PROTEUS2 is a web server for comprehensive protein structure prediction and structure-based annotation. The analysis pipeline includes signal identification, trans-membrane helix prediction, trans-membrane beta-strand prediction, secondary structure prediction and homology modeling for user inputs of single or multiple sequences.
Functions: Protein modelling, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction (helices), Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://wishart.biology.ualberta.ca/proteus2
Documentation: http://www.proteus2.ca/proteus2/documentation.jsp

name: PathoStat
text_content:
Tool Name: PathoStat
Description: The purpose of this package is to perform Statistical Microbiome Analysis on metagenomics results from sequencing data samples. In particular, it supports analyses on the PathoScope generated report files. This tool provides various functionalities including relative abundance charts, diversity estimates and plots, tests of differential abundance, time series visualization, and core OTU analysis.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Metagenomics, Microbiology, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PathoStat.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PathoStat.html

name: OutlierD
text_content:
Tool Name: OutlierD
Description: This package detects outliers using quantile regression on the M-A scatterplots of high-throughput data.
Functions: Regression analysis
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/OutlierD.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/OutlierD.html

name: GeneMeta
text_content:
Tool Name: GeneMeta
Description: A collection of meta-analysis tools for analysing high throughput experimental data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GeneMeta.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GeneMeta.html

name: Database for Bacterial Group 2 Introns
text_content:
Tool Name: Database for Bacterial Group 2 Introns
Description: Database for Bacterial Group 2 Introns: a catalogue of full-length, non-redundant group II introns present in bacterial DNA sequences in GenBank. General info on group 2 intron properties, structures and classification. Lists info for individual introns (insertion sites, DNA sequences, intron-encoded protein sequences, RNA secondary structure models). Tools fo ridentification and analysis of intron sequences.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure classification
Topics: DNA, Gene and protein families, Gene transcripts, Mobile genetic elements, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://webapps2.ucalgary.ca/~groupii/
Documentation:

name: WAViS
text_content:
Tool Name: WAViS
Description: The Web Alignment Visualization Server (WAViS) provides various web tools to enhance the presentation of amino acid or nucleotide multiple sequence alignments.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Small molecules, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://wavis.img.cas.cz/
Documentation: http://wavis.img.cas.cz

name: Web 3DNA
text_content:
Tool Name: Web 3DNA
Description: The web 3DNA server is the web interface for the 3DNA suite of programs developed for the analysis, reconstruction and visualization of 3D nucleic acid containing structures.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acid structure comparison, Nucleic acid structure prediction
Topics: Imaging, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://w3dna.rutgers.edu
Documentation: http://w3dna.rutgers.edu/index.php/doc/tutorial

name: MET
text_content:
Tool Name: MET
Description: The Motif Enrichment Tool (MET) takes user-defined gene sets and identifies significantly associated sets of genes that share a regulatory motif. The tool is available for a number of model organisms (human, mouse, zebrafinch, stickleback, fruitfly, etc). It incorporates transcription factor DNA-specificity motifs taken from literature curation, bacterial one-hybrid assays, high-throughput SELEX experiments, and protein binding microarrays.
Functions: Gene set testing, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: ChIP-seq, Gene expression, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://veda.cs.uiuc.edu/MET/
Documentation: https://academic.oup.com/nar/article/42/W1/W20/2437996

name: GC-Profile
text_content:
Tool Name: GC-Profile
Description: GC-Profile is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing the variation of GC content in genomic sequences.
Functions: CpG island and isochore detection, Genetic variation analysis
Topics: DNA structural variation, Genomics, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://tubic.tju.edu.cn/GC-Profile/
Documentation: http://tubic.tju.edu.cn/GC-Profile/

name: RNAcontext
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAcontext
Description: New motif-finding method designed to elucidate RNA-binding protein (RBP) specific sequence and structural preferences with greater accuracy than existing approahces.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction, RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA structure prediction
Topics: Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Proteins, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~hilal/rnacontext/
Documentation: http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~hilal/rnacontext/README.txt

name: CRAVAT
text_content:
Tool Name: CRAVAT
Description: Web-based resource for cancer-related analysis of genomic variants (single base substitutions and indels).  It provides scoring, sorting, filtering, and interactive visualizations to assist with identification of important variants.
Functions: SNP annotation, Sequence annotation, Variant classification, Variant prioritisation
Topics: Genetic variation, Genetics, Genomics
Homepage: http://www.cravat.us
Documentation: http://www.cravat.us/CRAVAT/help.jsp

name: SubSeqer
text_content:
Tool Name: SubSeqer
Description: Tool to find sequence motifs in low complexity protein sequences. It uses the application of a unique graph based approach.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.compsysbio.org/subseqer/
Documentation: http://compsysbio.org/subseqer/documentation.php

name: ElastoDB
text_content:
Tool Name: ElastoDB
Description: Repository for well-characterized elastin sequences to facilitate its study. The database has since expanded to include other non-elastin sequences that share elastic properties.
Functions: Data retrieval, Protein sequence analysis, Representative sequence identification, Sequence analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, Phylogeny, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.compsysbio.org/elastin/
Documentation: http://compsysbio.org/elastin/

name: Signature
text_content:
Tool Name: Signature
Description: This tool identifies signature genes or genes that are unique to a taxonomic clade and thus useful in phylogenetic analysis. Users input a set of query sequences and returned is a list of taxonomic clades that share signatures with the query.
Functions: Gene prediction, Query and retrieval, Sequence motif recognition, Taxonomic classification, Transposon prediction
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny
Homepage: http://www.cmbi.ru.nl/signature
Documentation: http://facil-host.cmbi.umcn.nl/signature/cgi-bin/display.pl?disp=help

name: Caryoscope
text_content:
Tool Name: Caryoscope
Description: Application for viewing gene expression data in a whole-genome context. It has been used to “draw” microarray data onto a set of chromosomes so that changes in DNA copy number can identify regions of chromosome loss or duplication within the genome of tumor cells (Nat Genet. 1999 Sep;23(1):41-6).
Functions: Enrichment analysis
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.stanford.edu/group/sherlocklab/software.shtml
Documentation:

name: CMF
text_content:
Tool Name: CMF
Description: Contrast motif finder that finds motifs with differential enrichment between two datasets. It aims to take advantage of multiple high quality binding datasets to identify subtle regulatory signals, such as context-dependent motifs, within bound sequences. It is specifically designed to discriminate between two sets of bound sequences and takes into account false positive sites when updating PWMs and other model parameters.
Functions: Enrichment analysis
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.stat.ucla.edu/~zhou/CMF/index.html
Documentation: http://www.stat.ucla.edu/~zhou/CMF/cmfREADME.txt

name: Bubbleparse
text_content:
Tool Name: Bubbleparse
Description: A method for detecting variants directly from next-generation reads without a reference sequence. It uses the de Bruijn graph implementation in the Cortex framework as a basis and allows the user to identify bubbles in these graphs that represent polymorphisms, quickly, easily and sensitively.
Functions: Generation, Variant calling
Topics: DNA, Genetic variation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.tgac.ac.uk/bubbleparse/
Documentation: https://github.com/richardmleggett/bubbleparse

name: NextClip
text_content:
Tool Name: NextClip
Description: Tool for comprehensive quality analysis and read preparation for Nextera long mate pair (LMP) libraries.
Functions: Data handling
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.tgac.ac.uk/nextclip/
Documentation: https://documentation.tgac.ac.uk/#all-updates

name: EasyQC
text_content:
Tool Name: EasyQC
Description: An R-package that provides advanced funcionality to perform file-level QC of single genome-wide association (GWA) data-sets, to conduct quality control across several GWA data-sets (meta-level QC) and to simplify data-handling of large-scale GWA data-sets.
Functions: Validation
Topics: GWAS study, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.uni-regensburg.de/medizin/epidemiologie-praeventivmedizin/genetische-epidemiologie/software/index.html
Documentation: http://homepages.uni-regensburg.de/~wit59712/easyqc/EasyQC_9.0_Commands_140918_2.pdf

name: PRBR
text_content:
Tool Name: PRBR
Description: Identify RNA-binding residues from protein sequences which combines a hybrid feature with the enriched random forest (ERF) algorithm.
Functions: Protein interaction prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, RNA
Homepage: http://www.cbi.seu.edu.cn/PRBR/
Documentation: http://www.cbi.seu.edu.cn/PRBR/instructions.php

name: Pyvolve
text_content:
Tool Name: Pyvolve
Description: Open-source Python module for simulating sequences along a phylogenetic tree according to continuous-time Markov models of sequence evolution.
Functions: Network simulation
Topics: Machine learning, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/sjspielman/pyvolve
Documentation: https://github.com/sjspielman/pyvolve/raw/master/user_manual/pyvolve_manual.pdf

name: ProteinFuncPred
text_content:
Tool Name: ProteinFuncPred
Description: Software of two domain-based protein function prediction methods that encode domain recurrence and order information.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Function analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://sfb.kaust.edu.sa/Pages/Software.aspx
Documentation: https://sfb.kaust.edu.sa/Pages/Software.aspx

name: GPCR-ModSim
text_content:
Tool Name: GPCR-ModSim
Description: Centralized and easy to use service dedicated to the structural modeling of G-protein Coupled Receptors (GPCRs).
Functions: Molecular dynamics, Protein modelling, Sequence alignment
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://open.gpcr-modsim.org/
Documentation: http://open.gpcr-modsim.org/static/docs/tutorial.pdf

name: HighMap
text_content:
Tool Name: HighMap
Description: Software suitable for genetic map. This software utilized maximum likelihood and smooth algorithm, and could deal with ten thousand markers that make map distance more stably.
Functions: Genetic mapping
Topics: Genetics, Mapping, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://highmap.biomarker.com.cn/
Documentation: http://highmap.biomarker.com.cn/

name: SPRING
text_content:
Tool Name: SPRING
Description: A tool for the analysis of genome rearrangements. SPRING takes two or more chromosomes as its input and then computes a minimum series of reversals and/or block-interchanges for transforming one chromosome into another. Phylogenetic trees based on the rearrangement analysis are also shown as part of the results.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree distances calculation, Phylogenetic tree generation (minimum distance methods), Phylogenetic tree reconstruction, Sequence distance matrix generation
Topics: DNA, Phylogenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://algorithm.cs.nthu.edu.tw/tools/SPRING
Documentation: http://algorithm.cs.nthu.edu.tw/tools/SPRING/help.php

name: aLeaves
text_content:
Tool Name: aLeaves
Description: Web server supports homolog collection from diverse animal genomes. An input sequence is passed through the server to collect similar sequences for molecular phylogenetic analysis.
Functions: DNA substitution modelling, Multiple sequence alignment, Phylogenetic tree analysis (natural selection), Phylogenetic tree generation (from molecular sequences), Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis, Zoology
Homepage: http://aleaves.cdb.riken.jp/
Documentation: http://aleaves.cdb.riken.jp/aleaves/faq.html

name: VelvetK
text_content:
Tool Name: VelvetK
Description: Estimate the best k-mer size to use for your Velvet de novo assembly. It needs two inputs: the estimated genome size, and all your sequence read files. The genome size can be supplied as as a number (eg. 3.5M) or as a FASTA file of a closely related genome.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.vicbioinformatics.com/software.velvetk.shtml
Documentation: http://www.vicbioinformatics.com/documents.shtml

name: Structator
text_content:
Tool Name: Structator
Description: A complete and robust open-source software solution for index-based search of RNA sequence-structure patterns.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/?id=271
Documentation: https://www.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/en/research/application-oriented-bioinformatics/software/structator.html

name: baySeq
text_content:
Tool Name: baySeq
Description: This package identifies differential expression in high-throughput 'count' data, such as that derived from next-generation sequencing machines, calculating estimated posterior likelihoods of differential expression (or more complex hypotheses) via empirical Bayesian methods.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/baySeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/baySeq.html

name: Rhtslib
text_content:
Tool Name: Rhtslib
Description: This package provides version 1.1 of the 'HTSlib' C library for high-throughput sequence analysis. It is primarily useful to developers of other R packages who wish to make use of HTSlib.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Rhtslib.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Rhtslib.html

name: qrqc
text_content:
Tool Name: qrqc
Description: Quickly scans reads and gathers statistics on base and quality frequencies, read length, k-mers by position, and frequent sequences. Produces graphical output of statistics for use in quality control pipelines, and an optional HTML quality report. S4 SequenceSummary objects allow specific tests and functionality to be written around the data collected.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/qrqc.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/qrqc.html

name: bigmelon
text_content:
Tool Name: bigmelon
Description: Methods for working with Illumina arrays using gdsfmt.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bigmelon.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bigmelon.html

name: BasicSTARRseq
text_content:
Tool Name: BasicSTARRseq
Description: Basic peak calling on STARR-seq data.
Functions: Peak calling
Topics: Mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BasicSTARRseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BasicSTARRseq.html

name: quantsmooth
text_content:
Tool Name: quantsmooth
Description: Implements quantile smoothing as introduced in: Quantile smoothing of array CGH data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/quantsmooth.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/quantsmooth.html

name: ArrayTV
text_content:
Tool Name: ArrayTV
Description: Wave correction for genotyping and copy number arrays.
Functions: Validation
Topics: Data quality management, Genotyping experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ArrayTV.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ArrayTV.html

name: rRDP
text_content:
Tool Name: rRDP
Description: Seamlessly interfaces RDP classifier.
Functions: Sequence classification
Topics: Microbiology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/rRDP.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/rRDP.html

name: bgafun
text_content:
Tool Name: bgafun
Description: A method to identify specifity determining residues in protein families using Between Group Analysis.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bgafun.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bgafun.html

name: Rcade
text_content:
Tool Name: Rcade
Description: This tool integrates ChIP-seq data with differential expression summary data through a Bayesian framework. A key application is identifing the genes targeted by a transcription factor of interest (that is, we collect genes that are associated with a ChIP-seq peak, and analyze the differential expression under some perturbation related to that TF).
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Gene expression
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Rcade.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Rcade.html

name: TGGE-STAR
text_content:
Tool Name: TGGE-STAR
Description: TGGE-STAR assists in the design of PCR primers for temperature gradient gel electrophoresis. It also incorporates the concept of bipolar clamping.
Functions: Nucleic acid temperature profile plotting, PCR primer design, Primer and probe design, Primer removal
Topics: Genetic variation, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Probes and primers, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.charite.de/bioinf/tgge/
Documentation:

name: RevTrans
text_content:
Tool Name: RevTrans
Description: RevTrans takes a set of DNA sequences, virtually translates them, aligns the peptide sequences, and uses this as a scaffold for constructing the corresponding DNA multiple alignment.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Scaffolding, Sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Genetic variation, Protein expression, Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/RevTrans/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/RevTrans/instructions.php

name: MaxAlign
text_content:
Tool Name: MaxAlign
Description: MaxAlign is a web server for maximizing usable data in an alignment. It maximizes the number of nucleotide (or amino acid) symbols present in gap-free columns by selecting the optimal subset of sequences to exclude from the alignment.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Small molecules
Homepage: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/MaxAlign/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/MaxAlign/instructions.php

name: SHOREmap
text_content:
Tool Name: SHOREmap
Description: Extension of the short read analysis pipeline SHORE. SHOREmap supports genome-wide genotyping and candidate-gene sequencing in a single step through analysis of deep sequencing data from a large pool of recombinants.
Functions: DNA mapping
Topics: Genomics, Genotype and phenotype, Mapping
Homepage: http://1001genomes.org/software/shoremap.html
Documentation: http://1001genomes.org/software/shoremap.html

name: REALPHY
text_content:
Tool Name: REALPHY
Description: The Reference sequence Alignment based Phylogeny builder is a free online pipeline that can infer phylogenetic trees from whole genome sequence data. The user only has to provide genome sequences in FASTA, GenBank or FASTQ formats. From these sequences phylogenetic trees are inferred via PhyML. The alignments, tree files and information on SNPs and deleted sites will be available for download after the analysis is finished.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree reconstruction, Sequence alignment
Topics: Evolutionary biology
Homepage: https://realphy.unibas.ch/fcgi/realphy
Documentation: https://realphy.unibas.ch/docs/Realphy_manual.pdf

name: Seq2Logo
text_content:
Tool Name: Seq2Logo
Description: A web-based sequence logo generation method for construction and visualization of amino acid binding motifs and sequence profiles including sequence weighting, pseudo counts and two-sided representation of amino acid enrichment and depletion.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Protein sites, features and motifs, Small molecules
Homepage: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/biotools/Seq2Logo/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/biotools/Seq2Logo-2.0/instructions.php

name: Quake
text_content:
Tool Name: Quake
Description: A program for detecting and correcting errors in next generation sequencing reads.
Functions: Optimisation and refinement, Sequence editing, Sequencing error detection, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.cbcb.umd.edu/software/quake
Documentation: http://www.cbcb.umd.edu/software/quake/manual.html

name: ADGO
text_content:
Tool Name: ADGO
Description: ADGO is a web tool that provides composite interpretations for microarray data comparing two sample groups. It also provides composite interpretations and enrichment analysis for lists of genes from diverse sources of biological information.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression analysis, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Service composition
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, Sample collections, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.btool.org/ADGO2
Documentation: http://www.btool.org/ADGO2

name: Vicuna
text_content:
Tool Name: Vicuna
Description: A software tool that enables consensus assembly of ultra-deep sequence derived from diverse viral or other heterogeneous populations.
Functions: De-novo assembly, Genetic variation analysis, de Novo sequencing
Topics: Genetic variation, Genomics, Sequence assembly, Virology
Homepage: http://www.broadinstitute.org/scientific-community/science/projects/viral-genomics/vicuna
Documentation: http://software.broadinstitute.org/viral/docs/vicuna_v1.0.pdf

name: SmashCommunity
text_content:
Tool Name: SmashCommunity
Description: A stand-alone metagenomic annotation and analysis pipeline suitable for data from Sanger and 454 sequencing technologies.
Functions: Genome annotation, Prediction and recognition, Sequence assembly
Topics: Functional genomics, Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.bork.embl.de/software/smash
Documentation: http://www.bork.embl.de/software/smash/docs.html

name: PAL2NAL
text_content:
Tool Name: PAL2NAL
Description: PAL2NAL converts a multiple sequence alignment of proteins and the corresponding DNA (or mRNA) sequences into a codon alignment. Synonymous (Ks) and non-synonymous (Ka) substitution rates can be calculated.
Functions: DNA substitution modelling, Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bork.embl.de/pal2nal/
Documentation:

name: CisGenome
text_content:
Tool Name: CisGenome
Description: An integrated tool for tiling array, ChIP-seq, genome and cis-regulatory element analysis
Functions: Data retrieval, Sequence motif recognition, Statistical calculation
Topics: ChIP-on-chip, ChIP-seq, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.biostat.jhsph.edu/~hji/cisgenome/index.htm
Documentation: http://www.biostat.jhsph.edu/~hji/cisgenome/index_files/manual.htm

name: LogoBar
text_content:
Tool Name: LogoBar
Description: LogoBar is a Java application to display protein sequence logos. With this application you can generate protein sequence logos from multiple sequence alignments that show the amino acid incidence at every position.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Small molecules
Homepage: http://www.biosci.ki.se/groups/tbu/logobar/
Documentation: http://www.biosci.ki.se/groups/tbu/logobar/logobardocumentation.pdf

name: SNP-o-matic
text_content:
Tool Name: SNP-o-matic
Description: Fast, memory-efficient and stringent read mapping tool offering a variety of analytical output functions, with an emphasis on genotyping.
Functions: Genotyping, Read mapping
Topics: Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://snpomatic.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://snpomatic.sourceforge.net/snpomatic_manual.pdf

name: ScreenBEAM
text_content:
Tool Name: ScreenBEAM
Description: An R package to do gene-level meta-anlaysis of high-throughput functional genomics RNAi or CRISPR screening data. Both microarray and NGS data are supported
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Genomics, RNAi experiment
Homepage: https://github.com/jyyu/ScreenBEAM
Documentation: https://github.com/jyyu/ScreenBEAM

name: SPASIBA
text_content:
Tool Name: SPASIBA
Description: An R package for spatial continuous assignment from genetic data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Phylogenetics, Simulation experiment
Homepage: http://www2.imm.dtu.dk/~gigu/Spasiba/
Documentation: http://www2.imm.dtu.dk/~gigu/Spasiba/

name: RAPTR-SV
text_content:
Tool Name: RAPTR-SV
Description: Read Pair and Split Read methods are used to identify structural variants in paired-end WGS data.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/njdbickhart/RAPTR-SV
Documentation: https://github.com/njdbickhart/RAPTR-SV/blob/master/README.md

name: PyMod
text_content:
Tool Name: PyMod
Description: A simple and intuitive interface between the popular molecular graphics system PyMOL and several other tools (i.e., BLAST, ClustalW, Muscle, CEalign and MODELLER) has been developed, to show how the integration of the individual steps required for homology modelling and sequence/structure analysis within the PyMOL framework can hugely simplify these tasks. It is a new tool for the analysis and the manipulation of protein sequences and structures.
Functions: Protein modelling, Protein sequence analysis, Structure analysis
Topics: Molecular modelling, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://schubert.bio.uniroma1.it/pymod/index.html
Documentation: http://schubert.bio.uniroma1.it/pymod/documentation.html

name: STEPP
text_content:
Tool Name: STEPP
Description: A support vector machine (SVM) model that uses a simple descriptor space based on 35 properties of amino acid content, charge, hydrophilicity and polarity for the quantitative prediction of proteotypic peptides.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Proteins, Small molecules
Homepage: http://cbb.pnnl.gov/portal/software/stepp.html
Documentation: http://cbb.pnnl.gov/portal/software/stepp.html

name: SKINK
text_content:
Tool Name: SKINK
Description: The web server classifies given alpha-helical sequences into kinked and canonical helices based on a specified support vector machine (SVM) model.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Structure classification
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://biows-inf.zdv.uni-mainz.de/skink/index.php
Documentation: http://biows-inf.zdv.uni-mainz.de/skink/documentation.php

name: NGSoptwin
text_content:
Tool Name: NGSoptwin
Description: R package to estimate the optimal window size in the analysis of very low coverage next-generation sequence data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www1.maths.leeds.ac.uk/~arief/R/win/
Documentation: http://www1.maths.leeds.ac.uk/~arief/R/win/

name: NGSrich
text_content:
Tool Name: NGSrich
Description: Tool for researchers concerned with target enrichment issues in next-generation sequencing. It evaluates the target enrichment performance of target regions given in BED format and outputs summary statistics, visualizations, and some additional files giving details on the analysis.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/ngsrich/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/ngsrich/

name: LoQuM
text_content:
Tool Name: LoQuM
Description: Assigns reliable mapping quality scores to mappings of Illumina reads returned by an alignment tool.
Functions: Mapping
Topics: Mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://compbio.case.edu/loqum/
Documentation: http://compbio.case.edu/loqum/

name: GControl
text_content:
Tool Name: GControl
Description: Computer program for Bayesian analysis of case-control data that controls for population stratification and cryptic relatedness. The program performs these analyses using Markov chain Monte Carlo algorithms.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction, Prediction and recognition
Topics: Genetics, Population genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://wpicr.wpic.pitt.edu/WPICCompGen/bayesian_genomic_control_softwar.htm
Documentation: http://wpicr.wpic.pitt.edu/WPICCompGen/bayesian_gc/readme.txt

name: STAMP
text_content:
Tool Name: STAMP
Description: A software package for analyzing metagenomic profiles (e.g., a taxonomic profile indicating the number of marker genes assigned to different taxonomic units or a functional profile indicating the number of sequences assigned to different biological subsystems or pathways) that promotes ‘best practices’ in choosing appropriate statistical techniques and reporting results. It encourages the use of effect sizes and confidence intervals in assessing biological importance.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA, Metagenomics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://kiwi.cs.dal.ca/Software/index.php/STAMP
Documentation: http://kiwi.cs.dal.ca/Software/index.php/STAMP

name: Softparsmap
text_content:
Tool Name: Softparsmap
Description: A java package that uses ’soft parsimony’ to root gene trees by mapping them on to a species tree.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree generation
Topics: Mapping, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://liberles.cst.temple.edu/Software/Softparsmap/index.html
Documentation: http://www.ii.uib.no/~steffpar/softparsmap/quick_start_guide/quick_start_guide.pdf

name: MultiBreak-SV
text_content:
Tool Name: MultiBreak-SV
Description: Software for structural variation analysis from next-generation paired end data, third-generation long read data, or data from a combination of sequencing platforms.
Functions: Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA structural variation, Sequencing, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.brown.edu/projects/multibreaksv/
Documentation: https://github.com/raphael-group/multibreak-sv/blob/master/README.md

name: mRNA optimiser
text_content:
Tool Name: mRNA optimiser
Description: Tool that redesigns a gene messenger RNA to optimise its secondary structure, without affecting the polypeptide sequence. The tool can either maximize or minimize the molecule minimum free energy (MFE), thus resulting in decreased or increased secondary structure strength.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.ua.pt/software/mrna-optimiser/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.ua.pt/software/mrna-optimiser/

name: NanoTiler
text_content:
Tool Name: NanoTiler
Description: Java application for the design of RNA nanostructures. Among other things, it can accomplish the following: 1) Detection, extraction and annotation of RNA structural elements, 2) Use of RNA building blocks for assemblying larger structures, 3) Combinatorial search of building blocks 4) Optimization of building block positions 5) Topology classification 6) Sequence Optimization (i.e. sequence design for self-assembly into the given topology).
Functions: Optimisation and refinement, Prediction and recognition, Sequence assembly
Topics: RNA, Structure analysis
Homepage: https://binkley2.ncifcrf.gov/users/bshapiro/software.html
Documentation: https://binkley2.ncifcrf.gov/users/bshapiro/software.html

name: RVFam
text_content:
Tool Name: RVFam
Description: This package provides functions to perform single SNP association analyses and gene-based tests for continuous, binary and survival traits against sequencing data (e.g. exome chip) using family data.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, SNP detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RVFam/
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RVFam/RVFam.pdf

name: RSEQtools
text_content:
Tool Name: RSEQtools
Description: The tool includes a format specification for RNA-Seq data that provides confidentially-aware; data summaries as well as several tools for performing common analyses: expression measurements (e.g. RPKMs), creation of signal tracks, segmentation, annotation manipulations, etc.
Functions: RNA-Seq quantification
Topics: RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://rseqtools.gersteinlab.org/
Documentation: http://info.gersteinlab.org/RSEQtools

name: Repeatoire
text_content:
Tool Name: Repeatoire
Description: A software on a hybrid data set of real genomic DNA with simulated interspersed repeats.
Functions: Recombination detection
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://wwwabi.snv.jussieu.fr/public/Repeatoire/
Documentation: http://wwwabi.snv.jussieu.fr/public/Repeatoire/

name: XSTK
text_content:
Tool Name: XSTK
Description: Suite of C and C++ libraries and command-line programs for DNA sequence analysis.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.phyloware.com/Phyloware/XSTK.html
Documentation: http://www.phyloware.com/Phyloware/XSTK.html

name: MIfold
text_content:
Tool Name: MIfold
Description: Matlab toolbox that uses mutual information and related measures to infer and display secondary structures (including pseudoknots). Given a sequence alignment It computes and displays the mutual and sequence information of the alignment. MIfold also uses a dynamic programming algorithm to predict the secondary structure with maximal total mutual information.
Functions: RNA structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.uea.ac.uk/computing/mifold
Documentation: http://www.uea.ac.uk/documents/429378/432070/MIfold%2Btutorial.pdf/03f3dac7-8a59-41ba-98cb-c50dd2ea5116

name: SRinversion
text_content:
Tool Name: SRinversion
Description: A framework to analyze poorly mapped or unmapped reads by splitting and re-aligning them for the purpose of inversion detection.
Functions: DNA mapping, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://paed.hku.hk/genome/software/SRinversion/index.html
Documentation: http://paed.hku.hk/genome/software/SRinversion/manual.html

name: SeqWare
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqWare
Description: Portable software infrastructure designed to analyze massive genomics datasets produced by contemporary and emerging technologies, in particular Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) platforms.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://seqware.io/
Documentation: https://github.com/SeqWare/seqware/blob/master/LICENSE.txt

name: BATS
text_content:
Tool Name: BATS
Description: It consists of a collection of libraries that can be used to run basic sequence analysis tasks. Routines for global alignment (LCS from Fragments, Edit Distance with Gaps), local alignment (approximata string matching with K mismateches or differences), and statistical analysis (Filter, Z-Score and Model Generation ) are included.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.math.unipa.it/~raffaele/BATS/index.html
Documentation: http://www.math.unipa.it/~raffaele/BATS/download/guide/BATS_User_Guide.pdf

name: hierGWAS
text_content:
Tool Name: hierGWAS
Description: Testing individual SNPs, as well as arbitrarily large groups of SNPs in GWA studies, using a joint model of all SNPs. The method controls the FWER, and provides an automatic, data-driven refinement of the SNP clusters to smaller groups or single markers.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Genetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/hierGWAS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/hierGWAS.html

name: Colib read
text_content:
Tool Name: Colib read
Description: A project and collection of tools for analyzing and comparing next generation sequencing data without the need to first assemble the genome.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Optimisation and refinement, Sequence feature detection, Sequence similarity search
Topics: Bioinformatics, Genetic variation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://colibread.inria.fr/
Documentation:

name: HGVbase
text_content:
Tool Name: HGVbase
Description: Attempt to summarize all known sequence variations in the human genome, to facilitate research into how genotypes affect common diseases, drug responses, and other complex phenotypes.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Genotyping, Haplotype mapping, Query and retrieval, SNP detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Genotype and phenotype, Human biology, Pathology
Homepage: http://www.hgvbaseg2p.org/index
Documentation: https://help.gwascentral.org/about/

name: TaxMan
text_content:
Tool Name: TaxMan
Description: Trims rRNA reference sequences based on user-selected primer pairs and returns an assessment of the primer specificity by taxa.
Functions: PCR primer design, Primer and probe design, Primer removal, Sequence trimming, Taxonomic classification
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/taxmanwww/
Documentation: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/taxmanwww/info.php

name: CD-Search
text_content:
Tool Name: CD-Search
Description: Allows the user to search the Conserved Domain Database (CDD) for conserved structural and functional domains in a sequence of interest; links to 3-D structures where applicable.
Functions: Pairwise sequence alignment, Protein domain recognition, Protein feature detection, Protein fold recognition, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Mapping, Protein folds and structural domains, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Structure/cdd/wrpsb.cgi
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Structure/cdd/cdd_help.shtml

name: COLORADO-3D
text_content:
Tool Name: COLORADO-3D
Description: Allows you to color your protein structures to indicate the presence of potential errors in protein structure (detected by ANOLEA, PROSAII, PROVE or VERIFY3D), buried residues, and sequence conservation. The server returns a PDB-formatted file which can be displayed in RASMOL.
Functions: Protein model validation, Protein modelling, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structural motif recognition, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Structural biology, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://asia.genesilico.pl/colorado3d/
Documentation: http://asia.genesilico.pl/colorado3d/help.html

name: CRASP
text_content:
Tool Name: CRASP
Description: Takes multiple alignments of amino acid sequences as input, and detects coordinated residue substitutions. These substitutions may suggest dependent evolution of functionally related pairs of amino acids.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Sequence alignment analysis (site correlation)
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Small molecules
Homepage: http://wwwmgs.bionet.nsc.ru/mgs/programs/crasp/
Documentation: http://wwwmgs.bionet.nsc.ru/mgs/programs/crasp/texts/index.html

name: ENA sequence search
text_content:
Tool Name: ENA sequence search
Description: Sequence similarity search to retrieve sequence and associated records from ENA.
Functions: Sequence similarity search
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/data/sequence/search
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: Probcons WS (jabaws)
text_content:
Tool Name: Probcons WS (jabaws)
Description: Tool for progressive protein multiple sequence alignment based on probabilistic consistency.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/man_about.html

name: Jpred WS (jabaws)
text_content:
Tool Name: Jpred WS (jabaws)
Description: The Jnet algorithm provides a three-state (α-helix, β-strand and coil) prediction of secondary structure. Given either a single protein sequence or a multiple sequence alignment, this tool derives alignment profiles from which predictions of secondary structure and solvent accessibility are made.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/man_about.html

name: IUPred WS (jabaws)
text_content:
Tool Name: IUPred WS (jabaws)
Description: Recognizes unstructured/disordered regions from the amino acid sequence based on the estimated pairwise energy content.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/man_about.html

name: GlobPlot WS (jabaws)
text_content:
Tool Name: GlobPlot WS (jabaws)
Description: Allows the user to plot the tendency within the query protein for order/globularity and disorder.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/man_about.html

name: Disembl WS (jabaws)
text_content:
Tool Name: Disembl WS (jabaws)
Description: Computational tool for prediction of disordered/unstructured regions within a protein sequence.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/man_about.html

name: Jronn WS (jabaws)
text_content:
Tool Name: Jronn WS (jabaws)
Description: Predict whether a protein is disordered, given its amino acid sequence.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/man_about.html

name: GLprobs WS (jabaws)
text_content:
Tool Name: GLprobs WS (jabaws)
Description: Simple and effective approach to improve the accuracy of multiple sequence alignment.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/man_about.html

name: CLARK
text_content:
Tool Name: CLARK
Description: Classification method based on a supervised sequence classification using discriminative k-mers.
Functions: Taxonomic classification
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://clark.cs.ucr.edu/
Documentation: http://clark.cs.ucr.edu

name: UniProt Align
text_content:
Tool Name: UniProt Align
Description: Multiple sequence alignment.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.uniprot.org/align
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: GenoCAD
text_content:
Tool Name: GenoCAD
Description: Web-based application for designing protein expression vectors, artificial gene networks and other genetic constructs composed of multiple functional blocks. Users can download the designed sequence for synthesis or further analysis. Users can also create personal accounts and thus can customize their workspace.
Functions: Genetic mapping, Sequence assembly
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.genocad.org
Documentation:

name: Geneious
text_content:
Tool Name: Geneious
Description: Search, organize and analyze genomic and protein information of any size via desktop program that provides publication ready images to enhance the impact of your research.
Functions: Community profiling, Genome visualisation, Read mapping, Sequence alignment, Sequence assembly, Sequence assembly validation, Sequence motif discovery, Variant calling, Visualisation
Topics: DNA structural variation, Epigenomics, Genomics, Metagenomics, Phylogenetics, Population genetics, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.geneious.com
Documentation: https://www.geneious.com/tutorials/

name: GeneTalk
text_content:
Tool Name: GeneTalk
Description: Web-based platform, that can filter, reduce and prioritize human sequence variants from NGS data and assist in the interpretation of personal variants in clinical context.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequence contamination filtering, Variant calling, Variant classification, Visualisation
Topics: DNA structural variation
Homepage: http://www.gene-talk.de
Documentation: http://www.gene-talk.de/docs

name: PALMapper
text_content:
Tool Name: PALMapper
Description: A tool for aligning RNA-Seq reads. It is designed to compute both unspliced and spliced alignments.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis, Read mapping, Sequence alignment, Statistical calculation
Topics: Mapping, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.fml.tuebingen.mpg.de/raetsch/suppl/palmapper
Documentation: http://www.raetschlab.org/suppl/palmapper/tutorial

name: Phusion
text_content:
Tool Name: Phusion
Description: Phusion is a software package for assembling genome sequences from whole genome shotgun(WGS) reads.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/tools/phusion
Documentation:

name: PRince
text_content:
Tool Name: PRince
Description: Web server which analyzes the structural features and physicochemical properties of the protein-RNA interface.
Functions: Protein interaction analysis, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein interactions, Proteins, RNA
Homepage: http://www.facweb.iitkgp.ernet.in/~rbahadur/prince/home.html
Documentation: http://www.facweb.iitkgp.ernet.in/~rbahadur/prince/introduction.html

name: IDT SciTools
text_content:
Tool Name: IDT SciTools
Description: Suite of online tools for the analysis and design of DNA and RNA oligomers. Tools include those for selection of PCR primers, antisense oligonucleotides, or sequences for RNA interference, as well as tools for calculation of secondary structures.
Functions: PCR primer design, Primer and probe design, RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, Structure visualisation
Topics: DNA, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Probes and primers, RNA
Homepage: http://www.idtdna.com/SciTools/SciTools.aspx
Documentation: https://eu.idtdna.com/pages/tools

name: Sequence Harmony
text_content:
Tool Name: Sequence Harmony
Description: Detects subfamily specific functional sites from a multiple sequence alignment by scoring compositional differences between given subfamily groupings.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/seqharmwww/
Documentation: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/seqharmwww/

name: PISCES
text_content:
Tool Name: PISCES
Description: Allows the user to weed out sequences from a set in order to obtain a subset of relatively high PDB structure quality and/or mutual sequence identity.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein folds and structural domains, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://dunbrack.fccc.edu/pisces/
Documentation: http://dunbrack.fccc.edu/pisces/

name: CorGen
text_content:
Tool Name: CorGen
Description: Measures long-range correlations in DNA sequences and can generate random sequences with the same (or user-specified) correlation and composition parameters.
Functions: Random sequence generation, Sequence alignment analysis (site correlation), Sequence composition calculation, Sequence generation
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequencing
Homepage: http://corgen.molgen.mpg.de
Documentation: http://corgen.molgen.mpg.de/

name: FOLD-RATE
text_content:
Tool Name: FOLD-RATE
Description: Predict the folding rates of proteins from their amino acid sequences.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Protein fold recognition, Protein folding analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein binding sites, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.iitm.ac.in/bioinfo/fold-rate/
Documentation: http://www.iitm.ac.in/bioinfo/fold-rate/

name: pknotsRG
text_content:
Tool Name: pknotsRG
Description: Server for single sequence RNA secondary structure prediction including pseudoknots, source code, binary executable, and web service available.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure visualisation
Topics: Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein secondary structure, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bibiserv.techfak.uni-bielefeld.de/pknotsrg/
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/pknotsrg/

name: DOUTfinder
text_content:
Tool Name: DOUTfinder
Description: Tool for facilitating protein domain detection among remotely related protein sequences.
Functions: Protein domain recognition, Protein feature detection, Protein fold recognition
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://mendel.imp.ac.at/dout/
Documentation: http://mendel.imp.ac.at/dout/

name: HyPe
text_content:
Tool Name: HyPe
Description: Helps in the identification and classification of novel peptidoglycan hydrolases from complete genomic or metagenomic ORFs.
Functions: Protein identification, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Enzymes, Microbiology, Pharmacology, Proteins
Homepage: http://metabiosys.iiserb.ac.in/hype/
Documentation: http://metabiosys.iiserb.ac.in/hype/algorithm.php

name: pSuc-Lys
text_content:
Tool Name: pSuc-Lys
Description: This web-server is used to predict the lysine succinylation in protein.
Functions: Post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/pSuc-Lys
Documentation: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/pSuc-Lys/pSucLys_readme.html

name: HattCI
text_content:
Tool Name: HattCI
Description: C-program for the identification of attC sites in any type of DNA data. It uses a hidden Markov model (HMM) to describe each part of the attC site in a probabilistic manner.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.math.chalmers.se/HattCI
Documentation: https://github.com/maribuon/HattCI/blob/master/README.md

name: ACG
text_content:
Tool Name: ACG
Description: The Ancestral Recombination Graph tool is a graphical desktop application that allows genetics researchers to infer properties of a population based on genetic sequences sampled from it.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Population genetics, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://arup.utah.edu/acg/
Documentation: http://arup.utah.edu/ACG/tutorial.html

name: H-BloX
text_content:
Tool Name: H-BloX
Description: Web-based JavaScript application that allows the calculation and visualization of Shannon information content or relative entropy (Kullback-Leibler ‘distance’) within sequence alignment blocks. The application was designed for use in both teaching and research. Amino acid, nucleic acid sequences, or any other type of aligned chemical structures may serve as the input.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Chemical biology, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://gecco.org.chemie.uni-frankfurt.de/h-blox/hblox.html
Documentation: http://gecco.org.chemie.uni-frankfurt.de/h-blox/help.html

name: JaDis
text_content:
Tool Name: JaDis
Description: Program for computing distances between nucleic acid sequences. It allows specific comparison of coding sequences, of non-coding sequences, or of coding and non-coding sequences.
Functions: Comparison
Topics: Genetics, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://wwwabi.snv.jussieu.fr/public/Jadis/
Documentation: http://wwwabi.snv.jussieu.fr/public/Jadis/

name: PredHydroxy
text_content:
Tool Name: PredHydroxy
Description: Web service which is constructed to predict the proline and lysine hydroxylation sites based on position weight amino acids composition, 8 high-quality amino acid indices and support vector machine.
Functions: Post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein modifications, Protein sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/PredHydroxy.aspx
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/PredHydroxy.aspx

name: ProQ2
text_content:
Tool Name: ProQ2
Description: Neural network based predictor that based on a number of structural features predicts the quality of a protein model. It is optimized to find correct models in contrast to other methods which are optimized to find native structures.
Functions: Protein property calculation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Protein properties, Proteins
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ifm.liu.se/ProQ2/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ifm.liu.se/ProQ2/

name: PTRcombiner
text_content:
Tool Name: PTRcombiner
Description: Tool for the study of the combinatorial nature of post-transcriptional trans-factors. It allows the identification of clusters of trans-factors (RBPs and miRNAs) from interaction maps and it performs the biological characterization of identified clusters giving information about the overlap among the target genes, the GO enrichments and similarity among GO terms.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Post-translation modification site prediction
Topics: Gene expression, Protein modifications, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://disi.unitn.it/~passerini/software/PTRcombiner/
Documentation: http://disi.unitn.it/~passerini/software/PTRcombiner/

name: Bio-Tradis
text_content:
Tool Name: Bio-Tradis
Description: This software contains a set of tools to analyse the output from Transposon Directed Insertion Sequencing (TraDIS)  analyses.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Mobile genetic elements, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/sanger-pathogens/Bio-Tradis
Documentation: https://github.com/sanger-pathogens/Bio-Tradis

name: RDNAanalyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: RDNAanalyzer
Description: This is an innovative computer based tool designed for DNA secondary structure prediction and sequence analysis. It can randomly generate the DNA sequence or the user can upload the sequences of their own interest in RAW format.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.cemb.edu.pk/sw.html
Documentation: http://www.cemb.edu.pk/sw.html

name: PyPDB
text_content:
Tool Name: PyPDB
