Description: Python 3 toolkit for performing searches with the RCSB Protein Data Bank (PDB) using its XML-based API.
Functions: Protein structure analysis
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/williamgilpin/pypdb
Documentation: https://github.com/williamgilpin/pypdb/blob/master/README.md

name: BEETL
text_content:
Tool Name: BEETL
Description: Suite of applications for building and manipulating the Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) of collections of DNA sequences. The algorithms employed are intended to scale to collections of sequences containing one billion entries or more.
Functions: Genome indexing
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://beetl.github.io/BEETL/
Documentation: http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/BEETL/

name: hot_scan
text_content:
Tool Name: hot_scan
Description: Free software to detect genomic regions unusually rich (hotspot) in a given pattern via scan statistics.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://github.com/itojal/hot_scan
Documentation: https://github.com/itojal/hot_scan/blob/master/hot_scan_man.pdf

name: BIMA
text_content:
Tool Name: BIMA
Description: Mapping/alignment customized for mate-pair library next generation sequencing.
Functions: Mapping
Topics: Mapping, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformaticstools.mayo.edu/research/bima/
Documentation: http://bioinformaticstools.mayo.edu/research/bima/

name: Laj
text_content:
Tool Name: Laj
Description: Tool for viewing and manipulating the output from pairwise alignment programs such as blastz. It can display interactive dotplot, pip, and text representations of the alignments, a diagram showing the locations of exons and repeats, and annotation links to other web sites containing additional information about particular regions.
Functions: Data handling, Pairwise sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://globin.cse.psu.edu/dist/laj/
Documentation: http://globin.cse.psu.edu/dist/laj/

name: QVZ
text_content:
Tool Name: QVZ
Description: Lossy compression algorithm for storing quality values associated with DNA sequencing.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: DNA, Data quality management, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/mikelhernaez/qvz
Documentation: https://github.com/mikelhernaez/qvz/blob/master/README.md

name: laSV
text_content:
Tool Name: laSV
Description: Software that employs a local de novo assembly based approach to detect genomic structural variations from whole-genome high-throughput sequencing datasets.
Functions: Sequence assembly, Structure analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Oncology, Population genomics, Structural genomics
Homepage: https://zlab.umassmed.edu/~zhuangj/laSV/
Documentation: https://github.com/JialiUMassWengLab/laSV/blob/master/Manual

name: TOUCAN 2
text_content:
Tool Name: TOUCAN 2
Description: Regulatory sequence analysis workbench for Metazoan sequences, directly linked with the Ensembl database and implementing SOAP clients for diverse alignment and motif detection algorithms.
Functions: Indel detection, Recombination detection, Sequence feature detection, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.esat.kuleuven.ac.be/~saerts/software/toucan.php
Documentation:

name: Ensembl Mouse Genome Browser
text_content:
Tool Name: Ensembl Mouse Genome Browser
Description: Analysis of finished and draft mouse genomic clone sequences.
Functions: Genome annotation, Genome visualisation, Sequence analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Genomics, Human biology, Sequence analysis, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://www.ensembl.org/Mus_musculus/index.html
Documentation: http://www.ensembl.org/info/index.html

name: DNABindProt
text_content:
Tool Name: DNABindProt
Description: Designed to predict DNA-binding residues, based on the fluctuations of residues in high-frequency modes by the Gaussian network model.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, DNA binding sites, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.prc.boun.edu.tr/appserv/prc/dnabindprot/
Documentation: http://www.prc.boun.edu.tr/appserv/prc/dnabindprot/

name: RNA Analyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: RNA Analyzer
Description: Searches for known structures and identifies RNA motifs in your input sequence.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA structure prediction, Sequence motif recognition, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://rnaanalyzer.bioapps.biozentrum.uni-wuerzburg.de/
Documentation: http://rnaanalyzer.bioapps.biozentrum.uni-wuerzburg.de/SEQUENCEinfo.html

name: MAVID
text_content:
Tool Name: MAVID
Description: Performs multiple sequence alignments for large sequences, constructs phylogenetic trees and displays VISTA plots of conserved regions.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Phylogenetic tree generation, Sequence alignment, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://pachterlab.github.io/software.html
Documentation:

name: DIALIGN
text_content:
Tool Name: DIALIGN
Description: Multiple alignment program which assembles a global sequence alignment from gap-free local pairwise alignments. This method could be especially useful when comparing large sequences that have only local similarities.
Functions: Global alignment, Local alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://dialign.gobics.de
Documentation: http://dialign.gobics.de/anchor/manual

name: LowComplexity
text_content:
Tool Name: LowComplexity
Description: Tool that searches for low complexity regions of DNA or protein sequences. Using it you can search long sequences (chromosomes, genomes) or a set of aligned sequences. This resource also contains links to other algorithms for evaluating the complexity of sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment validation, Sequence complexity calculation
Topics: DNA, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequencing
Homepage: http://wwwmgs.bionet.nsc.ru/mgs/programs/low_complexity/
Documentation: http://wwwmgs.bionet.nsc.ru/mgs/programs/lzcomposer/complete.html

name: Eukaryotic linear motif resource (ELM)
text_content:
Tool Name: Eukaryotic linear motif resource (ELM)
Description: Tool for predicting eukaryotic protein functional sites that report domains, motifs, and sequence patterns based on the input sequence.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein fold recognition, Protein function prediction, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Model organisms, Protein binding sites, Protein sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://elm.eu.org/
Documentation: http://elm.eu.org/infos/about.html

name: Pscan
text_content:
Tool Name: Pscan
Description: Software tool that scans a set of sequences (e.g. promoters) from co-regulated or co-expressed genes with motifs describing the binding specificity of known transcription factors and assesses which motifs are significantly over- or under-represented, providing thus hints on which transcription factors could be common regulators of the genes studied, together with the location of their candidate binding sites in the sequences
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.beaconlab.it/pscan
Documentation: http://159.149.160.88/pscan/help.html

name: CleaveLand4
text_content:
Tool Name: CleaveLand4
Description: A pipeline for using degradome data to find cleaved small RNA targets.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA
Homepage: http://sites.psu.edu/axtell/software/cleaveland4/
Documentation: https://psu.app.box.com/v/axtelldata/file/99708412059

name: AmiGO 2
text_content:
Tool Name: AmiGO 2
Description: The GO Consortium GO browser and search engine.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Ontology visualisation, Query and retrieval, Sequence comparison
Topics: Ontology and terminology
Homepage: http://amigo.geneontology.org/amigo
Documentation: http://wiki.geneontology.org/index.php/AmiGO_2_Manual:_Home

name: PLAAC
text_content:
Tool Name: PLAAC

name: ARBitrator

Documentation: https://www.jzehrlab.com/

name: KAnalyze

Documentation: http://vannberg.biology.gatech.edu:8080/VannbergLab/kanalyze.html

name: protea
text_content:
Tool Name: protea
Description: Software devoted to protein-coding sequences identification. The input is a set of DNA sequences that need not to be aligned. The method takes advantage of the specific substitution pattern of coding sequences together with the consistency of reading frames.
Functions: Gene prediction
Topics: DNA, Gene transcripts, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/protea/index.php
Documentation: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/protea/help.php

name: Segtools
text_content:
Tool Name: Segtools

Documentation: https://hoffmanlab.org/proj/segtools/

name: Hansa
text_content:
Tool Name: Hansa

Topics: DNA mutation, Genetics, Pathology

Documentation: http://hansa.cdfd.org.in:8080/index.php?target=method

name: rRNASelector
text_content:
Tool Name: rRNASelector

Documentation: http://hpc.ilri.cgiar.org/using-the-cluster

name: ProbCons
text_content:
Tool Name: ProbCons

Documentation: http://probcons.stanford.edu/about.html

name: PRANK
text_content:
Tool Name: PRANK
Description: Probabilistic multiple alignment program for DNA, codon and amino-acid sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence comparison
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://wasabiapp.org/software/prank/
Documentation: http://wasabiapp.org/about/

name: PAML
text_content:
Tool Name: PAML
Description: Package of programs for phylogenetic analyses of DNA or protein sequences using maximum likelihood.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis, Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods), Probabilistic sequence generation

Documentation: http://abacus.gene.ucl.ac.uk/software/paml.html#introduction

name: iAMP-2L
text_content:
Tool Name: iAMP-2L
Description: This web-server is a two-level multi-label predictor. It can be used to identify an uncharacterized peptide as antimicrobial peptide (AMP) or non-AMP according to its sequences information alone.

Homepage: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/iAMP-2L
Documentation: http://www.jci-bioinfo.cn/iAMP/ReadMe.htm

name: PhoScan
text_content:
Tool Name: PhoScan
Description: PhoScan is a software of prediction of kinase-specific phosphorylation sites with sequence features by a log-odds ratio approach.

Documentation: http://bioinfo.au.tsinghua.edu.cn/phoscan/

name: JProfileGrid
text_content:
Tool Name: JProfileGrid
Description: Java-based multiple sequence alignment tool that generates ProfileGrids for analysis and export. ProfileGrids are a new paradigm for visualizing and analyzing MSAs in a concise representation. For a protein sequence, a ProfileGrid matrix contains positional amino acid counts highlighted according to the frequency of the characters in the alignment.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.profilegrid.org/
Documentation: http://www.profilegrid.org/examples.shtml

name: PRaptorX Property
text_content:
Tool Name: PRaptorX Property
Description: Web server predicting structure property of a protein sequence without using any template information.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://raptorx2.uchicago.edu/StructurePropertyPred/predict/
Documentation: http://raptorx2.uchicago.edu/StructurePropertyPred/documentation/

name: Allosite
text_content:
Tool Name: Allosite
Description: Tool for the prediction of allosteric sites in proteins.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://mdl.shsmu.edu.cn/AST/
Documentation: http://mdl.shsmu.edu.cn/AST/module/help/help.jsp

name: GAT
text_content:
Tool Name: GAT
Description: This tool tests for association between intervals in a genome analysis context.
Functions: Genome feature comparison, Modelling and simulation
Topics: Genomics, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/AndreasHeger/gat
Documentation: http://gat.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: RAPIDR
text_content:
Tool Name: RAPIDR
Description: R package to perform non-invasive fetal testing for aneuploidies using sequencing count data from cell-free DNA.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RAPIDR/index.html
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/RAPIDR/RAPIDR.pdf

name: BND
text_content:
Tool Name: BND
Description: New balanced network deconvolution algorithm to identify optimized dependency matrix without limit on the eigenvalue range in the applied network systems. The algorithm was used to filter contact predictions of five widely-used co-evolution methods.
Functions: Deisotoping, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/BND/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/BND/

name: HAlign
text_content:
Tool Name: HAlign
Description: Package of multi-platform Java software tools, which aimed at large scale multiple similar DNA/RNA sequence alignment. It employs center star multiple sequence alignment strategy.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://datamining.xmu.edu.cn/software/halign/
Documentation: http://datamining.xmu.edu.cn/software/halign/

name: Phylo
text_content:
Tool Name: Phylo
Description: Human-based computing framework applying “crowd sourcing” techniques to solve the Multiple Sequence Alignment (MSA) problem. The key idea is to convert the MSA problem into a casual game that can be played by ordinary web users with a minimal prior knowledge of the biological context.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acids, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://phylo.cs.mcgill.ca/
Documentation: http://phylo.cs.mcgill.ca/#!/EN/About

name: 3DRobot
text_content:
Tool Name: 3DRobot
Description: 3DRobot is a program devoted for automated generation of diverse and well-packed protein structure decoys.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/3DRobot
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/3DRobot/about.html

name: BPBAac
text_content:
Tool Name: BPBAac
Description: A classifier, was developed and trained using Support Vector Machine (SVM) based on the Aac feature extracted using a Bi-profile Bayes model.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Small molecules, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://biocomputer.bio.cuhk.edu.hk/T3DB/BPBAac.php
Documentation: https://biocomputer.bio.cuhk.edu.hk/T3DB/BPBAac.php

name: ProTeus
text_content:
Tool Name: ProTeus
Description: An archive of functional signatures in protein termini.
Functions: Protein function analysis, Protein function comparison, Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Function analysis, Protein binding sites, Protein targeting and localisation, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://www.proteus.cs.huji.ac.il/index.php
Documentation: http://www.proteus.cs.huji.ac.il/glossary.php

name: FunFOLD2
text_content:
Tool Name: FunFOLD2
Description: Web server that integrates protein-ligand binding and quality assessment protocols for the prediction of protein function from sequence via structure.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein function prediction, Protein structure prediction, Protein-ligand docking
Topics: Function analysis, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Protein binding sites, Protein interactions, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.reading.ac.uk/bioinf/FunFOLD/FunFOLD_form_2_0.html
Documentation: http://www.reading.ac.uk/bioinf/FunFOLD/FunFOLD_help_2_0.html

name: RF-Cloning.org
text_content:
Tool Name: RF-Cloning.org
Description: Automates the primer design process of restriction-free clones, which are a PCR based technology that allows the insertion of any sequence into any plasmid at any location.
Functions: Data handling, PCR primer design, Plasmid map drawing, Primer and probe design
Topics: DNA binding sites, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.rf-cloning.org
Documentation:

name: SeqSphere+
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqSphere+
Description: This software is designed for distributed work-groups (client/server model) and allows automatic processing, assembling and analyzing NGS (e.g., Illumina, Ion Torrent or PacBio) and Sanger capillary-electrophoresis sequence data. It provides with an easy and automated microbial analysis; enabling your lab to employ whole genome microbial typing (cgMLST or MLST+), traditional MLST or eMLST/rMLST sequencing projects.
Functions: Read mapping, Sequence assembly, Variant calling
Topics: Comparative genomics, Microbiology
Homepage: http://www.ridom.de/seqsphere/
Documentation: http://www.ridom.de/seqsphere/tutorials/index.shtml

name: RBPmotif
text_content:
Tool Name: RBPmotif
Description: Web server for the discovery of sequence and structure preferences of RNA-binding proteins. Input is set of sequences known to be bound and unbound by the RNA-binding protein of interest.
Functions: Ab initio structure prediction, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.rnamotif.org
Documentation: http://rnamotif.org/help.html

name: PINTS
text_content:
Tool Name: PINTS
Description: Find reoccuring three-dimensional patterns of amino acids. These amino-acids are close in space but not necessarily close or co-linear in sequence, for example the serine-protease catalytic triad. Unlike other tools, PINTS does not aim to find proteins adopting a similar fold.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.russelllab.org/cgi-bin/tools/pints.pl
Documentation: http://www.russelllab.org/pints/help.shtml

name: LookSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: LookSeq
Description: AJAX-based browser for visualising deep sequencing data.
Functions: Database search, Multiple sample visualisation, Sequence visualisation, Service management
Topics: Data visualisation, Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/tools/lookseq
Documentation: https://github.com/magnusmanske/lookseq

name: SsahaSNP
text_content:
Tool Name: SsahaSNP
Description: A tool for polymorphism detection. It detects homozygous SNPs and indels by aligning shotgun reads to the finished genome sequence.
Functions: Read mapping, SNP detection
Topics: Genetic variation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/tools/ssahasnp
Documentation: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/tools/ssahasnp

name: BAli-Phy
text_content:
Tool Name: BAli-Phy
Description: Markov chain Monte Carlo software for simultaneous Bayesian estimation of alignment and phylogeny (and other parameters). It handles generic Bayesian modeling via probabilistic programming.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Phylogenetic tree generation (from molecular sequences), Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods)
Topics: Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bali-phy.org/
Documentation: http://www.bali-phy.org/docs.php#usersguide

name: FunTree
text_content:
Tool Name: FunTree
Description: Provides a range of data resources to detect the evolution of enzyme function within distant structurally related clusters within domain super families as determined by CATH.

Documentation: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/terms-of-use

name: trackViewer
text_content:
Tool Name: trackViewer
Description: An R package for Visualizing mapped reads along with annotation as track layers for NGS dataset such as ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, miRNA-seq, DNA-seq, SNPs and methylation data.

Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/trackViewer.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/trackViewer.html

name: savR
text_content:
Tool Name: savR
Description: Parse Illumina Sequence Analysis Viewer (SAV) files, access data, and generate QC plots.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/savR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/savR.html

name: sagenhaft
text_content:
Tool Name: sagenhaft
Description: This package implements several functions useful for analysis of gene expression data by sequencing tags as done in SAGE (Serial Analysis of Gene Expressen) data, i.e. extraction of a SAGE library from sequence files, sequence error correction, library comparison. Sequencing error correction is implementing using an Expectation Maximization Algorithm based on a Mixture Model of tag counts.
Functions: Database comparison, Database search
Topics: Gene expression
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/sagenhaft.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/sagenhaft.html

name: tracktables
text_content:
Tool Name: tracktables

Topics: Data visualisation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/tracktables.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/tracktables.html

name: seqTools
text_content:
Tool Name: seqTools

Topics: Sequence analysis

Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seqTools.html

name: REDseq
text_content:
Tool Name: REDseq
Description: The package includes functions to build restriction enzyme cut site (RECS) map, distribute mapped sequences on the map with five different approaches, find enriched/depleted RECSs for a sample, and identify differentially enriched/depleted RECSs between samples.

Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/REDseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/REDseq.html

name: r3Cseq
text_content:
Tool Name: r3Cseq

Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/r3Cseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/r3Cseq.html

name: SeqFIRE
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqFIRE
Description: Web tool for extracting regions of interest from a mulitple sequence alignment. From a multiple sequence alignment, it can search for and extract regions that contain insertions and deletions (indels), and output details of the indels, as well as a binary character matrix of conserved clean indels for use in phylogenetic analysis. It can also extract blocks of conserved columns from a sequence alignment, output for phylogenetic analysis.
Functions: Indel detection, Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogenomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.seqfire.org
Documentation: http://www.seqfire.org/seqfire_help.html

name: SOBA: Sequence Ontology Bioinformatics Analysis
text_content:
Tool Name: SOBA: Sequence Ontology Bioinformatics Analysis
Description: Provides a simple statistical and graphical summary of an annotated genome. To be used by annotators and for genome comparison.
Functions: Genome annotation, Genome comparison, Ontology comparison
Topics: Ontology and terminology, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.sequenceontology.org/cgi-bin/soba.cgi
Documentation:

name: rMAT
text_content:
Tool Name: rMAT
Description: This package is an R version of the package MAT and contains functions to parse and merge Affymetrix BPMAP and CEL tiling array files (using C++ based Fusion SDK and BioConductor package affxparser), normalize tiling arrays using sequence specific models, detect enriched regions from ChIP-chip experiments.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/rMAT.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/rMAT.html

name: Pviz
text_content:
Tool Name: Pviz
Description: This tool adapts the Gviz package for protein sequences and data.
Functions: Sequence annotation, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Pviz.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Pviz.html

name: BAC
text_content:
Tool Name: BAC
Description: This package uses a Bayesian hierarchical model to detect enriched regions from ChIP-chip experiments.
Functions: Enrichment analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, DNA binding sites, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BAC.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BAC.html

name: affyPara
text_content:
Tool Name: affyPara
Description: The package contains parallelized functions for exploratory oligonucleotide array analysis. The package is designed for large numbers of microarray data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Microarray experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/affyPara.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/affyPara.html

name: Exonerate
text_content:
Tool Name: Exonerate
Description: A tool for pairwise sequence alignment. It enables alignment for DNA-DNA and DNA-protein pairs and also gapped and ungapped alignment.

Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs

Documentation: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/about/vertebrate-genomics/software/exonerate-user-guide

name: shinyTANDEM
text_content:
Tool Name: shinyTANDEM

Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/shinyTANDEM.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/shinyTANDEM.html

name: PredyFlexy
text_content:
Tool Name: PredyFlexy

Topics: Protein properties, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.dsimb.inserm.fr/dsimb_tools/predyflexy/
Documentation: http://www.dsimb.inserm.fr/dsimb_tools/predyflexy/example.html

name: MitoGenesisDB
text_content:
Tool Name: MitoGenesisDB
Description: Dynamic of mitochondrial protein formation through global mRNA analyses. Three main parameters confer a global view of mitochondrial biogenesis: (i) time-course of mRNA production in highly synchronized yeast cell cultures, (ii) microarray analyses of mRNA localization that define translation sites and (iii) mRNA transcription rate and stability. It integrates and establishes cross-comparisons between these data.
Functions: Data handling, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Sequence assembly, Text mining
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Microarray experiment, Model organisms, Protein expression
Homepage: http://www.dsimb.inserm.fr/dsimb_tools/mitgene/
Documentation: http://www.dsimb.inserm.fr/dsimb_tools/mitgene/howto.php

name: TSSi
text_content:
Tool Name: TSSi
Description: An R package for Identifying and normalizing transcription start sites in high-throughput sequencing data.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TSSi.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TSSi.html

name: riboSeqR
text_content:
Tool Name: riboSeqR
Description: Plotting functions, frameshift detection and parsing of sequencing data from ribosome profiling experiments.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/riboSeqR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/riboSeqR.html

name: GDAP

Topics: Genomics, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.doe-mbi.ucla.edu/Services/GDAP
Documentation:

name: Lasergene
text_content:
Tool Name: Lasergene

Topics: Genomics, Mapping, Phylogenetics, Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.dnastar.com/t-products-dnastar-lasergene-core.aspx
Documentation: http://www.dnastar.com/t-support-tutorials.aspx

name: SeqMan NGen

Documentation: http://www.dnastar.com/t-support-tutorials.aspx

name: The Autophagy Database
text_content:
Tool Name: The Autophagy Database
Description: Database that provides basic, up-to-date information on relevant literature, and a list of autophagy-related proteins and their homologs. From the database, the user can search for proteins by keywords or sequences to obtain a wealth of data including functional and structural information and find possible functional homologs of proteins whose functions have been demonstrated in other species.
Functions: Database search, Protein feature detection, Protein function analysis, Protein modelling
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.tanpaku.org/autophagy/
Documentation: http://www.tanpaku.org/autophagy/help/help.html

name: snoStrip
text_content:
Tool Name: snoStrip
Description: A free web server for the analysis of small nucleolar RNAs (snoRNAs) in fungi genomes.

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://snostrip.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/index.py
Documentation: http://snostrip.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/documentation.py

name: subSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: subSeq

Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/subSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/subSeq.html

name: ROC
text_content:
Tool Name: ROC
Description: Various functionals of receiver operating characteristic curves.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ROC.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ROC.html

name: MAST
text_content:
Tool Name: MAST
Description: Methods and models for handling zero-inflated single cell assay data.

Topics: Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MAST.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MAST.html

name: Protinfo

Documentation: http://protinfo.compbio.buffalo.edu/

Tool Name: QuasiMotiFinder

name: GHOST
text_content:
Tool Name: GHOST
Description: Software package for global biological network alignment. It computes alignments based on a novel spectral signature for comparing the topological similarity of nodes across networks.

Documentation: https://github.com/Kingsford-Group/ghost2

name: targetSeqView
text_content:
Tool Name: targetSeqView
Description: A probability-based score and visualization method to aid in distinguishing true structural variants from alignment artifacts.
Functions: Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/Eitan177/targetSeqView
Documentation: https://github.com/Eitan177/targetSeqView

name: GPPAT
text_content:
Tool Name: GPPAT
Description: Web server for comparison of linear gap penalties and profile-based variable gap penalties in profile-profile alignments
Functions: Sequence profile alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids
Homepage: http://protein.cau.edu.cn/gppat/
Documentation: http://protein.cau.edu.cn/gppat/about.php

name: CCOMP
text_content:
Tool Name: CCOMP
Description: Complex COMParison, is a simple command-line tool for comparing ligand/receptor complexes. It can also be used for calculating pairwise all-atom RMSD of slightly different protein structures, taking care of missing atoms, sequence inconsistencies, etc.
Functions: Pairwise sequence alignment
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein interactions, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.pirx.com/ccomp/index.shtml
Documentation: http://www.pirx.com/ccomp/index.shtml

name: AutoMatrix
text_content:
Tool Name: AutoMatrix
Description: Matlab script that will calculate an instantaneous rate matrix (and its eigen value decompostion for use in phylip programs) from a series of substitution count matrices calculated for different levels of sequence identity/similarity.
Functions: Calculation
Topics: Applied mathematics, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.uhnresearch.ca/labs/tillier/software.htm#6
Documentation: http://wwwlabs.uhnresearch.ca/tillier/pmb/pmb.pdf

name: pibase
text_content:
Tool Name: pibase
Description: Tool for validating novel Single Nucleotide Variants (SNVs). It utilizes the details in the alignment files in order to identify the reproducible genotypes, hence distinguishing the true variants from artifacts. It can also be used to compare the nucleotide signals in different BAM files.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: Comparative genomics, DNA polymorphism, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://www.ikmb.uni-kiel.de/pibase/
Documentation: http://www.ikmb.uni-kiel.de/pibase/#tutorial

name: QGRS Mapper
text_content:
Tool Name: QGRS Mapper
Description: Quadruplex forming G-Rich Sequences (QGRS) Mapper searches nucleotide sequences for the presence of G-quartet motifs.  QGRS Mapper allows you to view the distribution and composition of QGRS in the context of alternatively spliced isoforms of your gene.
Functions: Quadruplex formation site detection, Sequence merging, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: RNA splicing, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.ramapo.edu/QGRS/index.php
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.ramapo.edu/QGRS/help.php

name: Align-m
text_content:
Tool Name: Align-m
Description: Align-m is an accurate and highly versatile multiple alignment program. It consists of 3 modules, S2P, P2P and P2M (see figure, manual), which can be used separately or consecutively to accomplish several tasks.
Functions: Global alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Genetic variation, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Small molecules
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.vub.ac.be/software/software.html
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.vub.ac.be/download/align_m_manual.pdf

name: MAGIIC-PRO
text_content:
Tool Name: MAGIIC-PRO
Description: MAGIIC-PRO is a tool for detecting patterns in protein sequences.  MAGIIC-PRO takes a protein sequence as input and helps users prepare training data for the pattern mining experiments by using Swiss-Prot annotations or by PSI-BLAST. Multiple resources for analysis of the detected patterns are also presented.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Data mining, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://biominer.bime.ntu.edu.tw/magiicpro/
Documentation:

name: CandiSSR
text_content:
Tool Name: CandiSSR
Description: New pipeline to automatically identify the candidate polymorphic SSRs for a given species or genus based on their assembled sequences.
Functions: Polymorphism detection
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.plantkingdomgdb.com/CandiSSR/index.html
Documentation: http://www.plantkingdomgdb.com/CandiSSR/index.html

name: LFMM
text_content:
Tool Name: LFMM
Description: Unified framework for inferring population genetic structure and gene-environment associations.
Functions: Modelling and simulation, Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: Ecology, Evolutionary biology, Genetic variation, Genetics, Genomics
Homepage: http://membres-timc.imag.fr/Eric.Frichot/lfmm/index.htm
Documentation: http://membres-timc.imag.fr/Olivier.Francois/lfmm/tutorial.htm

name: AmphoraVizu
text_content:
Tool Name: AmphoraVizu
Description: Visualize outputs generated by the metagenomic and genomic analysis tool AMPHORA2 or its webserver implementation AmphoraNet.
Functions: Genome visualisation, Sequence assembly visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Metagenomics, Phylogenomics
Homepage: http://pitgroup.org/amphoravizu/
Documentation: https://pitgroup.org/amphoravizu/

name: RADIS
text_content:
Tool Name: RADIS
Description: Perl pipeline which makes the processing of RAD-seq data easier and allows rapid and automated exploration of parameters/data for phylogenetic inference.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Population genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www1.montpellier.inra.fr/CBGP/software/RADIS/
Documentation: http://www1.montpellier.inra.fr/CBGP/software/RADIS/FAQ.html

name: BaCoCa
text_content:
Tool Name: BaCoCa
Description: BAse COmposition CAlculator is a user-friendly software that combines multiple statistical approaches (like RCFV and C value calculations) to identify biases in aligned sequence data which potentially mislead phylogenetic reconstructions.
Functions: Sequence alignment refinement
Topics: Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://annelida.de/research/bioinformatics/software/index.html
Documentation: http://annelida.de/research/bioinformatics/software/index.html

name: ATGme
text_content:
Tool Name: ATGme
Description: Open-source web-based application which can in a first step identify rare and highly rare codons from most organisms, and secondly gives the user the possibility to optimize the sequence.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Gene expression
Homepage: http://atgme.org/
Documentation: http://atgme.org/

name: Pro-Maya
text_content:
Tool Name: Pro-Maya
Description: Predict the protein stability free energy difference (ΔG), arising from a single-site amino acid substitution compared to the wild-type, denoted as ΔΔG.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://bental.tau.ac.il/ProMaya/
Documentation: http://bental.tau.ac.il/ProMaya/overview.php

name: Phos3D
text_content:
Tool Name: Phos3D
Description: Web server for the prediction of phosphorylation sites (P-sites) in proteins. The approach is based on Support Vector Machines trained on sequence profiles enhanced by information from the spatial context of experimentally identified P-sites.
Functions: Post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein properties, Proteins
Homepage: http://phos3d.mpimp-golm.mpg.de/
Documentation: http://phos3d.mpimp-golm.mpg.de/cgi-bin/index.py?show=help

name: protr
text_content:
Tool Name: protr
Description: Comprehensive R package for generating various numerical representation schemes of proteins and peptides from amino acid sequence.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/protr/index.html
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/protr/protr.pdf

name: piPipes
text_content:
Tool Name: piPipes
Description: Coordinated set of pipelines to analyze piRNA (PIWI-interacting RNAs) and transposon-derived RNAs from a variety of high-throughput sequencing libraries, including small RNA, RNA, degradome or 7-methyl guanosine cap analysis of gene expression (CAGE), chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) and genomic DNA-seq.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, DNA, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene expression, RNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bowhan.github.io/piPipes/
Documentation: https://github.com/bowhan/piPipes/wiki

name: qnr
text_content:
Tool Name: qnr
Description: Python implementation of a method for searching large metagenomic dataset to identify qnr fluoroquinolone antibiotic resistance genes.
Functions: Sequence database search
Topics: DNA, Machine learning, Metabolomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.math.chalmers.se/qnr/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.math.chalmers.se/qnr/

name: Pooling
text_content:
Tool Name: Pooling
Description: Computational framework for next-generation sequencing of heterogeneous viral populations using combinatorial pooling.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequencing, Virology
Homepage: http://alan.cs.gsu.edu/NGS/?q=content/pooling
Documentation: https://github.com/skumsp/Pooling

name: pRESTO
text_content:
Tool Name: pRESTO
Description: Integrated collection of platform-independent Python modules for processing raw reads from high-throughput (next-generation) sequencing of lymphocyte repertoires.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Immunology, Sequencing
Homepage: http://presto.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Documentation: http://presto.readthedocs.io/en/latest/usage.html

name: BioParser
text_content:
Tool Name: BioParser
Description: Perl program for parsing sequence similarity analysis reports.
Functions: Sequence alignment comparison
Topics: Genetics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.dbbm.fiocruz.br/BioParser.html
Documentation: http://www.dbbm.fiocruz.br/BioParser.html

name: Phylo-mLogo
text_content:
Tool Name: Phylo-mLogo
Description: Interactive multiple-logo visualization tool for large-number sequence alignments which allows the user to visualize the global profile of whole multiple sequence alignment and to hierarchically visualize homologous logos of each clade simultaneously.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cg1.iis.sinica.edu.tw/new/phylomlogo/
Documentation: http://cg1.iis.sinica.edu.tw/new/phylomlogo/instructions.php

name: Arioc
text_content:
Tool Name: Arioc
Description: Set of computer programs that carry out the alignment of short DNA sequences to a comparatively large reference sequence or genome.
Functions: DNA mapping, Mapping assembly, Read mapping
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://github.com/RWilton/Arioc
Documentation: https://github.com/RWilton/Arioc/tree/master/v1.01

name: AffyGCQC
text_content:
Tool Name: AffyGCQC
Description: This tool performs an Affymetrix GeneChip Quality Control by implementing a graphical representation of QC metrics recommended by Affymetrix for GeneChip oligonucleotide array technology. Most importantly, it performs extreme studentized deviate statistical tests for the set of arrays being compared in a given experiment, thus providing an objective measure for outlier detection.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Sequencing quality control, Statistical calculation
Topics: Data quality management, Gene expression
Homepage: http://www.transcriptome.ens.fr/AffyGCQC/
Documentation: http://www.genomique.biologie.ens.fr/fr/offres_et_services/prestations

name: BioWord
text_content:
Tool Name: BioWord
Description: Powerful biological sequence editor operating in the most convenient of places: inside your usual word-processor (Microsoft Word 2007 and 2010). Easy to install and embedded into a Microsoft Office Ribbon, BioWord allows instant access to most sequence manipulation and editing needs, such as reverse-complementing, translating or FASTA formatting, and features a full suite of sequence search methods, pair-wise alignment and motif discovery.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence motif discovery
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://erilllab.umbc.edu/bioword-2/
Documentation: http://www.biomedcentral.com/content/pdf/1471-2105-13-124.pdf

name: kdetrees
text_content:
Tool Name: kdetrees
Description: Non-parametric method for estimating distributions of phylogenetic trees, with the goal of identifying trees that are significantly different from the rest of the trees in the sample.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/grady/kdetrees
Documentation: https://github.com/grady/kdetrees/tree/master/man

name: hapLOHseq
text_content:
Tool Name: hapLOHseq
Description: Identifies regions of allelic imbalance (AI) in sequencing data obtained from impure samples where AI events exist in a potentially low proportion of cells in the sample.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/site/integrativecancergenomics/software/haplohseq
Documentation: https://sites.google.com/site/integrativecancergenomics/software/haplohseq

name: ANGLE
text_content:
Tool Name: ANGLE
Description: Program for predicting coding sequences from low quality cDNA. To achieve error-tolerant prediction, it uses a machine-learning approach, which makes better expression of coding sequence maximizing the use of limited information from input sequences.
Functions: Coding region prediction
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cbrc3.cbrc.jp/~shimizu/index.php?Kana%20Shimizu%27s%20web%20site#t11a427e
Documentation: http://cbrc3.cbrc.jp/~shimizu/index.php?Kana%20Shimizu%27s%20web%20site#zddbe95d

name: Phy-Mer
text_content:
Tool Name: Phy-Mer
Description: Novel alignment-free and reference-independent mitochondrial haplogroup classifier.
Functions: Alignment
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/danielnavarrogomez/phy-mer
Documentation: https://github.com/MEEIBioinformaticsCenter/phy-mer/blob/master/README.md

name: HomeoSplitter
text_content:
Tool Name: HomeoSplitter
Description: Fast and effective solution to disentangle homologous sequences based on a maximum likelihood optimization.
Functions: Sequence classification
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Genetics, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://bioweb.supagro.inra.fr/homeoSplitter/
Documentation: http://bioweb.supagro.inra.fr/homeoSplitter/index.php?menu=tutorial

name: HomSI
text_content:
Tool Name: HomSI
Description: Homozygous stretch identifier from next-generation sequencing data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.igbam.bilgem.tubitak.gov.tr/softwares/HomSI/
Documentation: http://www.igbam.bilgem.tubitak.gov.tr/en/softwares/HomSI/tutorial.html

name: CapR
text_content:
Tool Name: CapR
Description: The software calculates probabilities that each RNA base position is located within each secondary structural context for long RNA sequences.

Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/site/fukunagatsu/software/capr
Documentation: https://github.com/fukunagatsu/CapR

name: QC-Chain
text_content:
Tool Name: QC-Chain
Description: Package of quality control tools for next generation sequencing (NGS) data, consisting of both raw reads quality evaluation and de novo contamination screening, which could identify all possible contamination sequences.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://computationalbioenergy.org/qc-chain.html
Documentation: http://computationalbioenergy.org/qc-chain.html

name: ancGWAS
text_content:
Tool Name: ancGWAS
Description: Algebraic graph-based method to identify the most significant sub-network underlying ethnic difference in complex diseases risk in a recently admixed population.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Pathway or network analysis
Topics: Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Population genetics
Homepage: http://web.cbio.uct.ac.za/~emile/software.html
Documentation: http://web.cbio.uct.ac.za/~emile/software.html

name: PromoSer
text_content:
Tool Name: PromoSer
Description: Server which aims to extract proximal promoter sequences from mammalian genomes.  Does so by mapping mRNA and EST sequences and tracking overlapping alignments to find the transcription start site.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Mapping, Promoter prediction, Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Mapping, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://biowulf.bu.edu/zlab/PromoSer/
Documentation:

name: Blocks WWW Server
text_content:
Tool Name: Blocks WWW Server
Description: The Blocks WWW server provides tools to search DNA and protein queries against the Blocks database of multiple alignments, which represent conserved protein regions.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein feature detection, Query and retrieval, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: DNA, Gene and protein families, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://blocks.fhcrc.org/
Documentation: http://blocks.fhcrc.org/blocks/help/tutorial/tutorial.html

name: BYKdb
text_content:
Tool Name: BYKdb
Description: Bacterial protein tYrosine Kinase database (BYKdb). Bacterial tyrosine-kinases share no resemblance with their eukaryotic counterparts and they have been unified in a new protein family named BY-kinases. However, BY-kinase sequence annotations in primary databases remain incomplete. This prompted us to develop a specialized database of computer-annotated BY-kinase sequences.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Protein sequence analysis, Query and retrieval, Sequence annotation
Topics: Gene and protein families, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bykdb.ibcp.fr/BYKdb/
Documentation: https://bykdb.ibcp.fr/BYKdb/BYKdbHelp

name: Harmony
text_content:
Tool Name: Harmony
Description: Harmony is a server to assess the compatibility of an amino acid sequence with a proposed three-dimensional structure.
Functions: Hydrogen bond calculation, Protein model validation, Protein modelling, Protein structure assignment, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Small molecules, Structural biology, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/harmony/
Documentation: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/harmony/help.html

name: iMOT
text_content:
Tool Name: iMOT
Description: iMOT (interacting MOTif) server is designed to search for spatially interacting motifs among proteins sharing similar 3-dimensional structures.
Functions: Protein interaction analysis, Protein structural motif recognition, Sequence motif recognition, Structural similarity search
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins
Homepage: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/imot/iMOTserver.html
Documentation: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/imot/help.html

name: PASS2
text_content:
Tool Name: PASS2
Description: Database of structure-based sequence alignments of structural domain superfamilies.
Functions: Protein fold recognition, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment, Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/pass2/
Documentation: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/cgi-bin/pass2/help.py

name: SCANMOT
text_content:
Tool Name: SCANMOT
Description: SCANMOT is a sequence similarity searching tool that adds the additional constraints of simultaneous matching of multiple motifs.
Functions: Database search, Sequence feature detection, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif recognition, Sequence similarity search
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/scanmot/scanmot.html
Documentation: http://caps.ncbs.res.in/scanmot/info.html

name: SH3-Hunter
text_content:
Tool Name: SH3-Hunter
Description: SH3-Hunter identifies putative SH3 domain interaction sites on protein sequences.
Functions: Protein domain recognition, Protein feature detection, Protein fold recognition, Protein interaction analysis, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein interactions, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins
Homepage: http://cbm.bio.uniroma2.it/SH3-Hunter/
Documentation: http://cbm.bio.uniroma2.it/SH3-Hunter/help.html

name: indel-Seq-Gen
text_content:
Tool Name: indel-Seq-Gen
Description: Biological sequence simulation program that simulates highly divergent DNA sequences and protein superfamilies. This is accomplished through the addition of subsequence length constraints and lineage- and site-specific evolution.

Topics: Evolutionary biology, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfolab.unl.edu/~cstrope/iSG/
Documentation: http://bioinfolab.unl.edu/~cstrope/iSG/iSGv2_manual.pdf

name: Scooby Domain Prediction
text_content:
Tool Name: Scooby Domain Prediction
Description: Scooby-domain (sequence hydrophobicity predicts domains) is a method to identify globular domains in protein sequence, based on the observed lengths and hydrophobicities of domains from proteins with known tertiary structure.
Functions: Protein domain recognition, Protein fold recognition, Protein globularity prediction, Protein structure comparison, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://ibivu.cs.vu.nl/programs/scoobywww/
Documentation: http://www.ibi.vu.nl/programs/scoobywww/info.php

name: PVS
text_content:
Tool Name: PVS
Description: Protein Sequence Variability (PVS) is a web server for the prediction of conserved T-cell epitopes. Several variability metrics are used to compute the absolute site variability in multiple protein sequence alignments.
Functions: Epitope mapping, Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://imed.med.ucm.es/PVS/
Documentation: http://imed.med.ucm.es/PVS/pvs-help.html

name: INTEGRALL
text_content:
Tool Name: INTEGRALL
Description: INTEGRALL is a freely available, text-based search system developed to collect and organize information on integrons. There are more than 4800 integron sequences in the database.

Topics: Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://integrall.bio.ua.pt/
Documentation: http://integrall.bio.ua.pt/?about

name: BSDD
text_content:
Tool Name: BSDD
Description: BSDD (Biomolecules Segment Display Device) searches for and displays user defined sequence motifs in known protein structures.  This web based tool incorporates the graphics package of RASMOL for visualization.

Topics: Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://iris.physics.iisc.ernet.in/bsdd/
Documentation:

name: JSpecies
text_content:
Tool Name: JSpecies
Description: An easy to use, biologist-centric software designed to measure the probability if two genomes belonging to the same species or not.
Functions: Genome annotation, Genome comparison
Topics: Comparative genomics, Evolutionary biology, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.imedea.uib-csic.es/jspecies/index.html
Documentation: http://imedea.uib-csic.es/jspecies/about.html

name: ITS2
text_content:
Tool Name: ITS2
Description: The Internal Transcribed Spacer 2 Database (ITS2) includes a homology based RNA structure prediction algorithm which allows the detection and secondary structure prediction of ITS2 sequences. This resource also contains more than 25,000 pre-calculated secondary structures for currently known ITS2 sequences that can be searched and browsed via taxonomy.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein secondary structure, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://its2.bioapps.biozentrum.uni-wuerzburg.de/
Documentation:

name: MochiView
text_content:
Tool Name: MochiView
Description: Hybrid genome browser and motif visualization/analysis/management desktop software.

Topics: ChIP-on-chip, ChIP-seq, Genomics, RNA-Seq, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://johnsonlab.ucsf.edu/sj/mochiview-start/
Documentation: http://www.johnsonlab.ucsf.edu/mochi/

name: jpHMM

Documentation: http://jphmm.gobics.de/help.html

name: Kismeth
text_content:
Tool Name: Kismeth
Description: Web-based tool for bisulfite sequencing analysis

Topics: Epigenetics, Epigenomics
Homepage: http://katahdin.mssm.edu/kismeth
Documentation:

name: ProFET
text_content:
Tool Name: ProFET
Description: Protein Feature Engineering Toolkit for Machine Learning.

Topics: Machine learning, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/ddofer/ProFET
Documentation: https://github.com/ddofer/ProFET

name: Quality Assessment
text_content:
Tool Name: Quality Assessment
Description: Apply quality filter over NGS data. You can see quality distribution graphs and one graph for each base.

Topics: DNA, Data quality management, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/qualevaluato/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/qualevaluato/

name: PMB matrix
text_content:
Tool Name: PMB matrix
Description: Implementation of PMB in Pseq-gen and Data file to use with Ziheng Yang’s PAML for protein sequence analysis.

Documentation: http://wwwlabs.uhnresearch.ca/tillier/software.htm#6

name: MONKEY
text_content:
Tool Name: MONKEY

Documentation: http://labs.csb.utoronto.ca/moses/monkey-doc.txt

name: Protael
text_content:
Tool Name: Protael

Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://proteins.burnham.org:8080/Protael/
Documentation: http://proteins.burnham.org:8080/Protael/docs/index.html

name: LayerCake
text_content:
Tool Name: LayerCake
Description: Tool created for visualizing viral variation from next generation sequencing data.

Documentation: https://github.com/uwgraphics/layercake

name: LobSTR
text_content:
Tool Name: LobSTR

Documentation: http://lobstr.teamerlich.org/documentation.html

name: snoscan
text_content:
Tool Name: snoscan
