Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, RNA
Homepage: http://lowelab.ucsc.edu/snoscan/
Documentation: http://lowelab.ucsc.edu/snoscan/snoscanReadme.html

name: ET Report Maker
text_content:
Tool Name: ET Report Maker
Description: Evolutionary trace (ET) report maker pools information from different sources including databases and on-the-fly multiple sequence analysis to produce a pdf formatted document as output. The emphasis is on prediction of functional sites of proteins.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein function analysis, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Function analysis, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mammoth.bcm.tmc.edu/report_maker/
Documentation: http://mammoth.bcm.tmc.edu/tutorial/

name: dnaMATE
text_content:
Tool Name: dnaMATE
Description: dnaMATE calculates a consensus melting temperature (Tm) for any given short DNA sequence (16-30 nts) based on three independent thermodynamic data tables.   Stand-alone version available, list of other melting temperature calculation servers also provided.
Functions: Nucleic acid thermodynamic property calculation
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://melolab.org/dnaMATE/
Documentation: http://melolab.org/dnaMATE/about.html

name: PhyloDome
text_content:
Tool Name: PhyloDome
Description: PhyloDome is a tool with which you can visualize and analyze the phylogenetic distribution of one or more eukaryotic domains.
Functions: Protein domain recognition, Protein fold recognition, Protein function analysis, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Protein folds and structural domains
Homepage: http://mendel.imp.ac.at/PhyloDome/
Documentation: http://mendel.imp.ac.at/PhyloDome/

name: Meta-MEME
text_content:
Tool Name: Meta-MEME
Description: Creates hidden Markov model of motif from MEME output and searches sequence database for matches to this motif.
Functions: Modelling and simulation, Sequence database search, Sequence feature detection, Sequence motif recognition, Sequence similarity search
Topics: Gene and protein families, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://metameme.sdsc.edu/
Documentation: http://nbcr-222.ucsd.edu/opal2/dashboard?command=docs

name: Mfold
text_content:
Tool Name: Mfold
Description: Predict RNA secondary structure from sequence; does not predict pseudoknots - see PKNOTS.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure visualisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein secondary structure, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://mfold.rna.albany.edu/?q=mfold/download-mfold
Documentation: http://unafold.rna.albany.edu/?q=mfold/faq

name: NASSAM
text_content:
Tool Name: NASSAM
Description: The NASSAM webserver searches for 3D patterns in nucleic acid structures. Motifs and formations of nucleic acid bases in 3D space within nucleic acid PDB formatted structures. The searches are based on distances between the bases which are represented as pseudoatom vectors. This search is independent of the base sequence order.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acid structure comparison, Nucleic acid structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://mfrlab.org/grafss/nassam/
Documentation: http://27.126.156.175/nassam/help.html

name: GUIDANCE
text_content:
Tool Name: GUIDANCE
Description: Assess alignment confidence scores for the identification of unreliable alignment regions. Users input a set of unaligned sequences, output is a graphic visualization of the alignment with confidence scores at each residue.
Functions: Representative sequence identification, Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://guidance.tau.ac.il
Documentation: http://guidance.tau.ac.il/ver2/overview.php

name: Btrim
text_content:
Tool Name: Btrim
Description: Fast and lightweight software to trim adapters and low quality regions in reads.
Functions: Sequence trimming
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://graphics.med.yale.edu/trim/
Documentation: http://graphics.med.yale.edu/trim/readme

name: TopHat-Fusion
text_content:
Tool Name: TopHat-Fusion
Description: A tool that enables fusion genes detection and read alignment across fusion points.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis, Read mapping, Sequence comparison, Structural variation detection
Topics: Gene structure, Gene transcripts, Mapping, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://ccb.jhu.edu/software/tophat/fusion_index.shtml
Documentation: http://ccb.jhu.edu/software/tophat/fusion_manual.html

name: CCRXP
text_content:
Tool Name: CCRXP
Description: A tool for the detection of conserved residue clusters from an input PDB file. Structural properties of each residue, such as solvent accessibility (ASA), secondary structure, conservation score etc. and the conserved residue clusters are also computed.
Functions: Accessible surface calculation, Clustering, Protein property calculation, Residue cluster calculation, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://ccrxp.netasa.org
Documentation: http://ccrxp.netasa.org

name: CEAS
text_content:
Tool Name: CEAS
Description: Cis-regulatory Element Annotation System (CEAS) is a resource for ChIP-chip analyses that retrieves repeat-masked genomic sequences, calculates GC content, plots evolutionary conservation, maps nearby genes, and identifies enriched transcription factor binding (TFBS) motifs.
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: ChIP-on-chip, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Mapping, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://ceas.cbi.pku.edu.cn
Documentation: http://ceas.cbi.pku.edu.cn/documentation.htm

name: GeMprospector
text_content:
Tool Name: GeMprospector
Description: GeMprospector is designed to find cross-species genetic marker candidates in legumes and grasses.  GeMprospector automates PCR primer design based on multiple sequence alignments of submitted ESTs and their homologues in sequence databases from legumes or grasses.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, PCR primer design, Sequence alignment
Topics: Gene transcripts, Genetics, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://cgi-www.daimi.au.dk/cgi-chili/GeMprospector/main
Documentation:

name: PriFi
text_content:
Tool Name: PriFi
Description: PriFi is a tool for designing and evaluating primer pairs based on the input of a DNA sequence alignment, useful for the PCR amplification of homologs.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, PCR primer design, Sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://services.birc.au.dk/prifi/
Documentation: https://services.birc.au.dk/prifi/prifi_troubleshooting.html

name: PolyBayes
text_content:
Tool Name: PolyBayes
Description: UNIX-based SNP discovery from redundant sequences; integrated with Phred/Phrap/Consed infrastructure (see DNA -- Contig Assembly); free for non-commercial use.
Functions: EST assembly, Genetic variation analysis, SNP detection, Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Gene transcripts, Genetic variation, Mapping, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://clavius.bc.edu/~marth/PolyBayes/pages/main.html
Documentation:

name: Megraft
text_content:
Tool Name: Megraft
Description: Megraft is a software tool to graft ribosomal small subunit (16S/18S) fragments from metagenomes onto full-length SSU sequences, enabling accurate diversity estimates from fragmentary and non-overlapping sequence data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://microbiology.se/software/megraft
Documentation: http://microbiology.se/software/megraft/

name: Metaxa
text_content:
Tool Name: Metaxa
Description: Metaxa uses Hidden Markov Models to identify, extract and classify small-subunit (SSU) rRNA sequences (12S/16S/18S) of bacterial, archaeal, eukaryotic, chloroplast and mitochondrial origin in metagenomes and other large sequence sets
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://microbiology.se/software/metaxa/
Documentation: http://microbiology.se/software/metaxa/

name: FGDB
text_content:
Tool Name: FGDB
Description: The MIPS Fusarium graminearum Genome Database (FGDB) is a comprehensive genome database for Fusarium graminearum. The current version of FGDB v3.1 provides information on the full manually revised gene set based on the Broad Institute assembly FG3 genome sequence. The database serves as a convenient entry point to explore expression data results and to obtain information on the Affymetrix GeneChip probe sets.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Gene prediction, Genome assembly
Topics: Gene expression, Pathology, Plant biology, Probes and primers, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://mips.gsf.de/genre/proj/FGDB/
Documentation: http://bioinformatik.wzw.tum.de/index.php?id=63

name: miRvestigator
text_content:
Tool Name: miRvestigator
Description: miRvestigator is a web based tool to identify miRNAs mediating co-regulation of gene expression patterns observed in transcriptome profilng data. The miRvestigator takes as input a list of co-expressed genes and returns the most likely miRNA regulating the genes. It searches for an over-represented sequence motif in the 3' UTRs of the genes using Weeder and compares the motif to all unique miRNA seed sequences in miRBase using our custom built miRvestigator hidden Markov model (HMM).
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Gene expression correlation, Gene expression profiling, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene expression, Gene regulation, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://mirvestigator.systemsbiology.net
Documentation: http://mirvestigator.systemsbiology.net/help

name: MISTIC
text_content:
Tool Name: MISTIC
Description: MISTIC (Mutual Information Server to Infer Coevolution) is a web server for graphical representation of the information contained in a multiple sequence alignment and a complete analysis tool for mutual information networks in proteins.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein interaction network analysis, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://mistic.leloir.org.ar
Documentation: http://mistic.leloir.org.ar/help.php

name: JOY
text_content:
Tool Name: JOY
Description: JOY is a program for displaying 3D structural information in a multiple sequence alignment.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://mizuguchilab.org/joy/
Documentation: http://mizuguchilab.org/joy/joyman.htm

name: MKT
text_content:
Tool Name: MKT
Description: Standard and Generalized McDonald-Kreitman Test (MKT) is a web tool for the molecular level detection of signatures of natural selection.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Phylogenetic tree analysis (natural selection), Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Gene transcripts, Genetic variation, Mapping, Population genetics, Zoology
Homepage: http://mkt.uab.es
Documentation: http://mkt.uab.es/mkt/help_MKT.asp

name: 3Matrix
text_content:
Tool Name: 3Matrix
Description: 3Matrix is a tool for visualizing protein sequence motifs and their properties in 3 dimensions. This tool needs to be downloaded and run locally on your own machine.
Functions: Protein property calculation, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Protein properties, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://motif.stanford.edu/distributions/3matrix/
Documentation: http://motif.stanford.edu/distributions/3matrix/

name: 3Motif
text_content:
Tool Name: 3Motif
Description: 3Motif is a tool for visualizing protein sequence motifs and their properties in 3 dimensions from PDB structure files.
Functions: Protein property calculation, Protein structural motif recognition, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif discovery
Topics: Protein properties, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://motif.stanford.edu/distributions/3motif/
Documentation: http://motif.stanford.edu/distributions/3motif/

name: SBC tools
text_content:
Tool Name: SBC tools
Description: Kalign is a fast and accurate multiple sequence alignment algorithm designed to align large numbers of protein sequences. Kalignvu is an xml based alignment viewer that allows users to resize alignments and choose different colour schemes. Mumsa is a tool for automatic assessment of alignment quality.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment validation
Topics: Gene and protein families, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://msa.cgb.ki.se/cgi-bin/msa.cgi
Documentation: http://msa.cgb.ki.se/cgi-bin/msa.cgi

name: NAPP
text_content:
Tool Name: NAPP
Description: Nucleic Acid Phylogenetic Profile Database: classifies coding and non-coding sequences in a genome according to their pattern of conservation across other genomes.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Nucleic acid feature detection, Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid structure prediction
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://napp.u-psud.fr/
Documentation: http://rna.igmors.u-psud.fr/NAPP/Help.php

name: NDB Tools
text_content:
Tool Name: NDB Tools
Description: The Nucleic Acid Database (NDB) Tools page includes RNAView and BPView, programs for the visualization and classification of RNA base pairs, motifs, and structures.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acid structure prediction, Sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://ndbserver.rutgers.edu/ndbmodule/services/index.html
Documentation: http://ndbserver.rutgers.edu/ndbmodule/about_ndb/about.html

name: Newt-omics
text_content:
Tool Name: Newt-omics
Description: Database of data from the newt Notophthalmus viridescens. Newt-Omics aims to provide a comprehensive platform of expressed genes during tissue regeneration, including extensive annotations, expression data and experimentally verified peptide sequences with yet no homology to other publically available gene sequences.
Functions: Data handling, Data retrieval, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Query and retrieval
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Model organisms, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://newt-omics.mpi-bn.mpg.de/
Documentation: http://newt-omics.mpi-bn.mpg.de/tutorial.php

name: Gowinda
text_content:
Tool Name: Gowinda
Description: Gowinda: unbiased analysis of gene set enrichment for Genome Wide Association Studies
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Ontology comparison
Topics: Genomics, Population genetics, Population genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://code.google.com/p/gowinda/
Documentation: https://code.google.com/archive/p/gowinda/wikis

name: GenomicTools
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomicTools
Description: GenomicTools is a platform for the analysis and manipulation of high-throughput sequencing data such as RNA-seq and ChIP-seq.
Functions: Genome comparison, Heat map generation, Peak calling
Topics: ChIP-seq, Genomics, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://code.google.com/p/ibm-cbc-genomic-tools/
Documentation: https://github.com/tsirigos/ibm-cbc-genomic-tools/blob/master/README

name: SwDMR
text_content:
Tool Name: SwDMR
Description: swDMR: a sliding window approach to identify differentially methylated regions based on bisulfite sequencing
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://code.google.com/p/swdmr/
Documentation: http://seqanswers.com/forums/showthread.php?t=23196

name: WebMAM
text_content:
Tool Name: WebMAM
Description: This is the web version of the Multiple alignment Manipulator (MaM), which takes a multiple alignment of genomic sequences as input and calculates the locations of exons, common repeat elements and unique regions based on user-selected programs/information. The graphical display also allows users to focus an assessment of sequence variation on the identified regions.
Functions: Genome alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: Gene transcripts, Phylogeny, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequencing
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.sfu.ca/MAM.htm
Documentation:

name: taveRNA
text_content:
Tool Name: taveRNA
Description: taveRNA hosts three RNA web services: alteRNA, inteRNA and pRuNA. alteRNA is an alternative to many RNA folding methods. inteRNA predicts the joint secondary structure of two RNA sequences. pRuNA is an database pruning method which given a query RNA returns only a few ncRNAs as potential regulators.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure visualisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.sfu.ca/taverna/
Documentation:

name: LigAlign
text_content:
Tool Name: LigAlign
Description: LigAlign: an automated system and structure visualization tool for flexible ligand alignment and analysis. When performing rigid alignments, LigAlign produces results consistent with manually annotated structural motifs. In performing flexible alignments, LigAlign automatically produces biochemically reasonable ligand fragmentations and subsequently identifies conserved structural motifs that are not detected by rigid alignment.
Functions: Protein structural motif recognition, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Sequence motif recognition, Structure alignment
Topics: Molecular dynamics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.toronto.edu/ligalign/
Documentation: http://compbio.cs.toronto.edu/ligalign/README.html

name: iMembrane
text_content:
Tool Name: iMembrane
Description: Homology-based method, which predicts a membrane protein’s position within a lipid bilayer. It projects the results of coarse-grained molecular dynamics simulations onto any membrane protein structure or sequence provided by the user.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Molecular dynamics, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://opig.stats.ox.ac.uk/webapps/medeller/home.pl?app=iMembrane
Documentation: http://opig.stats.ox.ac.uk/webapps/medeller/help.pl?app=iMembrane

name: Meerkat
text_content:
Tool Name: Meerkat
Description: Meerkat is designed to identify structure variations (SVs) in human cancer genomes from paired end high throughput sequencing data.
Functions: Polymorphism detection, Sequence analysis, Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA structural variation, Oncology, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://compbio.med.harvard.edu/Meerkat/
Documentation:

name: SAM-T08
text_content:
Tool Name: SAM-T08
Description: The SAM-T08 web server is a 3D protein structure prediction server. The server also provides 3 multiple sequence alignments of putative homologs, prediction of local structural features including backbone and burial properties and residue-residue contact predictions.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structural motif recognition, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://compbio.soe.ucsc.edu/SAM_T08/T08-query.html
Documentation:

name: Poretools
text_content:
Tool Name: Poretools
Description: Flexible toolkit for exploring datasets generated by nanopore sequencing devices from MinION for the purposes of quality control and downstream analysis.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/arq5x/poretools
Documentation: http://poretools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: HyperLasso
text_content:
Tool Name: HyperLasso
Description: Software of simultaneous analysis of many SNPs and covariates.
Functions: Data handling, Genome visualisation, Genotyping, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/projects/BARGEN/
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/sites/ebi.ac.uk/files/groups/kersey_service_team/HyperLasso/readme.txt

name: BOCTOPUS
text_content:
Tool Name: BOCTOPUS
Description: This software allows for requests of up to 1 protein sequence at a time for better predictive performance.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Computational biology, Membrane and lipoproteins, Proteins
Homepage: http://boctopus.bioinfo.se/
Documentation: http://boctopus.bioinfo.se/

name: htsint
text_content:
Tool Name: htsint
Description: Python package used to create gene sets for the study of high-throughput sequencing data.
Functions: Functional clustering
Topics: Function analysis, Functional genomics, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://ajrichards.github.io/htsint/
Documentation: http://ajrichards.github.io/htsint/

name: PSS
text_content:
Tool Name: PSS
Description: Protein structural statistics program for Unix-like environments.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Structure analysis
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://thomasgaillard.fr/pss/
Documentation: http://thomasgaillard.fr/pss/#doc

name: Ragout
text_content:
Tool Name: Ragout
Description: Tool for assisted assembly using multiple references. It takes a short read assembly (a set of contigs), a set of related references and a corresponding phylogenetic tree and then assembles the contigs into scaffolds.
Functions: Genome assembly
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://fenderglass.github.io/Ragout/
Documentation: http://fenderglass.github.io/Ragout/usage.html

name: RecountDB
text_content:
Tool Name: RecountDB
Description: A secondary database derived from primary data in NCBI's short read archive. Database for corrected read counts and genome mapping on NCBI's transcriptomics archives.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Mapping, Read mapping, Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping, Sequencing error detection
Topics: Gene expression, Mapping, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://recountdb.cbrc.jp/
Documentation:

name: Salmonella CRISPR typing
text_content:
Tool Name: Salmonella CRISPR typing
Description: This tool gets a CRISPR profile by identifying the presence of known spacers and direct repeats (DRs) in a given sequence based on a catalogue.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Microbiology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://research.pasteur.fr/team/enteric-bacterial-pathogens/
Documentation: https://research.pasteur.fr/en/guides

name: DMINDA
text_content:
Tool Name: DMINDA
Description: DMINDA: An integrated web server for DNA motif identification and analyses.
Functions: Sequence feature detection, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif recognition, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://csbl.bmb.uga.edu/DMINDA/
Documentation: http://bmbl.sdstate.edu/DMINDA2/documentation.php

name: NetCSSP
text_content:
Tool Name: NetCSSP
Description: A web application based on contact-dependent secondary structure propensity calculations for predicting chameleon sub-sequences that may contribute to amyloid fibril formation. NetCSSP also contains precalculated non-native secondary structure propensities for 1.4 million fragments of 7 residue length from PDB structures.
Functions: Protein secondary structure analysis, Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction, RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://cssp2.sookmyung.ac.kr
Documentation: http://cssp2.sookmyung.ac.kr/help.html

name: KeeSeeK
text_content:
Tool Name: KeeSeeK
Description: Command line tool for generating, for a given reference genome, a set of k-mers absent in that genome.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.medcomp.medicina.unipd.it/main_site/doku.php?id=keeseek
Documentation: http://www.medcomp.medicina.unipd.it/main_site/doku.php?id=keeseek

name: NRPS-PKS
text_content:
Tool Name: NRPS-PKS
Description: NRPS-PKS is an tool comprising four integrated databases for the analysis of large multi-enzymatic multi-domain megasynthases.  The user can submit a query sequence to search for domains or view the properties of the products.
Functions: Database search, Query and retrieval, Sequence database search (by property), Sequence similarity search
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://nrps.igs.umaryland.edu/
Documentation: http://nrps.igs.umaryland.edu/tutorial.html

name: psRobot
text_content:
Tool Name: psRobot
Description: psRobot is a web-based tool for plant small RNA meta-analysis. psRobot computes stem-loop small RNA prediction, which aligns user uploaded sequences to the selected genome, extracts their predicted precursors, and predicts whether the precursors can fold into stem-loop shaped secondary structure. psRobot also computes small RNA target prediction, which predict the possible targets of user provided small RNA sequences from the selected transcript library.
Functions: Protein subcellular localisation prediction, RNA secondary structure prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction, microRNA detection
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, Plant biology, RNA, Small molecules
Homepage: http://omicslab.genetics.ac.cn/psRobot/
Documentation: http://omicslab.genetics.ac.cn/psRobot/help.php

name: PatSearch
text_content:
Tool Name: PatSearch
Description: A pattern matcher that is able to search for specific combinations of oligonucleotide consensus sequences, secondary structure elements and position-weight matrices.
Functions: Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structure comparison, RNA secondary structure analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Protein secondary structure, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://itbtools.ba.itb.cnr.it/patsearch
Documentation: http://itbtools.ba.itb.cnr.it/

name: DARIO
text_content:
Tool Name: DARIO
Description: DARIO is a web service for the study of short read data from small RNA-seq experiments. It provides a wide range of analysis features including qulity control, read normalization, ncRNA quantification and prediction of putative ncRNA candidates.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Quantification, RNA-Seq quantification
Topics: Experimental design and studies, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://dario.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/
Documentation: http://dario.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/help.py#intro

name: siDirect
text_content:
Tool Name: siDirect
Description: Server for computing small interfering RNA (siRNA) sequences which are best suited for mammalian RNA interference (RNAi).  The site accepts a sequence as input and returns a list of siRNA candidates.
Functions: siRNA duplex prediction
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://design.RNAi.jp/
Documentation: http://sidirect2.rnai.jp/doc/

name: DIALIGN-TX
text_content:
Tool Name: DIALIGN-TX
Description: DIALIGN-TX is an update to DIALIGN. It combines the greedy heuristic method of DIALIGN with a traditional progressive method.
Functions: Protein secondary structure analysis, Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://dialign-tx.gobics.de/
Documentation: http://dialign-tx.gobics.de/

name: CHAOS DIALIGN WWW server
text_content:
Tool Name: CHAOS DIALIGN WWW server
Description: The CHAOS/DIALIGN WWW server is a multiple sequence alignment site which passes input sequences through CHAOS to create a list of local similarites. These similarities serve as anchor points, allowing DIALIGN to conduct global alignments faster. ABC can then be used for the interactive visualization of the alignment.
Functions: Global alignment, Local alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment
Topics: Gene transcripts, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://dialign.gobics.de/chaos-dialign-submission
Documentation: http://dialign.gobics.de/chaos-dialign-submission

name: SEM
text_content:
Tool Name: SEM
Description: Symmetry Equivalent Molecules (SEM) is a tool for generating symmetrically equivalent three-dimensional (3D) molecules. This web based tool incorporates the graphics package of RASMOL for visualization, some configuration necessary.
Functions: 3D profile generation, Generation, Molecular model refinement, Nucleic acid folding analysis
Topics: Electron microscopy, Molecular modelling, Nucleic acids, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://dicsoft2.physics.iisc.ernet.in/sem/
Documentation: http://dicsoft2.physics.iisc.ernet.in/sem/

name: ICM Web
text_content:
Tool Name: ICM Web
Description: The Interactive Chromatin Modeling (ICM) web server is an interactive tool that allows users to rapidly assess nucleosome stability and fold sequences of DNA into putative chromatin templates.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Protein folding analysis
Topics: DNA binding sites, DNA packaging, Immunoprecipitation experiment, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein folding, stability and design
Homepage: http://dna.ccs.tulane.edu/icm
Documentation:

name: E1DS
text_content:
Tool Name: E1DS
Description: E1DS is a web server for enzyme catalytic site prediction. Annotation of enzymes is made using a novel pattern mining algorithm that discovers long sequence motifs.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein feature detection, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Enzymes, Protein binding sites, Protein sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://e1ds.csbb.ntu.edu.tw/

Homepage: http://past.in.tum.de/
Documentation: http://past.in.tum.de/query.php

name: NJplot
text_content:
Tool Name: NJplot
Description: NJplot is a tool for visualizing binary trees such as the phylogenetic trees output from the PHYLIP programs. Available for several platforms including Windows, MacOS, Linux and Solaris.

Topics: Gene expression, Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/software/njplot.html
Documentation: http://doua.prabi.fr/software/njplot

name: PDA
text_content:
Tool Name: PDA
Description: Primer Design Assistant (PDA) is a PCR primer design tool that will accept batch submissions of query sequences.

Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, PCR experiment, Probes and primers, Sequencing
Homepage: http://pda.uab.es/pda2/
Documentation: http://pda.uab.es/pda2/pda_help.asp

name: edge
text_content:
Tool Name: edge
Description: Software package for the significance analysis of DNA microarray experiments for both standard and time course experiments based on our new Optimal Discovery Procedure and Time Course Methodology.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Genetics, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/edge.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/edge.html

name: Erpin
text_content:
Tool Name: Erpin
Description: Easy RNA Profile IdentificatioN takes as input an RNA sequence alignment and secondary structure annotation and will identify a wide variety of known RNA motifs (such as tRNAs, 5S rRNAs, SRP RNA, C/D box snoRNAs, hammerhead motifs, miRNAs and others) in your sequence(s) of interest. Also contains tool for drawing secondary structure of motifs.
Functions: Database search, Sequence alignment, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Computational biology, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://rna.igmors.u-psud.fr/Software/erpin.php
Documentation: http://rna.igmors.u-psud.fr/Software/erpin.php

name: eShadow
text_content:
Tool Name: eShadow
Description: Tool for performing comparative sequence analysis of multiple closely-related nucleotide or protein sequences.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Computational biology, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://eshadow.dcode.org/
Documentation: https://eshadow.dcode.org/

name: Kinefold
text_content:
Tool Name: Kinefold
Description: Kinefold calculates (and animates) the folding kinetics of RNA sequences including pseudoknots.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, RNA, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction, Zoology
Homepage: http://kinefold.curie.fr/
Documentation: http://kinefold.curie.fr/download.html

name: Ulysses
text_content:
Tool Name: Ulysses
Description: Chimeric python/R tool that is designed to provide an accurate detection of low-frequency structural variations in large insert-size sequencing libraries.
Functions: Structure analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetic variation, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.lcqb.upmc.fr/ulysses/
Documentation: http://www.lcqb.upmc.fr/ulysses/

name: Atlas Suite
text_content:
Tool Name: Atlas Suite
Description: Suite of variant analysis tools specializing in the separation of true SNPs and insertions and deletions (indels) from sequencing and mapping errors in Whole Exome Capture Sequecing (WECS) data. SNPs may be called using the Atlas-SNP2 application and indels may be called using the Atlas-Indel2 application.
Functions: Variant calling
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.hgsc.bcm.edu/software/atlas-2
Documentation: https://www.hgsc.bcm.edu/software/atlas-2

name: VectorNTI
text_content:
Tool Name: VectorNTI
Description: Application for integrated for molecular sequence analysis including primer design, virtual cloning, alignments, and sequence assembly. The free license needs to be renewed every year.
Functions: PCR primer design, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequence assembly visualisation
Topics: Probes and primers, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.thermofisher.com/dk/en/home/life-science/cloning/vector-nti-software.html
Documentation: https://www.thermofisher.com/dk/en/home/life-science/cloning/vector-nti-software/vector-nti-express-designer-software.html

name: Berkeley Phylogenomics Group
text_content:
Tool Name: Berkeley Phylogenomics Group
Description: The Berkeley Phylogenomics Group provides a series of web servers for phylogenomic analysis: classification of sequences to pre-computed families and subfamilies using the PhyloFacts Phylogenomic Encyclopedia, FlowerPower clustering of proteins sharing the same domain architecture, MUSCLE multiple sequence alignment, SATCHMO simultaneous alignment and tree construction, and SCI-PHY subfamily identification.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Gene and protein families, Phylogenetics, Phylogenomics, Protein folds and structural domains, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://phylogenomics.berkeley.edu/
Documentation:

name: LymphoSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: LymphoSeq
Description: This R package analyzes high-throughput sequencing of T and B cell receptor complementarity determining region 3 (CDR3) sequences generated by Adaptive Biotechnologies' ImmunoSEQ assay.  Its input comes from tab-separated value (.tsv) files exported from the ImmunoSEQ analyzer.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/LymphoSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/LymphoSeq.html

name: EnteriX
text_content:
Tool Name: EnteriX
Description: EnteriX is a collection of tools for viewing pairwise and multiple alignments for bacterial genome sequences.
Functions: Genome alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Pairwise sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://enterix.cbcb.umd.edu/
Documentation:

name: CUBE-DB
text_content:
Tool Name: CUBE-DB
Description: A database of pre-evaluated results for detection of functional divergence in human/vertebrate protein families, but based on all currently available vertebrate genomes.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Model organisms, Proteins
Homepage: http://epsf.bmad.bii.a-star.edu.sg/cube/db/html/home.html
Documentation: http://epsf.bmad.bii.a-star.edu.sg/cube/db/html/doc.html

name: ESPript 3.0
text_content:
Tool Name: ESPript 3.0
Description: Easy Sequencing in Postscript (ESPript) is a utility which provides postscript output for aligned sequences with graphical enhancements and structural information.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein secondary structure, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://espript.ibcp.fr/ESPript/ESPript/index.php
Documentation: http://espript.ibcp.fr/ESPript/ESPript/esp_tutorial.php#

name: FastML
text_content:
Tool Name: FastML
Description: FastML is a webserver for computing and reconstructing ancestral sequences using maximum likelihood.
Functions: Ancestral reconstruction, Haplotype mapping, Metabolic network modelling, Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods), Phylogenetic tree reconstruction
Topics: Experimental design and studies, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://fastml.tau.ac.il/
Documentation: http://fastml.tau.ac.il/overview.php

name: FFAS
text_content:
Tool Name: FFAS
Description: The Fold & Function Assignment System (FFAS) takes an amino-acid sequence as input and generates a profile which is compared to several sets of sequence profiles including PDB, SCOP, and PFAM. Public metagenomic sequence data has been added to FFAS, so that the profile of a user's protein can be compared to 20 additional profile databases including several complete proteomes, etc.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Protein feature detection, Protein fold recognition, Sequence profile generation
Topics: Metagenomics, Protein folds and structural domains, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://ffas.godziklab.org
Documentation: http://ffas.sanfordburnham.org/ffas-cgi/cgi/document.pl?ses=&rv=&lv=

name: 3D-Footprint
text_content:
Tool Name: 3D-Footprint
Description: 3D-footprint provides estimates of binding specificity for all protein-DNA complexes available at the Protein Data Bank. The web interface allows the user to: (i) browse DNA-binding proteins by keyword; (ii) find proteins that recognize a similar DNA motif and (iii) BLAST similar DNA-binding proteins, highlighting interface residues in the resulting alignments. Comparisons with expert-curated databases RegulonDB and TRANSFAC support the quality of structure-based estimates of specificity.
Functions: Database comparison, Molecular docking, Protein comparison, Protein model validation
Topics: Protein binding sites, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://floresta.eead.csic.es/3dfootprint
Documentation: http://floresta.eead.csic.es/3dfootprint/tutorial.html

name: WebMOTIFS
text_content:
Tool Name: WebMOTIFS
Description: WebMOTIFS is a tool for motif discovery, scoring, analysis, and visualization. It allows you to use different programs (AlignACE, MDscan, MEME, and Weeder) to search for DNA-sequence motifs, and evaluate the results.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Peak calling, Sequence motif analysis, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: ChIP-on-chip, Gene expression, Immunoprecipitation experiment, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://fraenkel.mit.edu/webmotifs/
Documentation: http://fraenkel.mit.edu/webmotifs-faq.html

name: rQuant.web
text_content:
Tool Name: rQuant.web
Description: rQuant.web is a web service for quantitative analysis of RNA sequencing data based on quadratic programming. rQuant.web is available as a tool in Galaxy.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Mapping, Read mapping
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Mapping, RNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://galaxy.fml.mpg.de
Documentation: https://galaxyproject.org/main/

name: GalaxyWEB
text_content:
Tool Name: GalaxyWEB
Description: GalaxyWeb is a webserver for predicting protein structure from sequence by template based modeling. It refines loop or terminus regions by ab initio modeling
Functions: Ab initio structure prediction, Molecular model refinement, Protein modelling, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://galaxy.seoklab.org/
Documentation: http://galaxy.seoklab.org/cgi-bin/help.cgi

name: FASTR3D
text_content:
Tool Name: FASTR3D
Description: FASTR3D is a web based search tool that allows users to search the PDB database for structurally similar RNAs from input queries of PDB coordinates for an RNA molecule, an RNA secondary structure or RNA primary sequence.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structure visualisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://genome.cs.nthu.edu.tw/FASTR3D/
Documentation: http://genome.cs.nthu.edu.tw/FASTR3D/help.html

name: RE-MuSiC
text_content:
Tool Name: RE-MuSiC
Description: RE-MuSiC is a tool for multiple sequence alignments where users can specify conserved blocks by supplying  regular expression constraints.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://genome.cs.nthu.edu.tw/RE-MUSIC/
Documentation: http://genome.cs.nthu.edu.tw/RE-MUSIC/help.html

name: SIM4
text_content:
Tool Name: SIM4
Description: Align cDNA with genomic DNA, allowing for introns and small number of sequencing errors.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Genome alignment, Sequence alignment, Sequencing error detection
Topics: DNA, Gene transcripts, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://globin.bx.psu.edu/html/docs/sim4.html
Documentation: http://globin.bx.psu.edu/html/docs/sim4.html#params

name: OPTIMIZER
text_content:
Tool Name: OPTIMIZER
Description: Application that optimizes the codon usage of a DNA sequence. This server can be used to predict and optimize the level expression of a gene in heterologous gene expression systems.
Functions: Codon usage analysis, Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Gene prediction
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Gene and protein families, Gene expression, Zoology
Homepage: http://genomes.urv.es/OPTIMIZER/
Documentation: http://genomes.urv.es/OPTIMIZER/

name: FastQValidator
text_content:
Tool Name: FastQValidator
Description: Checking that FastQ files are follows standards.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data quality management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/FastQValidator
Documentation: https://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/FastQValidator

name: Arachne
text_content:
Tool Name: Arachne
Description: Program for assembling data from whole genome shotgun sequencing experiments.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.broadinstitute.org/computational-rd/computational-research-and-development
Documentation: http://archive.broadinstitute.org/crd/wiki/index.php/Arachne_Main_Page

name: HHpred
text_content:
Tool Name: HHpred
Description: Based on the comparison of profile HMMs, HHpred takes a protein sequence or multiple sequence alignment as input and searches for remote homologues in an assortment of databases such as PDB, SMART and Pfam.  The user can select either a local or global alignment method, and the search results can be used to generate  3D structural models.
Functions: Global alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment comparison
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: https://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/#/tools/hhpred
Documentation: https://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/#/tools/hhpred

name: MiRNAkey
text_content:
Tool Name: MiRNAkey
Description: A software pipeline for the analysis of microRNA Deep Sequencing data
Functions: microRNA detection
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA
Homepage: http://ibis.tau.ac.il/miRNAkey
Documentation: http://ibis.tau.ac.il/miRNAkey/man.html

name: SHREC
text_content:
Tool Name: SHREC
Description: A new algorithm for correcting errors in short-read data that uses a generalized suffix trie on the read data as the underlying data structure
Functions: Sequencing error detection, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data quality management, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/shrec-ec/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/shrec-ec/files/Readme.txt/download

name: PoPoolation
text_content:
Tool Name: PoPoolation
Description: Toolbox specifically designed for the population genetic analysis of sequence data from pooled individuals.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetics, Population genetics
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/popoolation/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/popoolation/wiki/browse_pages/

name: IMAGE
text_content:
Tool Name: IMAGE
Description: “Iterative Mapping and Assembly for Gap Elimination”. IMAGE closes gaps in a draft assembly using Illumina paired-end reads.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/image2/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/image2/wiki/Home/

name: ATAC
text_content:
Tool Name: ATAC
Description: Computational process for comparative mapping between two genome assemblies, or between two different genomes.
Functions: DNA mapping, Sequence alignment, Sequence assembly validation
Topics: DNA, Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://kmer.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Main_Page
Documentation: http://kmer.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Getting_Started_with_ATAC

name: QuEST
text_content:
Tool Name: QuEST
Description: Kernel Density Estimator-based package for analysis of massively parallel sequencing data from chromatin immunoprecipitations (ChIP-seq or ChIPseq).
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: ChIP-seq
Homepage: http://mendel.stanford.edu/sidowlab/downloads/quest/
Documentation: http://www-hsc.usc.edu/~valouev/QuEST/QuEST.html

name: Scaffolder
text_content:
Tool Name: Scaffolder
Description: Edit your genome sequence using a simple human readable syntax. Manage contig positions and add inserts all in a plain text file.
Functions: Scaffolding
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://next.gs/
Documentation: http://www.rubydoc.info/gems/scaffolder/Scaffolder

name: SymCurv
text_content:
Tool Name: SymCurv
Description: SymCurv is a computational ab initio method for nucleosome positioning prediction. It is based on the structural property of natural nucleosome forming sequences, to be symmetrically curved around a local minimum of curvature.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://genome.crg.es/cgi-bin/SymCurv/SymCurv.pl
Documentation: http://genome.crg.es/SymCurv/tutorial.html

name: mmeta
text_content:
Tool Name: mmeta
Description: mmeta is a program to produce and to align the TF-maps of multiple promoter regions. mmeta is very powerful to characterize promoter regions from multiple orthologous genes, or from co-regulated genes in microarrays, as it reduces the signal/noise ratio in a very significant manner, still detecting the real functional sites.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://big.crg.cat/services/mmeta
Documentation: http://genome.crg.es/software/mmeta/index.html

name: UnderIICRMS
text_content:
Tool Name: UnderIICRMS
Description: Parameter-free Alignment-free comparison of regulatory sequences (cis-regulatory modules).  Assembly-free Genome Comparison based on Next-Generation Sequencing Reads and Variable Length Patterns.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/UnderIICRMS.html
Documentation: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/UnderIICRMS.html

name: Adenosiland
text_content:
Tool Name: Adenosiland
Description: Adenosiland represents the first attempt of an integrated bioinformatics and chemoinformatics web-resource dedicated to adenosine receptors. This informatics platform provides a wide-ranging of structure based and ligand based query functions to facilitate the exploration of adenosine receptor structures from primary sequences to three-dimensional architectures. Here, we present an overview of Adenosiland platform describing the most valuable searching tools and their functionalities.
Functions: Protein structure analysis
Topics: Cheminformatics
Homepage: http://mms.dsfarm.unipd.it/Adenosiland/
Documentation: http://mms.dsfarm.unipd.it/Adenosiland/help.php

name: MetaStudent
text_content:
Tool Name: MetaStudent
Description: Metastudent predicts Gene Ontology (GO) terms from the Molecular Function Ontology (MFO) and Biological Process Ontology (BPO) for input protein sequences by homology-based inference from already annotated proteins.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Computational biology
Homepage: https://github.com/Rostlab/MetaStudent
Documentation: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Metastudent

name: Wurst
text_content:
Tool Name: Wurst
Description: Wurst is a protein structure prediction tool that uses threading, aligning submitted sequences to thousands of PDB template structures.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structure prediction, Protein super-secondary structure prediction, Protein threading
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/wurst/
Documentation: http://flensburg.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/~wurst/salami/

name: BCL
text_content:
Tool Name: BCL
Description: Bio Chemical Library is a software package that provides unique tools for biological research, such as protein structure determination from sparse experimental data.
Functions: Mapping, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Cheminformatics, Mapping, Medicinal chemistry, Membrane and lipoproteins, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.meilerlab.org/research/show/w_text_id/92
Documentation: http://www.meilerlab.org/research/show/w_text_id/92

name: POWER
text_content:
Tool Name: POWER
Description: The Phylogenetic Web Repeater (POWER) allows users to perform phylogenetic analysis using the PHYLIP package. The POWER pipeline can start with processing either multiple sequence alignments (MSA) or can proceed directly with aligned sequences.
Functions: DNA substitution modelling, Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis, Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Workflows
Homepage: http://power.nhri.org.tw/
Documentation: http://power.nhri.org.tw/power/help.htm

name: PredictProtein
text_content:
Tool Name: PredictProtein
Description: PredictProtein is a protein sequence analysis and structure prediction tool.  Users provide a protein sequence, and PredictProtein reports similar sequences, PROSITE sequence motifs, and various types of structure prediction information.  You can also use META PredictProtein to submit a sequence to one web form and query several other servers at once, retrieving the results by e-mail.
Functions: Protein fold recognition, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction (helices), Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://ppopen.rostlab.org
Documentation: https://open.predictprotein.org/tutorials

name: HorA
text_content:
Tool Name: HorA
Description: HorA (Homology or Analogy) is a web server that identifies likely homologs for a given query protein structure. HorA combines sequence information with structure information from spatial similarity measures.
Functions: Protein modelling, Protein structural motif recognition, Protein structure comparison, Sequence similarity search, Structural similarity search
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://prodata.swmed.edu/horaserver/
Documentation: http://prodata.swmed.edu/horaserver/hora_tutorial.htm

name: PROMALS3D
text_content:
Tool Name: PROMALS3D
Description: PROMALS (Profile Multiple Alignment with Local Structure) is a progressive mutliple sequence alignment method that improves alignment quality by using additional homologs from PSI-BLAST searches and secondary structure predictions from PSIPRED.  PROMALS3D constructs alignments for multiple protein sequences and/or structures using information from sequence database searches, secondary structure prediction, available homologs with 3D structures and user-defined constraints.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://prodata.swmed.edu/promals3d
Documentation: http://prodata.swmed.edu/promals3d/info/promals3d_help.html

name: PromoterCAD
text_content:
Tool Name: PromoterCAD
Description: PromoterCAD is a web server for designing synthetic promoters in plants with altered transcriptional regulation. PromoterCAD uses published high-throughput expression and motif data from Arabidopsis thaliana to guide DNA design.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Gene prediction, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: DNA, Data mining, Gene expression, Plant biology, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://promotercad.org/
Documentation: http://promotercad.org/

name: ScanProsite
text_content:
Tool Name: ScanProsite
Description: ScanProsite is a tool for detecting PROSITE signature matches in protein sequences. Users can also search protein databases for specific motifs.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Sequence database search, Sequence feature detection, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://prosite.expasy.org/scanprosite/
Documentation: https://prosite.expasy.org/prosite_doc.html

name: ProSplicer
text_content:
Tool Name: ProSplicer
Description: Database which stores alternative splicing information generated from EST, mRNA and protein alignments with genomic sequence; text-based queries and graphical views of putative splice variants.
Functions: EST assembly, Sequence merging, Sequence tag mapping, Splicing model analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, Protein variants, Proteins, RNA splicing
Homepage: http://prosplicer.mbc.nctu.edu.tw/
Documentation: http://prosplicer.mbc.nctu.edu.tw/about/prosplicer.htm

name: ProteinDBS
text_content:
Tool Name: ProteinDBS
Description: ProteinDBS takes a PDB ID or structure as input, and searches for similar protein tertiary structures using computer visualization techniques.  The superposition of structures and the aligned component of the sequence can then be viewed over the web. ProteinDBS v2.0 applies advanced feature extraction algorithms and scalable indexing techniques to achieve a fast computation time.
Functions: Global structure alignment, Protein structure comparison, Structural similarity search, Structure alignment
Topics: Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://proteindbs.rnet.missouri.edu/
Documentation: http://proteindbs.rnet.missouri.edu/

name: NAP
text_content:
Tool Name: NAP
Description: Nucleotide Amino Acid Alignment is a Java interface to the nap C program. The NAP program computes an optimal global alignment of a DNA sequence and a protein sequence without penalizing terminal gaps. NAP handles frameshifts and long introns in the DNA sequence. It delivers the alignment in linear space, so long sequences can be aligned. The experimental results demonstrate that NAP is a sensitive and powerful tool for finding genes by DNA-protein sequence homology.
Functions: Global alignment
Topics: DNA, Gene transcripts, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://athena.bioc.uvic.ca/virology-ca-tools/nap/
Documentation: http://virology.uvic.ca/help/tool-help/how-to/NAP-how-to/

name: MotifRegressor
text_content:
Tool Name: MotifRegressor
Description: MOTIFREGRESSOR for discovering sequence motifs upstream of genes that undergo expression changes in a given condition. The method combines the advantages of matrix-based motif finding and oligomer motif-expression regression analysis, resulting in high sensitivity and specificity. MOTIF REGRESSOR is particularly effective in discovering expression-mediating motifs of medium to long width with multiple degenerate positions.
Functions: Regression, Regression analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.math.umass.edu/~conlon/mr.html
Documentation:

name: MULTICOM
text_content:
Tool Name: MULTICOM
Description: MULTICOM is a protein tertiary structure predictor using multi-template combination
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Topics: Structure prediction
Homepage: http://sysbio.rnet.missouri.edu/multicom_cluster/human/
Documentation:

name: MODexplorer
text_content:
Tool Name: MODexplorer
Description: MODexplorer is an integrated tool aimed at exploring the sequence, structural and functional diversity in protein families useful in homology modeling and in analyzing protein families in general.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Homology modeling, Protein families
Homepage: http://modorama.org/modexplorer/index/
Documentation: http://modorama.org/help/modexplorer

name: MGA
text_content:
Tool Name: MGA
Description: Multiple Genome Aligner computes multiple genome alignments of large, closely related DNA sequences. MGA  is a software tool for efficiently aligning two or more sufficiently similar genomic sized sequences [HKO02]. It belongs to the category of anchor-based multiple alignment methods. mga uses multiMEMs (or MEMs, MUMs as special cases) to anchor the alignment. In essence, they are (hopefully long) stretches or regions of identical bases occuring in all input sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bibiserv.techfak.uni-bielefeld.de/mga/
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/mga?id=mga_manual

name: MEMSAT-SVM
text_content:
Tool Name: MEMSAT-SVM
Description: MEMSATSVM is a SVM (support vector machines) based TM (Transmembrane Protein) protein topology predictor.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction, Structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure, Protein structure prediction, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bioinfadmin.cs.ucl.ac.uk/downloads/memsat-svm/
Documentation: http://bioinfadmin.cs.ucl.ac.uk/downloads/memsat-svm/README

name: MEAP
text_content:
Tool Name: MEAP
Description: MEAP is an R package for large-scale exon array data analysis.It includes a novel algorithm (PM-BayesBG) to estimate sequence-based backgrounds that allows more reliable expression estimation than the existing background correction methods. MEAP also contains algorithms for generating robust expression estimates at exon, alternatively spliced variant and gene levels that facilitates the quantitative analysis of alternative spliced variants in the whole transcriptome.
Functions: Microarray data analysis
Topics: Transcriptome
Homepage: http://csbi.ltdk.helsinki.fi/meap/index.html
Documentation: http://csbi.ltdk.helsinki.fi/meap/doc.html

name: MAPSCI
text_content:
Tool Name: MAPSCI
Description: MAPSCI is an algorithm to compute a multiple structure alignment for a set of proteins and to generate a consensus structure.
Functions: Multiple alignment, Multiple structure alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Structure alignment
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://www.geom-comp.umn.edu/mapsci/index.html
Documentation: http://www.geom-comp.umn.edu/mapsci/readme.html

name: LatPack
text_content:
Tool Name: LatPack
Description: LatPack is a collection of tools related to the folding simulations of lattice-protein models with arbitrary energy function.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Studies
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/LatPack/
Documentation: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/LatPack/manual-LatSeF.pdf

name: LRensemble
text_content:
Tool Name: LRensemble
Description: LRensemble (LR Ensemble Localization Predictor) predicts 4 major locations for Yeast Proteins: Cytosol, Mitochondrion, Nucleus, Secretory. The prediction method is to build an ensemble over different available localization predictors. In the current version, our predict collects prediction results from up to 6 predictors and Logistic Regression is used as the ensemble algorithm.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Regression
Topics: Model organisms, Proteins
Homepage: http://mleg.cse.sc.edu/LRensemble/cgi-bin/index.html
Documentation: http://mleg.cse.sc.edu/LRensemble/link1.htm

name: JAMMING
text_content:
Tool Name: JAMMING
Description: JAMMING is a software for prediction of critical residues for protein function based only on the 3D structure of proteins
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Networks, Proteins
Homepage: http://bis.ifc.unam.mx:8090/JAMMING/
Documentation: http://132.248.16.230:8090/JAMMING/QuickTour/index.html

name: IPPI
text_content:
Tool Name: IPPI
Description: IPPI is a web server of inferring protein-protein interactions
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Interactions, Model organisms, Protein interactions, Protein-protein interactions
Homepage: http://sunflower.kuicr.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~morihiro/protint/ppi-form.html
Documentation: http://sunflower.kuicr.kyoto-u.ac.jp/morihiro/protint/supplement.html

name: PipMaker
text_content:
Tool Name: PipMaker
Description: Compute alignments of similar regions in two DNA sequences.  MultiPipMaker allows the user to see relationships among more than two sequences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Regulatory element prediction, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Tree-based sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, DNA binding sites, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bio.cse.psu.edu/
Documentation: http://www.bx.psu.edu/miller_lab/docs/galaxy_phen_assoc/tutorial/

name: wiggleplotr
text_content:
Tool Name: wiggleplotr
Description: An R package to visualise RNA-seq read coverage across annotated exons. Introns of long transcripts can be rescaled to a fixed length for better visualisation of exonic coverage.
Functions: RNA-seq read count analysis, Read mapping, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Exome sequencing, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/wiggleplotr.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/wiggleplotr/man/wiggleplotr.pdf

name: Hydrophobicity
text_content:
Tool Name: Hydrophobicity
Description: Hydrophobicity Grapher graphs the hydrophobicity/hydrophilicity of a sequence of amino acids, using a sliding window. The window size can be specified by the user, and several hydrophobicity scales can be used to determine the plot.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Computational biology, Small molecules
Homepage: http://athena.bioc.uvic.ca/virology-ca-tools/hydrophobicity/
Documentation: http://virology.uvic.ca/help/tool-help/how-to/hydrophobicity-grapher-how-to/

name: HelixCorr
text_content:
Tool Name: HelixCorr
Description: HelixCorr is a software to predict correlated mutations specifically for the transmembrane parts of membrane proteins. It includes predictions obtained by several individual prediction algorithms and combines them to a consensus prediction.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Proteins
Homepage: http://webclu.bio.wzw.tum.de/helixcorr/index.html
Documentation: http://webclu.bio.wzw.tum.de/helixcorr/instructions.html

name: HTM-ONE
text_content:
Tool Name: HTM-ONE
Description: HTM-ONE takes single amino acid sequence as input and returns residue-wise prediction of several one-dimensional structural properties of helical transmembrane regions.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Transmembrane proteins, Transmembrane regions
Homepage: http://mizuguchilab.org/netasa/htmone/
Documentation:

name: Freescore
text_content:
Tool Name: Freescore
Description: Freescore is a scoring system based on local alignment partition functions for the classification of conotoxin proteins
Functions: Classification, Local alignment, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://faculty.uaeu.ac.ae/nzaki/SVM-Freescore.htm
Documentation:

name: FaaPred
text_content:
Tool Name: FaaPred
Description: FaaPred is a SVM-based prediction method for fungal adhesins and adhesin-like proteins
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://bioinfo.icgeb.res.in/faap/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.icgeb.res.in/faap/tutorial.html

name: FREAD
text_content:
Tool Name: FREAD
Description: FREAD is a database search loop structure prediction protocol. Loops are generally located in the protein’s surface and they are known to be notoriously difficult to predict.The basic assumption of FREAD is that local sequence similarity may determine the backbone structure of a local protein structure if it is constrained within anchor structures.
Functions: Database search, Prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Search, Structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://opig.stats.ox.ac.uk/webapps/fread/php/index.php
Documentation: http://opig.stats.ox.ac.uk/webapps/fread/php/tutorial.php

name: Erebus
text_content:
Tool Name: Erebus
Description: Erebus is a web server that searches the entire Protein Data Bank for a given substructure defined by a set of atoms of interest, such as the binding scaffolds for small molecules.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Search
Topics: Small molecules
Homepage: http://troll.med.unc.edu/erebus/login.php
Documentation: http://troll.med.unc.edu/erebus/help.php

name: EFIN
text_content:
Tool Name: EFIN
Description: EFIN is a free tool which predict whether amino acids substitution would related to disease evaluated by random forests based on protein conservation.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Amino acids, Disease
Homepage: http://paed.hku.hk/efin/
Documentation: http://paed.hku.hk/efin/help.html

name: DisplayFam
text_content:
Tool Name: DisplayFam
Description: DisplayFam browses protein families via the “Rich Family Description” format.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein families
Homepage: http://multalin.toulouse.inra.fr/DisplayFam/
Documentation:

name: Discriminative HMMs
text_content:
Tool Name: Discriminative HMMs
Description: Discriminative HMMs (Hidden Markov models) predicts localizations using motifs that are present in a compartment but absent in other, nearby, compartments by utilizing an hierarchical structure that mimics the protein sorting mechanism.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: HMMs, Protein sorting
Homepage: http://murphylab.cbi.cmu.edu/software/2009_TCBB_motif/
Documentation:

name: DescFold
text_content:
Tool Name: DescFold
Description: DescFold is a web server for protein fold recognition,which can predict a protein’s fold type from its amino acid sequence.
Functions: Protein fold recognition, Protein sequence analysis, Recognition
Topics: Protein fold recognition
Homepage: http://protein.cau.edu.cn/DescFold/
Documentation: http://protein.cau.edu.cn/DescFold/usage.html

name: SEWAL
text_content:
Tool Name: SEWAL
Description: Process deep sequencing data from in vitro selection experiments.
Functions: In vitro selection, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/sewal/
Documentation:

name: PhosCalc
text_content:
Tool Name: PhosCalc
Description: System for estimating the site of phosphorylation in a phosphorylated peptide with ambiguous sites. It does this by generating ions from peptide sequences and calculating their masses, generating different ions and masses for water-loss, different cysteine modifications and different charge states.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Protein properties, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/danmaclean/phoscalc
Documentation: https://github.com/danmaclean/PhosCalc/blob/master/README

name: ANTHEPROT
text_content:
Tool Name: ANTHEPROT
Description: Interactive program with a graphical user interface that allows handling of protein sequence and data in a very interactive and convenient manner. It provides many methods and tools, which are integrated into a graphical user interface.
Functions: Molecular dynamics simulation, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular dynamics, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://antheprot-pbil.ibcp.fr/
Documentation: http://antheprot-pbil.ibcp.fr/anthe_histo.php?evene=3D%20viewer

name: CycloPs
text_content:
Tool Name: CycloPs
Description: CycloPsWeb generates structures for and displays properties of cyclised and linear peptides. Information includes solid-phase peptide synthesis feasibility, Octanol-water partition coefficient, and drug-like properties Structural representations are available in 1D SMILES, 2D .png image, and 3D .sdf formats Functionality for generating libraries of cyclised peptides, including commercially available non-natural amino acids is available in the standalone CycloPs client.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Amino acids, Peptides
Homepage: http://bioware.ucd.ie/~cyclops/cgi-bin/webpep.cgi
Documentation: https://github.com/fergaljd/cyclops

name: CanBind
text_content:
Tool Name: CanBind
Description: CanBind is a pipeline to identify genes significantly mutated in cancer
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Cancer, Protein binding sites
Homepage: http://canbind.princeton.edu/
Documentation:

name: CSM
text_content:
Tool Name: CSM
Description: CSM (Cutoff Scanning Matrix) is a novel structure-based protein function prediction and structural classification method. CSM generates feature vectors that represent distance patterns between protein residues. These feature vectors are then used as evidence for classification.
Functions: Classification, Prediction, Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Recognition
Topics: Protein function prediction
Homepage: http://homepages.dcc.ufmg.br/~dpires/csm/index.html
Documentation:

name: CRNPRED
text_content:
Tool Name: CRNPRED
Description: CRNPRED is a program that predicts secondary structures (SS), contact numbers (CN), and residue-wise contact orders (RWCO) of a native protein structure from its amino acid sequence.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.org/crnpred/wiki/
Documentation: https://www.bioinformatics.org/crnpred/wiki/PmWiki/DocumentationIndex

name: BEARR
text_content:
Tool Name: BEARR
Description: Takes a list of gene identifiers (such as RefSeq and Unigene IDs), consensus patterns, and (optionally) a position weight matrix as input and returns a list of matches for the patterns in both the sense and anti-sense strands of the relevant genomic sequence.  The user specifies what distance up and downstream from both the transcription start site and the 3' terminus to look for the patterns.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Regulatory element prediction, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA binding sites, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://giscompute.gis.a-star.edu.sg/~vega/BEARR1.0/
Documentation:

name: IgDiscover
text_content:
Tool Name: IgDiscover
Description: Analyzes antibody repertoires and discovers new V genes from high-throughput sequencing reads. Heavy chains, kappa and lambda light chains are supported (to discover VH, VK and VL genes).
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Homology-based gene prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://igdiscover.se/
Documentation: http://docs.igdiscover.se/

name: PLecDom
text_content:
Tool Name: PLecDom
Description: Program for the detection of Plant Lectin Domains in a polypeptide or EST sequence. In the web server, users evaluate their input sequence for lectin domains, classify the identified domains into substrate classes, estimate the extent of divergence of new domains, extract domain boundaries and examine flanking sequence.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Gene transcripts, Plants, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.nipgr.res.in/plecdom.html
Documentation: http://www.nipgr.res.in/plecdom.tutorial.html

name: CRSD
text_content:
Tool Name: CRSD
Description: Microarray analysis pipeline aimed at the discovery of motifs involved in gene regulation including microRNA signatures and transcription factor binding sites (TFBS).
Functions: Regulatory element prediction, Sequence motif discovery, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene expression, Gene regulation, Microarray experiment, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://140.120.213.10:8080/crsd/main/home.jsp
Documentation:

name: WEB-THERMODYN
text_content:
Tool Name: WEB-THERMODYN
Description: Analyzes DNA sequences and computes the DNA helical stability. This tool can be used to predict sites of low helical stability present at regulatory regions for transcription and replication.
Functions: DNA transcription, Regulatory element prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, DNA replication and recombination, Gene expression, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.gsa.buffalo.edu/dna/dk/WEBTHERMODYN/
Documentation:

name: MGX
text_content:
Tool Name: MGX
Description: Open source client/server framework for the analysis of shotgun metagenome data. Flexible analysis workflows based on the Conveyor workflow engine provide the user with a wide range of recent algorithms for taxonomic, functional and statistical analysis. The ability to integrate own datasources and custom analysis pipelines enables researchers to address highly specific study aims and generate high-quality charts as well as interactive visualizations.
Functions: Sequence similarity search, Taxonomic classification
Topics: Metagenomics
Homepage: https://mgx-metagenomics.github.io/
Documentation: https://mgx-metagenomics.github.io/

name: BayesMotif
text_content:
Tool Name: BayesMotif
Description: BayesMotif is a de novo identification algorithm for finding a common type of protein sorting motifs in which a highly conserved anchor is present along with a less conserved motif regions.
Functions: Motif discovery, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein sorting
Homepage: http://mleg.cse.sc.edu/BayesMotif/
Documentation: http://mleg.cse.sc.edu/BayesMotif/manual.html

name: BRS-nonint
text_content:
Tool Name: BRS-nonint
Description: BRS-nonint (Balanced Random Sampling of Non-interactions) is a method of sampling non-interactions randomly from the complement graph of protein-protein interactions, while the degree of each protein in the ‘positive’ dataset (interactions) equals to that in the ‘negative’ dataset (non-interactions).
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Interactions, Protein interactions, Protein-protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.leeds.ac.uk/BRS-nonint/
Documentation: http://www.bioinformatics.leeds.ac.uk/BRS-nonint/example_brs.html

name: Ampred
