text_content:
Tool Name: Ampred
Description: Ampred server predicts the Antimicrobial activity of given sequence. The activity may be antifungal, antiviral and antibacterial .This server works based on Multidimensional signatures of antimicrobial peptides
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Peptides
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.org/Antimicrobial/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.org/antimicrobial/int1.html

name: ASSIST v1- Active Site Similarity Search Tool
text_content:
Tool Name: ASSIST v1- Active Site Similarity Search Tool
Description: ASSIST is an application for the detection of catalytic sites in unknown function proteins.
Functions: Detection, Protein sequence analysis, Search
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://www.computationalbiology.it/software.html
Documentation:

name: T-Reg Comparator
text_content:
Tool Name: T-Reg Comparator
Description: Tool for the analysis of transcriptional regulation that allows you to compare a set of position weight matrices (PWM) against the T-Reg database (a collection of PWMs built from Transfac and Jaspar).
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Regulatory element prediction, Sequence motif recognition, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA binding sites, Gene expression, Gene regulation, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://treg.molgen.mpg.de/
Documentation:

name: NCBI Influenza Virus Sequence Annotation Tool
text_content:
Tool Name: NCBI Influenza Virus Sequence Annotation Tool
Description: Web application for user-provided sequences. It can predict protein sequences encoded by an input flu sequence and produce a feature table that can be used for sequence submission to GenBank.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Sequence annotation, Sequence feature comparison, Sequence feature detection
Topics: Gene transcripts, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Virology
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genomes/FLU/Database/annotation.cgi
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/viruses/variation/help/flu-help-center/annotation-tool/

name: DeFuse
text_content:
Tool Name: DeFuse
Description: A software package for gene fusion discovery using RNA-Seq data. The software uses clusters of discordant paired end alignments to inform a split read alignment analysis for finding fusion boundaries.
Functions: Gene expression comparison, RNA-Seq analysis, Sequence motif discovery, Splicing model analysis
Topics: Gene structure, Gene transcripts, Oncology, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://shahlab.ca/projects/defuse/
Documentation: http://shahlab.ca/projects/defuse/

name: GPCRHMM
text_content:
Tool Name: GPCRHMM
Description: A hidden Markov model for GPCR detection.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://gpcrhmm.sbc.su.se/
Documentation: http://gpcrhmm.sbc.su.se/instructions.html

name: PlantPhos
text_content:
Tool Name: PlantPhos
Description: Web tool for predicting potential phosphorylation sites in plant proteins.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Plant biology, Protein modifications, Proteins
Homepage: http://csb.cse.yzu.edu.tw/PlantPhos/
Documentation: http://csb.cse.yzu.edu.tw/PlantPhos/Introduction.html

name: AKDESeq
text_content:
Tool Name: AKDESeq
Description: Software for adaptative-bandwidth kernel density estimation for high-throughput sequencing data.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.perkinslab.ca/software
Documentation: http://www.perkinslab.ca/Software.html

name: RCA
text_content:
Tool Name: RCA
Description: Relative codon adaptation is a novel index for measuring codon adaptation in genomic sequences. Similar to CAI, it can use a reference geneset to estimate gene expression, but it takes directly into account the background nucleotide distribution.
Functions: Codon usage analysis
Topics: Computational biology, Gene expression, Molecular genetics
Homepage: http://erilllab.umbc.edu/research/software/201-2/
Documentation: http://erilllab.umbc.edu/research/software/201-2/

name: DGD
text_content:
Tool Name: DGD
Description: Provides a list of groups of co-located and duplicated genes.
Functions: Sequence annotation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://dgd.genouest.org/
Documentation: http://dgd.genouest.org/tutorial

name: BoBro
text_content:
Tool Name: BoBro
Description: BOTTLENECK BROKEN TOOL is a software  for prediction of cis-regulatory motifs in a given set of promoter sequences.
Functions: Regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://csbl.bmb.uga.edu/~maqin/motif_finding/
Documentation: http://csbl.bmb.uga.edu/~maqin/motif_finding/faq.html

name: iACP
text_content:
Tool Name: iACP
Description: This web-server was developed to identify the anticancer peptides based on the sequence information.
Functions: Peptide identification, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Medicines research and development, Oncology, Pharmacology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/iACP
Documentation: http://lin.uestc.edu.cn/server/iACPred/readme

name: PhosphoPICK
text_content:
Tool Name: PhosphoPICK
Description: Method for predicting kinase substrates using cellular context information, and is currently able to make predictions for 59 human kinases.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein modifications, Proteins
Homepage: http://bioinf.scmb.uq.edu.au/phosphopick/phosphopick
Documentation: http://bioinf.scmb.uq.edu.au/phosphopick/tutorial

name: PTMPred
text_content:
Tool Name: PTMPred
Description: Tool for predicting post-transcriptional modification sites based on protein sequence.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein modifications, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://doc.aporc.org/wiki/PTMPred
Documentation: http://doc.aporc.org/wiki/PTMPred

name: PhosphoSVM
text_content:
Tool Name: PhosphoSVM
Description: Web server for prediction of phosphorylation sites by integrating various protein sequence attributes with a support vector machine.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein modifications, Proteins
Homepage: http://sysbio.unl.edu/PhosphoSVM/
Documentation: http://sysbio.unl.edu/PhosphoSVM/download.php

name: Precise
text_content:
Tool Name: Precise
Description: Predict regulatory cis-acting elements through DNA sequences. This tool aimed at advanced mining of specific biological data: sequence data of DNA sequences that lie upstream of regions with known coding function.
Functions: Regulatory element prediction
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.wageningenur.nl/en/show/PRECISE-Prediction-of-REgulatory-CISacting-Elements.htm
Documentation: http://www.wur.nl/upload_mm/1/3/c/5766fafc-a226-4d7c-998f-0c14ab689755_precise_manual.pdf

name: Phogly-PseAAC
text_content:
Tool Name: Phogly-PseAAC
Description: Predicting lysine phosphoglycerylation sites in proteins incorporating with position-specific propensity.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins
Homepage: http://app.aporc.org/Phogly-PseAAC/
Documentation: http://app.aporc.org/Phogly-PseAAC/ReadMe.html

name: PTMClust
text_content:
Tool Name: PTMClust
Description: Software that can be applied to the output of blind PTM (Post-translational Modification) search methods to improve prediction quality, by suppressing noise in the data and clustering peptides with the same underlying modification to form PTM groups. We showed that our technique outperforms two standard clustering algorithms on a simulated dataset.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Model organisms, Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://genes.toronto.edu/PTMClust/
Documentation: http://genes.toronto.edu/PTMClust/README.txt

name: iSuc-PseAAC
text_content:
Tool Name: iSuc-PseAAC
Description: This web-server is established for predicting the lysine succinylation sites in proteins.
Functions: Protein post-translation modification site prediction
Topics: Protein modifications, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://app.aporc.org/iSuc-PseAAC
Documentation: http://app.aporc.org/iSuc-PseAAC/ReadMe.html

name: T-Analyst
text_content:
Tool Name: T-Analyst
Description: A program for analyzing molecular dynamics trajectories based on internal bond-angle-torsion coordinates. The program computes entropy and rotameric states of dihedrals, clusters multiple conformations and detects dihedral rotations that contribute hinge-like motions. It was developed with special focuses on showing changes of protein flexibility between different states, and selecting representative protein conformations for molecular docking studies.
Functions: Molecular dynamics simulation, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Molecular dynamics, Protein structure analysis, Structure analysis
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/site/tanalystprogram/
Documentation: https://sites.google.com/site/tanalystprogram/download/tutorial

name: AGenDA
text_content:
Tool Name: AGenDA
Description: AGenDA is a web tool that compares the genomic sequences from evolutionarily related organisms in order to make gene predictions.  It takes pairs of genomic sequences as input, aligns the sequences, and makes predictions based on splice signals, start and stop codons, and areas of conserved sequence.
Functions: Gene prediction, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Sequence merging
Topics: Comparative genomics, Genomics, Model organisms, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bibiserv.techfak.uni-bielefeld.de/agenda/
Documentation: https://bibiserv.cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de/agenda

name: Gene2Oligo
text_content:
Tool Name: Gene2Oligo
Description: Tool which divides both strands of an input DNA sequence into a set of contiguous oligonucleotides.  These oligos are designed with complimentary regions so that the complete set can be combined to synthesize the input DNA sequence in vitro (using oligonucleotide synthesis and assembly PCR).
Functions: PCR primer design, Read mapping, Sequence assembly
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Probes and primers, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: http://berry.engin.umich.edu/gene2oligo/
Documentation: http://berry.engin.umich.edu/gene2oligo/

name: Kablammo
text_content:
Tool Name: Kablammo
Description: Helps you create interactive visualizations of BLAST results from your web browser. Find your most interesting alignments, list detailed parameters for each, and export a publication-ready vector image, all without installing any software.
Functions: Sequence assembly visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://kablammo.wasmuthlab.org/
Documentation: https://github.com/jwintersinger/kablammo

name: 3D-SURFER
text_content:
Tool Name: 3D-SURFER
Description: 3D-SURFER is a web-based tool for real-time protein surface comparison and analysis. The server integrates a repertoire of methods to assist in high throughput screening and visualization of protein surface comparisons.
Functions: Molecular surface analysis, Molecular surface comparison, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structural motifs and surfaces
Homepage: http://kiharalab.org/3d-surfer/
Documentation: http://kiharalab.org/3d-surfer/tutorial.php

name: PyroTrimmer
text_content:
Tool Name: PyroTrimmer
Description: Program that trims barcodes, linkers, primers, and sequence region with low quality scores from 454 sequence reads.
Functions: Sequence cutting
Topics: DNA, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://pyrotrimmer.kopri.re.kr/
Documentation: http://pyrotrimmer.kopri.re.kr/manual.docx

name: Kolmogorov
text_content:
Tool Name: Kolmogorov
Description: Multistep approach to classify and cluster Biological Sequences and Structures, via Compression.
Functions: Clustering
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.math.unipa.it/~raffaele/kolmogorov/
Documentation: http://www.math.unipa.it/~raffaele/kolmogorov/Documentation.txt

name: ABMapper
text_content:
Tool Name: ABMapper
Description: Portable, easy-to-use package for spliced alignment, junction site detection, and reads mapping.
Functions: DNA mapping, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Prediction and recognition
Topics: Mapping, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://www.hkbic.cuhk.edu.hk/software/abmapper
Documentation: http://www.hkbic.cuhk.edu.hk/software/abmapper/

name: RBRIdent
text_content:
Tool Name: RBRIdent
Description: An algorithm for improved identification of RNA-binding residues in proteins from primary sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Protein interactions, Protein sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://166.111.152.91/RBRIdent.html
Documentation: http://166.111.152.91/Home.html

name: catRAPID signature
text_content:
Tool Name: catRAPID signature
Description: This software calculates the overall RNA-binding propensity followed by the prediction of RNA-binding regions
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://s.tartaglialab.com/new_submission/signature
Documentation: http://service.tartaglialab.com/static_files/shared/documentation_signature.html

name: IndelCoder
text_content:
Tool Name: IndelCoder
Description: Takes a NEXUS file containing aligned DNA sequences and recodes the gaps using the simple indel coding algorithm.
Functions: Sequence alignment refinement
Topics: Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.rosenberglab.net/software.html#IndelCoder
Documentation: https://github.com/msrosenberg/IndelCoder

name: HapFlow
text_content:
Tool Name: HapFlow
Description: Python application for visualising haplotypes present in sequencing data. It identifies variant profiles present and reads and creates an abstract visual representation of these profiles to make haplotypes easier to identify.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Variant classification, Visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Genetics, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://mjsull.github.io/HapFlow/
Documentation: https://github.com/mjsull/HapFlow/wiki

name: ProPAS
text_content:
Tool Name: ProPAS
Description: Calculate the basic property of peptides/proteins. The properties include the Isoelectric point (pI), Mass weight (MW) and Hydrophobicity (Hy). Additionally, amino acid composition of all peptides/proteins in the list was also calculated.
Functions: Protein property calculation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein properties, Proteins
Homepage: http://bioinfo.hupo.org.cn/tools/ProPAS/propas.htm
Documentation: http://bioinfo.hupo.org.cn/tools/ProPAS/propas_example1.htm

name: HiTSelect
text_content:
Tool Name: HiTSelect
Description: Software for the deconvolution and analysis of high-throughput, pooled, genetic screens. It is designed for screens which use next-generation sequencing as readout. It provides modules for identifying screen hits via rigorous statistics, visualizing screen readout and performing downstream functional and network analysis.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Functional genomics, Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://github.com/diazlab/HiTSelect
Documentation: https://github.com/diazlab/HiTSelect/blob/master/README.md

name: PGT
text_content:
Tool Name: PGT
Description: Software to find motifs using random projections.
Functions: Genome comparison, Sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www1.cse.wustl.edu/~jbuhler/pgt/
Documentation: http://www1.cse.wustl.edu/~jbuhler/pgt/projection-toolkit-0.42.tar.bz2

name: Carboxylator
text_content:
Tool Name: Carboxylator
Description: Novel tool that applies support vector machine (SVM) for identifying carboxylation sites on glutamate residue.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein structure analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://csb.cse.yzu.edu.tw/Carboxylator/
Documentation: http://csb.cse.yzu.edu.tw/Carboxylator/index.php?item=Intro

name: PR2ALIGN
text_content:
Tool Name: PR2ALIGN
Description: Find an optimal minimal distance global alignment of two amino acid sequences based on the comparison of the profiles of biochemical properties of these sequences.
Functions: Global alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://pr2align.rit.albany.edu/
Documentation: http://pr2align.rit.albany.edu/help.html

name: iQTL-F2
text_content:
Tool Name: iQTL-F2
Description: R code for mapping imprinted quantitative trait loci (iQTL) in F2 experimental cross.
Functions: Mapping
Topics: Genetics, Genomics, Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.stt.msu.edu/~cui/software.html
Documentation: https://www.stt.msu.edu/~cui/software.html

name: PLNseq
text_content:
Tool Name: PLNseq
Description: Package which conducts differential expression (DE) analysis using high throughput RNA-seq read count data generated from correlated samples.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://homepage.fudan.edu.cn/zhangh/softwares/plnseq/
Documentation: https://github.com/zhanghfd/PLNseq/

name: Hapler
text_content:
Tool Name: Hapler
Description: Tool for assembling robust haplotype regions given alignments (from de-novo assembly or mapping to a reference) of genetically diverse sequence data. It compares each sequence to every other, and groups sequences together into sets that don’t have any conflicts (minimum coloring of the sequence ‘conflict graph’).
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence assembly, Sequence classification
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.cse.nd.edu/~biocmp/hapler/
Documentation: http://www.cse.nd.edu/~biocmp/hapler/hapler_doc_1.60.pdf

name: ABRA
text_content:
Tool Name: ABRA
Description: Realigner for next generation sequencing data. It uses localized assembly and global realignment to align reads more accurately, thus improving downstream analysis (detection of indels and complex variants in particular).
Functions: Indel detection, Read mapping, Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/mozack/abra
Documentation: https://github.com/mozack/abra

name: Hobbes
text_content:
Tool Name: Hobbes
Description: Software package for efficiently mapping DNA snippets (reads) against a reference DNA sequence. It can map short and long reads, and supports Hamming distance (only substitutions) and edit distance (substitutions/insertions/deletions). It accepts both single-end and paired-end reads for alignment, and can run on multiple CPU cores using multithreading.
Functions: DNA mapping
Topics: DNA, Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://hobbes.ics.uci.edu
Documentation: http://hobbes.ics.uci.edu/index.shtml

name: IBS
text_content:
Tool Name: IBS
Description: Software package that can be used for representing the organization of either protein or nucleotide sequences, in a convenient, efficient and precise manner.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Nucleic acids, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://ibs.biocuckoo.org/
Documentation: http://ibs.biocuckoo.org/userguide.php

name: QuickProbs
text_content:
Tool Name: QuickProbs
Description: Fast multiple sequence alignment algorithm designed for graphics processors.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Gene and protein families, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://sun.aei.polsl.pl/REFRESH/index.php?page=projects&project=quickprobs&subpage=about
Documentation: http://sun.aei.polsl.pl/REFRESH/index.php?page=projects&project=quickprobs&subpage=about

name: KCMBT
text_content:
Tool Name: KCMBT
Description: Very fast multi-threaded k-mer counting algorithm. It uses cache efficient burst tries to store k-mers
Functions: k-mer counting
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://github.com/abdullah009/kcmbt_mt
Documentation: https://github.com/abdullah009/kcmbt_mt/blob/master/README.md

name: PINCAGE
text_content:
Tool Name: PINCAGE
Description: Method that uses probabilistic integration of cancer genomics data for combined evaluation of RNA-seq gene expression and 450K array DNA methylation measurements of promoters as well as gene bodies.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: DNA, Gene expression, Genomics, Oncology, RNA, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://moma.ki.au.dk/prj/pincage/
Documentation: http://moma.ki.au.dk/prj/pincage/

name: HYCUD
text_content:
Tool Name: HYCUD
Description: Python-based program for prediction of rotational correlation time of folded protein domains in the context of flexible multidomain proteins and protein complexes with long disordered tails and/or interdomain linkers as well as intrinsically disordered proteins.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein disordered structure, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www3.mpibpc.mpg.de/groups/zweckstetter/_links/software_hycud.html
Documentation: http://www3.mpibpc.mpg.de/groups/zweckstetter/_links/software_hycud.html#Tutorial

name: ARCT
text_content:
Tool Name: ARCT
Description: Toolkit of Perl modules aimed at bioinformatics, genomics, and gerontology, partly based on the BioPerl package, which aim is to allow the comparative genomics of aging. It is a collection of data-mining tools, algorithms, parsers, wrappers, spiders and web applications, etc.
Functions: Molecular dynamics, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Computational biology, DNA, Experimental design and studies, Genomics
Homepage: http://genomics.senescence.info/software/perl.html
Documentation: http://genomics.senescence.info/software/perl.html

name: PyRAD
text_content:
Tool Name: PyRAD
Description: Pipeline to assemble de novo RADseq loci with the aim of optimizing coverage across phylogenetic datasets.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://dereneaton.com/software/pyrad/
Documentation: http://nbviewer.jupyter.org/gist/dereneaton/af9548ea0e94bff99aa0/pyRAD_v.3.0.ipynb

name: PhyloSim
text_content:
Tool Name: PhyloSim
Description: Extensible object-oriented framework for the Monte Carlo simulation of sequence evolution written in 100 percent R.
Functions: Modelling and simulation, Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: Phylogenetics, Simulation experiment
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/goldman-srv/phylosim/
Documentation: https://github.com/bsipos/phylosim

name: Bubble GUM
text_content:
Tool Name: Bubble GUM
Description: Computational tool that allows to automatically extract phenotype signatures based on transcriptomic data and to perform easily multiple GSEA runs in a row.
Functions: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.ciml.univ-mrs.fr/applications/BubbleGUM/index.html
Documentation: http://www.ciml.univ-mrs.fr/applications/BubbleGUM/BubbleGUM_files/download/BubbleGum_UserGuide.pdf

name: ARTO
text_content:
Tool Name: ARTO
Description: The Analysis of Replication Timing and Organization tool uses signal processing methods to fit a constant piece-wise linear curve to the measured raw data. It takes raw time of replication (ToR) measurement signals as input and outputs for each genomic location an estimate of its ToR and an association to CTR (constant ToR region) or TTR (Temporal Transition Region).
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: http://bioinfo.cs.technion.ac.il/people/zohar/ARTO/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.cs.technion.ac.il/people/zohar/ARTO/

name: E2G
text_content:
Tool Name: E2G
Description: E2G is a tool that maps a large set of EST and cDNA sequences to a user-supplied genomic sequence.  The use of pre-computed indexed data structures increases the efficiency of the sequence comparison process, allowing a large amount of data to be mapped within a reasonable timeframe.
Functions: Genome indexing, Mapping, Sequence comparison, Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping
Topics: DNA, Gene transcripts, Mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bibiserv.techfak.uni-bielefeld.de/e2g/
Documentation:

name: pFlexAna
text_content:
Tool Name: pFlexAna
Description: Protein Flexibility Analyzer (pFlexAna) detects and displays conformational changes in remotely related proteins, without using sequence homology information. Rather than detecting regions of structural similarity, pFlexAna detects regions exhibiting structural change.
Functions: Clustering, Protein flexibility and motion analysis, Protein modelling, Protein structure comparison
Topics: Molecular dynamics, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bigbird.comp.nus.edu.sg/pmwiki/farm/motion/index.php?n=Site.ProteinFlexibility
Documentation: http://motion.comp.nus.edu.sg/projects/proflexana/docs/html/index.html

name: Virus Genotyping Tools
text_content:
Tool Name: Virus Genotyping Tools
Description: This web server facilitates high-throughput virus genotyping by aligning query sequences to a pre-defined set of reference strains and then computing phylogenetic analysis.
Functions: DNA substitution modelling, Genotyping, Query and retrieval, Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Virology
Homepage: http://bioafrica.mrc.ac.za/rega-genotype/html/
Documentation:

name: CABS-fold
text_content:
Tool Name: CABS-fold
Description: CABS-fold is a web server for the de novo and consensus-based prediction of protein structure. The web server output is a coarse grained trajectory of generated conformations.
Functions: Ab initio structure prediction, Protein modelling, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structure prediction, de Novo sequencing
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://biocomp.chem.uw.edu.pl/CABSfold
Documentation: http://biocomp.chem.uw.edu.pl/CABSfold/#

name: DNaseR
text_content:
Tool Name: DNaseR
Description: DNase I footprinting analysis of DNase-seq data in R
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Peak calling
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.riken.jp/packages/2.14/bioc/html/DNaseR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.riken.jp/install/#install-bioconductor-packages

name: HMS-ICS
text_content:
Tool Name: HMS-ICS
Description: The Hyperlink Management System (HMS) automatically updates and maintains hyperlinks among major databases using various data IDs (e.g. HUGO Gene Symbols, IDs from PDB, UniProt). The ID Converter System (ICS) supports the conversion of data IDs using the corresponding tables in HMS.
Functions: Data retrieval, ID mapping, Query and retrieval
Topics: Database management, Gene and protein families, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://biodb.jp/
Documentation: http://biodb.jp/help/index_en.html

name: InterEvol
text_content:
Tool Name: InterEvol
Description: Database designed to explore 3D structures of homologous interfaces of protein complexes. Provides tools to retrieve and visualize these structures, including downloadable pre-computed multiple sequence alignments.
Functions: Data retrieval, Multiple sequence alignment, Structural similarity search
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://biodev.cea.fr/interevol/
Documentation: http://biodev.cea.fr/interevol/help/help.html

name: RASMOT-3D PRO
text_content:
Tool Name: RASMOT-3D PRO
Description: The RASMOT-3D PRO web server performs systematic searches in 3D protein structures for a set of residues exhibiting a particular topology. Input is a PDB file for the motif of interest; output is an interactive list of protein structures exhibiting resides of similar topology.
Functions: Protein model validation, Protein structural motif recognition, Protein structure comparison, Residue distance calculation, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Protein structure analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://biodev.extra.cea.fr/rasmot3d/
Documentation: http://biodev.extra.cea.fr/rasmot3d/help.html

name: enoLOGOS
text_content:
Tool Name: enoLOGOS
Description: enoLOGOS creates sequence logos based on a variety of input, including sequence alignments, probability and alignment matrices and energy measurements.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis, Sequence alignment conversion
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://biodev.hgen.pitt.edu/enologos/
Documentation: http://biodev.hgen.pitt.edu/enologos/enoLOGOS_documentation.html#reference

name: Pool-hmm
text_content:
Tool Name: Pool-hmm
Description: Estimate allele frequencies and detect selective sweeps, using NGS data from a sample of pooled individuals from the same population.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetics, Machine learning, Sequencing
Homepage: https://qgsp.jouy.inra.fr/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=56&Itemid=63
Documentation: https://forge-dga.jouy.inra.fr/projects/pool-hmm

name: HHCompare
text_content:
Tool Name: HHCompare
Description: Pipeline for HMM-HMM comparison based hierarchial clustering and analysis of potential paralogues in sequence set.
Functions: Clustering
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/rgacesa/HHCompare
Documentation: https://github.com/rgacesa/HHCompare/blob/master/README.md

name: Annocript
text_content:
Tool Name: Annocript
Description: Pipeline for the annotation of de-novo generated transcriptomes. It executes BLAST analysis with UniProt, NCBI Conserved Domain Database and Nucleotide divisions, Gene Ontology, UniPathways and the Enzyme Commission
Functions: Sequence annotation, Transcriptome assembly
Topics: Gene transcripts, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://github.com/frankMusacchia/Annocript
Documentation: https://github.com/frankMusacchia/Annocript

name: ANNIE
text_content:
Tool Name: ANNIE
Description: ANNIE integrates over twenty protein function prediction tools in a single website. ANNIE displays prediction results in an integrated manner using an innovative AJAX-based sequence viewer.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein function prediction, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Function analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://annie.bii.a-star.edu.sg
Documentation: http://annie.bii.a-star.edu.sg/annie/help/guide/Tutorial.html

name: ComSin
text_content:
Tool Name: ComSin
Description: ComSin is a database of protein structures in bound (complex) and unbound (single) states. The developed server enables one to search for proteins in bound and unbound states with several options including sequence similarity between the corresponding proteins in bound and unbound states, and validation of interaction interfaces of protein complexes.
Functions: Protein model validation, Protein modelling, Protein structure assignment, Protein structure comparison, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein disordered structure, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://antares.protres.ru/comsin/.
Documentation: http://antares.protres.ru/comsin/about.html

name: PRED-GPCR
text_content:
Tool Name: PRED-GPCR
Description: PRED-GPCR is a tool which queries user-supplied sequences against a database of HMMs corresponding to G-protein coupled receptor (GPCR) families in order to determine which GPCR family the query sequence most resembles.
Functions: Query and retrieval, Transmembrane protein analysis, Transmembrane protein prediction
Topics: Gene and protein families, Physiology, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: http://athina.biol.uoa.gr/bioinformatics/PRED-GPCR/
Documentation: http://athina.biol.uoa.gr/bioinformatics/PRED-GPCR/help.htm

name: Clean reads
text_content:
Tool Name: Clean reads
Description: clean_reads cleans NGS (Sanger, 454, Illumina and solid) reads.It can trim bad quality regions, adaptors, vectors and regular expressions and also filters out reads that do not meet a minimum quality criteria.
Functions: Sequence trimming, Sequencing quality control, Service invocation
Topics: Data quality management, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinf.comav.upv.es/clean_reads/
Documentation:

name: FFPred
text_content:
Tool Name: FFPred
Description: Using a machine learning approach, FFPred server predicts protein function using protein features scanned against a library of over 300 Gene Ontology annotation terms. FFPred has the capacity to annotate distant homologues and orphan protein sequences.
Functions: Gene functional annotation, Protein feature detection, Protein function prediction
Topics: Function analysis, Machine learning, Ontology and terminology, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins
Homepage: http://bioinf.cs.ucl.ac.uk/ffpred/
Documentation: http://bioinf.cs.ucl.ac.uk/index.php?id=779

name: SDPpred
text_content:
Tool Name: SDPpred
Description: SDPpred is a tool for predicting which residues of a protein determine functional differences relative to its homologues.  It takes as input an multiple sequence alignment of a protein family divided into groups based on the perceived functional differences.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: Function analysis, Gene and protein families, Protein binding sites, Protein folding, stability and design, Proteins
Homepage: http://bioinf.fbb.msu.ru/SDPpred/
Documentation:

name: CARNAC
text_content:
Tool Name: CARNAC
Description: Server which predicts conserved secondary structure elements of homologous RNAs.  The input of a set of RNA sequences are not required to be previously aligned.
Functions: RNA secondary structure alignment, RNA secondary structure analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction, Virology
Homepage: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/carnac
Documentation: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/carnac/help.php

name: MAGNOLIA
text_content:
Tool Name: MAGNOLIA
Description: MAGNOLIA is software for multiple alignment of protein coding and structural RNA sequences making use of the putative functions of these sequences. Magnolia extracts information from the similarities and differences in the data, and searches for a specific evolutionary pattern.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Multiple structure alignment, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: Gene transcripts, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/magnolia
Documentation: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/magnolia/help.php

name: mreps
text_content:
Tool Name: mreps
Description: mreps is a tool for identifing tandemn repeats in DNA sequences.
Functions: Genome feature comparison, Repeat sequence analysis, Repeat sequence detection, Repeat sequence organisation analysis, Sequence masking
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/mreps/
Documentation: http://mreps.univ-mlv.fr/tutorial.html

name: YASS
text_content:
Tool Name: YASS
Description: YASS is a genomic similarity search tool, for nucleic (DNA/RNA) sequences in fasta or plain text format (it produces local pairwise alignments).
Functions: Local alignment, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Pairwise sequence alignment, Sequence alignment validation
Topics: Genomics, Mapping, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/yass/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.lifl.fr/yass/help.php

name: WebLogo
text_content:
Tool Name: WebLogo
Description: Web-based application designed to make generate sequence logos.
Functions: Sequence cluster visualisation, Sequence motif recognition, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://weblogo.berkeley.edu/
Documentation: http://weblogo.berkeley.edu/README

name: DIAL
text_content:
Tool Name: DIAL
Description: A web server that provides structural alignment of RNA without the help of a reference genome. It takes into account nucleotide sequence similarity, dihedral angle similarity and nucleotide base-pairing similarity.
Functions: Global structure alignment, Local structure alignment, Nucleic acid structure comparison, Structure visualisation
Topics: Comparative genomics, Data mining, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/DIAL/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/DIAL/help.html

name: SeWeR
text_content:
Tool Name: SeWeR
Description: Sequence analysis tools on the web; includes nucleic acid, protein, PCR and alignment tools.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.org/sewer/
Documentation:

name: PSAR
text_content:
Tool Name: PSAR
Description: Software to the alignments in the UCSC Genome Browser to measure the reliability of alignments in different types of regions, such as coding exons and conserved non-coding regions, and use it to guide cross-species conservation study.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment validation
Topics: Data quality management, Gene transcripts, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioen-compbio.bioen.illinois.edu/psar
Documentation: http://bioen-compbio.bioen.illinois.edu/psar/

name: ProMK
text_content:
Tool Name: ProMK
Description: Method for predicting protein function using Multiple Kernels.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein properties, Proteins
Homepage: https://sites.google.com/site/guoxian85/home/promk
Documentation: https://sites.google.com/site/guoxian85/home/promk

name: PSMix
text_content:
Tool Name: PSMix
Description: R package to infer population structure using genomic markers.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetics, Population genetics
Homepage: http://zhaocenter.org/software/#Population_Genetics
Documentation: http://zhaocenter.org/labcode/PSMix/psmixreadme.txt

name: I-sites
text_content:
Tool Name: I-sites
Description: Method for predicting initiation sites of folding protein sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinfo.rpi.edu/bystrc/Isites2/
Documentation: http://www.bioinfo.rpi.edu/bystrc/Isites2/

name: JAR3D
text_content:
Tool Name: JAR3D
Description: Scores RNA hairpin and internal loop sequences against motif groups from the RNA 3D Motif Atlas, by exact sequence match for sequences already observed in 3D and by probabilistic scoring and edit distance for novel sequences.
Functions: RNA secondary structure analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://rna.bgsu.edu/jar3d
Documentation: http://www.bgsu.edu/research/rna/help/tutorials.html

name: AlignBucket
text_content:
Tool Name: AlignBucket
Description: Software for splitting a protein FASTA file into smaller pieces suitable for alignment with BLAST. The constraint used to optimize the result is the required minimum alignment coverage.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Splitting
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.biocomp.unibo.it/~giuseppe/partitioning.html
Documentation: https://github.com/profgiuseppe/alignbucket

name: Insyght
text_content:
Tool Name: Insyght
Description: Browser that helps navigate among abundant homologies, syntenies and genes annotations.
Functions: Data handling
Topics: Data management, Genetics, Microbiology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genome.jouy.inra.fr/Insyght
Documentation: http://genome.jouy.inra.fr/Insyght_doc_online/

name: MuSi
text_content:
Tool Name: MuSi
Description: Designed to analyze (aligned) gene libraries, in particular in case that codon directed mutagenesis was applied to them. The program generates several tables providing information about trinucleotide characteristics, deletions, substitutions and amino acids distributions.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Molecular genetics, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://gobics.de/ingo/musi/musi.html
Documentation: http://gobics.de/ingo/musi/musi.html

name: Vidjil
text_content:
Tool Name: Vidjil
Description: Open-source platform for the interactive analysis of high-throughput sequencing data from lymphocyte recombinations. It contains an algorithm gathering reads into clonotypes according to their V(D)J junctions, a web application made of a sample, experiment and patient database and a visualization for the analysis of clonotypes along the time.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Immunology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.vidjil.org/
Documentation: https://github.com/vidjil/vidjil

name: IMP
text_content:
Tool Name: IMP
Description: Integrated Meta-omic Pipeline. Large-scale standardized integrated analysis of coupled metagenomic and metatranscriptomic data. Incorporates robust read preprocessing, iterative co-assembly of metagenomic and metatranscriptomic data, analyses of microbial community structure and function as well as genomic signature-based visualizations.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Genome annotation, Sequence assembly
Topics: Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://r3lab.uni.lu/web/imp/
Documentation: http://r3lab.uni.lu/web/imp/doc.html

name: RUbioSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: RUbioSeq

Topics: Epigenetics, Exome sequencing, Sequencing
Homepage: http://rubioseq.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3694642/

name: NGS-Trex
text_content:
Tool Name: NGS-Trex

Documentation: https://www.ngs-trex.disit.unipmn.it/Trex/cms/index.php?page_id=6

name: Bioclojure
text_content:
Tool Name: Bioclojure
Description: Functional framework for the processing of biological sequence data that provides simple mechanisms for concurrency and lazy evaluation of large datasets.
Functions: Data retrieval
Topics: DNA, Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/s312569/clj-biosequence
Documentation: https://github.com/s312569/clj-biosequence

name: incaRNAfbinv
text_content:
Tool Name: incaRNAfbinv
Description: Fragment-based design of RNA sequences.
Functions: Nucleic acid design
Topics: RNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://www.cs.bgu.ac.il/incaRNAfbinv/
Documentation: https://www.cs.bgu.ac.il/incaRNAfbinv/Help.jsp

name: MetaSV
text_content:
Tool Name: MetaSV
Description: Accurate method-aware merging algorithm for structural variations.
Functions: Structural variation detection
Topics: Sequencing, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioinform.github.io/metasv/
Documentation: http://bioinform.github.io/metasv/

name: TargetATPsite
text_content:
Tool Name: TargetATPsite
Description: Full-featured GUI application for targeting protein-ATP binding residues in protein sequences, consisting of two parts of local client and remote server.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction
Topics: Protein binding sites, Protein interactions, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/targetATP/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/targetATP/

name: HaploSearch
text_content:
Tool Name: HaploSearch
Description: Tool for transforming DNA sequences into haplotype data and vice versa, speeding up the manipulation of large datasets.
Functions: N/A
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.haplosite.com/haplosearch/
Documentation:

name: LASAGNA-Search
text_content:
Tool Name: LASAGNA-Search
Description: Length-Aware Site Alignment Guided by Nucleotide Association algorithm for Transcription Factor Binding Site alignment. Search include (i) acceptance of unaligned variable-length TFBSs, (ii) a collection of 1726 TF models, (iii) automatic promoter sequence retrieval, (iv) visualization in the UCSC Genome Browser, and (v) gene regulatory network inference and visualization based on binding specificities.
Functions: Gene regulatory network analysis, Pathway or network comparison, Protein binding site prediction
Topics: ChIP-seq, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://biogrid-lasagna.engr.uconn.edu/lasagna_search/
Documentation:

name: WESA
text_content:
Tool Name: WESA
Description: Weighted Ensemble Solvent Accessibility.  Meta-predictor based on a weighted ensemble of five methods, for solvent accessibility of residues, using the protein sequence as input. It has an expected accuracy of 80% and the prediction can be used for structure prediction.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Structure prediction
Topics: Structure prediction
Homepage: http://pipe.scs.fsu.edu/wesa/
Documentation: http://pipe.scs.fsu.edu/wesa/helper.html

name: TFpredict
text_content:
Tool Name: TFpredict
Description: Transcription Factor predict. Combines sequence similarity searching with supervised machine learning methods for the identification of TFs and the prediction of their structural superclass.
Functions: Classification, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Proteins, Transcription, Transcription factors
Homepage: http://www.ra.cs.uni-tuebingen.de/software/TFpredict/welcome_e.html
Documentation: http://www.ra.cs.uni-tuebingen.de/software/TFpredict/doc/documentation.htm

name: SurpResi
text_content:
Tool Name: SurpResi
Description: Method for finding binding sites in proteins based on the probabilitic analysis of global radial distributions of atoms.
Functions: Prediction, Protein binding site prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Amino acids, Proteins
Homepage: http://pmbm.ippt.gov.pl/services/surpresi/cgi-bin/prediction.py
Documentation:

name: VGO
text_content:
Tool Name: VGO
Description: Viral Genome Organizer is a genome browser that can be used to display information about a genome, its genes, ORFs and start/stop codons. It can also be used to perform a regular expression search, a fuzzy motif search and a masslist search, as well as compare genomes with VOCs genome sequence database.
Functions: Database search, Genome visualisation, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://athena.bioc.uvic.ca/virology-ca-tools/vgo/
Documentation: http://virology.uvic.ca/help/tool-help/how-to/vgo-how-to/

name: Utopia
text_content:
Tool Name: Utopia
Description: User-friendly Tools for Operating Informatics Applications visualizes and analyzes bioinformatics data in a user-friendly way. Based on an ontology-driven data model, it allows to view and align protein sequences, to render complex molecular structures in 3D, and to find and use resources such as web services and data objects.
Functions: Protein analysis, Protein sequence analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Informatics
Homepage: http://utopia.cs.man.ac.uk/utopia/
Documentation:

name: TransModis
text_content:
Tool Name: TransModis
Description: Generalization of MODEM to consider sequence motif and multiple gene expression or ChIP-binding experiments to identify TF binding sites.
Functions: Microarray data analysis
Topics: ChiP, Gene expression
Homepage: http://wanglab.ucsd.edu/star/download.php
Documentation:

name: UNFOLD
text_content:
Tool Name: UNFOLD
Description: Predict the sequence of protein (un)folding events by recursive min-cut on a weighted secondary structure element graph.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Pathways, Protein folding
Homepage: http://www.cs.rpi.edu/~zaki/www-new/pmwiki.php/Software/Software#toc34
Documentation:

name: TOPS
text_content:
Tool Name: TOPS
Description: They are source code of TPOS dadabase (an enhanced database of protein structural topology).
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.leeds.ac.uk/TOPS/
Documentation:

name: TMhhcp
text_content:
Tool Name: TMhhcp
Description: It is developed to predict residue-residue contacts in alpha-helix transmembrane proteins. The predicted contacts could be further used to predict helix-helix interactions between helices.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Interactions, Proteins, Transmembrane proteins
Homepage: http://systbio.cau.edu.cn/tmhhcp/
Documentation: http://systbio.cau.edu.cn/tmhhcp/help.html

name: TMHcon
text_content:
Tool Name: TMHcon
Description: It predicts helix-helix contacts specifically within the transmembrane parts of membrane proteins. It includes predictions by two different neural networks, one developed for helix-helix contacts on all transmembrane helix pairs and one specifically tailored for the prediction of helix-helix contacts lying on non-neighboring transmembrane helices.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Networks, Proteins, Transmembrane proteins
Homepage: http://webclu.bio.wzw.tum.de/tmhcon/index.html
Documentation: http://webclu.bio.wzw.tum.de/tmhcon/instructions.html

name: ATAC Primer Tool (APT)
text_content:
Tool Name: ATAC Primer Tool (APT)
Description: A tool for designing primers and identifying accurate normalization controls for ATAC-qPCR.
Functions: Primer and probe design, Structure analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Structural biology
Homepage: https://github.com/ChangLab/ATACPrimerTool
Documentation: https://github.com/ChangLab/ATACPrimerTool

name: MAMBO
text_content:
Tool Name: MAMBO
Description: MAMBO (Metabolomic Analysis of Metagenomes using fBa and Optimization) is an algorithm which assesses and optimizes correlations between genome-scale, constraint-based metabolic models and microbial abundance profiles obtained from shotgun sequence data.
Functions: Annotation, Correlation, Network simulation
Topics: Data mining, Metabolomics, Metagenomics, Microbial ecology
Homepage: https://github.com/danielriosgarza/MAMBO
Documentation: https://github.com/danielriosgarza/MAMBO

name: Zincidentifier
text_content:
Tool Name: Zincidentifier
Description: Datasets and scripts used to apply the trained models to predict zinc-binding sites in proteins.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://protein.cau.edu.cn/zincidentifier/
Documentation: http://protein.cau.edu.cn/zincidentifier/download/readme.txt

name: Picky
text_content:
Tool Name: Picky
Description: A pipeline for detecting structural variants from third generation long read sequencing data (works on Oxford Nanopore and PacBio).
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence feature detection, Structural variation detection
Topics: Genetic variation, Oncology, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Workflows
Homepage: https://github.com/TheJacksonLaboratory/Picky
Documentation: https://github.com/TheJacksonLaboratory/Picky/wiki

name: catRAPID
text_content:
Tool Name: catRAPID
Description: Aan algorithm to estimate the binding propensity of protein-RNA pairs. By combining secondary structure, hydrogen bonding and van der Waals contributions, catRAPID predicts protein-RNA associations with great accuracy.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Interactions, Protein-RNA interaction, RNA
Homepage: http://s.tartaglialab.com/page/catrapid_group
Documentation: http://service.tartaglialab.com/static_files/shared/documentation.html

name: cbsPredict
text_content:
Tool Name: cbsPredict
Description: Given a protein structure (PDB file), cbsPredict will identify potential carbohydrate-binding sites based on detection of coplanar, aromatic residues located on the protein surface.
Functions: Detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure
Homepage: http://doxey.uwaterloo.ca/cgi-bin/cbsPredict.cgi
Documentation:

name: clasp
text_content:
Tool Name: clasp
Description: A fast and flexible fragment chainer that supports linear and sum-of-pair gap costs and uses highly time-efficient index structure, i.e., Johnson priority queues and range trees padded with Johnson priority queues. Chaining of short match fragments helps to quickly and accurately identify region of synteny that may not be found using common local alignment heuristics alone.
Functions: Local alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence assembly, Synteny
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/Software/clasp/
Documentation: http://www.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/Software/clasp/clasp.html

name: SPEPLip
text_content:
Tool Name: SPEPLip
Description: Neural network-based method, trained and tested on a set of experimentally derived signal peptides from eukaryotes and prokaryotes, that identifies the presence of sorting signals and predicts their cleavage sites.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Model organisms, Peptides, Proteins
Homepage: http://gpcr.biocomp.unibo.it/cgi/predictors/spep/pred_spepcgi.cgi
Documentation: http://gpcr.biocomp.unibo.it/oldpredictors/spep/info/

name: SPOT-Struct-DNA
text_content:
Tool Name: SPOT-Struct-DNA
Description: DNA -binding protein prediction from 3D structure.
Functions: Prediction, Protein domain prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: DNA
Homepage: http://sparks-lab.org/yueyang/server/SPOT-Struct-DNA
Documentation:

name: ScrewFit
text_content:
Tool Name: ScrewFit
Description: Characterization of protein secondary structures. It provides an efficient description of structural motifs based on simple geometrical assumptions.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Structural motifs
Homepage: http://dirac.cnrs-orleans.fr/plone/software/screwfit/screwfit/
Documentation:

name: SeSAW
text_content:
Tool Name: SeSAW
Description: Identifying functionally or evolutionarily conserved motifs in protein structures by locating sequence and structural similarities, and quantifying these at the level of individual residues. Results can be visualized in 2D, as annotated alignments, or in 3D, as structural superpositions.
Functions: Alignment, Functional mapping, Mapping, Protein sequence analysis, Query
Topics: Mapping
Homepage: http://sysimm.ifrec.osaka-u.ac.jp/sesaw.2.0/
Documentation: https://sysimm.ifrec.osaka-u.ac.jp/sesaw.2.0/about.php

name: QCS
text_content:
Tool Name: QCS
Description: New method to evaluate the quality of structure predictions, especially for template free structure prediction. It captures both global and local structural features, with emphasis on global topology.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction, Quality control, Structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure, Protein structure prediction, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://prodata.swmed.edu/QCS/
Documentation: http://prodata.swmed.edu/QCS/README.html

name: SNAP
text_content:
Tool Name: SNAP
Description: Method for evaluating/predicting effects of single amino acid substitutions on protein function. Each prediction is associated with a reliability index that correlates with accuracy and thereby enables experimentalists to zoom into the most promising predictions.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Mutation
Homepage: http://www.rostlab.org/services/SNAP/
Documentation:

name: SLPFA
text_content:
Tool Name: SLPFA
Description: Predictor for subcellular location of proteins. Uses feature vectors based on amino acid composition (frequency) and sequence alignment.

Topics: Plant, Proteins
Homepage: http://sunflower.kuicr.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~tamura/slpfa.html
Documentation:

name: iNitro-Tyr
text_content:
Tool Name: iNitro-Tyr
Description: New predictor was developed by incorporating the position-specific dipeptide propensity into the general pseudo amino acid composition for discriminating the nitrotyrosine sites from non-nitrotyrosine sites in proteins.

Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://app.aporc.org/iNitro-Tyr/
Documentation: http://app.aporc.org/iNitro-Tyr/ReadMe.html

name: Phymm
text_content:
Tool Name: Phymm
Description: A classifier for metagenomic data, that has been trained on 539 complete, curated genomes and can accurately classify reads as short as 100 base pairs
Functions: Sequence clustering, Sequence comparison, Taxonomic classification
Topics: Metagenomics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/phymmbl/index.shtml
Documentation: https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/phymmbl/README.txt

name: ProLoc-GO
text_content:
Tool Name: ProLoc-GO
Description: ProLoc-GO is an efficient sequence-based method by mining informative Gene Ontology terms for predicting protein subcellular localization.

Topics: Ontology and terminology
Homepage: http://140.113.239.45/prolocgo/
Documentation:

name: PrePPI
text_content:
Tool Name: PrePPI
Description: Database of predicted and experimentally determined protein-protein interactions (PPI) for yeast and human. Predicted interactions in the database are determined using a Bayesian framework that combines structural, functional, evolutionary and expression information.

Topics: Model organisms, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein interactions
Homepage: http://bhapp.c2b2.columbia.edu/PrePPI/
Documentation: https://bhapp.c2b2.columbia.edu/PrePPI/help.html

name: Parepro
text_content:
Tool Name: Parepro

Topics: Probability
Homepage: http://www.mobioinfor.cn/parepro/index.htm
Documentation: http://www.mobioinfor.cn/parepro/quickhelp.htm

name: PSOPIA
text_content:
Tool Name: PSOPIA
Description: PSOPIA (Prediction Server Of Protein-protein InterActions) is an AODE for predicting protein-protein interactions using three seqeucne based features; (I) sequence similarities to a known interacting protein pair, (II) statistical propensities of domain pairs observed in interacting proteins and (III) a sum of edge weights along the shortest path between homologous proteins in a PPI network.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Interactions, Protein interactions, Protein-protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://mizuguchilab.org/PSOPIA/
Documentation: http://mizuguchilab.org/PSOPIA/help.html

name: POPI
text_content:
Tool Name: POPI
Description: POPI is a SVM-based prediction server using informative physicochemical properties for predicting immunogenicity of binding peptides of MHC class I and II.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Peptides
Homepage: http://iclab.life.nctu.edu.tw/POPI/
Documentation: http://iclab.life.nctu.edu.tw/POPI/help.php

name: PHOSFER
text_content:
Tool Name: PHOSFER
Description: PHOSFER uses a novel machine-learning approach in order to predict phosphorylation sites in soybean proteins, and will be expanded to predict for other plants in the future.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Plants, Proteins
Homepage: http://saphire.usask.ca/saphire/phosfer/index.html
Documentation:

name: PFP-Pred
text_content:
Tool Name: PFP-Pred
Description: PFP-Pred is an ensemble classifier for protein fold pattern recognition

Topics: Pattern recognition
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/PFP-Pred/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/PFP-Pred/Readme.htm

name: PDART
text_content:
Tool Name: PDART
Description: PDART is a web site to compare domain architectures or proteins.

Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://cmb.bnu.edu.cn/pdart/
Documentation: http://cmb.bnu.edu.cn/cmb/pdart/getitem?it=features

name: PCI-SS
text_content:
Tool Name: PCI-SS
Description: PCI-SS is a method of predicting protein secondary structure using a PCI-based classifier and also a consensus method to combine PCI with PSIPRED.
Functions: Prediction, Protein secondary structure, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein secondary structure
Homepage: http://bioinf.sce.carleton.ca/PCISS/start.php
Documentation:

name: P.R.E.S.S.
text_content:
Tool Name: P.R.E.S.S.
Description: P.R.E.S.S. (Protein Residue-Level Structural Statistics) is an R-package developed to allow researchers to get access to and manipulate on a large set of statistical data on protein residue-level structural properties such as residue-level virtual bond lengths, virtual bond angles, and virtual torsion angles.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Statistics
Homepage: http://orion.math.iastate.edu/press/presspage/P.R.E.S.S..html
Documentation: http://orion.math.iastate.edu/press/presspage/P.R.E.S.S._files/pressData-manual.pdf

name: QTLtools
text_content:

Description: Tool set for molecular QTL discovery and analysis. It allows to go from the raw sequence data to collection of molecular Quantitative Trait Loci (QTLs) in few easy-to-perform steps.

Topics: Gene expression, Genetic variation, Population genetics
Homepage: https://qtltools.github.io/qtltools/
Documentation: https://qtltools.github.io/qtltools/

name: Stargazer
text_content:
Tool Name: Stargazer
Description: Calling star alleles of polymorphic pharmacogenes from next-generation sequencing (NGS) data.

Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Genetics, NGS
Homepage: https://stargazer.gs.washington.edu/stargazerweb/
Documentation: https://stargazer.gs.washington.edu/stargazerweb/res/documentation.html

name: SPAR
text_content:
Tool Name: SPAR
Description: Small RNA-seq Portal for Analysis of sequencing expeRiments. interactive processing, analysis, annotation and visualization of small RNA sequencing data. Supports sequencing data generated from various experimental protocols, including smRNA-seq, short total RNA sequencing, microRNA-seq, and single-cell small RNA-seq.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, RNA-Seq analysis, miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, RNA-Seq
Homepage: https://www.lisanwanglab.org/SPAR/
Documentation: https://www.lisanwanglab.org/SPAR/tutorials

name: Motif scraper
text_content:
Tool Name: Motif scraper
Description: Tool for finding matches to degenerate sequence motifs in FASTA files.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/RobersonLab/motif_scraper
Documentation: https://github.com/RobersonLab/motif_scraper

name: ProFED
text_content:
Tool Name: ProFED
Description: Profile filtering of expression data.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: Drug discovery, Protein expression, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://ebi056.uni-muenster.de:3838/profed/
Documentation: http://ebi056.uni-muenster.de:3838/profed/#tab-3022-5

name: PuLSE
text_content:
Tool Name: PuLSE

Homepage: https://github.com/stevenshave/PuLSE
Documentation: https://github.com/stevenshave/PuLSE/blob/master/README.md

name: SMARTIV
text_content:
Tool Name: SMARTIV
Description: Discovering and visualizing combined RNA sequence and structure motifs from high-throughput RNA-binding data, generated from in-vivo experiments. Predicts motifs from enriched k-mers that combine information from ranked RNA sequences and their predicted secondary structure, obtained using various folding methods. Consequently, SMARTIV generates Position Weight Matrices (PWMs) in a combined sequence and structure alphabet with assigned P-values.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, RNA secondary structure prediction, Sequence motif discovery
Topics: RNA, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://choosealicense.com
Documentation: http://nesher.bi.technion.ac.il/SMARTIV/overview.html

name: BaMM
text_content:
Tool Name: BaMM
Description: de-novo motif discovery and regulatory sequence analysis.
Discovery of regulatory motifs with higher-order Bayesian Markov Models (BaMMs)
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: ChIP-seq, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://bammmotif.mpibpc.mpg.de
Documentation: http://bammserver.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html

name: iFeature
text_content:
Tool Name: iFeature
Description: Python Toolkit and Web Server for Calculating a Wide Range of Structural and Physicochemical Feature Descriptors from Protein and Peptide Sequences.

Documentation: http://ifeature.erc.monash.edu/

name: esATAC

Topics: ChIP-seq, Epigenetics, Genomics

Documentation: https://www.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/esATAC/man/esATAC.pdf

name: AltHapAlignR
text_content:
Tool Name: AltHapAlignR

Functions: Haplotype mapping, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: https://github.com/jknightlab/AltHapAlignR
Documentation: https://github.com/jknightlab/AltHapAlignR

name: FasParser2
text_content:
Tool Name: FasParser2

Documentation: https://github.com/Sun-Yanbo/FasParser/releases/tag/untagged-71c0c548bb9e7c44a4df

name: MatrixEpistasis
text_content:
Tool Name: MatrixEpistasis

Homepage: https://github.com/fanglab/MatrixEpistasis
Documentation: https://github.com/fanglab/MatrixEpistasis/blob/master/vignettes/MatrixEpistasis-manual.pdf

name: MGmapper

Tool Name: MGmapper

Topics: Metagenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://cge.cbs.dtu.dk/services/MGmapper/
Documentation: https://cge.cbs.dtu.dk/services/MGmapper/instructions.php

name: COMER
text_content:
Tool Name: COMER

Documentation: https://github.com/bioinfo-ut/primer3_masker

name: Haystack
text_content:
Tool Name: Haystack

Homepage: https://github.com/pinellolab/haystack_bio
Documentation: https://github.com/pinellolab/haystack_bio

name: Mustguseal
text_content:
Tool Name: Mustguseal
Description: Multiple structure-guided sequence alignment of protein families.

Homepage: https://biokinet.belozersky.msu.ru/mustguseal
Documentation: https://biokinet.belozersky.msu.ru/mustguseal-protocol

name: bioBakery
text_content:

Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/biobakery/biobakery/wiki/Home
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/biobakery/biobakery/wiki/Home

name: RecoverY

name: CapSim
text_content:
Tool Name: CapSim
Description: Simulation of targeted sequencing. Given a genome sequence and a set of probes, it simulates the fragmentation, the dynamics of probe hybridization and the sequencing of the captured fragments on Illumina and PacBio sequencing platforms. The simulated data can be used for evaluating the performance of the analysis pipeline, as well as the efficiency of the probe design.
Functions: DNA substitution modelling
Topics: Preclinical and clinical studies, Sequencing, Simulation experiment
Homepage: https://github.com/Devika1/capsim
Documentation: https://github.com/Devika1/capsim

name: PaRSnIP
text_content:
Tool Name: PaRSnIP

Topics: Protein properties, Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/RedaRawi/PaRSnIP
Documentation: https://github.com/RedaRawi/PaRSnIP

name: HiCapTools
text_content:
Tool Name: HiCapTools
Description: Probe design and proximity detection for targeted chromosome conformation capture applications.
Functions: Primer and probe design
Topics: Genomics, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/sahlenlab/HiCapTools
Documentation: https://github.com/sahlenlab/HiCapTools

name: polyploid-genotyping
text_content:
Tool Name: polyploid-genotyping
Description: SNP genotyping and parameter estimation in polyploids using low-coverage sequencing data.
