Documentation: https://github.com/pblischak/polyploid-genotyping

name: QR Concordance (QRC)
text_content:
Tool Name: QR Concordance (QRC)
Description: Simple and reliable way to ensure that multiple DNA sequence data files represent the same individual person. This tool will identify any swaps that may have been made during wet lab processing or data file handling by ensuring that that two different DNA sequence data files represent the same person.
Functions: Data handling, Sequence analysis
Topics: Data management, Genomics, Molecular genetics
Homepage: http://qrcme.tech/
Documentation: http://qrcme.tech/Home/About

name: VKCDB
text_content:
Tool Name: VKCDB
Description: The Voltage-gated K(+) Channel DataBase contains full-length or nearly full-length unique channel sequences from Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryotes. Corresponding nucleotide sequences of the open reading frames corresponding to the amino acid sequences are now available and can be extracted in parallel with sets of protein sequences. Channels are categorized into subfamilies by phylogenetic analysis and by using hidden Markov model analyses.
Functions: Data retrieval, Protein sequence analysis, Query and retrieval
Topics: Model organisms, Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Proteins
Homepage: http://vkcdb.biology.ualberta.ca
Documentation:

name: GenomePartitioner
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomePartitioner
Description: Tool that permits multi-level partitioning of large scale DNA constructs for synthetic biology applications. The partitioning algorithm fragments large DNA sequences into smaller, fabricable DNA blocks sharing flanking homologies for in vitro and in vivo DNA assembly. Overlapping homology regions between adjacent DNA blocks are optimized to remove hairpin, sequence repeats and any pattern that interferes with the DNA assembly process. Segments, blocks and sub-blocks that build the blueprint for hierarchical DNA assembly are listed in a GenBank output file.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Biology, Genomics, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://christenlab.ethz.ch/GenomePartitioner/upload_form_v6.php
Documentation:

name: SoyBase
text_content:
Tool Name: SoyBase
Description: Soybean genetic database, is a comprehensive repository for curated genetics, genomics and related data resources for soybean. Contains the most current genetic, physical and genomic sequence maps integrated with qualitative and quantitative traits. SoyBase also contains the well-annotated ''Williams 82'' genomic sequence and associated data mining tools.
Functions: Gene expression QTL analysis, Genetic mapping, Mapping, Physical mapping, Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping
Topics: Genetics, Genotype and phenotype, Mapping, Plant biology, Quantitative genetics
Homepage: http://soybase.org
Documentation: https://soybase.org/tutorials/

name: LinkageMapView
text_content:
Tool Name: LinkageMapView
Description: Produces high resolution, publication ready linkage maps and quantitative trait loci maps. Input can be output from 'R/qtl', simple text or comma delimited files. Output is currently a portable document file.
Functions: QTL mapping
Topics: Data management, Data visualisation, Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/LinkageMapView/
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/LinkageMapView/LinkageMapView.pdf

name: Kmer-SSR
text_content:
Tool Name: Kmer-SSR
Description: Fast, Accurate, and Complete SSR Detection in Genomic Sequences.
Functions: Repeat sequence detection
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/ridgelab/Kmer-SSR
Documentation: https://github.com/ridgelab/Kmer-SSR

name: RiboFrame
text_content:
Tool Name: RiboFrame
Description: It is a novel method for microbial profiling based on the identification and classification of 16S rRNA sequences in non targeted metagenomics datasets. Reads overlapping the 16S rRNA genes are identified using Hidden Markov Models and a taxonomic assignment is obtained by naive Bayesian classification. All reads identified as ribosomal are coherently positioned in the 16S rRNA gene, allowing the use of the topology of the gene to instruct the abundance analysis.
Functions: Taxonomic classification
Topics: Taxonomy
Homepage: http://bioserver2.sbsc.unifi.it/bioinfo/riboframe.html
Documentation:

name: RepeatAround
text_content:
Tool Name: RepeatAround
Description: It is designed to find “direct repeats”, “inverted repeats”, “mirror repeats” and “complementary repeats”, from 3 bp to 64 bp length, in circular genomes. It processes input files directly extracted from GenBank database and several genomes can be input simultaneously. The program provides visualisation of the repeats location in the genomic structure and the search for specific motifs is also possible.
Functions: Repeat sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Simulation experiment
Homepage: http://portugene.com/repeataround.html
Documentation: http://portugene.com/repeataround.html

name: QUEEN
text_content:
Tool Name: QUEEN
Description: QUantitative Evaluation of Experimental Nmr restraints is a new software for quantifying the information contained in the experimental NMR restraints. The method is based on a description of the structure in distance space and concepts derived from information theory. It allows for an objective description of the amount of available experimental information, which is shown to be related to the positional uncertainty of the NMR ensemble.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: NMR
Homepage: http://www.cmbi.ru.nl/software/queen/
Documentation: http://www.cmbi.ru.nl/software/queen/

name: PSVS
text_content:
Tool Name: PSVS
Description: It evaluates the quality of protein structures. It integrates analyses from several widely-used structure quality evaluation tools. It provides standard constraint analyses, statistics on the PDB validation goodness-of-fit between structures and experimental data, and knowledge-based structure quality scores in standardized format suitable for database integration. Global quality measures are reported as Z scores, based on calibration with a set of high-resolution X-ray crystal structures.
Functions: Protein model validation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Data quality management, Protein structure analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://psvs-1_5-dev.nesg.org/
Documentation: http://psvs-1_5-dev.nesg.org/htdocs/psvs_help.html

name: MISTIC2
text_content:
Tool Name: MISTIC2
Description: Update to the previous server (MISTIC: calculate covariation in protein families and visualize the results.), that allows to calculate four covariation methods (MIp, mfDCA, plmDCA and gaussianDCA).
Functions: Ab initio structure prediction, Protein interaction network analysis, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Residue distance calculation, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein folding, stability and design
Homepage: https://mistic2.leloir.org.ar/
Documentation: https://mistic2.leloir.org.ar/#/help

name: PlnTFDB
text_content:
Tool Name: PlnTFDB
Description: The Plant Transcription Factor Database is an integrative database that provides putatively complete sets of transcription factors (TFs) and other transcriptional regulators (TRs) in plant species whose genomes have been completely sequenced and annotated. TF or TR gene entries include information of expressed sequence tags, 3D protein structures of homologous proteins, domain architecture and cross-links to other computational resources online.
Functions: Gene regulatory network analysis, Protein fold recognition, Protein structure comparison, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Gene and protein families, Gene expression, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Plant biology, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://plntfdb.bio.uni-potsdam.de/
Documentation: http://plntfdb.bio.uni-potsdam.de/v3.0/

name: cgDNAweb
text_content:
Tool Name: cgDNAweb
Description: Interactive visualisation of the sequence-dependent ground state, or free energy minimizing, configuration of a DNA double helical fragment as predicted by the cgDNA model.
Functions: Nucleic acid structure prediction, Visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://cgdnaweb.epfl.ch
Documentation:

name: PIVOT
text_content:
Tool Name: PIVOT
Description: Protein Interactions VisualizatiOn Tool is a Java-based tool, for visualizing protein-protein interactions. It is rich in features that help the users navigate and interpret the interactions map, as well as graph-theory algorithms for easily connecting remote proteins to the displayed map. It is currently configured to work with proteins from four different species, and present functional annotations, designations of homologs from the four species, and links to information pages.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Model organisms, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://acgt.cs.tau.ac.il/pivot/
Documentation: http://acgt.cs.tau.ac.il/pivot/

name: Phospho.ELM
text_content:
Tool Name: Phospho.ELM
Description: It is a relational database designed to store in vivo and in vitro phosphorylation data extracted from the scientific literature and phosphoproteomic analyses. The resource comprises serine, threonine and tyrosine non-redundant phosphorylation sites. New features include: structural disorder/order and accessibility information and a conservation score. Additionally, the conservation of the phosphosites can be visualized directly on the multiple sequence alignment used for the score calculation.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Literature and language, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://phospho.elm.eu.org
Documentation: http://phospho.elm.eu.org/help.html

name: PEMer
text_content:
Tool Name: PEMer
Description: The package is composed of three modules, PEMer workflow, SV-Simulation and BreakDB. PEMer workflow is a sensitive software for detecting SVs from paired-end sequence reads. SV-Simulation randomly introduces SVs into a given genome and generates simulated paired-end reads from the ‘novel’ genome. Subsequent analysis with PEMer workflow on the simulated reads can facilitate parameterize PEMer workflow.
Functions: Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA structural variation
Homepage: http://sv.gersteinlab.org/pemer/
Documentation:

name: Non-B DB
text_content:
Tool Name: Non-B DB
Description: It is a non-canonical (non-B) structure database database integrating annotations and analysis of non-B DNA-forming sequence motifs. The database provides alternative DNA structure predictions, including Z-DNA motifs, quadruplex-forming motifs, inverted repeats, mirror repeats and direct repeats and their associated subsets of cruciforms, triplex and slipped structures, respectively.
Functions: DNA structure prediction, Quadruplex formation site detection, Query and retrieval, Repeat sequence analysis, Sequence feature detection
Topics: DNA, DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: https://nonb-abcc.ncifcrf.gov/apps/nBMST/default/
Documentation: https://nonb-abcc.ncifcrf.gov/apps/site/help_nBMST

name: mESAdb
text_content:
Tool Name: mESAdb
Description: microRNA expression and sequence analysis database is a database for the multivariate analysis of sequences and expression of microRNAs from multiple taxa. The database primarily comprises mature microRNA sequences and their target data, along with selected human, mouse and zebrafish expression data sets.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Sequence analysis, microRNA detection
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Microarray experiment, Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://konulab.fen.bilkent.edu.tr/mirna/
Documentation: http://konulab.fen.bilkent.edu.tr/mirna/user_manual/Overview.php

name: INTREPED
text_content:
Tool Name: INTREPED
Description: INTeractive dna REPair prEDiction is a collection of services for predicting properties relating to DNA repair. DNA repair is thought to exist in all organisms that have an active metabolism, and repair systems are crucial for repairing many types of DNA damage. External damage includes (but is not limited to) ionizing (UV) radiation, tobacco smoke, and chemical alteration. Examples of internal damage are DNA copying errors, oxygen byproducts resulting from metabolism, and hydrolysis.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Metabolism, Organisms
Homepage: http://sunflower.kuicr.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~jbbrown/dnaRepairPrediction/v2/index.py
Documentation: http://sunflower.kuicr.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~jbbrown/dnaRepairPrediction/v2/introduction.py

name: VEXOR
text_content:
Tool Name: VEXOR
Description: Integrative environment for prioritization of functional variants in fine-mapping analysis.

Documentation: http://romix.genome.ulaval.ca/vexor/UserManual_v01.pdf

name: GMV
text_content:
Tool Name: GMV
Description: The pipeline runs PRODIGAL gene predictions on all genomes, runs pan-reciprocal BLAST, and identifies ortholog sets. For a set of orthologous genes, if the positions of the PRODIGAL selected starts coincide in a multiple sequence alignment, they are accepted. If they do not coincide, a consistent start position is sought where a majority of the highest-scoring PRODIGAL selected sites coincide. If such a position is found, it is accepted, and the predictions are changed for the outlying genes.
Functions: Gene prediction, Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://code.google.com/p/gmv/
Documentation: https://code.google.com/archive/p/gmv/

name: ERGO Genome Analysis and Discovery System
text_content:
Tool Name: ERGO Genome Analysis and Discovery System
Description: Provides a systems-biology informatics toolkit centered on comparative genomics to capture, query and visualize sequenced genomes. Building upon the most comprehensive genomic database available anywhere integrated with the largest collection of microbial metabolic and non-metabolic pathways and using Igenbio's proprietary algorithms, it assigns functions to genes, integrates genes into pathways, and identifies previously unknown or mischaracterized genes, cryptic pathways and gene products.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Metabolic network modelling, Pathway or network analysis, SNP annotation, SNP detection, Sequence alignment, Sequence annotation
Topics: Comparative genomics, DNA polymorphism, Exome sequencing, Functional genomics, GWAS study, Gene structure, Metagenomics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Phylogenetics, Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://igenbio.com/ergo_bioinformatics_and_analysis
Documentation: https://www.igenbio.com/ergo#features

name: ONETOOL
text_content:
Tool Name: ONETOOL
Description: Implements the properties of well-known existing family data analysis tools and recently developed methods in a computationally efficient manner, and so is suitable for analyzing the vast amount of variant data available from sequencing family members, providing a rich choice of analysis methods for big data on families.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: Genetics, Phylogeny, Sequencing
Homepage: http://healthstat.snu.ac.kr/software/onetool/index.php
Documentation: http://healthstat.snu.ac.kr/software/onetool/pages/tutorial_new.php

name: BART
text_content:
Tool Name: BART
Description: Transcription factor prediction tool with query gene sets or epigenomic profiles.
Functions: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Epigenomics, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://faculty.virginia.edu/zanglab/bart/
Documentation: http://faculty.virginia.edu/zanglab/bart/#tutorial

text_content:
Tool Name: LZW-Kernel

Homepage: https://github.com/kfattila/LZW-Kernel
Documentation: https://github.com/kfattila/LZW-Kernel

text_content:

Description: Graph-based clustering and annotation for improved de novo transcriptome analysis.

Topics: Mapping, Sequence analysis, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://github.com/COMBINE-lab/grouper
Documentation: https://github.com/COMBINE-lab/grouper

name: ConSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: ConSeq
Description: Predicts functionally and structurally important amino acid residues in protein sequences. The predictions are based on the assumptions that residues of functional importance are often conserved and solvent-accessible, and those of structural importance are often conserved and located in the protein core. A multiple sequence alignment is used to predict the relative solvent accessibility state and the evolutionary rate at each residue.
Functions: Accessible surface calculation, Protein fold recognition, Protein model validation, Residue interaction prediction, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
Topics: Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein interactions, Small molecules, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://conseq.bioinfo.tau.ac.il/
Documentation: http://consurf.tau.ac.il/2016/quick_help.php

name: Candida genome database CGD
text_content:
Tool Name: Candida genome database CGD
Description: Provides online access to genomic sequence data and manually curated functional information about genes and proteins of the human pathogen Candida albicans. Two tools have been added to the DB. The Biochemical Pathways tool provides visualization of metabolic pathways and analysis tools that facilitate interpretation of experimental data, including results of large-scale experiments, in the context of Candida metabolism.
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene functional annotation, Literature search, Pathway or network analysis, Text annotation
Topics: Endocrinology and metabolism, Experimental design and studies, Model organisms, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks
Homepage: http://www.candidagenome.org/
Documentation: http://www.candidagenome.org/HelpContents.shtml

name: CAMP
text_content:
Tool Name: CAMP
Description: Collection of Anti-Microbial Peptides is a free online database that is manually curated and currently holds 3782 antimicrobial sequences. These sequences are divided into experimentally validated and predicted datasets based on their reference literature. Information like source organism, activity, reference literature, target and non-target organisms of AMPs are captured in the database. Prediction and sequence analysis tools, including BLAST, are integrated in the database.
Functions: Antimicrobial resistance prediction, Peptide database search, Sequence feature detection, Validation
Topics: Model organisms, Small molecules, Virology
Homepage: http://bicnirrh.res.in/antimicrobial
Documentation: http://www.camp.bicnirrh.res.in/campHelp.php

name: Bis-SNP
text_content:
Tool Name: Bis-SNP
Description: A package based on the Genome Analysis Toolkit map-reduce framework for genotyping in bisulfite treated massively parallel sequencing on Illumina platform. It uses bayesian inference with either manually specified or automatically estimated methylation probabilities of different cytosine context(not only CpG, CHH, CHG in Bisulfite-seq, but also GCH et.al. in other bisulfite treated sequencing) to determine genotypes and methylation levels simultaneously.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Methylation analysis, SNP detection
Topics: Epigenetics, Genotype and phenotype, Sequencing
Homepage: http://people.csail.mit.edu/dnaase/bissnp2011/
Documentation: http://people.csail.mit.edu/dnaase/bissnp2011/BisSNP-UserGuide-latest.pdf

name: Allegro
text_content:
Tool Name: Allegro
Description: It does simultaneous discovery of cis-regulatory motifs and their associated expression profiles. Its input are DNA sequences (typically, promoters or 3′ UTRs) and genome-wide expression profiles. Its output is the set of motifs found, and for each motif the set of genes it regulates (its transcriptional module). It is highly efficient and can analyze expression profiles of thousands of genes, measured across dozens of experimental conditions, along with all regulatory sequences in the genome.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://acgt.cs.tau.ac.il/allegro/
Documentation: http://acgt.cs.tau.ac.il/allegro/overview.html

name: ProximID
text_content:
Tool Name: ProximID
Description: An approach for building a cellular network based on physical cell interaction and single-cell mRNA sequencing (for cell type identification). It can be used to discover new preferential cellular interactions without prior knowledge of component cell types.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, RNA-Seq
Homepage: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41592-018-0009-z#Ack1
Documentation:

name: cellAlign
text_content:
Tool Name: cellAlign
Description: A method for comparing expression dynamics within and between single-cell differentiation trajectories.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Pathway or network prediction
Topics: Cell biology, Developmental biology, Gene expression
Homepage: https://github.com/shenorrLab/cellAlign
Documentation: https://github.com/shenorrLab/cellAlign

name: PRICE
text_content:
Tool Name: PRICE
Description: A method to identify open reading frames (ORF) using Ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) experiments embedded in a pipeline for data analysis. It is part of GEDI software platform.
Functions: Coding region prediction, Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA binding sites, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/erhard-lab/price
Documentation: https://github.com/erhard-lab/gedi

name: Branchpointer
text_content:
Tool Name: Branchpointer
Description: Predicts branchpoint probability for sites in intronic branchpoint windows. Queries can be supplied as intronic regions; or to evaluate the effects of mutations, SNPs.
Functions: Splicing model analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Genetic variation, Human biology, Machine learning, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/branchpointer.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/branchpointer/inst/doc/branchpointer.pdf

name: Biostrings
text_content:
Tool Name: Biostrings
Description: Memory efficient string containers, string matching algorithms, and other utilities, for fast manipulation of large biological sequences or sets of sequences.
Functions: Loading, Sequence analysis
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Biostrings.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Biostrings.html

name: REMP
text_content:
Tool Name: REMP
Description: Machine learning-based tools to predict DNA methylation of locus-specific repetitive elements (RE) by learning surrounding genetic and epigenetic information. These tools provide genomewide and single-base resolution of DNA methylation prediction on RE that are difficult to measure using array-based or sequencing-based platforms, which enables epigenome-wide association study (EWAS) and differentially methylated region (DMR) analysis on RE.
Functions: Alignment, Differentially-methylated region identification, Gene prediction, Standardisation and normalisation, Validation
Topics: Epigenetics, Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/REMP.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/REMP/man/REMP.pdf

name: IntEREst
text_content:
Tool Name: IntEREst
Description: This package performs Intron-Exon Retention analysis on RNA-seq data (.bam files).
Functions: Alignment, Differential protein expression analysis, Splicing model analysis, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/IntEREst.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/IntEREst/man/IntEREst.pdf

name: EventPointer
text_content:
Tool Name: EventPointer
Description: It identifies alternative splicing events that involve either simple or complex experimental designs such as time course experiments and studies including paired-samples. The algorithm can be used to analyze data from either junction arrays or sequencing data. The algorithm can generate a series of files to visualize the detected alternative splicing events in IGV. This eases the interpretation of results and the design of primers for standard PCR validation.
Functions: Splicing model analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, RNA splicing, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/EventPointer.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/EventPointer/man/EventPointer.pdf

name: DaMiRseq
text_content:
Tool Name: DaMiRseq
Description: Tidy pipeline of data mining
procedures to identify transcriptional biomarkers and exploit
them for both binary and multi-class classification purposes.
Functions: Classification, RNA-Seq analysis, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Data mining, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DaMiRseq.html
Documentation: https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/DaMiRseq/man/DaMiRseq.pdf

name: DEsingle
text_content:
Tool Name: DEsingle
Description: It defines and detects 3 types of differentially expressed genes between two groups of single cells, with regard to different expression status (DEs), differential expression abundance (DEa), and general differential expression (DEg). DEsingle employs Zero-Inflated Negative Binomial model to estimate the proportion of real and dropout zeros and to define and detect the 3 types of DE genes.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DEsingle.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/DEsingle/man/DEsingle.pdf

name: BUMHMM
text_content:
Tool Name: BUMHMM
Description: This is a probabilistic modelling pipeline for computing per- nucleotide posterior probabilities of modification from the data collected in structure probing experiments. The model supports multiple experimental replicates and empirically corrects coverage- and sequence-dependent biases. The model utilises the measure of a "drop-off rate" for each nucleotide.
Functions: Classification, Regression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Gene regulation, Genetic variation, Genetics, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Structure prediction, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BUMHMM.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/BUMHMM/man/BUMHMM.pdf

name: BASiCS
text_content:
Tool Name: BASiCS
Description: Bayesian Analysis of Single-Cell Sequencing data is an integrated Bayesian hierarchical model to perform statistical analyses of single-cell RNA sequencing datasets in the context of supervised experiments. It could perform built-in data normalisation and technical noise quantification. BASiCS provides an intuitive detection criterion for highly variable genes within a single group of cells. Also, it can compare gene expression patterns between two or more pre-specified groups of cells.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Cell biology, Gene expression, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BASiCS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/BASiCS/man/BASiCS.pdf

name: ATACseqQC
text_content:
Tool Name: ATACseqQC
Description: an assay for Transposase-Accessible Chromatin using sequencing, is a rapid and sensitive method for chromatin accessibility analysis. It was developed as an alternative method to MNase-seq, FAIRE-seq and DNAse-seq.
Functions: Gene regulatory network analysis
Topics: DNA packaging, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ATACseqQC.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/ATACseqQC/man/ATACseqQC.pdf

name: seqCAT
text_content:
Tool Name: seqCAT
Description: This package uses variant calling data (in the form of VCF files) from high throughput sequencing technologies to authenticate and validate the source, function and characteristics of biological samples used in scientific endeavours.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seqCAT.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/seqCAT/man/seqCAT.pdf

name: runibic
text_content:
Tool Name: runibic
Description: This package implements UbiBic algorithm in R. This biclustering algorithm for analysis of gene expression data was introduced by Zhenjia Wang et al. in 2016. It is currently considered the most promising biclustering method for identification of meaningful structures in complex and noisy data.
Functions: Clustering
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/runibic.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/runibic/man/runibic.pdf

name: RNAither
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAither
Description: This tool analyzes cell-based RNAi screens, including quality assessment, customizable normalization and statistical tests, leading to lists of significant genes and biological processes.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Computer science
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RNAither.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RNAither.html

name: recount_Bioconductor
text_content:
Tool Name: recount_Bioconductor
Description: Using this package, you can download RangedSummarizedExperiment objects at the gene, exon or exon-exon junctions level, the raw counts, the phenotype metadata used, the urls to the sample coverage bigWig files or the mean coverage bigWig file for a particular study. The RangedSummarizedExperiment objects can be used by different packages for performing differential expression analysis.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/recount.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/recount/man/recount.pdf

name: COFACTOR
text_content:
Tool Name: COFACTOR
Description: Structure-based multiple-level protein function predictions. By structurally threading low-resolution structural models through the BioLiP library, it infers three categories of protein functions including gene ontology, enzyme commission and ligand-binding sites from various analogous and homologous function templates.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Protein function prediction, Protein modelling, Protein threading
Topics: Function analysis, Protein binding sites, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/COFACTOR
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/COFACTOR/help.html

name: HISEA
text_content:
Tool Name: HISEA
Description: Efficient all-vs-all long read aligner for SMRT sequencing data.
Functions: Genome assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/lucian-ilie/HISEA
Documentation: https://github.com/lucian-ilie/HISEA/blob/master/README.md

name: htSeqTools
text_content:
Tool Name: htSeqTools
Description: We provide efficient, easy-to-use tools for High-Throughput Sequencing (ChIP-seq, RNAseq etc.). These include MDS plots (analogues to PCA), detecting inefficient immuno-precipitation or over-amplification artifacts, tools to identify and test for genomic regions with large accumulation of reads, and visualization of coverage profiles.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/htSeqTools.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/htSeqTools.html

name: dmrseq
text_content:
Tool Name: dmrseq
Description: Scan the genome to detect and perform accurate inference on differentially methylated regions from Whole Genome Bisulfite Sequencing data. The method is based on comparing detected regions to a pooled null distribution, that can be implemented even when as few as two samples per population are available.
Functions: Comparison, Differentially-methylated region identification, Regression analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Functional genomics, Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/dmrseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/dmrseq/man/dmrseq.pdf

name: GEM-Tools
text_content:
Tool Name: GEM-Tools
Description: C API and a Python module to support and simplify usage of the GEM Mapper.
Functions: Mapping
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/gemtools/gemtools
Documentation: https://github.com/gemtools/gemtools

Tool Name: AgiMicroRna

Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/AgiMicroRna.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/AgiMicroRna.html

Homepage: https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PathwaySplice.html
Documentation: https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/PathwaySplice/man/PathwaySplice.pdf

Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/a4Reporting.html

name: propr
text_content:
Tool Name: propr

text_content:

Description: Web server that can discover motifs that are enriched in sets of nucleotide sequences provided by the user. It uses a new approach for finding enriched motifs: It directly optimizes the statistical significance of enrichment for PWMs. It can also score conservation and positional clustering of motifs. In several benchmarks on yeast and metazoan sequences, the underlying XXmotif method showed better sensitivity and produced PWMs of higher quality than state-of-the-art tools.

Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs

name: RAVEN Toolbox
text_content:
Tool Name: RAVEN Toolbox
Description: The RAVEN (Reconstruction, Analysis and Visualization of Metabolic Networks) Toolbox 2 is a software suite for Matlab that allows for semi-automated reconstruction of genome-scale models (GEMs). It makes use of published models and/or KEGG, MetaCyc databases, coupled with extensive gap-filling and quality control features. The software suite also contains methods for visualizing simulation results and omics data, as well as a range of methods for performing simulations and analyzing the results. The software is a useful tool for system-wide data analysis in a metabolic context and for streamlined reconstruction of metabolic networks based on protein homology.
Functions: Metabolic network modelling, Pathway or network analysis, Pathway or network prediction
Topics: Bioengineering, Computational biology, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Systems biology
Homepage: https://github.com/SysBioChalmers/RAVEN
Documentation: https://github.com/SysBioChalmers/RAVEN/wiki

name: BamTools
text_content:
Tool Name: BamTools
Description: BamTools provides a fast, flexible C++ API & toolkit for reading, writing, and managing BAM files.
Functions: Data handling, Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/pezmaster31/bamtools
Documentation: https://github.com/pezmaster31/bamtools/wiki

name: GEMMA
text_content:
Tool Name: GEMMA
Description: Test for association in genome-wide association studies (GWAS) using a standard linear mixed model to account for population stratification and sample structure. It calculates exact Wald or likelihood ratio test statistics and p-values, and is computationally efficient for large GWAS.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Genotype and phenotype, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.xzlab.org/software.html
Documentation: http://www.xzlab.org/software/GEMMAmanual.pdf

name: CNVnator
text_content:
Tool Name: CNVnator
Description: CNV discovery and genotyping from read-depth analysis of personal genome sequencing.
Functions: Genotyping
Topics: Genetics, Genomics, Genotype and phenotype, Human biology
Homepage: https://github.com/abyzovlab/CNVnator
Documentation: https://github.com/abyzovlab/CNVnator/blob/master/README

name: Cortex
text_content:
Tool Name: Cortex
Description: Cortex is an efficient and low-memory software framework for analysis of genomes using sequence data. Cortex allows de novo assembly of variants without having to do a consensus assembly first. Also allows comparison of genomes without using consensus, and alignment of sequence data to a de Bruijn graph
Functions: Sequence assembly, Variant calling
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: http://cortexassembler.sourceforge.net/index.html
Documentation: http://cortexassembler.sourceforge.net/cortex_var_user_manual.pdf

name: Oligonucleotide Search
text_content:
Tool Name: Oligonucleotide Search
Description: Web-based tool for evaluating the propensity of primers to hybridize to similar sequences throughout the genome.
Functions: Primer and probe design
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://compbio.med.wayne.edu/software/index.html
Documentation: http://compbio.med.wayne.edu/software/index.html

name: SEQMINER
text_content:
Tool Name: SEQMINER
Description: An R package for annotating and querying files of sequence variants (e.g., VCF/BCF files) and summary association statistics (e.g., METAL/RAREMETAL files), and for integrating bioinformatics databases.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequence annotation
Topics: Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://seqminer.genomic.codes/
Documentation: http://seqminer.genomic.codes/

name: SANA
text_content:
Tool Name: SANA
Description: An algorithm for the alignment of two proteins. Specifically, core regions in two protein structures are first aligned by identifying connected components in a network of neighboring, geometrically compatible aligned fragment pairs (AFPs). The initial alignments then are refined through a multi-objective optimization method. The algorithm can produce both sequential and non-sequential alignments.
Functions: Structure alignment
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://doc.aporc.org/wiki/SANA
Documentation: http://doc.aporc.org/wiki/SANA

name: GIPS
text_content:
Tool Name: GIPS
Description: Software which considers a range of experimental and analysis choices in sequencing-based forward genetics studies within an integrated probabilistic framework, which enables direct gene cloning from the sequencing of several unrelated mutants of the same phenotype without the need to create segregation populations.
Functions: Genotyping
Topics: Genetics, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/synergy-zju/gips/wiki
Documentation: https://github.com/synergy-zju/gips/wiki

name: JABAWS
text_content:
Tool Name: JABAWS
Description: Collection of web services for bioinformatics, and currently provides services that make it easy to access well-known multiple sequence It is free software which provides web services conveniently packaged to run on your local computer, server, cluster or Amazon EC2 instance.
Functions: Service composition
Topics: Bioinformatics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/jabaws/

name: LEVER
text_content:
Tool Name: LEVER
Description: Collection of software tools for analyzing the development of proliferating (dividing) cells in time-lapse microscopy image sequences. It includes algorithms for segmentation, tracking and lineaging. It also includes a user interface that allows the segmentation, tracking and lineaging results to be validated, with any errors in the automated processing easily identified and quickly corrected.
Functions: Image analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Light microscopy
Homepage: https://bioimage.coe.drexel.edu/mp/lever/
Documentation: https://bioimage.coe.drexel.edu/mp/lever/index.php/sample-movies/

name: TRANSIT
text_content:
Tool Name: TRANSIT
Description: A tool for the analysis of Tn-Seq data. It provides an easy to use graphical interface and access to three different analysis methods that allow the user to determine essentiality in a single condition as well as between conditions.
Functions: Transposon prediction
Topics: DNA, Mobile genetic elements, Sequencing
Homepage: http://saclab.tamu.edu/essentiality/transit/
Documentation: http://transit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: SINA
text_content:
Tool Name: SINA
Description: Aligns and optionally taxonomically classifies your rRNA gene sequences.

Reference based multiple sequence alignment
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis, Structure-based sequence alignment, Taxonomic classification
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Taxonomy
Homepage: https://sina.readthedocs.io
Documentation: https://github.com/epruesse/SINA

name: GenoCrypt beta
text_content:
Tool Name: GenoCrypt beta
Description: Method for identifying genetic relatives without compromising privacy by taking advantage of novel cryptographic techniques customized for secure and private comparison of genetic information.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction
Topics: Genetics, Molecular genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genetics.cs.ucla.edu/crypto/
Documentation: http://genetics.cs.ucla.edu/crypto/manual.html

name: MotifCut 0.1 beta
text_content:
Tool Name: MotifCut 0.1 beta
Description: DNA motif-finding algorithm using a Maximum Density Subgraph.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://motifcut.stanford.edu/
Documentation: http://motifcut.stanford.edu/help.html

name: Typhon Beta
text_content:
Tool Name: Typhon Beta
Description: An algorithm for building an index from a multiple alignment for use in seeding local alignments to a query sequence.
Functions: Indexing
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://ai.stanford.edu/~flannick/typhon/
Documentation: http://ai.stanford.edu/~flannick/typhon/pages/manual/index.html

name: Atlas2
text_content:
Tool Name: Atlas2
Description: Next-generation sequencing suite of variant analysis tools specializing in the separation of true SNPs and insertions and deletions (indels) from sequencing and mapping errors in Whole Exome Capture Sequencing (WECS) data.
Functions: Exome assembly, Mapping
Topics: DNA, Exome sequencing, Mapping, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.hgsc.bcm.edu/software/atlas-2
Documentation: https://www.hgsc.bcm.edu/software/atlas-2

name: HTSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: HTSeq
Description: Python framework to process and analyse high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://htseq.readthedocs.io/en/release_0.9.1/
Documentation: http://htseq.readthedocs.io/en/release_0.9.1/overview.html#documentation-overview

name: SVDetect
text_content:
Tool Name: SVDetect
Description: Identifies genomic structural variations from paired-end and mate-pair next-generation sequencing data produced by the Illumina GA and ABI SOLiD platforms. Applying both sliding-window and clustering strategies, we use anomalously mapped read pairs provided by current short read aligners to localize genomic rearrangements and classify them according to their type, e.g. large insertions-deletions, inversions, duplications and balanced or unbalanced inter-chromosomal translocations
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: DNA structural variation
Homepage: http://svdetect.sourceforge.net/Site/Home.html
Documentation: http://svdetect.sourceforge.net/Site/Manual.html

name: Ensembl Genomes Fungi sequence search
text_content:

name: ARB
text_content:
Tool Name: ARB
Description: The ARB software is a graphically oriented package comprising various tools for sequence database handling and data analysis. A central database of processed (aligned) sequences and any type of additional data linked to the respective sequence entries is structured according to phylogeny or other user defined criteria
Functions: Base position variability plotting, DNA translation, Global alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Phylogenetic tree annotation, Phylogenetic tree editing, Phylogenetic tree visualisation, RNA secondary structure prediction, Sequence alignment comparison, Sequence alignment conversion, Sequence alignment editing, Sequence clustering, Sequence database search (by property), Sequence distance matrix generation, Sequence masking, Sequence similarity search, Structure editing, Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://arb-home.de
Documentation:

name: HybridCheck
text_content:
Tool Name: HybridCheck
Description: Software package to visualise the recombination signal in large DNA sequence dataset, and it can be used to analyse recombination, genetic introgression, hybridisation and horizontal gene transfer.
Functions: Sequence visualisation, Visualisation
Topics: DNA, DNA replication and recombination, Data visualisation, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/BenJWard/HybridCheck
Documentation: http://ward9250.github.io/HybridCheck/about.html

name: ArrayExpress
text_content:
Tool Name: ArrayExpress
Description: Public repository of functional genomics data supporting publications. It includes data generated by sequencing or array-based technologies.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Gene expression clustering, Gene expression profiling, Query and retrieval, Simulated gene expression data generation
Topics: Functional genomics, Gene expression
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/arrayexpress
Documentation: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/arrayexpress/help/index.html

name: HOGENOM
text_content:
Tool Name: HOGENOM
Description: It allows selection of sets of homologous genes among species, and visualisation of multiple alignments and phylogenetic trees. It is useful for comparative sequence analysis, phylogeny, molecular evolution studies and to get a view of what is known about a peculiar gene family.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Comparative genomics, Gene and protein families, Phylogenetics, Phylogenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/databases/hogenom3.html
Documentation: http://doua.prabi.fr/databases/hogenom/home.php?contents=methods

name: SNPmasker
text_content:
Tool Name: SNPmasker
Description: Comprehensive web interface for masking SNPs and all low-complexity regions or repeats found in large eukaryotic genomes.
Functions: Sequence masking
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/snpmasker/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/snpmasker/

name: Homologous vertebrate genes database (HOVERGEN)
text_content:
Tool Name: Homologous vertebrate genes database (HOVERGEN)
Description: This database allows selection of sets of homologous genes among vertebrate species, and visualisation of multiple alignments and phylogenetic trees. It is particularly useful for comparative sequence analysis, phylogeny and molecular evolution studies or more generally, for an overall view of what is known about a peculiar gene family.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Comparative genomics, Gene and protein families, Phylogenetics, Phylogenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/databases/hovergen.html
Documentation: http://pbil.univ-lyon1.fr/databases/hovergen.php

name: MultiPLX
text_content:
Tool Name: MultiPLX
Description: Tool that uses state-of-the-art nearest neighbour DNA binding thermodynamics to estimate possible unwanted pairings between PCR samples and calculates automatically optimal multiplexing (grouping) solution.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: PCR experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/multiplx
Documentation: http://bioinfo.ut.ee/multiplx/

name: SwissRegulon
text_content:
Tool Name: SwissRegulon
Description: SwissRegulon is a database of genome-wide annotations of regulatory sites. It contains annotations for 17 prokaryotes and 3 eukaryotes. The database frontend offers an intuitive interface showing genomic information in a clear and comprehensible graphical form.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction, Sequence alignment
Topics: Gene transcripts, Genomics, Sequence analysis, Systems biology, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://swissregulon.unibas.ch/sr/
Documentation: http://swissregulon.unibas.ch/sr/documentation

name: ISMARA
text_content:
Tool Name: ISMARA
Description: Models genome-wide expression data in terms of our genome-wide annotations of regulatory sites. For a given expression data-set it infers the key transcription regulators, their sample-dependent activities, and their genome-wide targets.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods)
Topics: Functional genomics, Gene transcripts, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein expression, Sequence analysis, Systems biology, Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://ismara.unibas.ch/mara/
Documentation: https://ismara.unibas.ch/fcgi/mara

name: BEAP
text_content:
Tool Name: BEAP
Description: BEAP uses a short starting DNA fragment, often a EST or partial gene segment, as “primer”, to recursively blast nucleotide databases in an attempt to obtain all sequences that overlaps, directly or indirectly, with the “primer” therefore help to “extend” the length of the original sequence for constructing a “full length” sequence for functional analysis, or at least to obtain neighboring regions of the segment for SNP discovery and linkage disequilibrium analysis.
Functions: Linkage disequilibrium calculation, Read mapping, SNP detection, Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.animalgenome.org/bioinfo/tools/beap/
Documentation: https://www.animalgenome.org/bioinfo/tools/beap/userguide.html

name: SOAP
text_content:
Tool Name: SOAP
Description: Short Oligonucleotide Analysis Package. Efficient gapped and ungapped alignment of short oligonucleotides onto reference sequences and full solution to next generation sequencing data analysis.
Functions: Read mapping, Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://soap.genomics.org.cn/
Documentation: http://soap.genomics.org.cn/

name: Waggawagga
text_content:
Tool Name: Waggawagga
Description: Web-based and command-line tool for the comparative visualization of coiled-coil predictions and the detection of stable single a-helices (SAH domains).

Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://waggawagga.motorprotein.de/
Documentation: http://waggawagga.motorprotein.de/request/doc

text_content:

Documentation: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/Help.jsp?toolName=CRISPRmap

name: HotNet2
text_content:
Tool Name: HotNet2

Homepage: https://github.com/raphael-group/hotnet2
Documentation: https://github.com/raphael-group/hotnet2

name: A-DaGO-Fun
text_content:
Tool Name: A-DaGO-Fun
Description: Python library that provides a comprehensive and customized set of Gene Ontology (GO) based functional analysis tools that exploit the biological knowledge that GO offers in describing genes or groups of genes through the use of GO semantic similarity measures for biological knowledge discovery.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://web.cbio.uct.ac.za/ITGOM/adagofun/
Documentation: http://web.cbio.uct.ac.za/ITGOM/adagofun/

name: misFinder
text_content:
Tool Name: misFinder
Description: Tool that aims to identify the assembly errors with high accuracy in an unbiased way and correct these errors at their mis-assembled positions to improve the assembly accuracy for downstream analysis.

Topics: Data quality management, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://github.com/hitbio/misFinder
Documentation: https://github.com/hitbio/misFinder/blob/master/README

name: EBI patent sequence database
text_content:
Tool Name: EBI patent sequence database
Description: Collection of non-redundant patent sequence databases, which cover the EMBL-Bank nucleotides patent class and the patent protein databases and contain value-added annotations from patent documents.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Sequence database search, Sequence database search (by property), Sequence similarity search

Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/patentdata/nr/
Documentation: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/sites/ebi.ac.uk/files/groups/external_services/patentdata/Non-redundant%20databases-user%20manual_v4.pdf

name: HHblits
text_content:
Tool Name: HHblits
Description: The first iterative method based on the pairwise comparison of profile Hidden Markov Models. In benchmarks it achieves better runtimes than other iterative sequence search methods such as PSI-BLAST or HMMER3 by using a fast prefilter based on profile-profile comparison. Furthermore, it greatly improves upon PSI-BLAST and HMMER3 in terms of sensitivity/selectivity and alignment quality.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/#/tools/hhblits
Documentation: https://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/#/tools/hhblits

name: AllerTOP
text_content:
Tool Name: AllerTOP
Description: Server for in silico prediction of allergens based on the main physicochemical properties of proteins.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Function analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.ddg-pharmfac.net/AllerTOP/
Documentation: http://www.ddg-pharmfac.net/AllerTOP/method.html

name: CCSOL
text_content:
Tool Name: CCSOL
Description: Predictor of protein solubility based on the physicochemical properties of amino acid sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis

Homepage: http://s.tartaglialab.com/new_submission/ccsol
Documentation: http://s.tartaglialab.com/static_files/shared/Agostini_JMB_2012.pdf

text_content:

Documentation: http://allerdictor.vbi.vt.edu/home/

text_content:

Description: Base-pairing profile local alignment is a powerful method that evaluates the similarity between a pair of RNAs taking into account secondary structure information. Based on the accurate similarity calculated by BPLA kernel, you can perform a broad range of structural RNA analysis, including family prediction, hierarchical clustering, and remote homology search.
Functions: Clustering, Local alignment
Topics: RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bpla-kernel.dna.bio.keio.ac.jp/
Documentation: http://bpla-kernel.dna.bio.keio.ac.jp/

name: bPE toolkit
text_content:
Tool Name: bPE toolkit
Description: This toolkit consists of 5 independent programs, that can be incorporated in a pipeline of various protein structure files. The programs include tools for chirality check for amino acids (ProChiral), contact map generation (CoMa), data redundancy (DaRe), hydrogen bond potential energy (HyPE) and electrostatic interaction energy (EsInE).
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://www.iitg.ac.in/bpetoolkit/
Documentation: http://www.iitg.ac.in/bpetoolkit/

name: THEME
text_content:

Documentation: https://www.zbh.uni-hamburg.de/fileadmin/gi/tallymer/tallymer.pdf

name: SSAHA
text_content:
Tool Name: SSAHA
Description: Sequence Search and Alignment by Hashing Algorithm is an algorithm for very fast matching and alignment of DNA sequences.

Documentation: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/tools/ssaha2-0

name: NorsNet
text_content:
Tool Name: NorsNet
Description: Identification unstructured loops from sequence.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction (coils)
Topics: Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://ppopen.informatik.tu-muenchen.de/
Documentation: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Norsnet

name: OXBench
text_content:
Tool Name: OXBench
Description: OXBench includes data and software to evaluate the accuracy of protein multiple sequence alignments.  It is a benchmark suite for multiple alignment algorithms that includes a large set of test alignments and software to aid in analysis of a method’s performance or relative performance.
Functions: Multiple alignment, Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/software.html#msa
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/downloads/oxbench/?C=D;O=A

name: PALSSE
text_content:
Tool Name: PALSSE
Description: Predictive Assignment of Linear Secondary Structure Elements is a software that delineates secondary structure elements from protein Cα coordinates and specifically addresses the requirements of vector-based protein similarity searches. Our program identifies two types of secondary structures: helix and β-strand, typically those that can be well approximated by vectors.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://prodata.swmed.edu/palsse/palsse.php
Documentation: http://prodata.swmed.edu/palsse/README

name: Pariga
text_content:
Tool Name: Pariga
Description: Performs BLAST searches on two sets of sequences selected by the user, storing the output in a python-serialized-objects database. Results can be interrogated by the user using logical operations, for example to retrieve cases where two queries match same targets, or when sequences from the two datasets are reciprocal best hits, or when a query matches a target in multiple regions.
Functions: Local alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://resources.bioinformatica.crs4.it/pariga/
Documentation:

name: PCOILS
text_content:
Tool Name: PCOILS

Documentation: https://toolkit.tuebingen.mpg.de/#/tools/pcoils

Documentation: https://rth.dk/resources/risearch/

Tool Name: blastprodom

Tool Name: HS-BLASTN

text_content:
Tool Name: varan
Description: Read processed sequence data in samtools' mpileup format and calculate various statistics for variant sites. In addition to some standard values, it also gives the expected information value (ESIV) which attempts to combine uncertainity (like p-values) with effect size (e.g. Fst) in a single value. Since the tool can read mpileup from a pipe, this eliminates the need to generate a huge temporary file containing mpileup output.

Topics: Genetics

Instead, it performs an exhaustive scan of the translation of the six reading frames of the complete genome.

text_content:
Tool Name: PseAAC
Description: Algorithm that could convert a protein sequence into a digital vector that could be processed by pattern recognition algorithms. The design of this tool incorporated the sequence order information to improve the conventional amino acid compositions. The application of pseudo amino acid composition is very common, including almost every branch of computational proteomics.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Data mining, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Proteomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/PseAAC/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/PseAAC/PseAAReadme.htm

name: PULSE
text_content:
Tool Name: PULSE
Description: Semi-supervised learning algorithm, positive unlabeled learning for splicing elucidation, which uses 48 features spanning various categories.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Splicing model analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Proteins, Proteomics experiment, RNA, RNA splicing
Homepage: http://www.kimlab.org/software/pulse
Documentation: http://www.kimlab.org/software/pulse

name: PVIEW
text_content:
Tool Name: PVIEW
Description: Software tool for the analysis and visualization of high resolution LC-MS/MS Data
Functions: Chromatographic alignment, Deisotoping, Isotope-coded protein label, Isotopic distributions calculation, Label-free quantification, Metabolic labeling, Peptide database search, Peptide identification, Protein quantification, SILAC, Spectral counting, Standardisation and normalisation, Target-Decoy
Topics: Data visualisation, Protein structure analysis, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.princeton.edu/pview/
Documentation: http://compbio.cs.princeton.edu/pview/

name: ReMus
text_content:
Tool Name: ReMus
Description: REinforced Merging techniques for Unique peptide Segments (ReMus) is designed for identification of the locations and compositions of unique peptide segments from a set of protein family sequences.
Functions: Peptide identification, Protein identification, Sequence merging, Tag-based peptide identification
Topics: Gene and protein families, Proteomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Small molecules
Homepage: http://biotools.cs.ntou.edu.tw/Remus.asp
Documentation:

name: SAMNetWeb
text_content:
Tool Name: SAMNetWeb
Description: A web-based tool that enables functional enrichment analysis and visualization of high-throughput datasets. Itcan analyse two distinct data types (e.g. mRNA expression and global proteomics) simultaneously across multiple experimental systems to identify pathways activated in these experiments and then visualize the pathways in a single interaction network.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Protein interaction prediction, Sequence analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Protein interactions, Proteomics, Sequencing, Systems biology
Homepage: http://fraenkel-nsf.csbi.mit.edu/samnetweb/
Documentation: http://fraenkel-nsf.csbi.mit.edu/samnetweb/quickstart.html

name: SIM-XL
text_content:
Tool Name: SIM-XL
Description: Spectrum Identification Machine for Cross-Linked Peptides.
Functions: Heat map generation, Mass spectrum visualisation, Pathway or network visualisation, Plotting, Protein feature detection, Protein interaction analysis, Protein structure analysis, Sequence database search
Topics: Protein interactions, Protein structure analysis, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment
Homepage: http://patternlabforproteomics.org/sim-xl
Documentation: http://patternlabforproteomics.org/sim-xl/Work.html

name: Spectrum similarity
text_content:
Tool Name: Spectrum similarity

Homepage: https://github.com/compomics/spectrum_similarity
Documentation: https://github.com/compomics/spectrum_similarity

name: SVMtm
text_content:

Homepage: http://ccb.imb.uq.edu.au/svmtm/svmtm_predictor.shtml
Documentation: http://ccb.imb.uq.edu.au/svmtm/documents/

name: Taverna4Proteomics

text_content:

Homepage: https://github.com/compomics/thermo-msf-parser
Documentation: https://github.com/compomics/thermo-msf-parser

name: TOPPR
text_content:

Documentation:

name: TRIC
text_content:
Tool Name: TRIC
Description: An alignment software for targeted proteomics (SRM or SWATH-MS) data. It uses a graph-based alignment strategy based on non-linear retention time correction to integrate information from all available runs. The input consists of a set of csv files derived from a targeted proteomics experiment generated by OpenSWATH (using either mProphet or pyProphet) or generated by Peakview.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Proteomics, Proteomics experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://proteomics.ethz.ch/tric/
Documentation: http://proteomics.ethz.ch/msproteomicstools/

name: UniProtKB
text_content:
Tool Name: UniProtKB
Description: The central hub for the collection of functional information on proteins with accurate, consistent and rich annotation. It consists of: UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot (manually-annotated records and curator-evaluated computational analysis) and UniProtKB/TrEMBL (computationally analyzed records awaiting manual annotation).
Functions: Gene functional annotation, Post-translation modification site prediction, Protein domain recognition, Protein function analysis, Protein quaternary structure prediction, Protein secondary structure analysis, Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis, Query and retrieval, Transmembrane protein analysis
Topics: Enzymes, Proteins, Proteomics
Homepage: http://www.uniprot.org/uniprot/
Documentation: http://www.uniprot.org/help/publications

name: EMBOSS
text_content:
Tool Name: EMBOSS
Description: Diverse suite of tools for sequence analysis; many programs analagous to GCG; context-sensitive help for each tool.
Functions: Global alignment, Local alignment, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: Biology, Molecular biology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://emboss.bioinformatics.nl/
Documentation: http://www.bioinformatics.nl/emboss-explorer/

name: SonicParanoid
text_content:
Tool Name: SonicParanoid
Description: SonicParanoid is a stand-alone software tool for the identification of orthologous relationships among multiple species.
Functions: Genome comparison, Phylogenetic tree analysis, Prediction and recognition, Sequence alignment
Topics: Bioinformatics, Comparative genomics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://iwasakilab.bs.s.u-tokyo.ac.jp/sonicparanoid/
Documentation: http://iwasakilab.bs.s.u-tokyo.ac.jp/sonicparanoid/#usage

name: RSAT peak-motifs
text_content:
Tool Name: RSAT peak-motifs
Description: A workflow combining a series of time- and memory-efficient motif analysis tools to extract motifs from full-size collections of peaks as generated by ChIP-seq, ChIP-chip or other ChIP-X technologies.
Functions: Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: ChIP-seq, Epigenomics, Gene regulation
Homepage: http://floresta.eead.csic.es/rsat/peak-motifs_form.cgi
Documentation:

name: RBioinf
text_content:
Tool Name: RBioinf
Description: Functions and datasets and examples to accompany the monograph R For Bioinformatics.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Gene expression, Genetics, Genomics, Microarray experiment
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RBioinf.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RBioinf.html

name: QuadFinder
text_content:
Tool Name: QuadFinder
Description: QuadFinder is a tool for the identification and analysis of quadruplex forming nucleotide sequences.

Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/xiuchengquek/QuadFinder
Documentation:

name: massXpert
text_content:
Tool Name: massXpert
Description: Tool for analysis of polymer and peptide/protein mass spectra.
Functions: Modelling and simulation, Nucleic acid restriction digest, Post-translation modification site prediction, Prediction and recognition (nucleic acid), Prediction and recognition (protein), Protein fragment weight comparison, Sequence motif recognition, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Biochemistry, Genomics, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Protein modifications, Protein properties, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment
Homepage: http://www.massxpert.org
Documentation:

name: SLiMSearch 4
text_content:
Tool Name: SLiMSearch 4
Description: Short Linear Motifs Search. Proteome-wide discovery and annotation of functional modules in intrinsically disordered regions. Scans a motif consensus, representing the specificity determinants of a motif-binding domain, against a proteome to discover putative novel motif instances. It applies several distinct and complementary approaches exploiting the common properties of SLiMs to predict novel motifs.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Protein modifications, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteomics
Homepage: http://slim.ucd.ie/slimsearch/
Documentation: http://slim.ucd.ie/slimsearch/index.php?page=help

name: MEME
text_content:
Tool Name: MEME
Description: Tool for discovering motifs in a group of related DNA or protein sequences. A motif is a sequence pattern that occurs repeatedly in a group of related protein or DNA sequences. This tool represents motifs as position-dependent letter-probability matrices which describe the probability of each possible letter at each position in the pattern.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Protein sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://meme-suite.org/tools/meme
Documentation: http://meme-suite.org/doc/meme.html?man_type=web

name: xiSPEC
text_content:
Tool Name: xiSPEC
Description: Next-generation web-based spectrum viewer for visualizing, analyzing and sharing mass spectrometry data. Allows users to save and share their datasets publicly or password protected for providing access to collaborators or readers and reviewers of manuscripts. The identification table features advanced interaction controls and spectra are presented in three interconnected views: (i) annotated mass spectrum, (ii) peptide sequence fragmentation key and (iii) quality control error plots of matched fragments.
Functions: Spectral analysis
Topics: Proteomics experiment
Homepage: https://spectrumviewer.org
Documentation: https://spectrumviewer.org/examples.php

name: dropClust
text_content:
Tool Name: dropClust
Description: Clustering tool for single-cell RNA sequencing data that uses Locality Sensitive Hashing algorithm.
Functions: Clustering profile plotting, Expression analysis, Expression profile clustering, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://debsinha.shinyapps.io/dropClust/
Documentation: https://debsinha.shinyapps.io/dropClust/

name: MzVar
text_content:
Tool Name: MzVar
Description: MzVar is a Java tool allowing the compilation of customized variant protein and peptide databases in the FASTA format for database searching of MS/MS data, using a VCF file as variant input and a FASTA file as transcript input. The tool is compatible with transcript sequences retrieved from either Ensembl or the UCSC Table Browser.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Protein identification, Protein sequence analysis, Spectral analysis
Topics: Genomics, Proteomics
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/sib-pig/mzvar-public/src/master/
Documentation:

name: Protter
text_content:
Tool Name: Protter
Description: Interactive protein feature visualization and integration with experimental proteomic data.
Functions: GPCR prediction, MRM/SRM, Protein feature detection, Topology diagram drawing, Transmembrane protein visualisation
Topics: Protein binding sites, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein interactions, Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis, Proteomics
Homepage: http://wlab.ethz.ch/protter/
Documentation: http://wlab.ethz.ch/protter/help/

name: CPTRA
text_content:
Tool Name: CPTRA

Homepage: https://www.mybiosoftware.com/cptra-20090207-cross-platform-transcriptome-analysis.html
Documentation:

name: MicroInspector
text_content:
Tool Name: MicroInspector
Description: Tool that detects miRNA (microRNA) binding sites in your input sequence by searching against databases of known miRNA binding sites.

Homepage: http://bioinfo.uni-plovdiv.bg/microinspector/
Documentation:

name: HomozygosityMapper
text_content:
Tool Name: HomozygosityMapper

Topics: Animals, DNA polymorphism, Genotype and phenotype, Mapping, Pathology, Rare diseases
Homepage: http://www.homozygositymapper.org
Documentation: http://www.homozygositymapper.org/documentation.html

name: MutationDistiller
text_content:
Tool Name: MutationDistiller
Description: Make the analysis of Next-Generation Sequencing data simple. Depending on your background and interest, it offers various modes with optimised settings: Clinical (HPO), Clinical (Gene Panels), Gene Function and Basic Search.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Expression analysis, Variant calling
Topics: Gene expression, Genetic variation, Rare diseases, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.mutationdistiller.org/
Documentation: https://www.mutationdistiller.org/MutationDistiller/info/documentation.html

name: Pbase
text_content:

Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Pbase.html

text_content:

text_content:

name: BRIE
text_content:
Tool Name: BRIE

text_content:

Documentation: http://wwwlabs.uhnresearch.ca/tillier/index.htm

name: VisCoSe
text_content:
Tool Name: VisCoSe
Description: Web based tool that takes a set of sequences (aligned or unaligned) and calculates a consensus sequence and the conservation rates for the sequence alignment, producing an easy to interpret visualization as output. One can also compare and visualize a set of consensus sequences generated from several sequence sets.

Topics: Comparative genomics, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Small molecules
Homepage: http://bio.math-inf.uni-greifswald.de/viscose/
Documentation:

name: TCS
text_content:
Tool Name: TCS
Description: A program to estimate gene genealogies including multifurcations and/or reticulations (i.e. networks). The network estimation implemented is also known as Statistical Parsimony. A cladistic analysis of phenotypic associations with haplotypes inferred from restriction endonuclease mapping and DNA sequence data.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Mapping, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://darwin.uvigo.es/software/tcs.html
Documentation: http://darwin.uvigo.es/software/tcs.html

name: Bayesembler
text_content:
Tool Name: Bayesembler
Description: Bayesian method for doing transcriptome assembly from RNA-seq data.
Functions: RNA-seq read count analysis, Sequence assembly, Transcriptome assembly
Topics: RNA, Sequence assembly, Transcription factors and regulatory sites, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioinformatics-centre.github.io/bayesembler/
Documentation: https://github.com/bioinformatics-centre/bayesembler/wiki/Manual

name: BARNACLE
text_content:
Tool Name: BARNACLE
Description: Python library for RNA 3D structure prediction. It can be used for probabilistic sampling of RNA structures that are compatible with a given nucleotide sequence and that are RNA like on a local length scale.

Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/barnacle-rna/
Documentation: http://sourceforge.net/projects/barnacle-rna/files/Documentation/Barnacle-0.2.pdf/download

name: ASAP
text_content:
Tool Name: ASAP

Topics: Gene regulation
Homepage: http://asap.binf.ku.dk/Asap/Home.html
Documentation: http://asap.binf.ku.dk/Asap/Tutorial.html

name: GMD
text_content:
Tool Name: GMD
Description: Package for non-parametric distance measurement between two discrete frequency distributions.

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://CRAN.R-project.org/package=GMD
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/GMD/citation.html

name: EasyGene
text_content:
Tool Name: EasyGene
Description: Fully automated gene prediction for prokaryotes. It produces a list of predicted genes for a chosen prokaryotic genome.

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://servers.binf.ku.dk/cgi-bin/easygene/search
Documentation: http://servers.binf.ku.dk/cgi-bin/easygene/search

name: BayesMD
text_content:
Tool Name: BayesMD
Description: Flexible, fully Bayesian model for motif discovery consisting of motif, background and alignment modules. It can be customized to different kind of biological applications, e.g. microarray, ChIP-chip, ditag, CAGE data analysis by integrating appropriately chosen features and functionalities.

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bayesmd.binf.ku.dk/
Documentation: http://bayesmd.binf.ku.dk/BayesMDdocumentation.pdf

name: MoAn
text_content:
Tool Name: MoAn
Description: Discriminative pattern finder capable of using a very large negative set to greatly improve its predictive power. It is capable of handling sequences that are not repeat masked given that the negative set is a representative sample of promoters from the organism examined.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://moan.binf.ku.dk/
Documentation: http://moan.binf.ku.dk/moan_current_doc.pdf

name: MASTR
text_content:
Tool Name: MASTR
Description: Multiple alignment and secondary structure prediction on a set of structural RNA sequences.
