text_content:
Tool Name: platypus
Description: A tool designed for efficient and accurate variant-detection in high-throughput sequencing data using local realignment of reads and local assembly. Platypus can detect SNPs, MNPs, short indels, replacements and (using the assembly option) deletions up to several kb.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Haplotype mapping, Sequence alignment
Topics: Genetic variation
Homepage: http://www.well.ox.ac.uk/platypus
Documentation: http://www.well.ox.ac.uk/platypus-doc

name: PRADA
text_content:
Tool Name: PRADA
Description: Flexible, modular and highly scalable software platform that provides many different types of information available by multifaceted analysis starting from raw paired-end RNA-seq data: gene expression levels, quality metrics, detection of unsupervised and supervised fusion transcripts, detection of intragenic fusion variants, homology scores and fusion frame classification.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Data architecture, analysis and design, Gene expression, RNA, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/PRADA:Overview
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/PRADA:Overview#Documentation

name: PRED-TMBB
text_content:
Tool Name: PRED-TMBB
Description: PRED-TMBB is a tool that takes a Gram-negative bacteria protein sequence as input and predicts the transmembrane strands and the probability of it being an outer membrane beta-barrel protein.  The user has a choice of three different decoding methods.
Functions: Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein subcellular localisation prediction, Transmembrane protein analysis, Transmembrane protein prediction
Topics: Membrane and lipoproteins, Protein folds and structural domains, Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.biol.uoa.gr/PRED-TMBB/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.biol.uoa.gr/PRED-TMBB/inputHelp.jsp

name: Cufflinks
text_content:
Tool Name: Cufflinks
Description: Cufflinks assembles transcripts and estimates their abundances in RNA-Seq samples. It accepts aligned RNA-Seq reads and assembles the alignments into a parsimonious set of transcripts. Cufflinks then estimates the relative abundances of these transcripts based on how many reads support each one.
Functions: Aggregation, DNA transcription, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression comparison, RNA-seq read count analysis, RNA-seq time series data analysis, Sequence comparison, Standardisation and normalisation, Transcriptome assembly
Topics: RNA splicing, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://cole-trapnell-lab.github.io/cufflinks
Documentation: http://cole-trapnell-lab.github.io/cufflinks/manual/

name: DBTSS
text_content:
Tool Name: DBTSS
Description: DataBase of Transcription Start Sites is a database which contains precise positional information for transcription start sites of eukaryotic mRNAs. Included are 330 million new tags generated by massively sequencing the 5-end of oligo-cap selected cDNAs in humans and mice. 31 different cell types or culture conditions are represented. Promoter sequence information is now displayed in a comparative genomics viewer where evolutionary turnover of the TSSs can be evaluated.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Generation, Genetic variation analysis, Promoter prediction, Sequence tag mapping
Topics: Cell culture collection, Epigenomics, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://dbtss.hgc.jp/
Documentation: https://dbtss.hgc.jp/?doc:help_2017.html

name: Diamond
text_content:
Tool Name: Diamond
Description: Sequence aligner for protein and translated DNA searches and functions as a drop-in replacement for the NCBI BLAST software tools. It is suitable for protein-protein search as well as DNA-protein search on short reads and longer sequences including contigs and assemblies, providing a speedup of BLAST ranging up to x20,000.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/bbuchfink/diamond
Documentation: https://github.com/bbuchfink/diamond/blob/master/diamond_manual.pdf

name: DSK
text_content:
Tool Name: DSK
Description: K-mer counting software, similar to Jellyfish. Jellyfish is very fast but limited to large-memory servers and k 32. This software supports large values of k, and runs with (almost-)arbitrarily low memory usage and reasonably low temporary disk usage. It can count k-mers of large Illumina datasets on laptops and desktop computers.
Functions: Sequence composition calculation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://minia.genouest.org/dsk/
Documentation: http://minia.genouest.org/dsk/

name: EBCall
text_content:
Tool Name: EBCall
Description: EBCall is a software package for somatic mutation detection (including InDels). EBCall uses not only paired tumor/normal sequence data of a target sample, but also multiple non-paired normal reference samples for evaluating distribution of sequencing errors, which leads to an accurate mutaiton detection even in case of low sequencing depths and low allele frequencies.
Functions: Polymorphism detection
Topics: DNA mutation, Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/friend1ws/EBCall
Documentation: https://github.com/friend1ws/EBCall/blob/master/readMe.md

name: Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor
text_content:
Tool Name: Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor
Description: Determines the effect of your variants (SNPs, insertions, deletions, CNVs or structural variants) on genes, transcripts, and protein sequence, as well as regulatory regions.
Functions: Variant effect prediction
Topics: Function analysis, Genetic variation, Genomics
Homepage: http://www.ensembl.org/info/docs/tools/vep/index.html
Documentation: http://www.ensembl.org/info/docs/tools/vep/index.html

name: Entrez Gene
text_content:
Tool Name: Entrez Gene
Description: NCBI’s database for gene-specific information. It maintains records from genomes which have been completely sequenced, which have an active research community to submit gene-specific information, or which are scheduled for intense sequence analysis.
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene methylation analysis, Gene prediction, Genetic variation analysis, Sequence tag mapping
Topics: Gene transcripts, Mapping, Model organisms, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gene
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK3841/#EntrezGene.Quick_Start

name: ESP
text_content:
Tool Name: ESP
Description: NHLBI Exome Sequencing Project (ESP): Exome Variant Server (EVS) for browsing single nucleotide variation data from exome sequencing experiments mainly focused on heart, lung and blood disorders.
Functions: Database search, Genetic variation analysis, Variant filtering
Topics: Exome sequencing, Genetic variation, Genotype and phenotype, Haematology, Pathology, Rare diseases, Respiratory medicine
Homepage: http://evs.gs.washington.edu/EVS/
Documentation: http://evs.gs.washington.edu/EVS/

name: ExomePicks
text_content:
Tool Name: ExomePicks
Description: ExomePicks is a program that suggests individuals to be sequenced in a large pedigree.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Data management, Sequencing
Homepage: http://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/ExomePicks
Documentation:

name: FANTOM
text_content:
Tool Name: FANTOM
Description: The Functional Annotation Of the Mammalian Genome is a database for the transcriptional network that regulates macrophage differentiation. Data comes from cap analysis of gene expression, sequencing mRNA 5-ends with a second-generation sequencer to quantify promoter activities even in the absence of gene annotation. Additional genome-wide experiments complement the setup including short RNA sequencing, microarray gene expression profiling on large-scale perturbation experiments.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression clustering, Gene expression profiling
Topics: ChIP-on-chip, Epigenetics, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://fantom.gsc.riken.jp/4/
Documentation: http://fantom.gsc.riken.jp/4/about/

name: FateID
text_content:
Tool Name: FateID
Description: A computational method for the quantification and visualisation  of fate bias  for multi-lineage single cell transcriptome data.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Sequence analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Cell biology, Genetics, RNA-Seq, Regenerative medicine
Homepage: https://github.com/dgrun/FateID
Documentation: https://github.com/dgrun/FateID

name: fineSTRUCTURE
text_content:
Tool Name: fineSTRUCTURE
Description: fineSTRUCTURE is an algorithm for identifying population structure using dense sequencing data. By using the output of ChromoPainter as a (nearly) sufficient summary statistic, it is able to perform model-based Bayesian clustering on large datasets, including full resequencing data, and can handle up to 1000s of individuals. Full assignment uncertainty is given.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Population genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://paintmychromosomes.com/
Documentation: http://paintmychromosomes.com/

name: PRICE
text_content:
Tool Name: PRICE
Description: PRICE uses paired-read information to iteratively increase the size of existing contigs.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://derisilab.ucsf.edu/software/price/index.html
Documentation: http://derisilab.ucsf.edu/software/price/PriceDocumentation130506/index

name: Friend
text_content:
Tool Name: Friend
Description: Bioinformatics application designed for simultaneous analysis and visualization of multiple structures and sequences of proteins and/or DNA/RNA. The application provides basic functionalities such as: structure visualization with different rendering and coloring, sequence alignment, and simple phylogeny analysis, along with a number of extended features.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Structure alignment, Structure visualisation
Topics: DNA, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Molecular modelling, Phylogeny, Proteins, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://ilyinlab.org/friend/
Documentation: http://ilyinlab.org/friend/

name: PrimerBank
text_content:
Tool Name: PrimerBank
Description: It is a public resource for the retrieval of human and mouse primer pairs for gene expression analysis by PCR and Quantitative PCR (QPCR). For each gene, at least one primer pair has been designed and in many cases alternative primer pairs exist. Primers have been designed to work under the same PCR conditions, thus facilitating high-throughput QPCR. There are several ways to search for primers for the gene(s) of interest.
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, PCR primer design, Primer and probe design
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Human biology, Probes and primers, Sequencing
Homepage: http://pga.mgh.harvard.edu/primerbank/
Documentation: https://pga.mgh.harvard.edu/primerbank/protocol.html

name: Full-parasites
text_content:
Tool Name: Full-parasites
Description: Full-Parasites is a transcriptome database of apicomplexa parasites, which include Plasmodium and Toxoplasma species. It contains EST sequences, full length cDNAs, transcription start sites and RNA-seq data sets. Various types of cDNA data resources were interconnected with our original database functionalities. By providing the largest unique full-length cDNA and dynamic transcriptome data, Full-Parasites is useful for understanding host-parasite interactions.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression analysis, Gene expression profiling, Sequence tag mapping, Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping
Topics: Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Mapping, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://fullmal.hgc.jp/
Documentation: http://fullmal.hgc.jp/fm_help_2015.html

name: FusionHunter
text_content:
Tool Name: FusionHunter
Description: An open-source software tool that identifies gene fusions in RNA-Seq data.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, RNA-Seq analysis, Sequence feature detection
Topics: Gene transcripts, Oncology, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioen-compbio.bioen.illinois.edu/FusionHunter/
Documentation:

name: ProfCom
text_content:
Tool Name: ProfCom
Description: Web based tool for the interpretation of genes that were identified to be functionally linked. Combinations of annotation terms are used to profile complex functions.
Functions: Gene expression QTL analysis, Gene expression profile clustering, Gene expression profiling, Gene functional annotation
Topics: Animals, Gene expression, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://webclu.bio.wzw.tum.de/profcom/
Documentation: http://webclu.bio.wzw.tum.de/profcom/demo.php

name: ProSight Lite
text_content:
Tool Name: ProSight Lite
Description: Free Windows application for matching a single candidate protein sequence and its modifications against a set of mass spectrometric observations.
Functions: Mapping, PTM identification, PTM localisation, Post-translation modification site prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Epigenetics, Protein modifications, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://prosightlite.northwestern.edu/
Documentation: http://prosightlite.northwestern.edu/img/ProSight%20Lite%20-%20asms2014.pdf

name: Gene3D
text_content:
Tool Name: Gene3D
Description: The Gene3D web services provide programmatic access to the CATH-Gene3D annotation resources and in-house software tools. These services include Gene3DScan for identifying structural domains within protein sequences, access to pre-calculated annotations for the major sequence databases, and linked functional annotation from UniProt, GO and KEGG.
Functions: Gene functional annotation, Sequence annotation
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://gene3d.biochem.ucl.ac.uk/Gene3D/
Documentation: http://gene3d.biochem.ucl.ac.uk/about

name: ProteoWizard
text_content:
Tool Name: ProteoWizard
Description: The ProteoWizard Library and Tools are a set of modular and extensible open-source, cross-platform tools and software libraries that facilitate proteomics data analysis.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure analysis
Topics: Proteomics, Proteomics experiment
Homepage: http://proteowizard.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://proteowizard.sourceforge.net/IntroductoryTutorial.shtml

name: Loc3D
text_content:
Tool Name: Loc3D
Description: Database of predicted subcellular localization for eukaryotic proteins of known three-dimensional (3D) structure and includes tools to predict the subcellular localization for submitted protein sequences.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein structure prediction, Protein subcellular localisation prediction
Topics: Model organisms, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://cubic.bioc.columbia.edu/db/LOC3d/
Documentation:

name: long-read-tools
text_content:
Tool Name: long-read-tools
Description: Long-read-tools is an interactive database of software tools for the analysis of long read sequencing data.
Functions: Operation
Topics: Bioinformatics, Epigenomics, Genomics, Nucleic acids, Omics, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://long-read-tools.org/
Documentation:

name: FASTX-Toolkit
text_content:
Tool Name: FASTX-Toolkit
Description: Collection of command line tools for Short-Reads FASTA/FASTQ files preprocessing.
Functions: Read pre-processing, Sequence editing
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://hannonlab.cshl.edu/fastx_toolkit/
Documentation: http://hannonlab.cshl.edu/fastx_toolkit/galaxy.html

name: gatk_variant_eval
text_content:
Tool Name: gatk_variant_eval
Description: General-purpose tool for variant evaluation (% in dbSNP, genotype concordance, Ti/Tv ratios, and a lot more).
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Sequencing
Homepage: https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/
Documentation: https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/documentation/tooldocs/3.8-0/org_broadinstitute_gatk_tools_walkers_varianteval_VariantEval.php

name: GATK
text_content:
Tool Name: GATK
Description: The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.
Functions: Genotyping, Polymorphism detection, Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: Genetic variation, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Workflows
Homepage: https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/
Documentation: https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/

name: G-Mo.R-Seq
text_content:
Tool Name: G-Mo.R-Seq
Description: Method aimed at using RNA-Seq short reads to build de novo gene models.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis, Read mapping, Transcriptome assembly
Topics: RNA-Seq, Sequence assembly, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.genoscope.cns.fr/externe/gmorse/
Documentation:

name: GASV
text_content:
Tool Name: GASV
Description: Software for classification and comparison of structural variants measured via paired-end sequencing and/or array-CGH.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequence motif discovery, Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA structural variation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.brown.edu/projects/gasv/
Documentation: https://code.google.com/archive/p/gasv/source/default/source

name: Metastats
text_content:
Tool Name: Metastats
Description: Employs the false discovery rate to improve specificity in high-complexity environments, and separately handles sparsely-sampled features using Fisher’s exact test.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Metagenomics, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://metastats.cbcb.umd.edu/detection.html
Documentation: http://cbcb.umd.edu/software/metastats

name: MethylExtract
text_content:
Tool Name: MethylExtract
Description: User friendly tool to generate i) high quality, whole genome methylation maps and ii) to detect sequence variation within the same sample preparation.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioinfo2.ugr.es/MethylExtract/
Documentation: http://bioinfo2.ugr.es/MethylExtract/downloads/ManualMethylExtract.pdf

name: MIP Scaffolder
text_content:
Tool Name: MIP Scaffolder
Description: Program for scaffolding contigs produced by fragment assemblers using mate pair data.
Functions: Data handling, Scaffolding, Sequence generation
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.cs.helsinki.fi/u/lmsalmel/mip-scaffolder/
Documentation: https://www.cs.helsinki.fi/u/lmsalmel/mip-scaffolder/README

name: miROrtho
text_content:
Tool Name: miROrtho
Description: miROrtho contains predictions of precursor miRNA genes covering several animal genomes combining orthology and a Support Vector Machine. We provide homology extended alignments of already known miRBase families and putative miRNA families exclusively predicted by our SVM and orthology pipeline.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Evolutionary biology, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Genomics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cegg.unige.ch/mirortho
Documentation: http://cegg.unige.ch/mirortho/info

name: MirTools
text_content:
Tool Name: MirTools
Description: Web server for microRNA data analysis, profiling and discovery based on high-throughput sequencing.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis, Read mapping, miRNA expression analysis
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Mapping, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://centre.bioinformatics.zj.cn/mirtools/
Documentation:

name: MizBee
text_content:
Tool Name: MizBee
Description: Multiscale synteny browser for exploring conservation relationships in comparative genomics data. Using side-by-side linked views, MizBee enables efficient data browsing across a range of scales, from the genome to the gene.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Comparative genomics, Genetics, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.cs.utah.edu/~miriah/mizbee/Overview.html
Documentation: http://www.cs.utah.edu/~miriah/mizbee/Video.html

name: MoDIL
text_content:
Tool Name: MoDIL
Description: Mixture of Distributions Indel Locator, a novel method for finding medium sized indels from high throughput sequencing datasets.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Indel detection, Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA mutation, Genetic variation, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://compbio.cs.toronto.edu/modil/
Documentation:

name: MrCaNaVaR
text_content:
Tool Name: MrCaNaVaR
Description: mrCaNaVaR is a copy number caller that analyzes the next-generation sequence mapping read depth to discover large segmental duplications and deletions. It also has the capability of predicting absolute copy numbers of genomic intervals.
Functions: Read depth analysis
Topics: Genomics, Personalised medicine
Homepage: http://mrcanavar.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://mrcanavar.sourceforge.net/manual.html

name: MultiLoc2
text_content:
Tool Name: MultiLoc2
Description: MultiLoc2 predicts animal, plant and fungal protein subcellularlocalizations by integrating phylogeny and Gene Ontology terms to the new version of the software.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Ontology and terminology, Phylogeny, Plant biology, Zoology
Homepage: http://abi.inf.uni-tuebingen.de/Services/MultiLoc2
Documentation: http://abi.inf.uni-tuebingen.de/Services/MultiLoc2/multiloc2_information

name: MultiMap
text_content:
Tool Name: MultiMap
Description: Computer program used for automated construction of genetic maps. It has been developed primarily for large-scale linkage mapping of markers genotyped in the CEPH reference pedigrees. It has been adapted for automated construction of radiation hybrid maps.
Functions: Genetic mapping
Topics: Genetics, Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://compgen.rutgers.edu/multimap.shtml
Documentation: https://www.nature.com/articles/ng0494-384

name: MutationTaster
text_content:
Tool Name: MutationTaster
Description: Employs a Bayes classifier to eventually predict the disease potential of an alteration. The Bayes classifier is fed with the outcome of all tests and the features of the alterations and calculates probabilities for the alteration to be either a disease mutation or a harmless polymorphism.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Function analysis, Genetic variation
Homepage: http://www.mutationtaster.org/
Documentation: http://www.mutationtaster.org/info/documentation.html

name: MutPred
text_content:
Tool Name: MutPred
Description: MutPred is a web application tool developed to classify an amino acid substitution as disease-associated or neutral in human. In addition, it predicts molecular cause of disease.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Disease
Homepage: http://mutpred.mutdb.org/
Documentation: http://mutpred.mutdb.org/about.html

name: InterMine
text_content:
Tool Name: InterMine
Description: Open source data warehouse built specifically for the integration and analysis of complex biological data. It enables the creation of biological databases accessed by sophisticated web query tools. Parsers are provided for integrating data from many common biological data sources and formats, and there is a framework for adding your own data.
Functions: Database search
Topics: Data integration and warehousing, Rare diseases
Homepage: http://www.intermine.org
Documentation: http://intermine.org/im-docs

name: FlyMine
text_content:
Tool Name: FlyMine
Description: An integrated database for Drosophila and Anopheles genomics.
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Query and retrieval, Visualisation
Topics: Data management, Genomics, Proteomics
Homepage: https://flymine.org/flymine
Documentation: http://intermine.org/im-docs/docs/web-services/index

name: HumanMine
text_content:
Tool Name: HumanMine
Description: HumanMine integrates many types of data for Homo sapiens and Mus musculus
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Query and retrieval, Visualisation
Topics: Data management, Genomics, Proteomics
Homepage: https://www.humanmine.org/humanmine
Documentation: http://intermine.org/im-docs/docs/web-services/index

name: ThaleMine
text_content:
Tool Name: ThaleMine
Description: ThaleMine enables you to analyze Arabidopsis thaliana genes, proteins, gene expression, protein-protein interactions, orthologs, and more.
Functions: Data retrieval, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Query and retrieval, Visualisation
Topics: Data management, Genomics, Proteomics
Homepage: https://bar.utoronto.ca/thalemine
Documentation: http://intermine.readthedocs.org/en/latest/web-services/

name: SAS WS
text_content:
Tool Name: SAS WS
Description: Tool for applying structural information to a given protein sequence. It uses FASTA to scan a given protein sequence against all the proteins of known 3D structure in the Protein Data Bank and provides functional residue annotation based on data from the Catalytic Site Atlas and PDBsum.
Functions: Data retrieval, Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/thornton-srv/databases/WSsas/
Documentation: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/thornton-srv/databases/WSsas/

name: WebProAnalyst
text_content:
Tool Name: WebProAnalyst
Description: Tool for searching for residues whose substitutions are correlated with variations in protein activity. Key physicochemical characteristics of these sites can be calculated.
Functions: Protein binding site prediction, Regression analysis, Residue distance calculation, Sequence alignment analysis (site correlation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein binding sites, Protein folding, stability and design, Proteins, Small molecules
Homepage: http://wwwmgs.bionet.nsc.ru/mgs/programs/panalyst/
Documentation: http://wwwmgs.bionet.nsc.ru/mgs/programs/panalyst/help.html

name: Vmatch
text_content:
Tool Name: Vmatch
Description: A versatile software tool for efficiently solving large scale sequence matching tasks
Functions: Data handling, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.vmatch.de/
Documentation: http://www.vmatch.de/virtman.pdf

name: VirusHunter
text_content:
Tool Name: VirusHunter
Description: This is a tool for the identification of viruses and their integration sites in host genomes using any type of NGS data. Its unique features include the characterization of insertion loci of any type of virus in the host genome and high accuracy and computational efficiency because of its well-designed pipeline.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Virology
Homepage: http://pathology.wustl.edu/VirusHunter/
Documentation:

name: Genotyping - NCBI
text_content:
Tool Name: Genotyping - NCBI
Description: Identifies the genotype (or subtype) of viral sequences by using a sliding window approach to BLAST analysis against reference sequences for different viral subtypes. Results are shown as a graphical output plotting the top-scoring genotype. An alignment tool is also available.
Functions: Genotyping, PCR primer design, Query and retrieval, Recombination detection
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Genotyping experiment, Microarray experiment, Model organisms, Virology
Homepage: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/genotyping/formpage.cgi
Documentation: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/genotyping/help.html

name: Nucleic Acid Database (NDB)
text_content:
Tool Name: Nucleic Acid Database (NDB)
Description: NDB (Nucleic Acid Database) is a repository of three-dimensional structural information about nucleic acids.
Functions: Nucleic acid folding analysis, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acid structure comparison, Nucleic acid structure prediction, Sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://ndbserver.rutgers.edu/
Documentation: http://ndbserver.rutgers.edu/ndbmodule/about_ndb/about.html

name: NEMBASE4
text_content:
Tool Name: NEMBASE4
Description: Resource for nematode transcriptome analysis, and a research tool for nematode biology, drug discovery and vaccine design.
Functions: DNA vaccine design, Gene expression profiling, Query and retrieval, Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping
Topics: Drug discovery, Gene and protein families, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.nematodes.org/nembase4/
Documentation:

name: NGMLR
text_content:
Tool Name: NGMLR
Description: An algorithm to map third generation long-read sequencing data (PacBio and Oxford Nanopore) to a reference genome with a focus on reads that span structural variation.
Functions: DNA mapping, Genetic variation analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: DNA structural variation, Mapping, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/philres/ngmlr
Documentation: https://github.com/philres/ngmlr

name: Ngs backbone
text_content:
Tool Name: Ngs backbone
Description: ngs_backbone is a bioinformatic application created to work on sequence analysis by using NGS (Next Generation Sequencing) and sanger sequences. It is capable of cleaning reads, do de novo assembly or mapping against a reference and annotate SNPs, SSRs, ORFs, GO terms and sequence descriptions.
Functions: Read mapping, Sequence assembly
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: http://bioinf.comav.upv.es/ngs_backbone/index.html
Documentation:

name: NGSView
text_content:
Tool Name: NGSView
Description: High-throughput sequencing technologies introduce novel demands on tools available for data analysis. We have developed NGSView, a generally applicable, flexible and extensible next-generation sequence alignment editor. The software allows for visualization and manipulation of millions of sequences simultaneously on a desktop computer, through a graphical interface. NGSView is available under an open source license and can be extended through a well documented API.
Functions: Sequence assembly visualisation
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: http://ngsview.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://ngsview.sourceforge.net/manual.html

name: Opera
text_content:
Tool Name: Opera
Description: Sequence assembly program. It uses information from paired-end reads to optimally order and orient contigs assembled from shotgun-sequencing reads.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/operasf/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/operasf/

LMAP_S was designed for the workstation multi-core environment and integrates over 30 scientific software, for which provides easy installation.

The LMAP_S package additionally includes our RYcode.pl application for purine/pyrimidine DNA/RNA (re-)coding.

name: PLAST
text_content:
Tool Name: PLAST
Description: PLAST is a heuristical method to search for highest scoring local alignments between a DNA sequence query and a graphical pangenome. It takes as input a plain DNA sequence and a pangenome which may either be a set of (multiple) FASTA or FASTQ files or a sequence graph constructed by the tool Bifrost. It then outputs statistically meaningful (gapped) alignments in the style of the NCBI BLAST standard output format. Alignments are calculated based on a "seed-and-extend approach" while traversing the sequence graph. Biologically meaningful alignments are filtered by using an alignment statistic explicitly developed for sequence-to-graph alignments involving graphical pangenomes.
Functions: Indexing, Local alignment
Topics: Comparative genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/tischulz1/plast
Documentation: https://gitlab.ub.uni-bielefeld.de/gi/plast/-/blob/master/README.md

This enables the fusion discovery process to be more effective and sensitive, also with a specular performance under low coverage of sequencing far more better than other tools.

The output is an interactive selection table containing annotated identified sequences.

name: CNVxplorer
text_content:
Tool Name: CNVxplorer
Description: CNVxplorer is a web server suited for the functional assessment of CNVs in a clinical diagnostic setting. CNVxplorer mines a comprehensive set of clinical, genomic, and epigenomic features associated with CNVs. It provides sequence constraint metrics, impact on regulatory elements and topologically associating domains, as well as expression patterns. Analyses offered cover (a) agreement with patient phenotypes; (b) visualizations of associations among genes, including those mediated by regulatory elements, and transcription factors; (c) enrichment on functional and pathway annotations; and (d) co-occurrence of terms across PubMed publications related to the query CNVs. A flexible evaluation workflow allows dynamic re-interrogation in clinical sessions.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Named-entity and concept recognition, Query and retrieval
Topics: Epigenomics, Gene expression, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Rare diseases, Workflows
Homepage: http://cnvxplorer.com
Documentation:

name: DeepArk
text_content:
Tool Name: DeepArk
Description: DeepArk is a set of models of the worm, fish, fly, and mouse regulatory codes. For each of these organism, we constructed a deep convolutional neural network that predict regulatory activities (i.e. histone modifications, transcription factor binding, and chromatin state) directly from genomic sequences. Besidese accurately predicting a sequence's regulatory activity, DeepArk can predict the effects of variants on regulatory function and profile sequences regulatory potential with in silico saturated mutagenesis.
Functions: Gene regulatory network analysis, Peak calling, Variant effect prediction
Topics: Gene regulation, Machine learning, Model organisms, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: https://DeepArk.princeton.edu
Documentation:

name: Discount
text_content:
Tool Name: Discount
Description: Discount is a Spark-based tool for k-mer counting, and for analysis of minimizer orderings. It is able to analyse large metagenomic-scale datasets while having a small memory footprint.
Functions: De-novo assembly, Taxonomic classification, k-mer counting
Topics: Metagenomics, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/jtnystrom/discount
Documentation:

name: DIYABC
text_content:
Tool Name: DIYABC
Description: DIYABC is an inference software implementing Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) combined with supervised machine learning based on Random Forests (RF), for model choice and parameter inference in the context of population genetics analysis.
Functions: Dimensionality reduction, Genotyping, Regression analysis, Statistical inference
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Machine learning, Population genetics, Sequencing, Workflows
Homepage: https://diyabc.github.io
Documentation: https://diyabc.github.io/doc/

name: eCOMPASS
text_content:
Tool Name: eCOMPASS
Description: eCOMPASS (evaluative comparison of multiple protein alignments by statistical score) addresses this problem using a statistical measure of relative alignment quality based on direct coupling analysis (DCA): to maintain protein structural integrity over evolutionary time, substitutions at one residue position typically result in compensating substitutions at other positions. eCOMPASS computes the statistical significance of the congruence between high scoring directly coupled pairs and 3D contacts in corresponding structures, which depends upon properly aligned homologous residues.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein sequence analysis, Structure alignment, Visualisation
Topics: Gene and protein families, Phylogeny, Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://www.igs.umaryland.edu/labs/neuwald/software/compass
Documentation:

name: DeepGOWeb
text_content:
Tool Name: DeepGOWeb
Description: DeepGOWeb is a webserver for protein function prediction from amino acid sequence. DeepGOWeb uses the DeepGOPlus function prediction model.
Functions: Genome indexing, Protein function prediction, Query and retrieval, Sequence feature detection
Topics: Function analysis, Machine learning, Ontology and terminology, Plant biology, Proteins
Homepage: https://deepgo.cbrc.kaust.edu.sa/
Documentation:

name: ANGSD
text_content:
Tool Name: ANGSD
Description: Software for analyzing next generation sequencing data. The software can handle a number of different input types from mapped reads to imputed genotype probabilities. Most methods take genotype uncertainty into account instead of basing the analysis on called genotypes. This is especially useful for low and medium depth data.
Functions: Genotyping, Sequence analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: Population genetics, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www.popgen.dk/angsd
Documentation: http://www.popgen.dk/angsd/index.php/Citing_angsd

text_content:
Tool Name: markerpen
Description: markerpen is an R library for the identification of cell-type-specific marker genes from co-expression patterns in tissue samples.
Functions: Deisotoping, Expression correlation analysis, Gene expression QTL analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Exome sequencing, Proteomics, RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=markerpen
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/markerpen/markerpen.pdf

name: ModFlex
text_content:
Tool Name: ModFlex
Description: The ModFlex server provides an interface with multiple options and tools, which make it possible to explore structural diversity in the available modeling templates and make an optimal choice. The server uses information from the previously developed PDBFlex database which is focused on structural flexibility and conformational diversity of proteins. The PDBFlex database contains structures that were extracted from the PDB and clustered based on sequence identity, such that each cluster represents an individual protein. The structures in each cluster were further grouped into subclusters based on structural similarity, such that each subcluster represents a distinct conformation of the protein. Thus, each cluster represents a protein, while each subcluster represents a specific conformation of that protein.
Functions: Protein identification, Protein modelling, Structure visualisation
Topics: Molecular modelling, Protein structure analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: https://modflex.org/
Documentation:

name: ModPhred
text_content:
Tool Name: ModPhred
Description: ModPhred is an integrative toolkit for the analysis and storage of nanopore sequencing DNA and RNA modification data. modPhred is a pipeline for detection, annotation and visualisation of DNA/RNA modifications from raw ONT data. The pipeline consists of four steps / modules: modEncode (Encoding modification probabilities in FastQ), modAlign (Build alignments keeping modification information in BAMs), modReport (Extraction of RNA modification information and QC reports), and modAnalysis (Plotting venn diagrams (mod_plot.py), co-occurrence of modifications and per-read clustering based on modification profiles).
Functions: Gene expression profiling, PTM site prediction, Visualisation
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, RNA, RNA-Seq, Workflows
Homepage: https://github.com/novoalab/modPhred
Documentation: https://modphred.readthedocs.io/

name: MTR3D
text_content:
Tool Name: MTR3D
Description: MTR3D is a web application for identifying regions within protein tertiary structures under purifying selection.
Functions: Database search, Protein modelling, Protein structure comparison
Topics: Exome sequencing, Gene expression, Protein structure analysis, Proteomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://biosig.unimelb.edu.au/mtr3d/
Documentation:

name: Ribose-Map
text_content:
Tool Name: Ribose-Map
Description: Ribose-Map is a user-friendly, standardized bioinformatics toolkit for the comprehensive analysis of ribonucleotide (rNMP) sequencing experiments. It can be applied to data generated using any high-throughput ribonucleotide sequencing technique, including ribose-seq, emRiboSeq, RHII-HydEn-seq, Alk-HydEn-seq, and Pu-seq.
Functions: DNA mapping, Demultiplexing, Genotyping, Sequence trimming
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Genetic variation, Mapping, Sequencing

Documentation: http://www.clustal.org/clustal2/

name: Proteome-pI 2.0
text_content:
Tool Name: Proteome-pI 2.0
Description: The database of pre-computed isoelectric points and molecular weights for proteins and digest peptides from model organism's proteomes. Contains data for over 61 million protein sequences from 20,115 proteomes with isoelectric point predicted using 21 algorithms. Additionally, 5.38 Billion dissociation constant (pKa) predictions for proteins are available. Furthermore, it contains also proteomes digested in silico with the five most frequently used proteases (Trypsin, Chymotrypsin, Trypsin+LysC, LysN, ArgC) - in total, 9.58 Billion peptides.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein pKa calculation, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence feature detection
Topics: Protein properties, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment
Homepage: http://isoelectricpointdb2.org
Documentation: http://isoelectricpointdb2.org/statistics.html

name: PERCEPTRON
text_content:
Tool Name: PERCEPTRON
Description: PERCEPTRON is an open-source GPU-accelerated proteoform identification pipeline for top-down proteomics. PERCEPTRON is a freely available web-based proteoform identification pipeline for Top-Down Proteomics (TDP).
Functions: Database search, PTM identification, de Novo sequencing
Topics: Protein modifications, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment, Sequence analysis, Workflows
Homepage: https://perceptron.lums.edu.pk
Documentation:

name: pftools
text_content:
Tool Name: pftools
Description: The pftools are a collection of programs to build, calibrate, and search biological sequences with generalized profiles. Generalized profiles are an extension of position specific scoring matrices by including position specific scores for insertions and deletions. They correspond to a matrix representation of a multiple sequence alignment that can be used to search distant homologous sequences and precisely align sequences to the model.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/sib-swiss/pftools3
Documentation: https://web.expasy.org/pftools/

name: SeqAn
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqAn
Description: An open source C++ library of efficient algorithms and data structures for the analysis of sequences with the focus on biological data. Our library applies a unique generic design that guarantees high performance, generality, extensibility, and integration with other libraries. The library is easy to use and simplifies the development of new software tools with a minimal loss of performance. Additionally, it includes several ready-made command line tools for common tasks in sequence analysis.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Read mapping, Sequence alignment, Sequence analysis, Variant calling
Topics: Bioinformatics, Comparative genomics, Metagenomics, Software engineering, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://www.seqan.de
Documentation: https://www.seqan.de

name: AIAP
text_content:
Tool Name: AIAP
Description: A Quality Control and Integrative Analysis Package to Improve ATAC-seq Data Analysis.

Documentation: https://pzlast.riken.jp/meta/api

name: PRISM
text_content:
Tool Name: PRISM
Description: PRISM (Poisson RNA-profile Identification in Scaled Mixtures) is statistical framework that allows simultaneous extraction of a tumor sample composition and cell type and sample specific whole-transcriptome profiles from individual bulk RNA-seq samples, by exploiting single-cell reference data. This facilitates a separate analysis of cancer cell and the microenvironment phenotypes and of the tumor composition.
Functions: Gene expression profiling, Sample comparison
Topics: Oncology, RNA-Seq, Surgery, Transcriptomics, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/anthakki/prism

name: SSRE
text_content:
Tool Name: SSRE
Description: SSRE is a tool for cell type detection based on sparse subspace representation and similarity enhancement. Accurate identification of cell types from single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data plays a critical role in a variety of scRNA-seq analysis studies. This task corresponds to solving an unsupervised clustering problem, in which the similarity measurement between cells affects the result significantly.
Functions: Clustering, Differential gene expression profiling
Topics: Cell biology, RNA, RNA-Seq
Homepage: https://github.com/CSUBioGroup/SSRE
Documentation:

name: STAMPR
text_content:
Tool Name: STAMPR
Description: STAMP (Sequence Tag-based Analysis of Microbial Populations) is a tool for the introduction of allelic diversity into otherwise identical bacteria using DNA barcodes enables sequencing-based measurements of these parameters. STAMPR is a successor to STAMP, which accounts for such population expansions.
Functions: DNA barcoding, Quantification, Visualisation
Topics: DNA, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/hullahalli/stampr_rtisan
Documentation:

name: STREME
text_content:
Tool Name: STREME
Description: STREME is accurate and versatile sequence motif discovery tool. The MEME Suite allows you to discover novel motifs in collections of unaligned nucleotide or protein sequences, and to perform a wide variety of other motif-based analyses. It provides motif discovery algorithms using both probabilistic (MEME) and discrete models (STREME), which have complementary strengths. It also allows discovery of motifs with arbitrary insertions and deletions (GLAM2). MEME-ChIP performs a comprehensive motif-based analysis of ChIP-seq and other large sequence datasets.
Functions: Sequence motif comparison, Sequence motif discovery, Sequence motif recognition, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: ChIP-seq, Epigenetics, RNA immunoprecipitation, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Small molecules
Homepage: http://meme-suite.org
Documentation:

name: svreg
text_content:
Tool Name: svreg
Description: The R package svreg implements the structural varying-coefficient regression (svReg) for the model selection of a varying-coefficient model with structured main predictors or modifying variables. It also provides functions for performing the pliable lasso (plasso).
Functions: Feature selection, Regression analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Neurobiology, Pathology, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/rakheon/svreg
Documentation:

name: UMI4Cats
text_content:
Tool Name: UMI4Cats
Description: UMI4Cats is an R package to analyze processing, analysis and visualization of UMI-4C chromatin contact data. UMI-4C is a technique that allows characterization of 3D chromatin interactions with a bait of interest, taking advantage of a sonication step to produce unique molecular identifiers (UMIs) that help remove duplication bias, thus allowing a better differential comparsion of chromatin interactions between conditions. This package allows processing of UMI-4C data, starting from FastQ files provided by the sequencing facility. It provides two statistical methods for detecting differential contacts and includes a visualization function to plot integrated information from a UMI-4C assay.
Functions: Quantification, Standardisation and normalisation, Visualisation
Topics: Chromosome conformation capture, DNA, Proteomics experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: https://www.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/UMI4Cats.html
Documentation:

name: VCF2CAPS
text_content:
Tool Name: VCF2CAPS
Description: VCF2CAPS is a VCF file analysis tool for CAPS marker development. The software facilitates the conversion of a large number of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs), multiple nucleotide polymorphisms (MNPs) and insertion/deletion (indel) polymorphisms detected by SNP calling tools, e.g. SAMtools, Platypus or FreeBayes, into CAPS markers.
Functions: Genetic mapping, Genotyping, Indel detection, PCR primer design, SNP detection
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Mapping, PCR experiment, Plant biology, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/Aviatore/vcf2caps
Documentation:

name: SpecHap

name: waddR
text_content:
Tool Name: waddR
Description: The waddR package offers statistical tests based on the 2-Wasserstein distance for detecting and characterizing differences between two distributions given in the form of samples. Functions for calculating the 2-Wasserstein distance and testing for differential distributions are provided, as well as specifically tailored test for differential expression in single-cell RNA sequencing data.
Functions: Differential gene expression profiling, Regression analysis, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, RNA-Seq, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://github.com/goncalves-lab/waddR

name: E2EDNA
text_content:

Topics: Biophysics, DNA, Molecular dynamics, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteomics experiment
Homepage: https://github.com/InfluenceFunctional/E2EDNA
Documentation:

name: eggNOG-mapper v2
text_content:
Tool Name: eggNOG-mapper v2
Description: EggNOG-mapper is a tool for fast functional annotation of novel sequences. It uses precomputed orthologous groups and phylogenies from the eggNOG database (http://eggnog5.embl.de) to transfer functional information from fine-grained orthologs only.
Functions: Fold recognition, Genome annotation, Homology-based gene prediction, Information extraction, Query and retrieval

name: geneBasis

name: JUMPt
text_content:
Tool Name: JUMPt
Description: JUMPt (JUMP-turnover) software determines the protein turnover rates in pulse SILAC labeled animals using mass spectrometry (MS) data. JUMPt uses a novel differential equation-based mathematical model to calculate the reliable and accurate protein turnover rates. The proposed method calculates the half-life of individual proteins by fitting the dynamic data of unlabeled free Lys and protein-bound Lys from individual proteins simultaneously.
Functions: Metabolic labeling, Molecular dynamics, SILAC
Topics: Mathematics, Proteomics, Proteomics experiment, Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: https://github.com/JUMPSuite/JUMPt

name: AnnotSV

name: FSA
text_content:
Tool Name: FSA
Description: FSA (Fast Statistical Alignment) is a probabilistic multiple sequence alignment algorithm which uses a "distance-based" approach to aligning homologous protein, RNA or DNA sequence. FSA brings the high accuracies previously available only for small-scale analyses of proteins or RNAs to large-scale problems such as aligning thousands of sequences or megabase-long sequences.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://fsa.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://fsa.sourceforge.net/FAQ.html

name: HH-suite

name: IonGAP
text_content:

name: MolProbity
text_content:
Tool Name: MolProbity
Description: MolProbity is a structure validation web service for diagnosing problems in 3D models of proteins, nucleic acids or complexes.  It adds and optimizes H atoms (correcting 180° flipped Asn/Gln/His sidechains), and then calculates global and local validation for all-atom contacts (steric clashes, H-bonds & vdW), covalent geometry, and conformation (Ramachandran & rotamers for protein, ribose puckers & suite conformers for RNA).  Results are displayed online as 3D graphics and sortable charts.
Functions: Molecular model refinement, Protein geometry calculation, Protein geometry validation, Protein model validation, Validation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://molprobity.biochem.duke.edu/

text_content:

It is entirely orientated towards rooted, time-measured phylogenies inferred using strict or relaxed molecular clock models. It can be used as a method of reconstructing phylogenies but is also a framework for testing evolutionary hypotheses without conditioning on a single tree topology.

ProSAP provides an integrated analysis workflow for thermal shift assay, which includes five modules: data preprocessing, data visualization, TPP analysis, NPARC analysis and iTSA analysis. With the assistance of the user-friendly interface, researchers can easily compare several statistical strategies, analyze the results and draw the conclusion from the proteomics quantitative table obtained by Proteome Discoverer or MaxQuant. Users would also benefit from a comprehensive overview of the performance of different algorithms, and apply appropriate algorithms to their dataset easily.

text_content:

It uses mainly profile-profile comparison to identify templates and alignments for deriving distance constraints. Its power lies in how it combines the distance constraints from up to the 50 best-ranked templates. It performs some knowledge-based free modelling in regions without any template-based information.

Topics: Function analysis, Molecular modelling, Protein structure analysis, Sequence assembly, Structure prediction

name: HCA (hydrophobic cluster analysis)
text_content:
Tool Name: HCA (hydrophobic cluster analysis)
Description: The HCA method is based on the use of a bidimensional plot, called the HCA plot. The bidimensional plot is associated with an alpha helicoidal pitch (3.6 residue/turn, connectivity distance of 4) which has been shown to offer the best correspondence between clusters and regular secondary structures. Examination of the HCA plot of a protein sequence allow to easily identify globular regions from non globular ones and, in globular regions, to identify secondary structures.
Functions: Protein hydrophobic region calculation
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Proteomics
Homepage: http://mobyle.rpbs.univ-paris-diderot.fr/cgi-bin/portal.py?form=HCA#forms::HCA
Documentation: http://bioserv.rpbs.univ-paris-diderot.fr/services/HCA/

name: TransMeta
text_content:
Tool Name: TransMeta
Description: TransMeta is an assembler that can simultaneously assemble RNA-seq reads of multiple samples. TransMeta can output a unified set of meta-annotations(GTF format) for all samples in an RNA-seq experiment and use the information from all the samples to generate a set of transcripts for each individual sample. TransMeta constructs the novel vector-weighted splicing graph model, in which the edges and nodes are weighted by vectors rather than single numbers with the element in kth position of the vectors being the corresponding weight in sample k. And TransMeta employs a cosine-similarity based combing strategy and label setting algorithm to recover the transcripts. TransMeta takes a file that lists the alignment files(Bam format) of multiple RNA-seq samples as input, and outputs all assembled candidate transcripts in GTF format.
Functions: RNA-Seq quantification, RNA-seq read count analysis, Sequence assembly
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-Seq, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://github.com/yutingsdu/TransMeta
Documentation:

name: SpCLUST
text_content:
Tool Name: SpCLUST
Description: > HOMEPAGE MISSING! | Towards a fast and reliable clustering for potentially divergent biological sequences | This paper presents SpCLUST, a new C++ package that takes a list of sequences as input, aligns them with MUSCLE, computes their similarity matrix in parallel and then performs the clustering. SpCLUST extends a previously released software by integrating additional scoring matrices which enables it to cover the clustering of amino-acid sequences. The similarity matrix is now computed in parallel according to the master slave distributed architecture, using MPI. Performance analysis, realized on two real datasets of 100 nucleotide sequences and 1049 amino-acids ones, show that the resulting library substantially outperforms the original Python package. The proposed package was also intensively evaluated on simulated and real genomic and protein data sets. The clustering results were compared to the most known traditional tools, such as UCLUST, CD-HIT and DNACLUST
Functions: N/A
Topics: Small molecules
Homepage: https://github.com/johnymatar/SpCLUST
Documentation:

name: Telescope
text_content:
Tool Name: Telescope
Description: Telescope is an open-source web application that tracks the progress of jobs submitted to remote servers using Sun Grid Engine (SGE) on-demand scheduling system. It allows remote scheduling of pre-defined pipelines, as well as re-scheduling queued jobs. Moreover, output files are rendered in HTML in real time, allowing the use of markdown and rich-text features. Telescope does not assume anything from the remote server, except for SSH connection. The connection is established using SSH key pairs that are stored after encrypted.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/Mangul-Lab-USC/telescope

name: Crop Analysis Tool Suite (CATS)
text_content:
Tool Name: Crop Analysis Tool Suite (CATS)
Description: A combination of several software tools for sequence analysis developed at the IPK Gatersleben. The BLAST server utilizes a homology search against the cereal genome resources (barley, rye and bread wheat). Kmasker plants is able to mask sequences originating from ten agronomically important plants based on mathematical defined repeats, furthermore, selection of sequences applicable for guideRNA construction for genome editing (CRISPR) or for fluorescence in situ hybridization is also possible. MISA web searches a sequence for microsatellites and is able generate molecular markers or primer. Using BRIDGE the complete barley collection of the IPK genebank can be visually explored in an interactive manner through diversity, certain phenotyped traits, and based on sequence polymorphisms. The barley genome explorer (BARLEX) is a system to visually inspect the reference genome sequence of barley, enriched with expression data, repeat and gene annotation and molecular marker data.
Functions: N/A
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Plant biology, Probes and primers
Homepage: https://cats.ipk-gatersleben.de/

name: Karyon
text_content:
Tool Name: Karyon
Description: Karyon is a computational framework for the diagnosis of hybrids, aneuploids, and other non-standard architectures in genome assemblies. Karyon is a pipeline for the assembly and analysis of highly heterozygous genomes. It uses redundans (Pryszcz & Gabaldón, 2016) to reduce heterozygosity during the assembly process, and then maps the original libraries against the reduced assembly to analyze the distribution of heterozygous regions. With this information, it generates a series of plots that can aid researchers to generate informed hypotheses with regard of the architecture of their genomes.
Functions: De-novo assembly, Genome assembly, Mapping assembly, Variant calling, de Novo sequencing
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Model organisms, Sequence assembly, Whole genome sequencing, Workflows

It can automatically identify differentially expressed microRNAs (DE miRNAs) between two conditions using two differential expression analysis software, namely DESeq2 and EdgeR, and is able to offer an integrated result suitable for experimental validation. Additionally, a functional analysis module puts biological meaning behind the list of DE miRNAs and eases the process of biomarker identification.

name: MEDUSA
text_content:
Tool Name: MEDUSA
Description: MEDUSA (Multiclass flexibility prediction from sequences of amino acids) is a deep learning approach for prediction of protein flexibility from sequence. MEDUSA takes as input an amino acid sequence and returns a flexibility class of each residue in terms of the expected normalized B-factor value range. Prediction is simultaneously performed in two-, three- and five classes using a convolutional neural network trained on a dataset of non-redundant X-ray structures.
Functions: Molecular dynamics, Protein structure prediction, Simulation analysis
Topics: Molecular dynamics, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein folds and structural domains, Small molecules, X-ray diffraction

text_content:
Tool Name: SeqTrace
Description: Application for viewing and processing DNA sequencing chromatograms (trace files). SeqTrace makes it easy to quickly generate high-quality finished sequences from a large number of trace files. SeqTrace can automatically identify, align, and compute consensus sequences from matching forward and reverse traces, filter low-quality base calls, and perform end trimming of finished sequences. The finished DNA sequences can then be exported to common sequence file formats, such as FASTA.
Functions: Chromatogram visualisation, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acids, Sequencing

name: baseLess
text_content:
Tool Name: baseLess
Description: Lightweight detection of sequences in raw MinION data. BaseLess reduces your MinION sequencing device to a simple species detector. As a trade-off, it runs on inexpensive computational hardware like single-board computers. The neural network it uses is a composite of many smaller networks, each detecting a different k-mer, thus reconfiguration of baseLess to detect a different sequence amounts to combining different smaller networks.
Functions: Base-calling, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Read mapping
Topics: Machine learning, Metagenomics, Model organisms, Nucleic acid structure analysis

name: 3SRP
text_content:
Tool Name: 3SRP
Description: A Snakemake-based pipeline for 3' sequencing RNA profiling data analysis.  This 3’ Digital gene expression sequencing technique allows a precise and low-cost transcriptome profiling.

The main steps of the pipeline are:
- Samples demultiplexing transform the raw paired-end fastq files into a single-end fastq file for each sample.
- Alignment on refseq reference transcriptome is performed using bwa.
- Aligned reads are parsed and UMI are counted for each gene in each sample to create an expression matrix.
If secondary analysis has been asked (providing a comparisons file), the expression matrix is normalized and differentially expressed genes (DEG) are searched using deseq2.
- If DEG are found, annotation is performed using the database GO and KEGG.
- A report is provided listing the main quality controls performed and the results found.

Cite : https://dx.doi.org/10.21203/rs.3.pex-1336/v1
Functions: Clustering profile plotting, Differential gene expression analysis, Heat map generation, RNA-seq read count analysis
Topics: Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://gitlab.univ-nantes.fr/bird_pipeline_registry/srp-pipeline
Documentation: https://gitlab.univ-nantes.fr/bird_pipeline_registry/srp-pipeline/-/wikis/home

name: VeryFastTree
text_content:
Tool Name: VeryFastTree
Description: VeryFastTree is a highly-tuned implementation of the FastTree-2 tool that takes advantage of parallelization and vectorization strategies to speed up the inference of phylogenies for huge alignments. It is important to highlight that VeryFastTree keeps unchanged the phases, methods and heuristics used by FastTree-2 to estimate the phylogenetic tree. In this way, it produces trees with the same topological accuracy than FastTree-2. In addition, unlike the parallel version of FastTree-2, VeryFastTree is deterministic.

To facilitate the adoption from the research community, VeryFastTree keeps exactly the same command line arguments than FastTree-2. In this way, it is only necessary to replace the call to FastTree-2 by a call to VeryFastTree using the same options to increase the overall performance.
Functions: Phylogenetic inference (from molecular sequences), Phylogenetic inference (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods)
Topics: Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/citiususc/veryfasttree
Documentation:

text_content:
Tool Name: OrthoFinder
Description: OrthoFinder is a fast, accurate and comprehensive platform for comparative genomics. It finds orthogroups and orthologs, infers rooted gene trees for all orthogroups and identifies all of the gene duplcation events in those gene trees. It also infers a rooted species tree for the species being analysed and maps the gene duplication events from the gene trees to branches in the species tree. OrthoFinder also provides comprehensive statistics for comparative genomic analyses.
Functions: Genome alignment, Genome comparison, Phylogenetic tree analysis, Phylogenetic tree generation (from molecular sequences)
Topics: Bioinformatics, Comparative genomics, Phylogenetics, Phylogenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/davidemms/OrthoFinder

name: seqkit
text_content:
Tool Name: seqkit
Description: FASTA and FASTQ are basic and ubiquitous formats for storing nucleotide and protein sequences. Common manipulations of FASTA/Q file include converting, searching, filtering, deduplication, splitting, shuffling, and sampling. Existing tools only implement some of these manipulations, and not particularly efficiently, and some are only available for certain operating systems. Furthermore, the complicated installation process of required packages and running environments can render these programs less user friendly. SeqKit demonstrates competitive performance in execution time and memory usage compared to similar tools. The efficiency and usability of SeqKit enable researchers to rapidly accomplish common FASTA/Q file manipulations.
Functions: DNA transcription, DNA translation, Sequence conversion, Sequence trimming
Topics: Database management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://bioinf.shenwei.me/seqkit/
Documentation:

name: VAPOR
text_content:
Tool Name: VAPOR
Description: VAPOR is a tool for classification of Influenza samples from raw short read sequence data for downstream bioinformatics analysis. VAPOR is provided with a fasta file of full-length sequences (> 20,000) for a given segment, a set of reads, and attempts to retrieve a reference that is closest to the sample strain.
Functions: Data retrieval, De-novo assembly, Read mapping
Topics: Mapping, Sequence assembly, Whole genome sequencing

name: POSMM
text_content:

Intended for short reads (e.g. 30-500nt), POSMM uses single-order Markov models and logistic regression models to assign taxa with an associated confidence at Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, and Species ranks.
Functions: Expression analysis, Regression analysis, Sequence assembly, Taxonomic classification

name: DeepAraPPI
text_content:
Tool Name: DeepAraPPI
Description: An integrated deep learning framework that uses sequence, domain and Gene Ontology information to predict PPIs of Arabidopsis thaliana. DeepAraPPI currently consists of three basic models: (i) a Siamese recurrent convolutional neural network (RCNN) model based on word2vec encoding, (ii) a multiple layer perceptron model based on Domain2vec encoding, and (iii) an multiple layer perceptron model based on GO2vec encoding. Finally, DeepAraPPI combines the results of three individual predictors using a logistic regression model.
Functions: Fold recognition, Network analysis, Protein interaction prediction, Regression analysis
Topics: Machine learning, Plant biology, Protein interactions
Homepage: http://zzdlab.com/deeparappi/

name: ReMap
text_content:
Tool Name: ReMap
Description: ReMap is a large scale integrative analysis of DNA-binding experiments for Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, Drosophila melanogaster and Arabidopsis thaliana transcriptional regulators. The catalogues are the results of the manual curation of ChIP-seq, ChIP-exo, DAP-seq from public sources (GEO, ENCODE, ENA). ReMap (https://remap.univ-amu.fr) aims to provide manually curated, high-quality catalogs of regulatory regions resulting from a large-scale integrative analysis of DNA-binding experiments in Human, Mouse, Fly and Arabidopsis thaliana for hundreds of transcription factors and regulators. In this 2022 update, we have uniformly processed >11 000 DNA-binding sequencing datasets from public sources across four species. The four regulatory catalogs are browsable through track hubs at UCSC, Ensembl and NCBI genome browsers.
Functions: Genome annotation, Peak calling, Read mapping, Sequence tag mapping
Topics: Epigenomics, Functional genomics, Gene regulation, Mapping, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Transcription factors and regulatory sites

Functions: Alignment, Classification, Protein modelling, Sequence clustering, Sequence comparison, Sequence motif comparison, Sequence similarity search, Visualisation

name: GPCR-SAS
text_content:
Tool Name: GPCR-SAS
Description: The G Protein-Coupled Receptors-Sequence Analysis and Statistics (GPCR-SAS) web application provides a set of tools to perform comparative analysis of sequence positions between receptors, based on a curated structural-informed multiple sequence alignment. The analysis tools include: (i) percentage of occurrence of an amino acid or motif and entropy at a position or range of positions, (ii) covariance of two positions, (iii) correlation between two amino acids in two positions (or two sequence motifs in two ranges of positions), and (iv) snake-plot representation for a specific receptor or for the consensus sequence of a group of selected receptors. The analysis of conservation of residues and motifs across transmembrane (TM) segments may guide the design of more selective ligands or help to rationalize activation mechanisms, among others. As an example, here we analyze the amino acids of the "transmission switch", that initiates receptor activation following ligand binding.
Functions: N/A
Topics: Computational biology, Protein interactions, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://lmc.uab.cat/gpcrsas/

text_content:
Tool Name: Deep-AVPiden
Description: A separable temporal convolutional networks based deep learning technique for discovering antiviral medicines.
The model behind this app is based on Temporal Convolutional Network (TCN). It uses the amino acid sequences of a given peptide as input and predicts whether the peptide is antifungal or not. The model consists of a word embedding layer, a spatial dropout layer, two TCN blocks, a global average pooling layer, a dense layer, and a dropout layer.

name: BAR
text_content:
Tool Name: BAR
Description: It is for the annotation of protein sequences relying on a comparative large-scale analysis on the entire UniProt. With BAR 3.0 and a sequence you can annotate when possible: function, structure, protein domains. Also if your sequence falls into a cluster with a structural/some structural template/s we provide an alignment towards the template/templates based on the Cluster-HMM that allows you to directly compute your 3D model. Cluster HMMs are available for downloading.
Functions: 3D profile generation, Database search, Functional clustering, Pathway or network prediction, Protein function prediction, Protein interaction prediction, Protein subcellular localisation prediction

name: COILS
text_content:

Description: Program that compares a sequence to a database of known parallel two-stranded coiled-coils and derives a similarity score. By comparing this score to the distribution of scores in globular and coiled-coil proteins, the program then calculates the probability that the sequence will adopt a coiled-coil conformation.

Topics: Protein structure analysis, Proteins, Statistics and probability

At the core of tinyRNA is a highly flexible counting utility, tiny-count, that allows for hierarchical assignment of small RNA reads to features based on positional information, extent of feature overlap, 5’ nucleotide, length, and strandedness. tinyRNA provides an all-in-one solution for small RNA-seq data analysis, with documentation and statistics generated at each step for accurate, reproducible results

Smoother is centered around an index including the genome, annotations, and datasets to be analyzed and visualized. Using this index, Smoother allows changing analysis parameters on-the-fly.

name: REPET
text_content:
Tool Name: REPET
Description: The REPET package integrates bioinformatics pipelines dedicated to detect, annotate and analyze transposable elements (TEs) in genomic sequences. The main pipelines are (i) TEdenovo, which search for interspersed repeats, build consensus sequences and classify them according to TE features, and (ii)
 TEannot, which mines a genome with a library of TE sequences, for instance the one produced by the TEdenovo pipeline, to provide TE annotations exported into GFF3 files.
Functions: Repeat sequence analysis, Repeat sequence detection
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: https://urgi.versailles.inrae.fr/Tools/REPET
Documentation: https://urgi.versailles.inrae.fr/Tools/REPET

name: SQUARNA
text_content:
Tool Name: SQUARNA
Description: SQUARNA is a tool for RNA secondary structure prediction. With a single RNA sequence as input, SQUARNA annotates and scores potential stems (stretches of consecutive canonical base pairs) and selects them one by one. SQUARNA handles pseudoknots and is able to predict alternative secondary structures. With a multiple sequence alignment input SQUARNA calculates the total matrix of stem scores and derives the most conserved base pairs. SQUARNA allows structural restraints and chemical probing data as additional input and is available at https://github.com/febos/SQUARNA.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Computational biology, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, RNA, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: https://github.com/febos/SQUARNA
Documentation: https://github.com/febos/SQUARNA/blob/main/README.md

name: ARTEM
text_content:
Tool Name: ARTEM
Description: ARTEM is a tool for the superposition of two arbitrary RNA 3D structure fragments.
ARTEM doesn’t rely on sequence similarity, annotated interactions, or backbone topology. Instead, ARTEM assumes at least one residue-residue match has a close-to-zero RMSD in the ideal superposition. Then, ARTEM tries all N*M single-residue matches and derives a subset of mutually closest residues as the matches for each of the single-residue-based superpositions. Finally, ARTEM returns the superpositions ordered by their size, letting the user choose the best one based on any specific requirements. ARTEM can read/write both PDB and mmCIF format.
Functions: Local structure alignment, Pairwise structure alignment
Topics: Computational biology, DNA, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Nucleic acids, RNA
Homepage: https://github.com/david-bogdan-r/ARTEM
Documentation: https://github.com/david-bogdan-r/ARTEM/blob/main/README.md

Description: T-Coffee is a multiple sequence alignment package. You can use T-Coffee to align sequences or to combine the output of your favorite alignment methods (Clustal, Mafft, Probcons, Muscle...) into one unique alignment (M-Coffee).

T-Coffee can align Protein, DNA and RNA sequences. It is also able to combine sequence information with protein structural information (3D-Coffee/Expresso), profile information (PSI-Coffee) or RNA secondary structures (R-Coffee).
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: Microbiology, Proteomics
Homepage: http://www.tcoffee.org/
Documentation:

name: mob_suite
text_content:

Description: MOB-suite: Software tools for clustering, reconstruction and typing of plasmids from draft assemblies
The MOB-suite depends on a series of databases which are too large to be hosted in git-hub. They can be downloaded or updated by running mob_init or if running any of the tools for the first time, the databases will download and initialize automatically if you do not specify an alternate database location.

Topics: Genomics, Genotype and phenotype, Metagenomics, Mobile genetic elements, Sequence assembly

name: kc-align
text_content:
Tool Name: kc-align
Description: A fast and accurate tool for performing codon-aware multiple sequence alignments. 

Kc-Align is a codon-aware multiple aligner that uses Kalgin2 to produce in-frame gapped codon alignments for selection analysis of small genomes (mostly viral and some smaller bacterial genomes). Takes nucleotide seqeunces as inputs, converts them to their in-frame amino acid sequences, performs multiple alignment with Kalign, and then converts the alignments back to their original codon sequence while preserving the gaps. Produces three outputs: the gapped nucleotide alignments in FASTA format and in CLUSTAL format and the amino acid level alignment.

Kc-Align will also attempt to detect any frameshift mutations in the input reads. If a frameshift is detected, that sequence will not be included in the multiple alignment and its ID will be printed to stdout.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Mapping
Homepage: https://github.com/davebx/kc-align
Documentation: https://github.com/davebx/kc-align/blob/dev/README.md

name: miniprot
text_content:
Tool Name: miniprot
Description: Miniprot aligns a protein sequence against a genome with affine gap penalty, splicing and frameshift. It is primarily intended for annotating protein-coding genes in a new species using known genes from other species.

Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/lh3/miniprot
Documentation: https://github.com/lh3/miniprot/blob/master/README.md

text_content:

Description: OMArk is a software for proteome (protein-coding gene repertoire) quality assessment. It provides measures of proteome completeness, characterizes the consistency of all protein coding genes with regard to their homologs, and identifies the presence of contamination from other species. OMArk relies on the OMA orthology database, from which it exploits orthology relationships, and on the OMAmer software for fast placement of all proteins into gene families.
Functions: Differential protein expression profiling, Sequence assembly validation
Topics: Proteomics, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: https://github.com/DessimozLab/OMArk
