Tool Name: DSS
Description: R library that performs differential analysis for count-based sequencing data. It detects differentially expressed genes (DEGs) from RNA-seq and differentially methylated loci or regions (DML/DMRs) from bisulfite sequencing (BS-seq). Its core is a new dispersion shrinkage method for estimating the dispersion parameter from Gamma-Poisson or Beta-Binomial distributions.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Differentially-methylated region identification
Topics: RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DSS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DSS.html

name: TFBSTools
text_content:
Tool Name: TFBSTools
Description: Package for the analysis and manipulation of transcription factor binding sites. It includes a matrix conversion system between Position Frequency Matrix (PFM), Position Weight Matrix (PWM) and Information Content Matrix (ICM). It can also scan putative TFBS from sequence/alignment, query the JASPAR database and provide a wrapper of de novo motif discovery software.
Functions: Sequence motif recognition, Transcription factor binding site prediction, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TFBSTools.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TFBSTools.html

name: SeqFeatR
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqFeatR
Description: SeqFeatR has been developed to identify associations between mutation patterns in biological sequences and specific selection pressures (“features”).
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Metagenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://seqfeatr.zmb.uni-due.de/
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/SeqFeatR/SeqFeatR.pdf

name: TCGAbiolinksGUI
text_content:
Tool Name: TCGAbiolinksGUI
Description: A Graphical User Interface to analyze cancer molecular and clinical data.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Differentially-methylated region identification
Topics: Epigenetics, Gene expression, Gene regulation, Genetics, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TCGAbiolinksGUI.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/TCGAbiolinksGUI/man/TCGAbiolinksGUI.pdf

name: R3CPET
text_content:
Tool Name: R3CPET
Description: The package provides a method to infer the set of proteins that are more probably to work together to maintain chormatin interaction given a ChIA-PET experiment results.
Functions: Pathway or network prediction, Pathway or network visualisation, Protein-protein interaction prediction, Statistical inference
Topics: ChIP-seq, Gene expression, Molecular modelling, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Protein interactions
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/R3CPET.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/R3CPET.html

name: PharmacoGx
text_content:
Tool Name: PharmacoGx
Description: Set of functions to perform large-scale analysis of pharmacogenomic data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Pharmacogenomics, Pharmacology
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PharmacoGx.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/PharmacoGx.html

name: HiC-Pro
text_content:
Tool Name: HiC-Pro
Description: This tool was designed to process Hi-C data, from raw fastq files (paired-end Illumina data) to the normalized contact maps. Since version 2.7.0, it can analyze data from digestion protocols as well as data from protocols that do not require restriction enzyme such as DNase Hi-C. The pipeline is flexible, scalable and optimized. It can operate either on a single laptop or on a computational cluster using the PBS-Torque scheduler.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Biology
Homepage: https://github.com/nservant/HiC-Pro
Documentation: https://github.com/nservant/HiC-Pro/blob/master/LICENSE

name: missMethyl
text_content:
Tool Name: missMethyl
Description: Normalisation and testing for differential variability and differential methylation for data from Illumina's Infinium HumanMethylation450 array. The normalisation procedure is subset-quantile within-array normalisation (SWAN). The test for differential variability is based on an empirical Bayes version of Levene's test. Gene ontology analysis is performed by taking into account the number of probes per gene on the array.
Functions: Methylation analysis, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/missMethyl.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/missMethyl.html

name: methylPipe
text_content:
Tool Name: methylPipe
Description: Memory efficient analysis of base resolution DNA methylation data in both the CpG and non-CpG sequence context. Integration of DNA methylation data derived from any methodology providing base- or low-resolution data.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Genetics, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylPipe.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylPipe.html

name: compEpiTools
text_content:
Tool Name: compEpiTools
Description: Tools for computational epigenomics developed for the analysis, integration and simultaneous visualization of various (epi)genomics data types across multiple genomic regions in multiple samples.
Functions: Multiple sample visualisation, Sequence analysis
Topics: Epigenomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/compEpiTools.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/compEpiTools.html

name: diffHic
text_content:
Tool Name: diffHic
Description: Detects differential interactions across biological conditions in a Hi-C experiment. Methods are provided for read alignment and data pre-processing into interaction counts. Statistical analysis is based on edgeR and supports normalization and filtering. Several visualization options are also available.
Functions: Clustering, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Omics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/diffHic.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/diffHic.html

name: motifbreakR
text_content:
Tool Name: motifbreakR
Description: Allows the biologist to judge in the first place whether the sequence surrounding the polymorphism is a good match, and in the second place how much information is gained or lost in one allele of the polymorphism relative to another. It is both flexible and extensible over previous offerings; giving a choice of algorithms for interrogation of genomes with motifs from public sources. It can predict effects for novel or previously described variants in public databases.
Functions: Sequence motif analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/motifbreakR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/motifbreakR.html

name: ViennNGS
text_content:
Tool Name: ViennNGS
Description: Build efficient pipelines for NGS data processing. Extracts and converts features from common NGS file formats, computation and evaluation of read mapping statistics, as well as normalization of RNA abundance. Moreover, It allows identification and characterization of splice junctions from RNA-seq data, parsing and condensing sequence motif data, automated construction of Assembly and Track Hubs for the UCSC genome browser, as well as wrapper routines for a set of commonly used NGS command line tools.
Functions: Expression analysis, RNA-Seq quantification, Read mapping, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, Workflows
Homepage: https://metacpan.org/release/Bio-ViennaNGS
Documentation: https://metacpan.org/release/Bio-ViennaNGS

name: NOISeq
text_content:
Tool Name: NOISeq
Description: Analysis of RNA-seq expression data or other similar kind of data. Exploratory plots to evualuate saturation, count distribution, expression per chromosome, type of detected features, features length, etc. Differential expression between two experimental conditions with no parametric assumptions.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/NOISeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/NOISeq.html

name: groHMM
text_content:
Tool Name: groHMM
Description: A pipeline for the analysis of GRO-seq data.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection, Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/groHMM.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/groHMM.html

name: SomaticSignatures
text_content:
Tool Name: SomaticSignatures
Description: This package identifies mutational signatures of single nucleotide variants (SNVs).
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SomaticSignatures.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SomaticSignatures.html

name: sincell
text_content:
Tool Name: sincell
Description: This package implements a methodological toolbox allowing flexible workflows under such framework and it contributes new algorithms to provide cell-state hierarchies with statistical support while accounting for stochastic factors in single-cell RNA seq. Graphical representations and functional association tests are provided to interpret hierarchies.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA, RNA-seq, Taxonomy, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/sincell.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/sincell/man/sincell.pdf

name: Forna
text_content:
Tool Name: Forna
Description: Web-based tool for displaying RNA secondary structure which allows users to easily convert sequences and secondary structures to clean, concise and customizable visualizations.
Functions: Structure visualisation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://rna.tbi.univie.ac.at/forna/
Documentation: http://nibiru.tbi.univie.ac.at/forna/documentation.html

name: ropls
text_content:
Tool Name: ropls
Description: The package includes methods for variable modeling as PCA or PLS, that can be useful for visualization, regression, classification, and feature selection of omics data where the number of variables exceeds the number of samples and with multicollinearity among variables. Orthogonal Partial Least Squares (OPLS) also enables to separately model the variation correlated (predictive) to the factor of interest and the uncorrelated (orthogonal) variation.
Functions: Genome visualisation, Regression analysis, Sequence feature detection
Topics: Omics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ropls.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ropls.html

name: RNAprobR
text_content:
Tool Name: RNAprobR
Description: This package facilitates analysis of Next Generation Sequencing data for which positional information with a single nucleotide resolution is a key. It allows for applying different types of relevant normalizations, data visualization and export in a table or UCSC compatible bedgraph file.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RNAprobR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RNAprobR.html

name: AllelicImbalance
text_content:
Tool Name: AllelicImbalance
Description: Provides a framework for allelic specific expression investigation using RNA-seq data.
Functions: Gene expression analysis
Topics: RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/AllelicImbalance.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/AllelicImbalance.html

name: quantro
text_content:
Tool Name: quantro
Description: A data-driven test for the assumptions of quantile normalization using raw data such as objects that inherit eSets (e.g. ExpressionSet, MethylSet). Group level information about each sample (such as Tumor / Normal status) must also be provided because the test assesses if there are global differences in the distributions between the user-defined groups.
Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/quantro.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/quantro.html

name: FourCSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: FourCSeq
Description: R package dedicated to the analysis of (multiplexed) 4C sequencing data. It provides a pipeline to detect specific interactions between DNA elements and identify differential interactions between conditions. The statistical analysis in R starts with individual bam files for each sample as inputs. To obtain these files, the package contains a python script to demultiplex libraries and trim off primer sequences. With a standard alignment software the required bam files can be then be generated.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/FourCSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/FourCSeq.html

name: AntaRNA
text_content:
Tool Name: AntaRNA
Description: Multi-objective sequence design by inverse folding.
Functions: Nucleic acid design
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/AntaRNA/
Documentation: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/AntaRNA/

name: DMRcate
text_content:
Tool Name: DMRcate
Description: De novo identification and extraction of differentially methylated regions (DMRs) from the human genome using Whole Genome Bisulphite Sequencing (WGBS) and Illumina Infinium Array (450K and EPIC) data. Provides functionality for filtering probes possibly confounded by SNPs and cross-hybridisation. Includes GRanges generation and plotting functions.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMRcate.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMRcate.html

name: strum
text_content:
Tool Name: strum
Description: strum is a structural equation modelling software tool for genetic analysis.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Applied mathematics, Genetics
Homepage: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/strum/index.html
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/strum/strum.pdf

name: SPARSE
text_content:
Tool Name: SPARSE
Description: Very efficient structure-based alignment of RNAs.
Functions: Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/SPARSE
Documentation: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/SPARSE/

name: cleanUpdTSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: cleanUpdTSeq
Description: This package uses the Naive Bayes classifier (from e1071) to assign probability values to putative polyadenylation sites (pA sites) based on training data from zebrafish. This will allow the user to separate true, biologically relevant pA sites from false, oligodT primed pA sites.
Functions: Sequence trimming
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cleanUpdTSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/cleanUpdTSeq.html

name: KeBABS
text_content:
Tool Name: KeBABS
Description: This package provides functionality for kernel based analysis of biological sequences via Support Vector Machine (SVM) based methods. Biological sequences include DNA, RNA, and amino acid (AA) sequences. Sequence kernels define similarity measures between sequences.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: DNA, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.jku.at/software/kebabs/
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/kebabs.html

name: normalize450K
text_content:
Tool Name: normalize450K
Description: This package provides functions to read and normalize 450K '.idat' files. The normalization corrects for dye bias and biases related to signal intensity and methylation of probes using local regression. No adjustment for probe type bias is performed to avoid the trade-off of precision for accuracy of beta-values.
Functions: Regression analysis, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Microarray experiment, Probes and primers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/normalize450K.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/normalize450K.html

name: ChIPseeker
text_content:
Tool Name: ChIPseeker
Description: This package implements functions to retrieve the nearest genes around the peak, annotate the genomic region of the peak, statistical methods for estimating the significance of overlap among ChIP peak data sets, and incorporate GEO database to compare the own dataset with those deposited in database. The comparison can be used to infer cooperative regulation and thus can be used to generate hypotheses.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Sequence annotation, Sequence feature comparison, Visualisation
Topics: ChIP-seq, Data mining, Data visualisation
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ChIPseeker.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ChIPseeker.html

name: CAGEr
text_content:
Tool Name: CAGEr
Description: Preprocessing of CAGE sequencing data, identification and normalization of transcription start sites and downstream analysis of transcription start sites clusters (promoters).
Functions: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Gene expression, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CAGEr.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CAGEr.html

name: ClassifyR
text_content:
Tool Name: ClassifyR
Description: The software formalises a framework for classification in R with four stages: data transformation, feature selection, classifier training, and prediction. The requirements of variable types and names are fixed, although specialised variables for functions can be provided. The classification framework is wrapped in a driver loop, that reproducibly carries out a number of cross-validation schemes.
Functions: Sequence classification
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ClassifyR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ClassifyR.html

name: wavClusteR
text_content:
Tool Name: wavClusteR
Description: The package provides an integrated pipeline for the analysis of PAR-CLIP data. PAR-CLIP-induced transitions are first discriminated from sequencing errors, SNPs and additional non-experimental sources by a non- parametric mixture model. The protein binding sites (clusters) are then resolved at high resolution and cluster statistics are estimated using a rigorous Bayesian framework.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction, RNA structure prediction, Sequence annotation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/wavClusteR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/wavClusteR.html

name: BiocGenerics
text_content:
Tool Name: BiocGenerics
Description: S4 generic functions needed by many BioConductor packages.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Genotyping
Topics: Gene expression, Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiocGenerics.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiocGenerics.html

name: ExpaRNA-P
text_content:
Tool Name: ExpaRNA-P
Description: Simultaneous exact pattern matching and folding of RNAs.
Functions: Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/ExpaRNA-P/
Documentation: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/ExpaRNA-P/

name: DupChecker
text_content:
Tool Name: DupChecker
Description: Meta-analysis has become a popular approach for high-throughput genomic data analysis because it can significantly increase power to detect biological signals or patterns in datasets. However, when using public-available databases for meta-analysis, duplication of samples is an often-encountered problem. Not removing duplicates would make study results questionable. We developed a BioConductor package that efficiently identifies duplicated samples by generating MD5 fingerprints for raw data.
Functions: Sequence redundancy removal
Topics: Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DupChecker.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DupChecker.html

name: jD2Stat
text_content:
Tool Name: jD2Stat
Description: A Java package that utilises a series of D2 statistics to extract k-mers (subsequences at defined k length) from a set of biological sequences, and generate pairwise distances for each possible pair. This distance can be used directly for phylogenetic inference using neighbour-joining.
Functions: Sequence distance matrix generation, k-mer counting
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.org.au/tools/jD2Stat/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.org.au/tools/jD2Stat/jD2Stat_User_manual.pdf

name: DOQTL
text_content:
Tool Name: DOQTL
Description: Quantitative trait locus (QTL) mapping pipeline designed for Diversity Outbred mice and other multi-parent outbred populations. The package reads in data from genotyping arrays and perform haplotype reconstruction using a hidden Markov model (HMM). The haplotype probabilities from the HMM are then used to perform linkage mapping. When founder sequences are available, it can use the haplotype reconstructions to impute the founder sequences onto DO genomes and perform association mapping.
Functions: Gene expression QTL analysis
Topics: Genomics, Machine learning, Zoology
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DOQTL.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DOQTL.html

name: QDNAseq
text_content:
Tool Name: QDNAseq
Description: Quantitative DNA sequencing for chromosomal aberrations. The genome is divided into non-overlapping fixed-sized bins, number of sequence reads in each counted, adjusted with a simultaneous two-dimensional loess correction for sequence mappability and GC content, and filtered to remove spurious regions in the genome. Downstream steps of segmentation and calling are also implemented via packages DNAcopy and CGHcall, respectively.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/QDNAseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/QDNAseq.html

name: BiRewire
text_content:
Tool Name: BiRewire
Description: Fast functions for bipartite network rewiring through N consecutive switching steps and for the computation of the minimal number of switching steps to be performed in order to maximise the dissimilarity with respect to the original network. Includes functions for the analysis of the introduced randomness across the switching steps and several other routines to analyse the resulting networks and their natural projections.
Functions: Sequence mutation and randomisation
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiRewire.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BiRewire.html

name: TitanCNA
text_content:
Tool Name: TitanCNA
Description: Hidden Markov model to segment and predict regions of subclonal copy number alterations (CNA) and loss of heterozygosity (LOH), and estimate cellular prevalenece of clonal clusters in tumour whole genome sequencing data.
Functions: Polymorphism detection, Sequence analysis, Structural variation detection
Topics: DNA structural variation, Data mining, Oncology, Statistics and probability, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TitanCNA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TitanCNA.html

name: biomvRCNS
text_content:
Tool Name: biomvRCNS
Description: In this package, a Hidden Semi Markov Model (HSMM) and one homogeneous segmentation model are designed and implemented for segmentation genomic data, with the aim of assisting in transcripts detection using high throughput technology like RNA-seq or tiling array, and copy number analysis using aCGH or sequencing.
Functions: Nucleic acid feature detection
Topics: Microarray experiment, RNA-seq, Sequence analysis, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/biomvRCNS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/biomvRCNS.html

name: exomePeak
text_content:
Tool Name: exomePeak
Description: The package is developed for the analysis of affinity-based epitranscriptome shortgun sequencing data from MeRIP-seq (maA-seq). It was built based on the MATLAB package (Meng, Jia, et al. "Exome-based analysis for RNA epigenome sequencing data." Bioinformatics 29.12 (2013): 1565-1567.) with new functions for differential analysis of two experimental conditions to unveil the dynamics in post-transcriptional regulation of the RNA methylome.
Functions: Peak calling
Topics: Exome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/exomePeak.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/exomePeak.html

name: EDASeq
text_content:
Tool Name: EDASeq
Description: Numerical and graphical summaries of RNA-Seq read data. Within-lane normalization procedures to adjust for GC-content effect (or other gene-level effects) on read counts: loess robust local regression, global-scaling, and full-quantile normalization (Risso et al., 2011). Between-lane normalization procedures to adjust for distributional differences between lanes (e.g., sequencing depth): global-scaling and full-quantile normalization (Bullard et al., 2010).
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: RNA-seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/EDASeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/EDASeq.html

name: DMRforPairs
text_content:
Tool Name: DMRforPairs
Description: This tool compares n>=2 unique samples regarding their methylation profile in either single CpG locus or region based analysis, defining regions of interest as genomic ranges with sufficient probes located in close proximity to each other. Probes in one region are optionally annotated to the same functional classes and differential methylation is evaluated by comparing the methylation values within each region between individual samples.
Functions: Methylation analysis, Sequence feature comparison
Topics: Epigenetics, Microarray experiment, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMRforPairs.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMRforPairs.html

name: chipenrich
text_content:
Tool Name: chipenrich
Description: ChIP-Enrich performs gene set enrichment testing using peaks called from a ChIP-seq experiment. The method empirically corrects for confounding factors such as the length of genes, and the mappability of the sequence surrounding genes.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Data quality management
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/chipenrich.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/chipenrich.html

name: PepExplorer
text_content:
Tool Name: PepExplorer
Description: PepExplorer – Statistically Filtering and Organising de novo Sequencing Results
Functions: Filtering, Protein sequence analysis, de Novo sequencing
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://proteomics.fiocruz.br/software.html
Documentation: http://www.mcponline.org/content/13/9/2480

name: csaw
text_content:
Tool Name: csaw
Description: Detection of differentially bound regions in ChIP-seq data with sliding windows, with methods for normalization and proper FDR control.
Functions: Read depth analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Data visualisation, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/csaw.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/csaw.html

name: RNABindRPlus
text_content:
Tool Name: RNABindRPlus
Description: RNABindRPlus predicts RNA-binding residues from protein sequences by combining the output from a Support Vector Machine (SVM) classifier with the output from a Homology-based method.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://ailab1.ist.psu.edu/RNABindRPlus/
Documentation: http://ailab1.ist.psu.edu/RNABindRPlus/instructions.html

name: IntaRNA - RNA-RNA interaction
text_content:
Tool Name: IntaRNA - RNA-RNA interaction
Description: sRNA target prediction.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/IntaRNA/
Documentation: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/Help.jsp

name: CopraRNA web server
text_content:
Tool Name: CopraRNA web server
Description: sRNA target prediction boosted by comparative information.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/CopraRNA/
Documentation: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/Help.jsp

name: flipflop
text_content:
Tool Name: flipflop
Description: Discovers which isoforms of a gene are expressed in a given sample together with their abundances, based on RNA-Seq read data. It takes an alignment file in SAM format as input, and it can also discover transcripts from several samples simultaneously, increasing statistical power.
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis, Splicing model analysis
Topics: Gene transcripts, RNA, RNA splicing, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/flipflop.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/flipflop.html

name: FRGEpistasis
text_content:
Tool Name: FRGEpistasis
Description: A Tool for Epistasis Analysis Based on Functional Regression Model.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Regression analysis
Topics: Quantitative genetics, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/FRGEpistasis.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/FRGEpistasis.html

name: ReadXplorer
text_content:
Tool Name: ReadXplorer
Description: Freely available comprehensive exploration and evaluation tool for NGS data. It extracts and adds quantity and quality measures to each alignment in order to classify the mapped reads. This classification is then taken into account for the different data views and all supported automatic analysis functions.
Functions: Sequence visualisation
Topics: Comparative genomics, Structural genomics, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://readxplorer.org
Documentation: http://readxplorer.org

name: ChIPQC
text_content:
Tool Name: ChIPQC
Description: Quality metrics for ChIPseq data.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ChIPQC.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ChIPQC.html

name: SVAMP
text_content:
Tool Name: SVAMP
Description: Standalone desktop application to visualise variants (SNPs and indels) and peform realtime analysis on selected regions of a genome on specific samples.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, Phylogenetic tree generation, Principal component plotting
Topics: DNA structural variation, Data visualisation, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.cbrc.kaust.edu.sa/svamp/
Documentation: http://www.cbrc.kaust.edu.sa/svamp/downloads/svamp_manual_V2.10.pdf

name: seqCNA
text_content:
Tool Name: seqCNA
Description: Copy number analysis of high-throughput sequencing cancer data with fast summarization, extensive filtering and improved normalization.
Functions: Copy number estimation
Topics: Oncology, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seqCNA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seqCNA.html

name: FISH Amyloid
text_content:
Tool Name: FISH Amyloid
Description: FISH Amyloid is a new method for finding amyloidogenic segments in proteins based on site specific co-occurrence of aminoacids.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins
Homepage: http://comprec-lin.iiar.pwr.edu.pl/fishInput/
Documentation: http://comprec-lin.iiar.pwr.edu.pl/fishAbout/

name: SeqGSEA
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqGSEA
Description: The package generally provides methods for gene set enrichment analysis of high-throughput RNA-Seq data by integrating differential expression and splicing. It uses negative binomial distribution to model read count data, which accounts for sequencing biases and biological variation. Based on permutation tests, statistical significance can also be achieved regarding each gene's differential expression and splicing, respectively.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SeqGSEA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SeqGSEA.html

name: bumphunter
text_content:
Tool Name: bumphunter
Description: Tools for finding bumps in genomic data.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bumphunter.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bumphunter.html

name: DNENRICH
text_content:
Tool Name: DNENRICH
Description: Statistical software package for calculating gene set enrichment for de novo mutations (typically detected by exome sequencing) of a disease cohort.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Genetics, Pathology
Homepage: https://psychgen.u.hpc.mssm.edu/dnenrich/
Documentation: https://psychgen.u.hpc.mssm.edu/dnenrich/started.shtml

name: GraphProt
text_content:
Tool Name: GraphProt
Description: GraphProt can be used for modeling binding preferences of RNA-binding proteins from high-throughput experiments such as CLIP-seq and RNAcompete.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, RNA
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/GraphProt/
Documentation: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/GraphProt/

name: deepSNV
text_content:
Tool Name: deepSNV
Description: This package implements methods for carrying out differential expression analyses of genome-wide gene expression studies. Significance testing using the optimal discovery procedure and generalized likelihood ratio tests are implemented for general study designs. Special functions are available to facilitate the analysis of common study designs, including time course experiments. Other packages are integrated to provide a wide range of tools for gene expression analysis.
Functions: Variant calling
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/deepSNV.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/deepSNV.html

name: derfinder
text_content:
Tool Name: derfinder
Description: This package provides functions for annotation-agnostic differential expression analysis of RNA-seq data. Two implementations of the DER Finder approach are included in this package: (1) single base-level F-statistics and (2) DER identification at the expressed regions-level. The DER Finder approach can also be used to identify differentially bounded ChIP-seq peaks.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/derfinder.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/derfinder.html

name: RUBI
text_content:
Tool Name: RUBI
Description: New web server to detect regions of proteins which are thought to contain ubiquitinated lysines.
Functions: Prediction and recognition
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://protein.bio.unipd.it/rubi/
Documentation: http://protein.bio.unipd.it/rubi/help_pages/help.html

name: phenoDist
text_content:
Tool Name: phenoDist
Description: This tool is designed for measuring phenotypic distance in image-based high-throughput screening, in order to identify strong phenotypes and to group treatments into functional clusters.
Functions: Clustering, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Image analysis, Sequence profile alignment, Statistical calculation
Topics: Cell biology, Drug discovery, Functional genomics, RNAi experiment, Systems biology
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/phenoDist.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/phenoDist.html

name: MEDIPS
text_content:
Tool Name: MEDIPS
Description: This tool was developed for analyzing data derived from Methylated DNA ImmunoPrecipitation (MeDIP) experiments followed by sequencing (MeDIP-seq). However, it provides functionalities for the analysis of any kind of quantitative sequencing data (e.g. ChIP-seq, MBD-seq, CMS-seq and others) including calculation of differential coverage between groups of samples and saturation and correlation analysis.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MEDIPS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/MEDIPS.html

name: SIMAP
text_content:
Tool Name: SIMAP
Description: Similarity Matrix of Proteins.
Functions: Local alignment
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cube.univie.ac.at/resources/simap
Documentation: http://cube.univie.ac.at/resources/simap

name: ReportingTools
text_content:
Tool Name: ReportingTools
Description: This software package enables users to easily display reports of analysis results generated from sources such as microarray and sequencing data. The package allows users to create HTML pages that may be viewed on a web browser such as Safari, or in other formats readable by programs such as Excel. Users can generate tables with sortable and filterable columns, make and display plots, and link table entries to other data sources such as NCBI or larger plots within the HTML page.
Functions: Expression data visualisation
Topics: Computer science
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ReportingTools.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ReportingTools.html

name: ChIPpeakAnno
text_content:
Tool Name: ChIPpeakAnno
Description: The package includes functions to retrieve the sequences around the peak, obtain enriched GO terms, find the nearest gene, exon, miRNA or custom features such as most conserved elements and other TF binding sites supplied by users. New functions have been added for finding the peaks with bi-directional promoters with summary statistics, for summarizing the occurrence of motifs in peaks and for adding other IDs to annotated peaks or enrichedGO.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis, Sequence annotation
Topics: ChIP-on-chip, ChIP-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ChIPpeakAnno.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ChIPpeakAnno.html

name: GenomicAlignments
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomicAlignments
Description: Provides efficient containers for storing and manipulating short genomic alignments (typically obtained by aligning short reads to a reference genome). This includes read counting, computing the coverage, junction detection, and working with the nucleotide content of the alignments.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis, RNA-seq read count analysis, Read depth analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicAlignments.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicAlignments.html

name: GenomicRanges
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomicRanges
Description: This package defines general purpose containers for storing and manipulating genomic intervals and variables defined along a genome. More specialized containers for representing and manipulating short alignments against a reference genome, or a matrix-like summarization of an experiment, are defined in the GenomicAlignments and SummarizedExperiment packages respectively.
Functions: Data handling, Sequence annotation
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicRanges.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicRanges.html

name: NetDiseaseSNP
text_content:
Tool Name: NetDiseaseSNP
Description: The tool predicts whether a single non-synonymous SNP causes a disease or is invariant.
Functions: Protein function prediction
Topics: Function analysis
Homepage: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/NetDiseaseSNP/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/NetDiseaseSNP/instructions.php

name: SSPA
text_content:
Tool Name: SSPA
Description: General Sample size and power analysis for microarray and next-generation sequencing data.
Functions: Statistical calculation
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SSPA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/SSPA.html

name: HIBAG
text_content:
Tool Name: HIBAG
Description: It is a software package for imputing HLA types using SNP data, and relies on a training set of HLA and SNP genotypes. It can be used by researchers with published parameter estimates instead of requiring access to large training sample datasets. It combines the concepts of attribute bagging (improves the accuracy and stability of classifier ensembles using bootstrap aggregating and random variable selection), an ensemble classifier method, with haplotype inference for SNPs and HLA types.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Immunology, Immunoproteins, genes and antigens
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/HIBAG.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/HIBAG.html

name: triplex
text_content:
Tool Name: triplex
Description: This package provides functions for the identification and visualization of potential intramolecular triplex patterns in DNA sequence. The main functionality is to detect the positions of subsequences capable of folding into an intramolecular triplex (H-DNA) in a much larger sequence. The potential H-DNA (triplexes) should be made of as many cannonical nucleotide triplets as possible. The package includes visualization showing the exact base-pairing in 1D, 2D or 3D.
Functions: Nucleic acid property calculation, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Structure visualisation
Topics: Computational chemistry, Data visualisation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/triplex.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/triplex.html

name: NAFlex
text_content:
Tool Name: NAFlex
Description: Nucleic Acids flexibility analysis portal.
Functions: Molecular dynamics, Nucleic acid structure analysis, Structure visualisation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis
Homepage: http://mmb.irbbarcelona.org/NAFlex/
Documentation: http://mmb.irbbarcelona.org/NAFlex/help.php?id=references

name: phyloseq
text_content:
Tool Name: phyloseq
Description: Provides a set of classes and tools to facilitate the import, storage, analysis, and graphical display of microbiome census data.
Functions: Analysis, Deposition, Visualisation
Topics: Metagenomics, Microbiology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/phyloseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/phyloseq.html

name: COHCAP
text_content:
Tool Name: COHCAP
Description: This package provides a pipeline to analyze single-nucleotide resolution methylation data (Illumina 450k/EPIC methylation array, targeted BS-Seq, etc.). It provides differential methylation for CpG Sites, differential methylation for CpG Islands, integration with gene expression data, with visualizaton options.
Functions: Methylation analysis, Sequence visualisation
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/COHCAP.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/COHCAP.html

name: clonotypeR
text_content:
Tool Name: clonotypeR
Description: The purpose of this package is to process and quantitatively analyse millions of V-CDR3-J combination, called clonotypes, from multiple sequence libraries.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Immunology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/clonotypeR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/clonotypeR.html

name: bsseq
text_content:
Tool Name: bsseq
Description: A collection of tools for analyzing and visualizing bisulfite sequencing data.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Immunoprecipitation experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bsseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/bsseq.html

name: methylKit
text_content:
Tool Name: methylKit
Description: R package for DNA methylation analysis and annotation from high-throughput bisulfite sequencing. The package is designed to deal with sequencing data from RRBS and its variants, but also target-capture methods and whole genome bisulfite sequencing. It also has functions to analyze base-pair resolution 5hmC data from experimental protocols such as oxBS-Seq and TAB-Seq. Perl is needed to read SAM files only.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Methylated DNA immunoprecipitation
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylKit.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/methylKit.html

name: easyRNASeq
text_content:
Tool Name: easyRNASeq
Description: Calculates the coverage of high-throughput short-reads against a genome of reference and summarizes it per feature of interest (e.g. exon, gene, transcript). The data can be normalized as 'RPKM' or by the 'DESeq' or 'edgeR' package.
Functions: Gene expression profiling
Topics: RNA-seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/easyRNASeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/easyRNASeq.html

name: triform
text_content:
Tool Name: triform
Description: IT is an R package to find enriched regions in trancription factor ChIP-seq data. The algorithm uses model-free statistics to identify peak-like distributions of TF ChIP sequencing reads, taking advantage of an improved peak definition in combination with known profile characteristics.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Peak calling, Statistical calculation, Transcription factor binding site prediction
Topics: ChIP-seq, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/triform.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/triform.html

name: CARNA web server
text_content:
Tool Name: CARNA web server
Description: Alignment of RNA structure ensembles.
Functions: Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/CARNA/
Documentation: http://rna.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/Help.jsp

name: BitSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: BitSeq
Description: This package is targeted for transcript expression analysis and DE analysis of RNA-seq data in a two-stage process. In the first stage it uses Bayesian methodology to infer expression of individual transcripts from individual RNA-seq experiments. The second stage embraces the DE analysis of transcript expression by providing expression estimates from replicates of multiple conditions.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BitSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BitSeq.html

name: LocARNA-P
text_content:
Tool Name: LocARNA-P
Description: Probabilistic structure-based multiple alignment of RNAs.
Functions: Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/LocARNA/
Documentation: http://www.bioinf.uni-freiburg.de/Software/LocARNA/

name: R4RNA
text_content:
Tool Name: R4RNA
Description: A package for RNA basepair analysis, including the visualization of basepairs as arc diagrams for easy comparison and annotation of sequence and structure. Arc diagrams can additionally be projected onto multiple sequence alignments to assess basepair conservation and covariation, with numerical methods for computing statistics for each.
Functions: RNA-Seq quantification, Sequence visualisation
Topics: RNA
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/R4RNA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/R4RNA.html

name: pcaGoPromoter
text_content:
Tool Name: pcaGoPromoter
Description: This package contains functions to ease the analyses of DNA micro arrays. It utilizes principal component analysis as the initial multivariate analysis, followed by functional interpretation of the principal component dimensions with overrepresentation analysis for GO terms and regulatory interpretations using overrepresentation analysis of predicted transcription factor binding sites with the primo algorithm.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, DNA binding sites, Microarray experiment
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/pcaGoPromoter.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/pcaGoPromoter.html

name: EhecRegNet
text_content:
Tool Name: EhecRegNet
Description: Database and analysis platform for pathogenic E. coli transcriptional gene regulatory networks. The database contains the known regulatory network of E. coli K-12 extracted from RegulonDB. In addition, it provides inter-species transferred gene regulatory interactions for 16 pathogenic E. coli strains.
Functions: Pathway or network analysis, Sequence database search
Topics: Mapping
Homepage: https://ehecregnet.compbio.sdu.dk/v2/index.html
Documentation: https://ehecregnet.compbio.sdu.dk/v2/index.html

name: fastseg
text_content:
Tool Name: fastseg
Description: Implements a very fast and efficient segmentation algorithm. It has similar functionality as DNACopy (Olshen and Venkatraman 2004), but is considerably faster and more flexible. It can segment data from DNA microarrays and data from next generation sequencing for example to detect copy number segments. Further it can segment data from RNA microarrays like tiling arrays to identify transcripts. Most generally, it can segment data given as a matrix or as a vector.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Microarray experiment, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/fastseg.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/fastseg.html

name: seq2pathway
text_content:
Tool Name: seq2pathway
Description: This functional gene-set tool for the analysis of NGS data consists of "seq2gene" and "gene2path" components. The seq2gene component links sequence-level measurements of genomic regions (including SNPs or point mutation coordinates) to gene-level scores, and the gene2path feature summarizes gene scores to pathway-scores for each sample.
Functions: Pathway or network analysis, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, GWAS study, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seq2pathway.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seq2pathway.html

name: seqbias
text_content:
Tool Name: seqbias
Description: This package implements a model of per-position sequencing bias in high-throughput sequencing data using a simple Bayesian network, the structure and parameters of which are trained on a set of aligned reads and a reference genome sequence.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seqbias.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seqbias.html

name: Genome Wide Association Study pipeline (GWASpi)
text_content:
Tool Name: Genome Wide Association Study pipeline (GWASpi)
Description: User-friendly, multiplatform, desktop-able application for the management and analysis of GWAS data, with a novel approach on database technologies to leverage the most out of commonly available desktop hardware. GWASpi aims to be a start-to-finish GWAS management application, from raw data to results, containing the most common analysis tools.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: GWAS study
Homepage: http://www.gwaspi.org/
Documentation: http://www.gwaspi.org/?page_id=226

name: CSAR
text_content:
Tool Name: CSAR
Description: Statistical tools for ChIP-seq data analysis. Taking the average DNA fragment size subjected to sequencing into account, the software calculates genomic single-nucleotide read-enrichment values. After normalization, sample and control are compared using a test based on the Poisson distribution. Test statistic thresholds to control the false discovery rate are obtained through random permutation.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CSAR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CSAR.html

name: parmigene
text_content:
Tool Name: parmigene
Description: The package provides a parallel estimation of the mutual information based on entropy estimates from k-nearest neighbours distances and algorithms for the reconstruction of gene regulatory networks.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis (site correlation)
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/parmigene/index.html
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/parmigene/parmigene.pdf

name: R453Plus1Toolbox
text_content:
Tool Name: R453Plus1Toolbox
Description: Comprises useful functions for the analysis of data generated by Roche's 454 sequencing platform. It adds functions for quality assurance as well as for annotation and visualization of detected variants, complementing the software tools shipped by Roche with their product. Further, a pipeline for the detection of structural variants is provided.
Functions: Sequence analysis, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Genomics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/R453Plus1Toolbox.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/R453Plus1Toolbox.html

name: EffectiveCCBD
text_content:
Tool Name: EffectiveCCBD
Description: Prediction of Type-III secreted proteins by recognition of chaperone-binding sites.
Functions: Protein-protein interaction prediction
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.effectivedb.org/method/effectiveccbd
Documentation: http://www.effectivedb.org/method/effectiveccbd

name: EffectiveELD
text_content:
Tool Name: EffectiveELD
Description: Prediction of putative secreted proteins based on eukaryotic-like domains (ELD).
Functions: Enrichment analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.effectivedb.org/method/effectiveeld
Documentation: http://www.effectivedb.org/method/effectiveeld

name: EffectiveDB
text_content:
Tool Name: EffectiveDB
Description: Prediction of intact bacterial protein secretion systems and putative secreted proteins.
Functions: Protein feature detection, Virulence prediction
Topics: Comparative genomics, Metagenomics, Protein sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.effectivedb.org/
Documentation: http://www.effectivedb.org/

name: PredCSF
text_content:
Tool Name: PredCSF
Description: The web server PredCSF was developed by using modified one-versus-rest SVMs. The SVMs’input features are composed of physicochemical properties, evolutionary information, second structure and amino acid composition. Each SVM classifier’s output is the probability assigned to a superfamily.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Probability
Homepage: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/PredCSF/
Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/PredCSF/Readme.htm

name: oligo
text_content:
Tool Name: oligo
Description: A package to analyze oligonucleotide arrays (expression/SNP/tiling/exon) at probe-level. It currently supports Affymetrix (CEL files) and NimbleGen arrays (XYS files).
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/oligo.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/oligo.html

name: BMGE
text_content:
Tool Name: BMGE
Description: Block Mapping and Gathering using Entropy.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Phylogeny
Homepage: https://research.pasteur.fr/en/software/bmge-block-mapping-and-gathering-with-entropy/
Documentation: https://research.pasteur.fr/en/software/bmge-block-mapping-and-gathering-with-entropy/

name: CPHmodels
text_content:
Tool Name: CPHmodels
Description: Protein homology modeling server.
Functions: Protein structure prediction
Topics: Protein structure analysis, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://cbs.dtu.dk/services/CPHmodels/
Documentation: http://www.cbs.dtu.dk/services/CPHmodels/instructions.php

name: TransClust
text_content:
Tool Name: TransClust
Description: Comprehensive clustering tool that incorporates the hidden transitive nature occuring e.g. within biomedical data sets. It is based on Weighted Transitive Graph Projection problem.
Functions: Sequence clustering
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://transclust.compbio.sdu.dk/main_page/index.php
Documentation: https://transclust.compbio.sdu.dk/main_page/general_description.php

name: QuasR
text_content:
Tool Name: QuasR
Description: This package provides a framework for the quantification and analysis of Short Reads. It covers a complete workflow starting from raw sequence reads, over creation of alignments and quality control plots, to the quantification of genomic regions of interest.
Functions: Read mapping, Read pre-processing, Statistical calculation
Topics: ChIP-seq, Genetics, Microarray experiment, RNA-seq, Sequencing, Workflows
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/QuasR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/QuasR.html

name: HTqPCR
text_content:
Tool Name: HTqPCR
Description: Analysis of Ct values from high throughput quantitative real-time PCR (qPCR) assays across multiple conditions or replicates. The input data can be from spatially-defined formats such ABI TaqMan Low Density Arrays or OpenArray; LightCycler from Roche Applied Science, etc. It handles data loading, quality assessment, normalization, visualization and parametric or non-parametric testing for statistical significance in Ct values between features.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: PCR experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/HTqPCR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/HTqPCR.html

name: blockbuster
text_content:
Tool Name: blockbuster
Description: detect blocks of overlapping reads using a gaussian-distribution approach
Functions: RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Genomics
Homepage: http://hoffmann.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/LIFE/blockbuster.html
Documentation: http://hoffmann.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/LIFE/blockbuster.html

name: GeneRegionScan
text_content:
Tool Name: GeneRegionScan
Description: A package with focus on analysis of discrete regions of the genome using Affymetrix data, including additional information about the sequence of each probe and the probe set it is derived from. It includes a number of functions used for plotting these probe level data as a function of location along sequences of mRNA-strands. name: ACME
text_content:
Tool Name: ACME
Description: Set of tools for analysing tiling array ChIP/chip, DNAse hypersensitivity, or other experiments that result in regions of the genome showing "enrichment". It does not rely on a specific array technology (although the array should be a "tiling" array), is very general (can be applied in experiments resulting in regions of enrichment), and is very insensitive to array noise or normalization methods. It is fast and can be applied on whole-genome tiling array experiments easily with enough memory.
Functions: Enrichment analysis
Topics: DNA, Immunoprecipitation experiment, Microarray experiment, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ACME.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ACME.html

text_content:
Tool Name: Protein Digestion Simulator

It can optionally digest the input sequences using trypsin, partial trypsin rules, or various other enzymes. The digested peptides will also have predicted normalized elution time (NET) values computed for them.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Enzymes, Peptides, Sequences
Homepage: http://omics.pnl.gov/software/protein-digestion-simulator
Documentation:

text_content:
Tool Name: CS-PSeq-Gen
Description: Its modifications are related to the aim of simulating the evolution of protein sequences under the constraints of the information of a particular reconstructed phylogeny. It will allow simulations to take such information into account and some control on the simulated tree / branch lengths around an average value. Finally, a particular category of applications for such simulations is the search for the significant co-evolution of sites.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Search
Topics: Phylogeny, Sequences
Homepage: http://bioserv.rpbs.univ-paris-diderot.fr/software.html#cspseqgen
Documentation:

name: pfilt
text_content:
Tool Name: pfilt
Description: Mask out (i.e. replace amino acid characters with Xs) regions of low complexity, coiled-coil regions and regions with extremely biased amino acid compositions. For compositional biased regions,only the overrepresented amino acids are masked.
Functions: Filtering, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence filtering
Topics: Amino acids
Homepage: http://bioinfadmin.cs.ucl.ac.uk/downloads/pfilt/
Documentation: http://bioinfadmin.cs.ucl.ac.uk/downloads/pfilt/README

name: DomainParser
text_content:
Tool Name: DomainParser
Description: DomainParser uses a new algorithm for the decomposition of a multi-domain protein into individual structural domains. The underlying principle used is that residue-residue contacts are denser within a domain than between domains. We have formulated the domain decomposition problem as a network flow problem, in which each residue is represented as a node of a network and each residue-residue contact is represented as an edge with a particular capacity, depending on the type of the contact.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein structure
Homepage: http://csbl.bmb.uga.edu/downloads/indexa.php#domainparser2
Documentation: http://csbl.bmb.uga.edu/downloads/domainparser_manual/manual.html

name: SISEQ
text_content:
Tool Name: SISEQ

Homepage: http://nsato4.c.u-tokyo.ac.jp/old/Siseq.html
Documentation: http://nsato4.c.u-tokyo.ac.jp/old/Software/About_siseq_E.txt

name: Alphabet
text_content:

Description: Alphabet takes a database of aligned protein sequences in BLOCKS+ format and examines the alignments column-wise looking for groups of amino acids that co-occur in columns more frequently than expected based on overall amino acid composition. These groups of amino acids can form a reduced alphabet for building sequence motifs (eMOTIFs) or for detecting correlations between columns of amino acids (MCSeq).
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Amino acids, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequences
Homepage: http://motif.stanford.edu/distributions/alphabet/index.html
Documentation:

It is possible to investigate an association between multiple phenotypes and each pathway or entire pathways simultaneously, regarding the relatedness across entire pathways, using collapsed rare variants using gene information.

text_content:
Tool Name: scHiCNorm
Description: Software package for eliminating systematic biases in single-cell Hi-C data. Considering that single-cell Hi-C data are zero-inflated, here we use zero-inflated (Poisson and Negative Binomial) and hurdle (Poisson and Negative Binomial) models to remove biases, including cutting sites, GC content, and mappability.
Functions: Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data quality management, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://dna.cs.miami.edu/scHiCNorm/
Documentation: http://dna.cs.miami.edu/scHiCNorm/

Topics: ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.seqacademy.org/
Documentation: http://www.seqacademy.org/p/tutorial.html

name: RSEQREP
text_content:
Tool Name: RSEQREP
Description: Cloud-enabled framework that allows users to execute start-to-end gene-level RNA-Seq analysis. It works with unstranded, stranded, and paired-end sequence FASTQ files. It automatically executes a series of customizable steps including reference alignment, CRAM compression, reference alignment QC, data normalization, multivariate data visualization, identification of differentially expressed genes, heatmaps, co-expressed gene clusters, enriched pathways, and a series of custom visualizations.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Expression data visualisation, Expression profile clustering, Pathway or network prediction, Sequencing quality control, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: RNA-seq
Homepage: https://github.com/emmesgit/RSEQREP
Documentation: https://github.com/emmesgit/RSEQREP/wiki

name: seqfam
text_content:
Tool Name: seqfam
Description: Analysis of next generation sequencing (NGS) DNA data from families with known pedigree information in order to identify rare variants that are potentially causal of a disease/trait of interest. It can be used to verify pedigree information, to perform Monte Carlo gene dropping, to undertake regression-based gene burden testing, and to identify variants which segregate by affection status in families via user-defined pattern of occurrence rules.
Functions: DNA mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Variant calling
Topics: DNA
Homepage: https://github.com/mframpton/seqfam
Documentation: http://seqfam.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: PROBer
text_content:
Tool Name: PROBer
Description: PROBer is a program to quantify chemical modification profiles for a general set of sequencing-based ‘toeprinting’ assays, which aim at probing RNA structures (DMS/SHAPE-seq), detecting RNA modifications (Pseudo-seq), and investigating RNA-protein interactions (iCLIP).
Functions: Transcriptome assembly
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://pachterlab.github.io/PROBer/
Documentation: http://pachterlab.github.io/PROBer/manual/

name: BAT
text_content:
Tool Name: BAT
Description: Bisulfite Analysis Toolkit. It facilitates the analysis of bisulfite sequencing data. It covers the essential analysis steps of read alignment, quality control, extraction of methylation information, and calling of differentially methylated regions, as well as biologically relevant downstream analyses, such as data integration with gene expression, histone modification data, or transcription factor binding site annotation.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequence annotation, Variant calling
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinf.uni-leipzig.de/Software/BAT/
Documentation:

name: valr
text_content:
Tool Name: valr
Description: Read and manipulate genome intervals and signals. Provides functionality similar to command-line tool suites within R, enabling interactive analysis and visualization of genome-scale data.
Functions: Data handling, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Genetic mapping
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Gene transcripts, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://valr.hesselberthlab.org
Documentation: http://valr.hesselberthlab.org/articles/valr.html

name: PSSA
text_content:
Tool Name: PSSA
Description: Pathogen Sequence Signature Analysis. Computational analysis of nucleotides sequences of different microorganisms. It uses phylogenetic analysis to identify the Serotype/Clade and Genotype of selected microorganisms. Analyses may be performed on very large data sets. The report of the analysis per sequence contains a brief overview of the nucleotide changes that produce an amino acid change, followed by details of the phylogenetic analysis including a phylogenetic tree.
Functions: Genotyping, Phylogenetic tree analysis, Phylogenetic tree generation
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Infectious disease, Phylogenetics, Virology
Homepage: http://pssa.itiud.org
Documentation:

name: GCAT
text_content:
Tool Name: GCAT
Description: Genetic Code Analysis Toolkit (GCAT) which provides workflows and algorithms for the analysis of the structure of nucleotide sequences. In particular, sets or sequences of codons can be transformed and tested for circularity, comma-freeness, dichotomic partitions and others. GCAT comes with a fertile editor custom-built to work with the genetic code and a batch mode for multi-sequence processing.
Functions: Sequence assembly, Sequence comparison
Topics: Sequence assembly, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: https://github.com/informatik-mannheim/genetic-code-analysis-toolkit
Documentation: https://github.com/informatik-mannheim/genetic-code-analysis-toolkit/blob/master/README.md

name: MetaGeneSense
text_content:
Tool Name: MetaGeneSense
Description: Managing and analytical bioinformatics framework that is engineered to run dedicated Galaxy workflows for the detection and eventually classification of pathogens.
Functions: Expression analysis, Sequence assembly, Taxonomic classification
Topics: Metagenomics, Sequencing, Workflows
Homepage: https://github.com/pgp-pasteur-fr/MetaGenSense
Documentation:

name: GMATA
text_content:
Tool Name: GMATA

text_content:

It uses cancer gene expression data based on an optimization procedure involving the usage of UPGMA (Unweighted Pair Group Method with Arithmetic Mean) and synergy.

Topics: Applied mathematics, Oncology, Sequence analysis

name: cit
text_content:

name: BEAST 2
text_content:
Tool Name: BEAST 2
Description: Bayesian phylogenetic analysis of molecular sequences. It estimates rooted, time-measured phylogenies using strict or relaxed molecular clock models. It can be used as a method of reconstructing phylogenies but is also a framework for testing evolutionary hypotheses without conditioning on a single tree topology. It uses Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) to average over tree space, so that each tree is weighted proportional to its posterior probability. It includes a graphical user-interface for setting up standard analyses and a suit of programs for analysing the results.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis (shape), Phylogenetic tree reconstruction
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogenomics
Homepage: http://www.beast2.org
Documentation: http://www.beast2.org/tutorials/

name: IMPre
text_content:
Tool Name: IMPre
Description: Immune Germline Prediction (IMPre), a tool for predicting germline Variable/Joining genes and alleles using deep-sequencing data derived from T-cell receptor/B-cell receptor repertoires.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Immunology, Immunoproteins, genes and antigens, Population genetics
Homepage: https://github.com/zhangwei2015/IMPre
Documentation: https://github.com/zhangwei2015/IMPre/blob/master/README.txt

name: DISMISS
text_content:
Tool Name: DISMISS
Description: DISMISS is a new software package that detects strand-associated DNA methylation from existing MeDIP-Seq analyses

Topics: DNA, Epigenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://uhkniazi.github.io/dismiss/
Documentation: http://uhkniazi.github.io/dismiss/

Documentation: http://charite.github.io/Q/manual.html

Tool Name: Goldilocks

name: rGREAT
text_content:
Tool Name: rGREAT

name: GeMSTONE
text_content:
Tool Name: GeMSTONE
Description: Germline Mutation Scoring Tool fOr Next-generation sEquencing data. Cloud-based variant prioritization with high-level customization and a comprehensive collection of bioinformatics tools and data libraries.

Topics: Genetic variation, Workflows
Homepage: http://gemstone.yulab.org/
Documentation: http://gemstone.yulab.org/about.html

name: XSuLT
text_content:
Tool Name: XSuLT
Description: Enhanced version of the protein alignment annotation program JoY,formats a submitted multiple-sequence alignment using three-dimensional (3D) structural information in order to assist in the comparative analysis of protein evolution and in the optimization of alignments for comparative modelling and construct design. It annotates each amino acid residue with residue depth, chain and ligand interactions, inter-residue contacts, sequence entropy, root mean square deviation and secondary structure and disorder prediction.
Functions: Protein secondary structure comparison, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein threading
Topics: Protein secondary structure, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://structure.bioc.cam.ac.uk/xsult/
Documentation: http://mordred.bioc.cam.ac.uk/xsult/help

name: ThreaDomEx
text_content:
Tool Name: ThreaDomEx
Description: Takes the amino acid sequence of the query protein as input. It first creates multiple threading alignments to recognize homologous and analogous template structures, from which a domain conservation score is then calculated for deducing the domain boundaries. Next, a boundary clustering method is used to optimize the domain model selections. For discontinuous domain structures, a symmetric alignment algorithm is applied to further integrate and refine the domain assignments.
Functions: Protein domain recognition, Protein secondary structure prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Sequence assembly, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/ThreaDomEx
Documentation: https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/ThreaDomEx/example.php

name: PHESANT
text_content:
Tool Name: PHESANT
Description: PHEnome Scan ANalysis Tool (pheWAS, Mendelian randomisation (MR)-pheWAS etc.) in UK Biobank.

Topics: Data acquisition, Data visualisation, Genotype and phenotype, Phenomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/MRCIEU/PHESANT
Documentation: https://github.com/MRCIEU/PHESANT

Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/methimpute/man/methimpute.pdf

text_content:
Tool Name: methylInheritance
Description: Permutation analysis, based on Monte Carlo sampling, for testing the hypothesis that the number of conserved differentially methylated elements, between several generations, is associated to an effect inherited from a treatment and that stochastic effect can be dismissed.

Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/methylInheritance/man/methylInheritance.pdf

name: FledFold
text_content:
Tool Name: FledFold
Description: Combines both thermodynamic and kinetic factors for RNA secondary structure and can predict RNA secondary structures from single primary sequences. Our early work has shown the accuracy of it is higher than the accuracy of traditional methods, especially for RNAs without pseudoknots.
Functions: RNA secondary structure prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.jlucomputer.com/fledfold.php
Documentation: http://www.jlucomputer.com/fledfold.php

name: MIRU-profiler
text_content:
Tool Name: MIRU-profiler
Description: Performs digital 24-loci MIRU-VNTR typing for Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

Topics: Genomics, Microbiology, Pathology
Homepage: https://github.com/rahimrajwani/MIRU-profiler
Documentation: https://github.com/rahimrajwani/MIRU-profiler

name: mpra
text_content:
Tool Name: mpra
Description: Tools for data management, count preprocessing, and differential analysis in massively parallel report assays (MPRA).

Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/mpra.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/mpra/man/mpra.pdf

name: SCCmecFinder
text_content:
Tool Name: SCCmecFinder
