Documentation: https://cge.cbs.dtu.dk/services/SCCmecFinder/instructions.php

name: CAFE
text_content:
Tool Name: CAFE
Description: aCcelerated Alignment-FrEe sequence analysis. Compute overall 28 distance/dissimilarity measures including (1) conventional measures based on k-mer counts, (2) newly developed measures based on background adjusted k-mer counts, and (3) measures based on presence/absence of k-mers.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence assembly, k-mer counting
Topics: Metagenomics, Sequence assembly, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/younglululu/CAFE
Documentation: https://github.com/younglululu/CAFE/blob/master/README.md

name: omicplotR
text_content:
Tool Name: omicplotR
Description: A Shiny app for visual exploration of omic datasets as compositions, and differential abundance analysis using ALDEx2. Useful for exploring RNA-seq, meta-RNA-seq, 16s rRNA gene sequencing with visualizations such as principal component analysis biplots (coloured using metadata for visualizing each variable), dendrograms and stacked bar plots, and effect plots (ALDEx2). Input is a table of counts and metadata file (if metadata exists), with options to filter data by count or by metadata to remove low counts, or to visualize select samples according to selected metadata.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Gene expression, Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, RNA-seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/omicplotR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/omicplotR/man/omicplotR.pdf

name: TrawlerWeb
text_content:
Tool Name: TrawlerWeb
Description: De novo motif discovery tool for next-generation sequencing datasets.
Functions: Sequence motif discovery
Topics: NGS, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://trawler.erc.monash.edu.au/
Documentation: https://trawler.erc.monash.edu.au/help/

name: STEAK
text_content:
Tool Name: STEAK
Description: Specific Transposable Element Aligner (HERV-K).
Functions: Virulence prediction
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Virology
Homepage: https://github.com/applevir/STEAK
Documentation: https://github.com/applevir/STEAK

name: Spurio
text_content:
Tool Name: Spurio
Description: Identify spurious protein predictions in prokaryotes. It searches the query protein sequence against a prokaryotic nucleotide database using tblastn and identifies homologous sequences. Features of the matches are used to score the query sequences' likelihood to be a spurious protein prediction using a Gaussian process model.
Functions: Protein feature detection
Topics: Biochemistry, Gene expression, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/bateman-group/spurio
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/bateman-group/spurio

name: seqsetvis
text_content:
Tool Name: seqsetvis
Description: seqsetvis enables the visualization and analysis of multiple genomic datasets. Although seqsetvis was designed for the comparison of mulitple ChIP-seq datasets, this package is domain-agnostic and allows the processing of multiple genomic coordinate files (bed-like files) and signal files (bigwig files or bam pileups).
Functions: Analysis, Visualisation
Topics: ChIP-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/seqsetvis.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/seqsetvis/man/seqsetvis.pdf

name: sevenC
text_content:
Tool Name: sevenC
Description: Chromatin looping is an essential feature of eukaryotic genomes and can bring regulatory sequences, such as enhancers or transcription factor binding sites, in the close physical proximity of regulated target genes. This package uses protein binding signals from ChIP-seq and sequence motif information to predict chromatin looping events.
Functions: Annotation, Classification, Regression analysis
Topics: ChIP-on-chip, ChIP-seq, Epigenetics, Functional genomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/sevenC.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/sevenC/man/sevenC.pdf

name: ACE
text_content:
Tool Name: ACE
Description: Efficient and sensitive tool to detect insecticide resistance-associated mutations in insect acetylcholinesterase from RNA-Seq data.
Functions: Antimicrobial resistance prediction
Topics: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, RNA-seq, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://genome.zju.edu.cn/software/ace/
Documentation: http://genome.zju.edu.cn/software/ace/index.html

name: VCFtoTree
text_content:
Tool Name: VCFtoTree
Description: User-friendly tool to construct locus-specific alignments and phylogenies from thousands of anthropologically relevant genome sequences.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree generation
Topics: Genomics, Phylogenetics, Population genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/duoduoo/VCFtoTree_3.0.0
Documentation: https://github.com/duoduoo/VCFtoTree_3.0.0/blob/master/VCFtoTreeManual_V3.0.0_Oct.pdf

name: Variant Ranker
text_content:
Tool Name: Variant Ranker
Description: Performs ranking and annotation of variants in genomic datasets, integrating information from multiple sources to prioritize each variant by its deleteriousness, novelty and existing information.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: GWAS study, Genetic variation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://paschou-lab.mbg.duth.gr/html5up/index.html
Documentation: http://paschou-lab.mbg.duth.gr/html5up/Tutorial22.html

name: zinbwave
text_content:
Tool Name: zinbwave
Description: Implements a general and flexible zero-inflated negative binomial model that can be used to provide a low-dimensional representations of single-cell RNA-seq data. The model accounts for zero inflation (dropouts), over-dispersion, and the count nature of the data. The model also accounts for the difference in library sizes and optionally for batch effects and/or other covariates, avoiding the need for pre-normalize the data.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/zinbwave.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/zinbwave/man/zinbwave.pdf

name: CAGEfightR
text_content:
Tool Name: CAGEfightR
Description: It is an R/Bioconductor package for performing a wide range of common CAGE data analysis tasks. Core functionality includes: import of CAGE TSSs (CTSSs), tag (or unidirectional) clustering for TSS identification, bidirectional clustering for enhancer identification, annotation with transcript and gene models, calculation of TSS shapes and quantification of CAGE expression as expression matrices.
Functions: Annotation, Genome visualisation, Peak detection, Standardisation and normalisation, Visualisation
Topics: Gene expression, Gene regulation, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CAGEfightR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/CAGEfightR/man/CAGEfightR.pdf

name: CytoDx
text_content:
Tool Name: CytoDx
Description: This package provides functions that predict clinical outcomes using single cell data (such as flow cytometry data, RNA single cell sequencing data) without the requirement of cell gating or clustering.
Functions: Classification, Regression analysis
Topics: Cell biology, RNA-seq, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/CytoDx.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/CytoDx/man/CytoDx.pdf

name: DEComplexDisease
text_content:
Tool Name: DEComplexDisease
Description: It is designed to find the differential expressed genes (DEGs) for complex disease, which is characterized by the heterogeneous genomic expression profiles. Different from the established DEG analysis tools, it does not assume the patients of complex diseases to share the common DEGs. By applying a bi-clustering algorithm, DECD finds the DEGs shared by as many patients.
Functions: Clustering, Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Functional genomics, Gene expression, Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DEComplexDisease.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/DEComplexDisease/man/DEComplexDisease.pdf

name: DMCHMM
text_content:
Tool Name: DMCHMM
Description: It is a novel profiling tool for identifying differentially methylated CpG sites using Hidden Markov Model in bisulfite sequencing data.
Functions: Methylation analysis
Topics: Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMCHMM.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/DMCHMM/man/DMCHMM.pdf

name: DMRScan
text_content:
Tool Name: DMRScan
Description: It detects differentially methylated regions, using a scan statistic with underlying Poisson heuristics. The scan statistic will depend on a sequence of window sizes and on a threshold for each window size. This threshold can be calculated by three different means: i) analytically using Siegmund solution, ii) an important sampling as suggested by Zhang, and a iii) full MCMC modeling of the data, choosing between a number of different options for modeling the dependency between each CpG.
Functions: Gene methylation analysis
Topics: Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DMRScan.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/DMRScan/man/DMRScan.pdf

name: ExpressionAtlas
text_content:
Tool Name: ExpressionAtlas
Description: It is for searching for datasets in EMBL-EBI Expression Atlas, and downloading them into R for further analysis. Each Expression Atlas dataset is represented as a SimpleList object with one element per platform. Sequencing data is contained in a SummarizedExperiment object, while microarray data is contained in an ExpressionSet or MAList object.
Functions: Expression data visualisation
Topics: Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ExpressionAtlas.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/ExpressionAtlas/man/ExpressionAtlas.pdf

name: HTSeqGenie
text_content:
Tool Name: HTSeqGenie
Description: Libraries to perform NGS analysis.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/HTSeqGenie.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/HTSeqGenie/man/HTSeqGenie.pdf

name: IMAS
text_content:
Tool Name: IMAS
Description: Integrative analysis of Multi-omics data for Alternative splicing.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Regression analysis
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Gene expression, Gene regulation, RNA splicing, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/IMAS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/IMAS/man/IMAS.pdf

name: ImpulseDE2
text_content:
Tool Name: ImpulseDE2
Description: It is a differential expression algorithm for longitudinal count data sets which arise in sequencing experiments such as RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq and DNaseI-seq. It is based on a negative binomial noise model with dispersion trend smoothing by DESeq2 and uses the impulse model to constrain the mean expression trajectory of each gene.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Cell biology, ChIP-seq, Gene expression, RNA-seq, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ImpulseDE2.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/ImpulseDE2/man/ImpulseDE2.pdf

name: InTAD
text_content:
Tool Name: InTAD
Description: The package is focused on the detection of correlation between expressed genes and selected epigenomic signals i.e. enhancers obtained from ChIP-seq data within topologically associated domains (TADs). Various parameters can be controlled to investigate the influence of external factors and visualization plots are available for each analysis step.
Functions: Prediction and recognition, Visualisation
Topics: ChIP-seq, Epigenetics, Gene expression, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/InTAD.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/InTAD/man/InTAD.pdf

name: LineagePulse
text_content:
Tool Name: LineagePulse
Description: It is a differential expression and expression model fitting package tailored to single-cell RNA-seq data (scRNA-seq). LineagePulse accounts for batch effects, drop-out and variable sequencing depth. One can use LineagePulse to perform longitudinal differential expression analysis across pseudotime as a continuous coordinate or between discrete groups of cells. Expression model fits can be directly extracted from LineagePulse.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Cell biology, Gene expression, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/LineagePulse.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/LineagePulse/man/LineagePulse.pdf

name: NADfinder
text_content:
Tool Name: NADfinder
Description: This Bioconductor package has been developed for bioinformatic analysis of the NAD-seq data, including normalization, smoothing, peak calling, peak trimming and annotation.
Functions: Annotation, Peak detection, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: Gene regulation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/NADfinder.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/NADfinder/man/NADfinder.pdf

name: Scale4C
text_content:
Tool Name: Scale4C
Description: It is an R/Bioconductor package for scale-space transformation and visualization of 4C-seq data. The scale-space transformation is a multi-scale visualization technique to transform a 2D signal into a tesselation in the scale space by applying different smoothing kernels. This transformation allows for explorative analysis and comparisons of the data's structure with other samples.
Functions: Validation, Visualisation
Topics: Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Scale4C.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/Scale4C/man/Scale4C.pdf

name: TCseq
text_content:
Tool Name: TCseq
Description: Quantitative and differential analysis of epigenomic and transcriptomic time course sequencing data, clustering analysis and visualization of temporal patterns of time course data.
Functions: Clustering, Differential gene expression analysis, Visualisation
Topics: ChIP-seq, Epigenetics, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TCseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/TCseq/man/TCseq.pdf

name: TFEA.ChIP
text_content:
Tool Name: TFEA.ChIP
Description: Package to analize transcription factor enrichment in a gene set using data from ChIP-Seq experiments.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Gene expression, Gene regulation, RNA-seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TFEA.ChIP.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/TFEA.ChIP/man/TFEA.ChIP.pdf

name: TissueEnrich
text_content:
Tool Name: TissueEnrich
Description: This package is used to calculate enrichment of tissue-specific genes in a set of input genes. For example, the user can input the most highly expressed genes from RNA-Seq data, or gene co-expression modules to determine which tissue-specific genes are enriched in those datasets.
Functions: Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TissueEnrich.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/TissueEnrich/man/TissueEnrich.pdf

name: adaptest
text_content:
Tool Name: adaptest
Description: Data-adaptive test statistics represent a general methodology for performing multiple hypothesis testing on effects sizes while maintaining honest statistical inference when operating in high-dimensional settings (). The utilities provided here extend the use of this general methodology to many common data analytic challenges that arise in modern computational and genomic biology.
Functions: Comparison, Differential gene expression analysis, Regression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Genetics, Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/adaptest.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/adaptest/man/adaptest.pdf

name: anota2seq
text_content:
Tool Name: anota2seq
Description: It provides analysis of translational efficiency and differential expression analysis for polysome-profiling and ribosome-profiling studies (two or more sample classes) quantified by RNA sequencing or DNA-microarray. Polysome-profiling and ribosome-profiling typically generate data for two RNA sources; translated mRNA and total mRNA.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Regression analysis, Standardisation and normalisation
Topics: GWAS study, Gene expression, Gene regulation, Microarray experiment, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/anota2seq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/anota2seq/man/anota2seq.pdf

name: apeglm
text_content:
Tool Name: apeglm
Description: It provides Bayesian shrinkage estimators for effect sizes for a variety of GLM models, using approximation of the posterior for individual coefficients.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/apeglm.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/apeglm/man/apeglm.pdf

name: biotmle
text_content:
Tool Name: biotmle
Description: This package facilitates the discovery of biomarkers from biological sequencing data based on the associations of potential biomarkers with exposure and outcome variables by implementing an estimation procedure that combines a generalization of moderated statistics with targeted minimum loss-based estimates (TMLE) of parameters defined via causal inference whose estimators admit asymptotically linear representations.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/biotmle.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/biotmle/man/biotmle.pdf

name: clusterSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: clusterSeq
Description: Identification of clusters of co-expressed genes based on their expression across multiple (replicated) biological samples.
Functions: Clustering, Comparison, Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/clusterSeq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/clusterSeq/man/clusterSeq.pdf

name: coseq
text_content:
Tool Name: coseq
Description: Co-expression analysis for expression profiles arising from high-throughput sequencing data. Feature profiles are clustered using adapted transformations and mixture models or a K-means algorithm, and model selection criteria are provided.
Functions: Analysis, Clustering
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/coseq.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/coseq/man/coseq.pdf

name: diffcoexp
text_content:
Tool Name: diffcoexp
Description: Identification of differentially coexpressed links (DCLs) and differentially coexpressed genes (DCGs).
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/diffcoexp.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/diffcoexp/man/diffcoexp.pdf

name: miRmine
text_content:
Tool Name: miRmine
Description: miRmine database is a collection of expression profiles from different publicly available miRNA-seq datasets, Panwar et al (2017) miRmine: A Database of Human miRNA Expression, prepared with this data package as RangedSummarizedExperiment.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/miRmine.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/manuals/miRmine/man/miRmine.pdf

name: unitas
text_content:
Tool Name: unitas
Description: Complete annotation of small RNA datasets from NGS.
Functions: Sequence annotation
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/unitas/files/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/#!/projects/unitas/files/readme.txt/download

name: LTRtype
text_content:
Tool Name: LTRtype
Description: Efficient tool to characterize structurally complex LTR retrotransposons and nested insertions on genomes.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.plantkingdomgdb.com/LTRtype/index.html
Documentation: http://www.plantkingdomgdb.com/LTRtype/index.html

name: CowPI
text_content:
Tool Name: CowPI
Description: Rumen Microbiome Focussed Version of the PICRUSt Functional Inference Software.
Functions: Gene functional annotation
Topics: Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://www.cowpi.org/2018/03/welcome.html
Documentation: https://www.cowpi.org/p/tutorial.html

name: xenoGI
text_content:
Tool Name: xenoGI
Description: Reconstructing the history of genomic island insertions in clades of closely related bacteria.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis, Sequence feature detection
Topics: Genomics, Microbiology, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Phylogeny
Homepage: http://siva.cs.hmc.edu/xgicgi/wxgi.py/form
Documentation: http://siva.cs.hmc.edu/xgicgi/wxgi.py/form

name: Matataki
text_content:
Tool Name: Matataki
Description: The development of Matataki can overcome current limitations in reanalyzing RNA-Seq data toward improving the potential for discovering genes and pathways associated with disease at reduced computational cost. Thus, the main bottleneck of RNA-Seq analyses has shifted to achieving the decompression of sequenced data.
Functions: Analysis, Mapping
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq
Homepage: https://github.com/informationsea/Matataki
Documentation: https://github.com/informationsea/Matataki/blob/master/README.md

name: MOTIFSIM
text_content:
Tool Name: MOTIFSIM
Description: Detecting similarity in a single or multiple DNA motif datasets.
Functions: Sequence motif comparison
Topics: DNA, Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://motifsim.org/
Documentation: http://motifsim.org/

name: quantiprot
text_content:
Tool Name: quantiprot
Description: Provides a simple and consistent interface to multiple methods for quantitative characterization of protein sequences. The package can be used to calculate dozens of characteristics directly from sequences or using physico-chemical properties of amino acids.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein sites, features and motifs, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://git.e-science.pl/wdyrka/quantiprot
Documentation: https://git.e-science.pl/wdyrka/quantiprot/blob/master/docs/manual.md

name: D-GENIES
text_content:
Tool Name: D-GENIES
Description: Dotplot large Genomes in an Interactive, Efficient and Simple way.
Functions: Dot plot plotting
Topics: Data visualisation, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/genotoul-bioinfo/dgenies
Documentation: https://dgenies.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html

name: hmmIBD
text_content:
Tool Name: hmmIBD
Description: A hidden Markov model for detecting segments of shared ancestry (identity by descent) in genetic sequence data.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree analysis
Topics: Genotype and phenotype, Machine learning, Phylogeny
Homepage: https://github.com/glipsnort/hmmIBD
Documentation: https://github.com/glipsnort/hmmIBD

name: UltraPse
text_content:
Tool Name: UltraPse
Description: A universal and extensible software platform for biological sequence representations.
Functions: Sequence visualisation
Topics: Bioinformatics, Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/pufengdu/UltraPse
Documentation: https://github.com/pufengdu/UltraPse

name: cyvcf2
text_content:
Tool Name: cyvcf2
Description: Library and software package for fast parsing and querying of VCF and BCF files and illustrate its speed, simplicity and utility.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetic variation, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/brentp/cyvcf2
Documentation: https://github.com/brentp/cyvcf2

name: ClonoCalc
text_content:
Tool Name: ClonoCalc
Description: GUI for the sub-tasks of processing raw NGS data by wrapping available implementations of various algorithms.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Immunology, NGS
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/ClonoSuite/clonocalc-plot
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/ClonoSuite/clonocalc-plot

name: BuddySuite
text_content:
Tool Name: BuddySuite
Description: Collection of four independent, yet interrelated, command line programs that facilitate each step in the workflow of sequence discovery, curation, alignment, and phylogenetic reconstruction.
Functions: Phylogenetic tree reconstruction, Sequence alignment, Sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acid structure analysis, Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://research.nhgri.nih.gov/software/BuddySuite/
Documentation: https://github.com/biologyguy/BuddySuite/wiki

name: DRAP
text_content:
Tool Name: DRAP
Description: De novo RNA-Seq Assembly Pipeline.
Functions: Sequence assembly validation
Topics: RNA-seq, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.sigenae.org/drap/
Documentation: http://www.sigenae.org/drap/quick_start.html

name: OrtholugeDB
text_content:
Tool Name: OrtholugeDB
Description: Ortholuge-based orthology predictions for completely sequenced bacterial and archaeal genomes. Also contains reciprocal best hit-based ortholog predictions, in-paralog predictions (recently duplicated genes) and proposed ortholog groups.
Functions: Phylogenetic footprinting / shadowing, Phylogenetic tree analysis, Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Mapping, Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://www.pathogenomics.sfu.ca/ortholugedb/
Documentation: http://www.pathogenomics.sfu.ca/ortholugedb/?page=about

name: SPiCE
text_content:
Tool Name: SPiCE
Description: Sequence-based protein classification and exploration.
Functions: Sequence classification
Topics: Gene and protein families, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/basvandenberg/spice
Documentation: https://github.com/basvandenberg/spice

name: EaSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: EaSeq
Description: Developed for user-friendly exploration, visualization and analysis of genome-wide single-read sequencing data.
Both individual genomic loci and populations of loci can be visualized. The underlying loci can then be inspected just by selecting them in the plots.
It also integrates more than 20 tools for analysis. Finally, it automatically generates legends and descriptions of the handling and can store plots together with underlying data and these descriptions as a single compact session file.
Functions: Clustering, Filtering, Formatting, Gene-set enrichment analysis, Genome comparison, Genome visualisation, Peak calling, Read summarisation, Regression analysis, Sequencing quality control, Visualisation
Topics: ChIP-seq
Homepage: http://easeq.net
Documentation: https://easeq.net/about/

name: Glimma
text_content:
Tool Name: Glimma
Description: Generates interactive visualisations for analysis of RNA-sequencing data using output from limma, edgeR or DESeq2 packages in an HTML page. The interactions are built on top of the popular static representations of analysis results in order to provide additional information.
Functions: Sequence visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Glimma.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Glimma.html

name: MOSAIK
text_content:
Tool Name: MOSAIK
Description: Reference guided aligner/assembler.
Functions: Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: https://github.com/wanpinglee/MOSAIK
Documentation: https://github.com/wanpinglee/MOSAIK

name: TMAP
text_content:
Tool Name: TMAP
Description: A short read aligner specifically tuned for data from the Ion Torrent PGM.
Functions: Read mapping
Topics: Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/iontorrent/TS/tree/master/Analysis/TMAP
Documentation: https://github.com/iontorrent/TS/blob/master/Analysis/TMAP/README.md

name: MDT
text_content:
Tool Name: MDT
Description: It prepares a raw frequency table, given information from MODELLER alignments and/or PDB files. The sample for generating the frequencies N is obtained depending on the type of features a, b, c, …, d. The sample can contain individual proteins, pairs of proteins, pairs of residues in proteins, pairs of aligned residues, pairs of aligned pairs of residues, chemical bonds, angles, dihedral angles, and pairs of tuples of atoms.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequences
Homepage: http://salilab.org/mdt/
Documentation: https://mdt.readthedocs.io/en/stable/index.html

name: NRProF
text_content:
Tool Name: NRProF
Description: It is a novel automated protein functional assignment method based on the neural response algorithm, which simulates the neuronal behavior of the visual cortex in the human brain. The main idea of this algorithm is to define a distance metric that corresponds to the similarity of the subsequences and reflects how the human brain can distinguish between different sequences.
Functions: Comparison, Prediction, Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis, Query, Validation
Topics: Protein function prediction, Sequences
Homepage: http://jjwanglab.org:8080/hkubioinfo/NRProF/NRProF.jsp
Documentation: http://jjwanglab.org:8080/hkubioinfo/NRProF/NRProF.jsp#usage

name: PDZPepInt
text_content:
Tool Name: PDZPepInt
Description: It is a cluster based prediction tool to predict binding peptides of PDZ domains in human, mouse, fly and worm. Peptides are represented as 5 C-terminal sequences of binding proteins. Depending on the user requirement Gene Ontology database can be used for getting reliable interactions. Additionally, it will also consider the C-terminal peptides that are intrinsically unstructured for getting high confidence interactions.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Interactions, Ontology and terminology, Peptides, Proteins, Sequences
Homepage: http://modpepint.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/PDZPepInt/Input.jsp
Documentation: http://modpepint.informatik.uni-freiburg.de/Help.jsp?toolName=PDZPepInt

name: ProBias
text_content:
Tool Name: ProBias
Description: It is a novel sensitive method for the detection of user-defined compositional bias in biological sequences.
It automatically searches a user-supplied protein sequence for segments that contain unusually dense clusters of user-specified amino acid types and computes analytical estimates of the statistical significance of each cluster.
Functions: Detection, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences, Statistics
Homepage: http://lcg.rit.albany.edu/bias/
Documentation: http://lcg.rit.albany.edu/bias/bias_guide_v1_0.txt

name: ProDGe
text_content:
Tool Name: ProDGe
Description: Protein Domain Gene visualizes existing and suggests novel domaindomain interactions and protein-protein interactions at the domain level. The comprehensive dataset behind ProDGe consists of protein, domain and interaction information for both layers, collected and combined appropriately from UniProt, Pfam, DOMINE and IntAct.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Interactions, Protein interactions, Protein-protein interactions
Homepage: http://www.ra.cs.uni-tuebingen.de/software/ProDGe/index.htm
Documentation: http://www.ra.cs.uni-tuebingen.de/software/ProDGe/doc/documentation.htm

name: ProSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: ProSeq
Description: PROcessor of SEQuences is a program for sequence editing and population genetics analysis. It is quite a convenient tool for sequence handling and preliminary molecular evolution analysis. However, it is recommended to check the results of the analyses by the other software since the program is under development and not all the parts of the program are thoroughly tested and completely reliable
Functions: Analysis, Editing, Sequence assembly, Sequence editing
Topics: Assembly, Genetics, Population genetics, Sequences
Homepage: http://dps.plants.ox.ac.uk/sequencing/proseq.htm
Documentation:

name: Protein Coverage Summarizer
text_content:
Tool Name: Protein Coverage Summarizer
Description: Protein Coverage Summarizer can be used to determine the percent of the residues in each protein sequence that have been identified. The program requires two input files: the first should contain the protein names and protein sequences while the second should contain the peptide sequences and optionally also contain the protein name associated with each peptide sequence.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://omics.pnl.gov/software/protein-coverage-summarizer
Documentation:

name: PSORTb
text_content:
Tool Name: PSORTb
Description: It is a high-precision localization prediction method for bacterial proteins. It has remained the most precise bacterial protein subcellular localization (SCL) predictor.  PSORTb version improved recall, higher proteome-scale prediction coverage, and new refined localization subcategories. It is the first SCL predictor specifically geared for all prokaryotes, including archaea and bacteria with atypical membrane/cell wall topologies.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Plant, Proteins, Sequences
Homepage: http://www.psort.org/psortb/
Documentation: http://www.psort.org/documentation/index.html

name: UniPROBE
text_content:
Tool Name: UniPROBE
Description: The Universal PBM Resource for Oligonucleotide-Binding Evaluation database is a centralized repository of information on the DNA-binding preferences of proteins as determined by universal protein-binding microarray (PBM) technology. Each entry for a protein in UniPROBE provides the quantitative preferences for all possible nucleotide sequence variants of length k, as well as position weight matrix (PWM) and graphical sequence logo representations of the k-mer data.
Functions: Data retrieval, Deposition, Protein quantification, Protein sequence analysis, k-mer counting
Topics: Microarray experiment, Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://uniprobe.org
Documentation:

name: NoD
text_content:
Tool Name: NoD
Description: NoD is a predictor of nucleolar localization sequences (NoLSs) in proteins. NoLSs are short basic motifs that localize proteins to the nucleolus, a sub-compartment of the nucleus. You can search the set of NoLSs predicted in 9531 human proteins out of the 43534 human proteins considered (from IPI version 3.40).
Functions: Detection, Protein sequence analysis, Search
Topics: Proteins, Sequences
Homepage: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/www-nod/
Documentation: http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/www-nod/HelpDoc.jsp

name: OliCheck
text_content:
Tool Name: OliCheck
Description: OliCheck is a program designed to test the validity of potential microarray probes by considering the possibility of cross-hybridization with non-target coding sequences. This analysis can be performed within a single genome or between several different strains/organisms.
Functions: Microarray data analysis
Topics: Organisms, Probes, Sequences
Homepage: http://www.genomic.ch/software.php
Documentation:

name: CodABC
text_content:
Tool Name: CodABC
Description: A Computational Framework to Coestimate Recombination, Substitution, and Molecular Adaptation Rates by Approximate Bayesian Computation.
Functions: Recombination detection
Topics: Gene transcripts, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://code.google.com/archive/p/codabc/
Documentation: https://code.google.com/archive/p/codabc/wikis/CodABC_Download.wiki

name: OligoArrayAux
text_content:
Tool Name: OligoArrayAux
Description: OligoArrayAux is an auxilliary package designed for use with the OligoArray software.  The package consists of several C programs and Perl scripts for performing energy minimization calculations on nucleic acid sequences.  OligoArrayAux is a subset of the UNAFold package, which calculates partition functions as well as minimum energies for a full ensemble of species for one or two nucleic acid sequences.
Functions: Microarray data analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://mfold.rna.albany.edu/?q=DINAMelt/OligoArrayAux
Documentation: http://unafold.rna.albany.edu/?q=unafold-man-pages

name: PFSTATS
text_content:
Tool Name: PFSTATS
Description: PFSTATS is a set of programs and scripts devoted to analyze protein families using simple statistics.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein families, Statistics
Homepage: http://www.biocomp.icb.ufmg.br/biocomp/?page_id=119
Documentation: http://www.biocomp.icb.ufmg.br/~neli/pfstats/UserGuide.pdf

name: PLMLA
text_content:
Tool Name: PLMLA
Description: PLMLA is an in silico online tool for prediction of potential lysine methylation and lysine acetylation from protein sequences.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://bioinfo.ncu.edu.cn/inquiries_PLMLA.aspx
Documentation:

name: PPI-PS
text_content:
Tool Name: PPI-PS
Description: The PPI-PS method consists of a representation of each protein sequence by a vector of pairwise similarities against large subsequences of amino acids created by a shifting window which passes over concatenated protein training sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Amino acids, Sequences

Results are stored in a new file containing the regions of the protein that contain the specified motif. The default output format is a new fasta file named _Motifs.fasta, but you can alternatively use /T to specify that a tab-delimited text file be created.

Topics: Sequences

You can also search for exact and inexact occurrences of user specified strings.

name: TASUKE
text_content:
Tool Name: TASUKE
Description: Web-based genome browser that visualizes large-scale resequencing data generated by next-generation sequencing technologies. The variation and read depth of multiple genomes, as well as annotations, can be shown simultaneously at various scales. The frequency of variants and depth of coverage are shown by gradational colors in a block whose size is variable from 1bp to 100kb.
Functions: Genome visualisation, Variant calling
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Data visualisation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://tasuke.dna.affrc.go.jp/
Documentation: http://tasuke.dna.affrc.go.jp/functions.html

name: CAPE
text_content:
Tool Name: CAPE
Description: Combine complementary information across multiple related phenotypes to infer directed epistatic interactions between genetic markers. This analysis can be applied to a variety of engineered and natural populations.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis
Topics: Genetics, Genotype and phenotype, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/cape/
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/cape/cape.pdf

name: Pse-in-One
text_content:
Tool Name: Pse-in-One

Topics: DNA, Proteins, RNA, Structure analysis
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.hitsz.edu.cn/Pse-in-One/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.hitsz.edu.cn/Pse-in-One/doc/

name: uQlust
text_content:
Tool Name: uQlust

Topics: Chemistry, Gene and protein families, RNA, Structure analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/uQlust

Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/amplimethprofiler/files/?source=navbar

name: Xtalk
text_content:

name: Structure-PPi
text_content:

Tool Name: CHSalign

Homepage: http://nature.njit.edu/biosoft/CHSalign/
Documentation: http://nature.njit.edu/biosoft/CHSalign/examples.html

text_content:

Documentation: http://brylinski.cct.lsu.edu/content/ematchsite-manual

name: CONTIGuator

Tool Name: CONTIGuator

Documentation:

name: PCRTiler
text_content:
Tool Name: PCRTiler
Description: Allows for the automated design of tiled primer pairs for any number of genomic loci. Based on Primer3 and BLAST analysis for cross-hybridization.
Functions: Analysis, PCR primer design, Primer and probe design, Primer removal, Splitting
Topics: Immunoprecipitation experiment, Laboratory techniques, Nucleic acids, PCR experiment, Probes and primers, Sequencing, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://pcrtiler.genap.ca/PCRTiler/
Documentation: http://pcrtiler.genap.ca/PCRTiler/tutorial.jsp

name: SeqBench
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqBench
Description: Management and analysis of exome sequencing data. Provides a user friendly data acquisition module to facilitate comprehensive and intuitive data handling. Provides also direct access to the analysis pipeline SIMPLEX, which can be configured to run locally, on a cluster, or in the cloud.
Functions: Exome assembly, Quantification, Variant calling
Topics: Exome sequencing, Genetic variation, Workflows
Homepage: http://www.icbi.at/software/seqbench/seqbench.shtml
Documentation:

name: Sebnif
text_content:
Tool Name: Sebnif
Description: Self-Estimation Based Novel lincRNA Filter. Discovery of bona fide novel lincRNAs that are suitable for further functional characterization. Specifically, it implements an algorithm for identifying high-quality single-exonic lincRNAs that were often omitted in many studies.
Functions: Enrichment analysis, Gene expression profiling, Sequence trimming
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Gene transcripts, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://sunlab.lihs.cuhk.edu.hk/sebnif/
Documentation: http://sunlab.lihs.cuhk.edu.hk/sebnif/README

name: Synteny Portal
text_content:
Tool Name: Synteny Portal

Homepage: http://bioinfo.konkuk.ac.kr/synteny_portal/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.konkuk.ac.kr/synteny_portal/htdocs/documentation.php

name: VivaxGEN
text_content:
Tool Name: VivaxGEN
Description: Open access platform for comparative analysis of short tandem repeat genotyping data in Plasmodium vivax populations.
Functions: Genotyping, Repeat sequence detection
Topics: Genotyping experiment, Parasitology, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
Homepage: http://vivaxgen.menzies.edu.au/
Documentation: http://vivaxgen.menzies.edu.au/

name: REDHORSE
text_content:
Tool Name: REDHORSE
Description: REcombination and Double crossover detection in Haploid Organisms using next-geneRation SEquencing data.
Functions: Recombination detection
Topics: DNA replication and recombination, Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://redhorse.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/redhorse/files/release%201.0/data/htmlPages.zip/download

name: IMSEQ
text_content:
Tool Name: IMSEQ
Description: Fast, PCR and sequencing error aware tool to analyze high throughput data from recombined T-cell receptor or immunoglobolin gene sequencing experiments.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Immunology, Immunoproteins, genes and antigens, PCR experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.imtools.org/
Documentation: https://github.com/lkuchenb/imseq/blob/master/README.md

name: MAPPIS
text_content:
Tool Name: MAPPIS
Description: Multiple Alignment of Protein-Protein Interfaces (MAPPIS) is a tool for the recognition of spatially conserved chemical interactions shared by a set of protein-protein interfaces or regions of protein interaction. Users input a set of protein-protein complexes and MAPPIS returns a list of shared interaction properties of the interfaces.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment, Protein fold recognition, Protein interaction analysis, Protein-protein interaction prediction
Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein binding sites, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein interactions, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://bioinfo3d.cs.tau.ac.il/MAPPIS
Documentation: http://bioinfo3d.cs.tau.ac.il/MAPPIS/help.html

name: MIPModDB
text_content:
Tool Name: MIPModDB
Description: A database of comparative protein structure models of MIP (Major Intrinsic Protein) family of proteins. For each MIP entry, this database contains information about the source, gene structure, sequence features, substitutions in the conserved NPA motifs, structural model, the residues forming the selectivity filter and channel radius profile. Users can derive structure-based sequence alignment for sets of MIPs. Sequences and structures of MIPs can be downloaded.
Functions: Filtering, Protein modelling, Sequence alignment analysis (conservation), Structure-based sequence alignment
Topics: Gene and protein families, Protein sites, features and motifs, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Proteins, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinfo.iitk.ac.in/MIPModDB/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.iitk.ac.in/MIPModDB/help.html

name: SEAL
text_content:
Tool Name: SEAL
Description: Seal is a suite of distributed applications for aligning short DNA reads, manipulating and analyzing short read alignments. It is generally run on the Hadoop framework, which makes it particularly well suited for processing large data sets.
Functions: Calculation, Filtering, Formatting, Sequence alignment, Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Mapping, Sequencing
Homepage: http://biodoop-seal.sourceforge.net/
Documentation: http://biodoop-seal.sourceforge.net/installation.html

name: BAGET
text_content:
Tool Name: BAGET
Description: BAGET (Bacterial and Archaeal Gene Exploration Tool) is a web service designed to facilitate extraction of specific gene and protein sequences from completely determined prokaryotic genomes. Query results can be exported as a rich text format file for printing, archival or further analysis.
Functions: Formatting, Protein sequence analysis, Query and retrieval, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Model organisms, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://archaea.u-psud.fr/bin/baget.dll
Documentation: http://archaea.u-psud.fr/Baget_help.html

name: POLYVIEW-2D
text_content:
Tool Name: POLYVIEW-2D
Description: Protein structure visualization server can be used to generate amino acid sequence annotations, such as secondary structure, relative solvent accessibility, evolutionary conservation, and physico-chemical property profiles. It can also be used to identify residues involved in protein-protein interactions and highlight other important sites and motifs.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein-protein interaction prediction, Structure visualisation
Topics: Protein interactions, Protein structure analysis
Homepage: http://polyview.cchmc.org/
Documentation: http://polyview.cchmc.org/polyview_doc.html

name: morFeus
text_content:
Tool Name: morFeus
Description: Meta-analysis based orthology finder using symmetrical best hits.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Molecular genetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bio.biochem.mpg.de/morfeus/
Documentation: http://bio.biochem.mpg.de/morfeus/morFeus-helpPages/

name: CollapsABEL
text_content:
Tool Name: CollapsABEL
Description: Implements a generalized version of the CDH test  for detecting compound heterozygosity on a genome-wide level, due to usage of generalized linear models it allows flexible analysis of binary and continuous traits with covariates.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Genetics, Genomics
Homepage: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/CollapsABEL/
Documentation: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/CollapsABEL/CollapsABEL.pdf

name: AnnoLnc
text_content:
Tool Name: AnnoLnc
Description: A web server for systematically annotating novel human lncRNAs.
Functions: Sequence annotation
Topics: Human biology, Nucleic acid structure analysis, RNA
Homepage: http://annolnc.cbi.pku.edu.cn/index.jsp
Documentation: http://annolnc.cbi.pku.edu.cn/about.jsp

name: GFF-Ex
text_content:
Tool Name: GFF-Ex
Description: Automated feature-based extraction of sequences from a GFF file.
Functions: Sequence feature detection
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://bioinfo.icgeb.res.in/gff/
Documentation: http://bioinfo.icgeb.res.in/gff/gffdownloads/

name: Kassiopeia
text_content:
Tool Name: Kassiopeia
Description: A web application for the generation, storage, and presentation of genome-wide analyses of mutually exclusive exonomes.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Genetics, Mapping, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://kassiopeia.motorprotein.de/kassiopeia
Documentation: https://kassiopeia.motorprotein.de/kassiopeia_help

name: AFST
text_content:
Tool Name: AFST
Description: AFST(Abnormality Filtering and Sequence Trimming for ESTs)is a software tool using a pattern analysis approach.
Functions: Filtering, Sequence trimming, Trimming
Topics: DNA, EST
Homepage: http://code.google.com/p/afst/
Documentation:

name: ARD2
text_content:
Tool Name: ARD2
Description: ARD2 (Alpha-rod Repeat Detector) is an application for the identification of alpha-rod repeats, also defined as alpha-solenoids (HEAT, Armadillo among others) in protein sequences using a neural network.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://cbdm-01.zdv.uni-mainz.de/~fournier/ard2/
Documentation: http://cbdm-01.zdv.uni-mainz.de/~fournier/ard2/help.html

name: MkDom2
text_content:
Tool Name: MkDom2
Description: Algorithm used to build each new release of ProDom. It can be run on any set of protein sequences in a fasta file.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Protein folds and structural domains, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://prodom.prabi.fr/prodom/current/documentation/mkdom2.html
Documentation: http://prodom.prabi.fr/prodom/current/documentation/mkdom2.html

name: PANTHER Tools
text_content:
Tool Name: PANTHER Tools
Description: Unique resource that classifies genes by their functions, using published scientific experimental evidence and evolutionary relationships to predict function. The research tools allow you to score proteins against the HMM library, use it to do gene expression analyses, and download tools and data.
Functions: Haplotype mapping, Over-representation analysis, Protein modelling (mutation)
Topics: Gene and protein families, Genetic variation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Pathology, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.pantherdb.org/tools/
Documentation: http://www.pantherdb.org/help/PANTHERhelp.jsp

name: AffyProbeMiner
text_content:
Tool Name: AffyProbeMiner
Description: AffyProbeMiner is to re-define chip definition files (CDFs) for Affymetrix chips taking into account the most recent genomic sequence information. It re-groups probes in Affymetrix chips into probe sets according to a list of non-redundant verified complete coding sequences available in GenBank and RefSeq. Pre-computed CDFs for several chips are available for download.
Functions: Microarray data analysis
Topics: ChiP, Probes, Sequences
Homepage: http://discover.nci.nih.gov/affyprobeminer/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/23/18/2385.full.pdf

name: ArchSchema
text_content:
Tool Name: ArchSchema
Description: ArchSchema is a java program that generates dynamic plots of related Pfam domain architectures. The protein sequences having each architecture can be displayed on the plot and separately listed. Where there is 3D structural information in the PDB, the relevant PDB codes can be shown on the plot. Sequences can be be filtered by organism, or the output can be limited to just those protein sequences for which there is structural information in the PDB.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/archschema/
Documentation:

name: AutoCSA
text_content:
Tool Name: AutoCSA
Description: AutoCSA (Automatic Comparative Sequence Analysis) is a mutation detection program designed to detect small mutations (1-50 bases) in sequence traces. The software is capable of detecting both homozygous and heterozygous base substitutions, as well as small insertions and deletions, to a high sensitivity.
Functions: Detection, Mutation detection, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Mutation, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.sanger.ac.uk/science/tools/autocsa
Documentation:

name: BreakFusion
text_content:
Tool Name: BreakFusion
Description: BreakFusion is a software that combines the strength of reference alignment followed by read-pair analysis and de novo assembly to achieve a good balance in sensitivity, specificity and computational efficiency.
Functions: Alignment, Analysis, Sequence assembly
Topics: Assembly, Genetics, RNA, RNA-seq
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.mdanderson.org/main/BreakFusion#
Documentation: http://odin.mdacc.tmc.edu/~kchen3/BreakFusion/BreakFusion-1.0.1/doc/README.pdf

name: CRC64
text_content:
Tool Name: CRC64
Description: CRC64 is the source code for an improved CRC-64 routine for hashing protein sequences. This CRC function has been extensively tested on real sequences and articially generated sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://bioinfadmin.cs.ucl.ac.uk/downloads/crc64/
Documentation: http://bioinfadmin.cs.ucl.ac.uk/downloads/crc64/README

name: ClonalOrigin
text_content:
Tool Name: ClonalOrigin
Description: ClonalOrigin is a tool for recombination detection in bacteria. ClonalOrigin performs a comparative analysis of the sequences of a sample of bacterial genomes in order to reconstruct the recombination events that have taken place in their ancestry.
Functions: Detection, Recombination detection
Topics: DNA, Sequences
Homepage: http://code.google.com/p/clonalorigin/
Documentation: http://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/~ansari/BiasedRecV1.tgz

name: Clone Mapper
text_content:
Tool Name: Clone Mapper
Description: Clone Mapper is an online suite of tools specifically adapted to the analysis pipeline typical for RNAi experiments with C. elegans.
Functions: Analysis, Mapping
Topics: Mapping, Sequences
Homepage: http://bioinformatics.lif.univ-mrs.fr/RNAiMap/
Documentation: http://bioinformatics.lif.univ-mrs.fr/RNAiMap/help.php

name: DBindR
text_content:
Tool Name: DBindR
Description: DBindR is a web server for prediction of DNA-binding residues in proteins from amino acid sequences using a random forest model with a hybrid feature
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Proteins, Sequences
Homepage: http://www.cbi.seu.edu.cn/DBindR/DBindR.htm
Documentation: http://www.cbi.seu.edu.cn/DBindR/Manual.htm

name: CANEapp
text_content:
Tool Name: CANEapp
Description: Application for Comprehensive automated Analysis of Next-generation sequencing Experiments.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, RNA-Seq analysis
Topics: Gene expression, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://psychiatry.med.miami.edu/research/laboratory-of-translational-rna-genomics/CANE-app
Documentation: http://psychiatry.med.miami.edu/documents/research/CANEapp_manual.pdf

name: InsertionMapper
text_content:
Tool Name: InsertionMapper
Description: A pipeline tool for the identification of targeted sequences from multidimensional high throughput sequencing data.
Functions: Representative sequence identification
Topics: Compound libraries and screening, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://sourceforge.net/projects/insertionmapper/
Documentation: http://bo.csam.montclair.edu/du/insertionmapper

name: NEAT
text_content:
Tool Name: NEAT
Description: Framework for building fully automated NGS pipelines and analyses.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/pschorderet/NEAT
Documentation: https://github.com/pschorderet/NEAT

name: AUREA
text_content:
Tool Name: AUREA
Description: Open-source software system for accurate and user-friendly identification of relative expression molecular signatures.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: Gene expression, Genetics, Machine learning
Homepage: https://hood-price.systemsbiology.org/research/aurea/
Documentation: https://hood-price.systemsbiology.org/research/aurea/

name: GEN3VA
text_content:
Tool Name: GEN3VA
Description: Aggregation and analysis of gene expression signatures from related studies.
Functions: Gene expression comparison, Sequence database search
Topics: Data mining, Gene expression, Genetics, Microarray experiment
Homepage: http://amp.pharm.mssm.edu/gen3va/
Documentation: http://amp.pharm.mssm.edu/gen3va/documentation

name: DLocalMotif
text_content:
Tool Name: DLocalMotif
Description: DLocalMotif is a discriminitive motif discovery web service specifically designed to discover local motifs in protein sequences that are aligned relative to a defined sequence landmark. It uses three discriminitive scoring features, motif spatial confinement (MSC), motif over-representation (MOR) and motif relative entropy (MRE). These features establish if a motif is positioned in a constrained sequence interval in positive data set and absent in negative data set.
Functions: Motif discovery, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://bioinf.scmb.uq.edu.au/dlocalmotif/
Documentation:

name: DNA for Windows
text_content:
Tool Name: DNA for Windows
Description: DNA for Windows is a compact, easy to use DNA analysis program, ideal for small-scale sequencing projects.  It is particularly suited to working with chromatogram files from ABI machines, and is one of the few programs able to edit as well as view these files.  The program has powerful DNA translation and restriction enzyme analysis facilities, and works with external programs to produce multiple alignments and contigs with ease.
Functions: DNA translation, Editing, Sequence editing
Topics: DNA, DNA analysis, Gene expression, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.dna-software.co.uk/
Documentation: http://www.dna-software.co.uk/readme.txt

name: Fas2Nex
text_content:
Tool Name: Fas2Nex
Description: Fas2Nex  can read a .FAS (FASTA) file and save it as .NEX (NEXUS) file (or again as a .fas file) for phylogenetic analysis with PAUP*, with the option of removing columns of characters consisting only of gaps. If necessary, the ends of short sequences in the .fas file will be padded to full length.
Functions: Analysis, Formatting
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://www.famd.me.uk/AGL/AGL_sw.html
Documentation: http://www.famd.me.uk/AGL/AGL_SwDoc.pdf

name: GMATo
text_content:
Tool Name: GMATo
Description: GMATo is a novel soft for faster and accurate microsatellite mining at any length and comprehensive statistical analysis for DNA sequences in any genome at any size, with easily customized parameters control for biologists and bio-informatician, running easily at common computers with Windows, Linux, MAC OS etc multiple platforms (platform independently) with both graphic and command interface programmed in Java and Perl computing language.

Topics: DNA, Sequences
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/gmato/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/gmato/wiki/Home/

name: HEA-PSP

Documentation: http://www.cs.gmu.edu/~ashehu/?q=EvolInspSearch

Documentation: http://sunflower.kuicr.kyoto-u.ac.jp/~sjn/hse/help.html

name: Hipsec
text_content:
Tool Name: Hipsec
Description: Hipsec is a tool for predicting high-level protein production in Aspergillus niger. The software predicts if gene overexpression of an extracellular protein will lead to successful high-level production in Aspergillus niger. The prediction is based on a protein’s amino acid sequence. One or more protein sequences can be pasted into the the text area (fasta format) or uploaded as a fasta file.
Functions: Prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Sequences
Homepage: http://helix.ewi.tudelft.nl/hipsec/home.py
Documentation: http://helix.ewi.tudelft.nl/hipsec/about.py

name: HotSpot
text_content:

Homepage: http://sfb.kaust.edu.sa/Pages/Software.aspx
Documentation:

name: R2R
text_content:
Tool Name: R2R
Description: Package for very sensitive analysis of short read sequence data obtained by NextGen sequencing techniques. R2R was developed in conjunction with data obtained on the Illumina GA platforms. R2R is written in simple Perl script and runs equally well under MS Windows, Mac OS and Linux/Unix operative systems.
Functions: Sequence alignment
Topics: Data visualisation, Sequencing
Homepage: http://milne.ruc.dk/R2R/
Documentation: http://milne.ruc.dk/R2R/R2R_manual_0.950.pdf

Documentation:

Documentation: http://www.csbio.sjtu.edu.cn/bioinf/LnSignal/Readme.htm

name: MASiVE
text_content:
Tool Name: MASiVE

text_content:

text_content:

Documentation:

name: PlantTFDB
text_content:

Description: Plant Transcription Factor Database (PlantTFDB) is database that attempts to identify a comprehensive set of plant genes coding for transcription factors. A web interface to the database allows users to browse by species, search using a sequence identifier, or query using BLAST.

Topics: Gene and protein families, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Plant biology, Transcription factors and regulatory sites

Documentation: http://plntfdb.bio.uni-potsdam.de/v3.0/

name: compmerge
text_content:
Tool Name: compmerge
Description: compmerge is a program that tries to solve the same problem as cuffmerge. It is not limited to cufflinks/stringtie models and transcripts, but can work with any GTF file. It merges the spliced transcripts that have a compatible intron structure and merges the monoexonic transcripts based on simple stranded overlap.The output is a GTF file of merged transcripts.
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://big.crg.cat/services/compmerge
Documentation: http://big.crg.cat/services/compmerge

name: project
text_content:
Tool Name: project
Description: project is a program that projects genomic features onto their sequences. Please contact Sarah Djebali (sarah dot djebali at crg dot es for any question).
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acids
Homepage: http://big.crg.cat/services/project
Documentation: http://big.crg.cat/services/project

name: NextGen Utility Scripts
text_content:
Tool Name: NextGen Utility Scripts

Documentation: http://nebc.nox.ac.uk/nebc_website_frozen/nebc.nerc.ac.uk//tools/bioinformatics-docs/high-throughput-seq/nextgen-scripts

text_content:

Documentation: https://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/Arf

name: Graphical Codon Usage Analyser
text_content:
Tool Name: Graphical Codon Usage Analyser
Description: Differences in codon usage preference among organisms lead to a variety of problems concerning heterologous gene expression but can be overcome by rational gene design and gene synthesis. The gcua tool displays the codon quality either in codon usage frequency values or relative adaptiveness values.
Functions: Codon usage analysis, Codon usage bias calculation, Codon usage bias plotting, Codon usage table comparison, Codon usage table generation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Data visualisation, Gene expression, Genomics, Protein expression, Sequence analysis, Small molecules
Homepage: http://gcua.schoedl.de
Documentation: http://gcua.schoedl.de/seqoverallex.html

name: GeneGenie
text_content:
Tool Name: GeneGenie
Description: GeneGenie is an optimised oligomer design web server for doing directed evolution.
Functions: Codon usage analysis, Codon usage table generation, Read mapping
Topics: Experimental design and studies, Gene expression, Protein folding, stability and design, Protein variants, Sequencing
Homepage: http://g.gene-genie.appspot.com
Documentation: http://g.gene-genie.appspot.com

name: POBO
text_content:

text_content:

Homepage: http://pilot-hmm.vbi.vt.edu/
Documentation: http://pilot-hmm.vbi.vt.edu/about.php

text_content:
Tool Name: Genedata Expressionist

Topics: ChIP-seq, Epigenetics, Gene structure, Genomics, Laboratory information management, RNA-Seq, Sequencing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: https://www.genedata.com/products/expressionist/
Documentation: https://www.genedata.com/products/expressionist/resources/

text_content:
Tool Name: SOLID software tools

name: GenomicTuples
text_content:
Tool Name: GenomicTuples

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicTuples.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenomicTuples.html

text_content:
Tool Name: .NET BIO
Description: ".NET Bio is an open source library of common bioinformatics functions, intended to simplify the creation of life science applications.
The core library implements a range of file parsers and formatters for common file types, connectors to commonly-used web services such as NCBI BLAST, and standard algorithms for the comparison and assembly of DNA, RNA and protein sequences. Sample tools and code snippets are also included."

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bio.codeplex.com/
Documentation: https://github.com/dotnetbio/bio

text_content:
Tool Name: VIRsiRNAdb
Description: VIRsiRNAdb is a curated database of experimentally validated viral siRNA/shRNA targeting diverse genes of 42 important human viruses including influenza, SARS and Hepatitis viruses. Additionally useful siRNA analysis tools are also provided e.g. siTarAlign for aligning the siRNA sequence with reference viral genomes or user defined sequences.
Functions: Deposition, Validation, siRNA binding specificity prediction, siRNA duplex prediction
Topics: Data submission, annotation and curation, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, Small molecules, Virology
Homepage: http://crdd.osdd.net/servers/virsirnadb/
Documentation: http://crdd.osdd.net/servers/virsirnadb/details.php

name: CaRpools
text_content:
Tool Name: CaRpools
Description: CaRpools is an R package for exploratory data analysis of pooled CRISPR/Cas9 screens.

Homepage: https://github.com/boutroslab/caRpools
Documentation: https://github.com/boutroslab/caRpools

name: CoMet
text_content:
Tool Name: CoMet

Topics: Gene and protein families, Mapping, Metagenomics, Microbial ecology, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://comet.gobics.de
Documentation: http://comet2.gobics.de/Help.php

name: Cluster Flow
text_content:

Homepage: http://clusterflow.io/
Documentation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BFBt5fCWWSY&index=2&list=PLIA2-lqNuhvH6fog0ctm5ZpdtPoUOun-l

name: RASS
text_content:

Homepage: http://cloud.stat.fsu.edu/RASS/
Documentation: http://cloud.stat.fsu.edu/RASS/

text_content:

Homepage: http://clip.med.yale.edu/selection
Documentation:

name: RefCov
text_content:
Tool Name: RefCov

Documentation:

name: PROBER
text_content:
Tool Name: PROBER
Description: Oligonucleotide primer design software application that can generate highly specific probes for use in fluorescence in-situ hybridization (FISH) and other in-situ labeling methods by densely tiling relatively small genomic intervals.

Topics: DNA, Probes and primers, Protein interaction experiment, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://prober.cshl.edu/
Documentation: http://prober.cshl.edu/tutorial.html

text_content:
Tool Name: GROK

It operates on genomic regions, annotated chromosomal intervals that represent sequencing short reads, gene locations, ChIP-seq peaks or other genomic features. Applications of GROK include file format conversions, set operations, overlap queries, and filtering and transformation operations. Supported file formats include BAM/SAM, BED, BedGraph, CSV, FASTQ, GFF/GTF, VCF and Wiggle.
Functions: Filtering, Formatting
Topics: ChIP-seq, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://csbi.ltdk.helsinki.fi/grok/
Documentation: http://csbi.ltdk.helsinki.fi/grok/files/userguide.pdf

name: ATIVS
text_content:
Tool Name: ATIVS
Description: ATIVS (analytical tool for influenza virus surveillance) is a web server for analyzing serological data of all influenza viruses and provide interpretive summaries. ATIVS also compares the HA1 sequences of viruses to those of the reference vaccine strains to predict influenza A/H3N2 antigenic drift.
Functions: Epitope mapping, Genetic mapping, Genetic variation analysis, Mapping
Topics: Immunoproteins, genes and antigens, Mapping, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Virology
Homepage: http://influenza.nhri.org.tw/ATIVS/
Documentation: http://influenza.nhri.org.tw/ATIVS/Introduction.jsp

name: HiTRACE-Web
text_content:
Tool Name: HiTRACE-Web

Homepage: http://hitrace.org
Documentation: http://hitrace.org/index.php/page/view/help

name: HitPredict
text_content:

Description: HitPredict is a database with quality assessed PPIs in nine species. HitPredict assigns a confidence level to interactions based on a reliability score that is computed using evidence from sequence, structure and functional annotations of the interacting proteins.

Topics: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Protein interaction experiment, Protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://hintdb.hgc.jp/htp/
Documentation: http://hintdb.hgc.jp/htp/help.html

name: HFV
text_content:
Tool Name: HFV
Description: The LANL hemmorhagic fever virus database, a new platform for analyzing biothreat viruses.

Topics: Pathology, Sequence analysis, Small molecules, Virology
Homepage: http://hfv.lanl.gov/content/index
Documentation:

name: BioRuby
text_content:
Tool Name: BioRuby
Description: A bioinformatics software for the Ruby programming language.  The toolkit contains a set of free development tools and libraries for bioinformatics and biology. BioRuby has components for sequence analysis, pathway analysis, protein modelling and phylogenetic analysis; it supports many widely used data formats and provides easy access to databases, external programs and public web services, including BLAST, KEGG, GenBank, MEDLINE and GO.
Functions: Aggregation, Deposition, Service invocation
Topics: Bioinformatics, Computational biology, Data management, Software engineering
Homepage: http://bioruby.org/
Documentation: http://bioruby.org/rdoc/

name: C-HMM
text_content:
Tool Name: C-HMM
Description: Software to detect remote/distant homologues from protein sequence databases. It is based on HMMs(Hidden Markov Models) for identifying the deep evolutionary relationships of protein sequences.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Data submission, annotation and curation, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: https://github.com/RSLabNCBS/C-HMM
Documentation: https://github.com/SwatiKaushik/C-HMM

name: Profppikernel
text_content:
Tool Name: Profppikernel
Description: This tool uses an accelerated version of the original profile kernel to train SVM based protein-protein interaction (PPI) prediction models and to predict new PPIs from sequence alone.

Homepage: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Profppikernel
Documentation: https://rostlab.org/owiki/index.php/Profppikernel

name: MHCPred
text_content:
Tool Name: MHCPred
Description: Uses the additive method to predict the binding affinity of major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class I and II molecules and also to the Transporter associated with Processing (TAP).

Topics: Immunology, Immunoproteins, genes and antigens, Small molecules, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.ddg-pharmfac.net/mhcpred/MHCPred/
Documentation: http://www.ddg-pharmfac.net/mhcpred/MHCPred/help.htm

name: ssviz
text_content:
Tool Name: ssviz
Description: Small RNA sequencing viewer.
Functions: Analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ssviz.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ssviz.html

name: NextGENe
text_content:
Tool Name: NextGENe
Description: De novo and reference assembly of Roche/454, Illumina and SOLiD data. Uses a novel Condensation Assembly Tool approach where reads are joined via "anchors" into mini-contigs before assembly which reduces sequencing errors. Requires Win or MacOS.

A desktop application for analyzing next generation sequencing data. It does not require scripting.
Functions: Data handling, Genetic variation analysis, Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Workflows
Homepage: http://www.softgenetics.com/NextGENe.php
Documentation: https://softgenetics.com/appnotes.php

name: BPP
text_content:
