Topics: Phylogenetics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://abacus.gene.ucl.ac.uk/software.html
Documentation: http://abacus.gene.ucl.ac.uk/software/CommandLine.MACosx.pdf

name: IgSimulator
text_content:
Tool Name: IgSimulator
Description: Tool for simulation of antibody repertoire and Ig-seq library. It is designed for testing and benchmarking tools for reconstruction of Ig repertoires.
Functions: Modelling and simulation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Gene and protein families, Immunology, Immunoproteins, genes and antigens
Homepage: http://yana-safonova.github.io/ig_simulator/
Documentation: http://yana-safonova.github.io/ig_simulator/ig_simulator_manual.html

name: PhenoFam
text_content:
Tool Name: PhenoFam
Description: Perform gene set enrichment analysis by employing structural and functional information on families of protein domains as annotation terms. The tool is designed to analyse complete sets of results from quantitative high-throughput studies (gene expression microarrays, functional RNAi screens, etc.) without prior pre-filtering or hits-selection steps.
Functions: Filtering, Gene-set enrichment analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/phenofam/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/p/phenofam/wiki/Home/

name: SeqWords
text_content:
Tool Name: SeqWords
Description: Featherweight object for the calculation of n-mer word occurrences in a single sequence.
Functions: k-mer counting
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://search.cpan.org/dist/BioPerl-1.6.924/Bio/Tools/SeqWords.pm
Documentation: http://search.cpan.org/dist/BioPerl-1.6.924/Bio/Tools/SeqWords.pm

name: SPInDel Workbench
text_content:
Tool Name: SPInDel Workbench
Description: Method for species identification in all domains of life using multiplex analysis of variable-length sequences containing multiple insertion/deletion (indel) variants.
Functions: Community profiling, Filtering, Genotyping, Indel detection, PCR primer design
Topics: DNA, Ecology, Genetic variation, Probes and primers, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.portugene.com/SPInDel/SPInDel_web.html
Documentation: http://www.portugene.com/SPInDel/SPInDel_webworkbench.html#spindel-version-1-1-documentation-1-february-2012

name: GelQuest
text_content:
Tool Name: GelQuest
Description: Software for the analysis of DNA fingerprints (AFLP, t-RFLP, RAPD, ERIC-PCR, RFLP-PCR). It works in a fast and efficient way with trace files (FSA files) as well as with gel image files (TIFF, JPG, BMP, etc.) and handles AFLP, t-RFLP, ERIC-PCR, RFLP-PCR or RAPD data.
Functions: Image analysis
Topics: DNA, Laboratory techniques, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.sequentix.de/gelquest/index.php
Documentation: http://www.sequentix.de/gelquest/features.php

name: Stellar
text_content:
Tool Name: Stellar
Description: A local pairwise aligner that has full sensitivity, i.e. guarantees to report all matches of a given minimal length and maximal error rate. The aligner is composed of two steps, filtering and verification. For filtering it applies the SWIFT algorithm, for which we have developed a new, exact verification strategy.
Functions: Alignment, Filtering
Topics: Data quality management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.seqan.de/projects/stellar/
Documentation: https://github.com/seqan/seqan/tree/master/apps/stellar

name: ProSpect
text_content:
Tool Name: ProSpect
Description: Software of using Ciphergen outcome files to reduce the count of peaks to a biological more interesting subset.
Functions: Filtering, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Data management, Proteins
Homepage: http://fafner.meb.ki.se/personal/yudpaw/?page_id=13
Documentation: http://fafner.meb.ki.se/personal/yudpaw/?page_id=13

name: Kpath
text_content:
Tool Name: Kpath
Description: Reference-based compression software of short read data sets.
Functions: Formatting
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~ckingsf/software/pathenc/
Documentation: http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~ckingsf/software/pathenc/

name: A5-miseq
text_content:
Tool Name: A5-miseq
Description: De novo assembly & analysis of Illumina sequence data, including the A5 pipeline, A5-miseq, tools to evaluate assembly quality, and scripts to facilitate data submission to NCBI and the RAST annotation system
Functions: De-novo assembly, Deposition, Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/ngopt/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/ngopt/

name: MutDB
text_content:
Tool Name: MutDB
Description: Database that associates protein structural information with mutations and polymorphisms in gene sequences. The data is derived from dbSNP and Swiss-Prot, and can be browsed by gene name or searched by keyword or by various identifiers.
Functions: Polymorphism detection, Protein modelling (mutation), Protein structure assignment, Sequence similarity search, Structure database search
Topics: Gene structure, Genetic variation, Protein structure analysis, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.mutdb.org/
Documentation: http://www.mutdb.org/

name: Patchwork
text_content:
Tool Name: Patchwork
Description: Bioinformatic tool for analyzing and visualizing allele-specific copy numbers and loss-of-heterozygosity in cancer genomes. The data input is in the format of whole-genome sequencing data which enables characterization of genomic alterations ranging in size from point mutations to entire chromosomes. High quality results are obtained even if samples have low coverage, low tumor cell content or are aneuploid. The first takes BAM files as input whereas CG takes input from CompleteGenomics files.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: DNA structural variation, Genomics
Homepage: http://patchwork.r-forge.r-project.org/
Documentation: http://patchwork.r-forge.r-project.org/

name: kmx
text_content:
Tool Name: kmx
Description: Count the occurrences of k-mers in biological sequences (Fastq or Fasta formatted). It can then perform various analyses on the generated indices. The counting is resource intensive, but this tool can divide the computation up, so that it can be run as sequential parts (to fit in memory), in parallel (to exploit multiple CPUs), or distributed (to use a cluster of computers).
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Molecular biology
Homepage: http://github.com/ketil-malde/kmx
Documentation: http://github.org/ketil-malde/kmx

name: VariantBam
text_content:
Tool Name: VariantBam
Description: Tool to extract/count specific sets of sequencing reads from next-generational sequencing files.
Functions: Filtering, Sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Sequencing
Homepage: https://github.com/jwalabroad/VariantBam
Documentation: https://github.com/walaj/VariantBam

name: BioSequenceAssembler
text_content:
Tool Name: BioSequenceAssembler
Description: BioSequenceAssembler is intended for use by biologist and laboratory technicians who are responsible for managing next-generation genomic sequencing data for alignment, assembly, and/or BLAST identification.
Functions: Alignment, Generation, Sequence assembly
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bio.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=sequenceassembler&referringTitle=sampleapps&ANCHOR#sampleapps
Documentation: https://github.com/dotnetbio/bio

name: H3LooPred
text_content:
Tool Name: H3LooPred
Description: Open source package for the accurate structure prediction of antibodies H3 loop ( third hypervariable loop ). The method is based on random forest automatic learning and a knowledge-based potential derived from known antibody structures.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein structure prediction
Topics: Immunoproteins, genes and antigens, Machine learning, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://www.biocomputing.it/H3Loopred/
Documentation: http://circe.med.uniroma1.it/H3Loopred/README.txt

name: PubServer
text_content:
Tool Name: PubServer
Description: PubServer collects homologous sequences from NR database and retrieves and filters associated publications.
Functions: Data retrieval, Filtering, Protein feature detection, Protein modelling, Query and retrieval
Topics: Gene and protein families, Molecular modelling, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://pubserver.burnham.org/
Documentation: http://pubserver.burnham.org/help.html

name: Barcode generator
text_content:
Tool Name: Barcode generator
Description: The program generates barcodes for sequences suitable for Illumina sequencing.
Functions: Community profiling, Random sequence generation, Sequence analysis, Sequence editing
Topics: Data identity and mapping, Sequence composition, complexity and repeats, Sequencing
Homepage: http://comailab.genomecenter.ucdavis.edu/index.php/Barcode_generator
Documentation: http://comailab.genomecenter.ucdavis.edu/index.php/Barcode_generator

name: canceR
text_content:
Tool Name: canceR
Description: This package is a user friendly interface based on the cgdsr and other modeling packages to explore, compare, and analyse all available cancer data (Clinical data, Gene Mutation, Gene Methylation, Gene Expression, Protein Phosphorylation, Copy Number Alteration) hosted by the Computational Biology Center at Memorial-Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC).
Functions: Analysis, Comparison, Data handling
Topics: Data visualisation, Genetics, Oncology
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/canceR.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/canceR.html

name: pcaExplorer
text_content:
Tool Name: pcaExplorer
Description: This package provides functionality for interactive visualization of RNA-seq datasets based on Principal Components Analysis. The methods provided allow for quick information extraction and effective data exploration. A Shiny application encapsulates the whole analysis.
Functions: Principal component plotting
Topics: Data visualisation, Gene expression, RNA-Seq, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/pcaExplorer.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/pcaExplorer.html

name: IVAS
text_content:
Tool Name: IVAS
Description: Identification of genetic variants affecting alternative splicing.
Functions: Analysis, Visualisation
Topics: RNA splicing, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/IVAS.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/IVAS.html

name: PatMatch
text_content:
Tool Name: PatMatch
Description: PatMatch is a pattern matching tool that allows you to search for short (<20 residues) nucleotide or peptide sequences and can accomodate ambiguous/degenerate patterns.
Functions: Database search, Protein sequence analysis, Sequence ambiguity calculation
Topics: DNA, Sequencing, Small molecules
Homepage: http://www.arabidopsis.org/cgi-bin/patmatch/nph-patmatch.pl
Documentation:

name: ArrayAnalysis.org
text_content:
Tool Name: ArrayAnalysis.org
Description: ArrayAnalysis.org is a web server for quality control and pre-processing analysis of Affymetrix gene expression results by extending, integrating and harmonizing functionality of Bioconductor packages. The tool may also be downloaded for use in R.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Gene expression analysis, Sequencing quality control, Validation
Topics: ChIP-on-chip, Data architecture, analysis and design, Gene expression, Microarray experiment, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.arrayanalysis.org
Documentation: http://www.arrayanalysis.org

name: Genominator
text_content:
Tool Name: Genominator
Description: Tools for storing, accessing, analyzing and visualizing genomic data.
Functions: Deposition, Genome visualisation, Sequence analysis
Topics: Data management, Genomics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Genominator.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Genominator.html

name: RiboProfiling
text_content:
Tool Name: RiboProfiling
Description: Starting with a BAM file, this package provides the necessary functions for quality assessment, read start position recalibration, the counting of reads on CDS, 3'UTR, and 5'UTR, plotting of count data: pairs, log fold-change, codon frequency and coverage assessment, principal component analysis on codon coverage.
Functions: Codon usage analysis
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RiboProfiling.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RiboProfiling.html

name: RTCGA
text_content:
Tool Name: RTCGA
Description: The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) Data Portal provides a platform for researchers to search, download, and analyze data sets generated by TCGA. It contains clinical information, genomic characterization data and high level sequence analysis of the tumor genomes.
Functions: Data retrieval, Database search, Formatting
Topics: Genomics, Oncology
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RTCGA.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/RTCGA.html

name: Uniquorn
text_content:
Tool Name: Uniquorn
Description: This packages enables users to identify cancer cell lines based on the locations of somatic and germline mutations. The implemented method is optimized for the next-generation whole exome and whole genome DNA-sequencing technology.
Functions: Genetic variation analysis, Sequence comparison, Statistical calculation
Topics: Exome sequencing, Genetic variation, Genomics, Oncology, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Uniquorn.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Uniquorn.html

name: BadRegionFinder
text_content:
Tool Name: BadRegionFinder
Description: This package identifies regions with a bad, acceptable and good coverage in sequence alignment data available as bam files. The whole genome may be considered as well as a set of target regions. Various visual and textual types of output are available.
Functions: Analysis, Sequence alignment
Topics: Genomics, Nucleic acids, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BadRegionFinder.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/BadRegionFinder.html

name: Imetagene
text_content:
Tool Name: Imetagene
Description: This package provide a graphical user interface to the metagene package. This will allow people with minimal R experience to easily complete metagene analysis.
Functions: Analysis, Design
Topics: Experimental design and studies, Genetics, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Imetagene.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/Imetagene.html

name: metagene
text_content:
Tool Name: metagene
Description: This package produces metagenic plots to compare the behavior of DNA-interacting proteins at selected groups of genes/features. Bam files are used to increase the resolution. Multiple combination of group of bam files and/or group of genomic regions can be compared in a single analysis. Bootstraping analysis is used to compare the groups and locate regions with statistically different enrichment profiles.
Functions: Analysis, Visualisation
Topics: Genetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/metagene.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/metagene.html

name: GenRank
text_content:
Tool Name: GenRank
Description: Methods for ranking genes based on convergent evidence obtained from multiple independent evidence layers. This package adapts three methods that are popular for meta-analysis.
Functions: Sequence feature comparison
Topics: Genetics
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenRank.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/GenRank.html

name: Pegasys
text_content:
Tool Name: Pegasys
Description: Pegasys is a a flexible, modular and customizable software system that coordinates the execution of multiple biological sequence analysis tools and facilitates the integration of their output. The software allows users to create analysis workflows using a graphical user interface. Adaptors are included for various software tools.
Functions: Data handling, Filtering, Sequence analysis
Topics: DNA, Gene transcripts, Sequence analysis, Software engineering
Homepage: http://www.bioextract.org/query/index.jsp
Documentation: https://www.bioextract.org/help/index.jsp

name: Alignment-Annotator
text_content:
Tool Name: Alignment-Annotator
Description: Alignment Annotator is a web service which annotates and renders sequence alignments using annotation services and the PDB. The annotated and colorized alignment can be downloaded as an interactive HTML file for web browsers.
Functions: Sequence alignment, Sequence visualisation, Visualisation
Topics: Data visualisation, Molecular interactions, pathways and networks, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.bioinformatics.org/strap/aa/
Documentation: http://www.bioinformatics.org/strap/aa/aaScriptDemo.php

name: PHIRE
text_content:
Tool Name: PHIRE
Description: Phage In silico Regulatory Elements (PHIRE) is a standalone program in Visual Basic which performs a string-based search on bacteriophage genome sequences discovering and extracting blocks displaying sequence similarity corresponding to conserved regulatory elements contained within these genomes.
Functions: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
Topics: Gene regulation, Genomics, Protein interaction experiment, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.biw.kuleuven.be/logt/PHIRE.htm
Documentation: https://www.biw.kuleuven.be/logt/PHIRE.htm

name: CRUNCH
text_content:
Tool Name: CRUNCH
Description: A completely automated pipe-line for ChIP-seq data analysis, starting from raw sequencing reads, through quality filtering, read mapping, fragment size estimation, peak calling, peak annotation and comprehensive regulatory motif analysis. It runs with data from human (hg19), mouse (mm9) or drosophila (dm3).
Functions: Sequence analysis, Transcription factor binding site prediction
Topics: ChIP-seq, Sequence sites, features and motifs, Systems biology
Homepage: https://crunch.unibas.ch
Documentation: https://crunch.unibas.ch/fcgi/crunch.fcgi

name: PACMAN
text_content:
Tool Name: PACMAN
Description: Generates publication quality images of methylated motifs counts, locations and non-methylated locations, on one or both strands of the DNA. The user can apply several filters on the gff data to avoid bad quality modifications or low coverage, for example. The optional filters are the IPDratio, the coverage and the identification quality value (idqv). This web page requires upload of a bacterial full or draft genome, together with the motifs.gff file of a PacBio sequencing analysis.
Functions: Visualisation
Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.unifr.ch/bugfri/pacman
Documentation:

name: Pipeline Pilot
text_content:
Tool Name: Pipeline Pilot
Description: Analysis and workflow development of Next Generation Sequencing and gene expression.
Functions: Gene expression analysis, Read mapping, Sequence alignment, Sequence analysis, Variant calling
Topics: ChIP-seq, Genomics, RNA-Seq, Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly, Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://accelrys.com/products/pipeline-pilot/component-collections.html
Documentation: http://accelrys.com/products/collaborative-science/biovia-pipeline-pilot/component-collections/index.html

name: TransView
text_content:
Tool Name: TransView
Description: This package provides efficient tools to generate, access and display read densities of sequencing based data sets such as from RNA-Seq and ChIP-Seq.
Functions: Formatting, RNA-Seq analysis, Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: ChIP-seq, Mapping, RNA-Seq, Workflows
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TransView.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/TransView.html

name: ampliQueso
text_content:
Tool Name: ampliQueso
Description: The package provides tools and reports for the analysis of amplicon sequencing panels, such as AmpliSeq.
Functions: Sequence analysis
Topics: Nucleic acids, PCR experiment, Proteins, Sequencing
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ampliQueso.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/ampliQueso.html

name: sequins
text_content:
Tool Name: sequins
Description: Performs sequence validation by comparing the model side chains against the electron density. It may be run with phases from experimental phasing, or it can calculate its own phases using a side-chain-omit process. In this case it can be used after molecular replacement, or to validate structures in the PDB.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: Molecular modelling, Proteins, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ysbl.york.ac.uk/~cowtan/sequins/sequins.html
Documentation: http://www.ysbl.york.ac.uk/~cowtan/sequins/csequins.html

name: PatentIn
text_content:
Tool Name: PatentIn
Description: Facilitates the creation of sequence listings for inclusion in patent applications sequences. It accepts data about the sequences validates the data, creates a sequence listing file and a mechanism for printing out and saving to removable medium for submission.
Functions: Formatting, Sequence analysis
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.uspto.gov/patents-getting-started/patent-basics/types-patent-applications/utility-patent/checker/patentin
Documentation: https://www.uspto.gov/patents-getting-started/patent-basics/types-patent-applications/utility-patent/patentin-version-351

name: Kipper
text_content:
Tool Name: Kipper
Description: The basic command-line file versioning solution is a key-value data store that keeps track of when particular items are inserted or deleted (updates are deletes followed by inserts).It can recall versions by date or version id. It can keep versions in one or more volume files.
Functions: Formatting
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis
Homepage: https://github.com/Public-Health-Bioinformatics/kipper
Documentation: https://github.com/Public-Health-Bioinformatics/kipper

name: SDDA
text_content:
Tool Name: SDDA
Description: Program that uses a stochastic dictionary model to search for transcription factor binding sites (motifs) in DNA sequences. The algorithm is capable of detecting multiple motif sites of multiple types, gapped motifs, finding the optimal motif width, and calculating motif significance through a MAP score and the Bayes factor using computational methods.
Functions: Transcription factor binding site prediction
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Transcription factors and regulatory sites
Homepage: http://www.stats.gla.ac.uk/~mgupta/publications.htm
Documentation:

name: Pintail
text_content:
Tool Name: Pintail
Description: Program for detecting and analysing 16S rRNA chimeras and other anomalies. Pintail is a tool for identifying anomalies, including chimeras, within 16S rDNA sequences. The program works by comparing evolutionary distances between a query and subject sequence over the length of the 16S rRNA gene (small subunit rRNA), by employing a sampling window of specified size, progressing a fixed number of bases at a time along the length of the gene.
Functions: Query and retrieval
Topics: RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.softpedia.com/get/Science-CAD/Pintail.shtml
Documentation:

name: MARBL
text_content:
Tool Name: MARBL
Description: MARBL is an open-source package for indexing the text components of GenBank records and the NLM article abstracts associated with them. A few demonstrations of the package are also available at this website.
Functions: Data retrieval, Text mining
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing, Whole genome sequencing
Homepage: http://www.cs.uni.edu/~okane/source/MARBL/proc1.html
Documentation:

name: QCluster
text_content:
Tool Name: QCluster
Description: NGS reads clustering
Functions: Sequence assembly, Sequence clustering
Topics: Sequence analysis, Sequence assembly
Homepage: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/qcluster.html
Documentation: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/qcluster.html

name: UnderlyingFilter
text_content:
Tool Name: UnderlyingFilter
Description: Filtering Degenerate Motifs with Application to Protein Sequence Analysis
Functions: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
Topics: Sequence sites, features and motifs
Homepage: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/filtering.html
Documentation: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~ciompin/main/filtering.html

name: PyCogent
text_content:
Tool Name: PyCogent
Description: Software library for genomic biology. It is a fully integrated and thoroughly tested framework for: controlling third-party applications; devising workflows; querying databases; conducting novel probabilistic analyses of biological sequence evolution; and generating publication quality graphics. It is distinguished by many unique built-in capabilities (such as true codon alignment) and the frequent addition of entirely new methods for the analysis of genomic data.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Biology
Homepage: http://pycogent.org/
Documentation: http://pycogent.org/install.html

name: HomoloSampler
text_content:
Tool Name: HomoloSampler
Description: This is a command line tool for sampling related sequences from Ensembl. It requires PyCogent, Numpy, SQLAlchemy, PyMysql, Click and SciTrack. At present, this tool provides capabilities to support sampling one-to-one orthologs from protein coding genes stored in an Ensembl MySQl database. It can either write out the protein coding sequences from the canonical CDS, or it can write out the Ensembl multiple sequence alignment of the entire gene with annotated features masked.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Biology
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/pycogent3/homologsampler
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/pycogent3/homologsampler

name: QIIME
text_content:
Tool Name: QIIME
Description: Open-source bioinformatics pipeline for performing microbiome analysis from raw DNA sequencing data. The pipeline is designed to take users from raw sequencing data generated on the Illumina or other platforms through publication quality graphics and statistics. This includes demultiplexing and quality filtering, OTU picking, taxonomic assignment, and phylogenetic reconstruction, and diversity analyses and visualizations.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Biology
Homepage: http://qiime.org/
Documentation: http://qiime.org/tutorials/index.html

name: MutationMotif
text_content:
Tool Name: MutationMotif
Description: This library provides capabilities for analysis of mutation properties. Two different analysis approaches are supported: (1) log-linear analysis of neighbourhood base influences on mutation coupled with a sequence logo like representation of influences; (2) log-linear analysis of mutation spectra, the relative proportions of different mutation directioons from a starting base. A logo-like visualisation of the latter is also supported.
Functions: Analysis
Topics: Biology
Homepage: https://bitbucket.org/pycogent3/mutationmotif
Documentation: https://bitbucket.org/pycogent3/mutationmotif

name: oligoClasses
text_content:
Tool Name: oligoClasses
Description: This package contains class definitions, validity checks, and initialization methods for classes used by the oligo and crlmm packages.
Functions: Classification, Deposition
Topics: Probes and primers, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/oligoClasses.html
Documentation: http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/oligoClasses.html

name: BioFace
text_content:
Tool Name: BioFace
Description: A simple software for editing and analyzing DNA, RNA, and protein sequences that is written in Java using SWT and JFace as libraries. Opening GenBank, FASTA, EMBL, or simple sequence files and analizing these sequences can be done.
Functions: Sequence editing
Topics: DNA, RNA, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://y-s.wikidot.com/bioface
Documentation:

name: BARCOD
text_content:
Tool Name: BARCOD
Description: Encodes a multiple alignment according to the method developed by Véronique Barriel (C.R.Acad.Sci.III 317(7):693-701).From a an existing alignment (which will not be changed) BARCOD builds a character matrix suitable for use in phylogeny recontstruction programs. The method allows to encode each insertion/deletion event as one single event (whatever the number of nucleotides involved), while retaining any indel common to two or more taxa as a possibly shared character.
Functions: Multiple sequence alignment
Topics: Phylogenetics, Phylogeny, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://wwwabi.snv.jussieu.fr/public/Barcod/
Documentation: http://wwwabi.snv.jussieu.fr/public/Barcod/download.html

name: Ea-utils
text_content:
Tool Name: Ea-utils
Description: FASTQ processing utilities
Functions: Sequence merging, Sequence trimming, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data management, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: https://expressionanalysis.github.io/ea-utils/
Documentation: https://github.com/ExpressionAnalysis/ea-utils/blob/wiki/FastqMcf.md

name: CORAL (Contig Ordering Algorithm)
text_content:
Tool Name: CORAL (Contig Ordering Algorithm)
Description: An algorithm for ordering fingerprinted clones within contigs.
Functions: Physical mapping, Sequence analysis
Topics: Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bcgsc.ca/platform/bioinfo/software/coral/
Documentation: http://www.bcgsc.ca/platform/bioinfo/software/coral/

name: Partek Genomics Suite
text_content:
Tool Name: Partek Genomics Suite
Description: Easy to use software providing A to Z analysis for all Next Generation Sequencing and Microarray data.
Functions: RNA-Seq quantification
Topics: ChIP-seq, Epigenomics, Functional genomics, RNA splicing, Transcriptomics
Homepage: http://www.partek.com
Documentation: http://www.partek.com/softwareoverview

name: Phred
text_content:
Tool Name: Phred
Description: The software reads DNA sequencing trace files, calls bases, and assigns a quality value to each called base.
Functions: Base-calling, Formatting, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Data mining, Genomics, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.phrap.org/phredphrapconsed.html
Documentation: http://www.phrap.org/phredphrap/phred.html

name: QSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: QSeq
Description: DNASTAR's Next-Gen application for RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, and miRNA alignment and analysis.
Functions: Peak calling, Sequence alignment, Visualisation
Topics: ChIP-seq, Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA, RNA-Seq
Homepage: http://www.dnastar.com/t-nextgen-qseq.aspx/
Documentation: http://www.dnastar.com/t-nextgen-qseq.aspx/

name: Bcbio-nextgen
text_content:
Tool Name: Bcbio-nextgen
Description: Python scripts and modules for automated next gen sequencing analysis. These provide a fully automated pipeline for taking sequencing results from an Illumina sequencer, converting them to standard Fastq format, aligning to a reference genome, doing SNP calling, and producing a summary PDF of results.
Functions: Filtering, Genome comparison, Genotyping, Peak calling, Read mapping, Sequence alignment, Sequence motif recognition, Sequence trimming, Sequencing quality control
Topics: Workflows
Homepage: https://github.com/chapmanb/bcbb/blob/master/nextgen/README.md
Documentation: https://bcbio-nextgen.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

name: MiRspring
text_content:
Tool Name: MiRspring
Description: The product of this pipeline creates a miRspring document, which essentiallyis a small HTML javascript file. Each miRspring document has been developed in such a way that it reproduces miRNA sequencing data from a BAM file. Additionally it provides unique analysis tools, and does not need internet connectivity for these processes.
Functions: Formatting

Protegen includes basic antigen information and experimental evidence curated from peer-reviewed articles. It also includes detailed gene/protein information (e.g. DNA and protein sequences, and COG classification). Different antigen features, such as protein weight and pI, and subcellular localizations of bacterial proteins are precomputed.

The design of this API is intended to match the python API and other tools included with the biom-format project, but with a decidedly "R flavor" that should be familiar to R users. This includes S4 classes and methods, as well as extensions of common core functions/methods.

name: npSeq
text_content:
Tool Name: npSeq
Description: R package for the significance analysis of sequencing data.  The statistic used is exactly the same as that in SAM 4.0. The only difference is that our tool uses symmetric cutoffs, while SAM uses asymmetric cutoffs. Therefore, for some datasets, all significant genes obtained by SAM are either all up-regulated or all down-regulated, but npSeq almost always gives significant genes that include both up-regulated genes and down-regulated genes.
Functions: Analysis, Statistical calculation
Topics: DNA, Sequencing, Statistics and probability
Homepage: http://www3.nd.edu/~jli9/research.html#npseq
Documentation: https://www3.nd.edu/~jli9/npSeq/npseq-manual.pdf

name: Sequence Searcher
text_content:
Tool Name: Sequence Searcher
Description: Easy-to-use Java tool for searching protein and DNA sequences for user specified sequence motifs.  The Sequence Searcher can search multiple sequences in a single pass.  The target sequences may be imported from your computer in FASTA format or you can manually paste the sequence(s) into a text window.
Functions: Database search
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequence sites, features and motifs

Homepage: http://genocanyon.med.yale.edu/
Documentation: http://genocanyon.med.yale.edu/GenoCanyon_FAQ.html

name: NUCwave
text_content:

Documentation: http://nucleosome.usal.es/nucwave/

name: UniGene gene-oriented nucleotide sequence clusters
text_content:
Tool Name: UniGene gene-oriented nucleotide sequence clusters
Description: Each entry is a set of transcript (expressed sequence tag) sequences that appear to come from the same transcription locus (gene or expressed pseudogene), together with information on protein similarities, gene expression, cDNA clone reagents, and genomic location.

Topics: Gene and protein families, Gene transcripts, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sites/entrez?db=UniGene

name: SAMSVM
text_content:
Tool Name: SAMSVM
Description: Applying the LIBSVM, a package of support vector machine, this tool was developed to correctly detect and filter the misaligned reads of SAM format. Such filtration can reduce false positives in alignment and the following variant analysis.
Functions: Analysis, Sequence contamination filtering
Topics: DNA, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://sourceforge.net/projects/samsvm/
Documentation: https://sourceforge.net/projects/samsvm/?source=navbar

name: eBLOCKS
text_content:
Tool Name: eBLOCKS
Description: eBLOCKS is a database of 80,000 conserved protein regions from 20,000 aligned protein families assembled using PSI-BLAST. eBLOCKs lets you compare new proteins to this database of conserved sequences using either eMOTIFs or eMATRICES made from eBLOCKs.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Protein families, Proteins, Sequences
Homepage: http://motif.stanford.edu/distributions/eblocks/index.html
Documentation:

name: GeneWall Genome Browser
text_content:

Homepage: http://www.wobblebase.com/#
Documentation:

name: LINKMFEX
text_content:
Tool Name: LINKMFEX
Description: A set of programs will allow you to analyze the segregation results from pairwise sets of loci in outbred families for possible linkage relationships. The same input data file may be used to analyze linkage relationships among loci using either parent as the mapping parent.
Functions: Linkage analysis

Homepage: http://www.uoguelph.ca/~rdanzman/software.htm
Documentation:

name: FAssign
text_content:
Tool Name: FAssign

Documentation:

name: Ribo
text_content:

name: STORM
text_content:
Tool Name: STORM
Description: The tool combines protein analyses of BLAST, FASTA, Pfam and ProtParam on a batch-file of protein sequences. It subsequently summarizes and organizes the output in an Access database format.More specifically, it extracts protein sequences after ORF prediction and subsequently performs an automatic analysis for each of the proteins. This analysis consists of web-based similarity searches as well as Pfam predictions and Protparam calculations of protein physicochemical properties.
Functions: Protein property calculation, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Proteins, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.biw.kuleuven.be/logt/STORM.htm
Documentation: https://www.biw.kuleuven.be/logt/STORM.htm

name: Mgenome
text_content:
Tool Name: Mgenome
Description: Designed to find the optimal trees for multiple genome rearrangement by signed reversals. The problem is modeled as: For a given collection of genomes represented by signed permutations on genes, find a tree to connect the given genomes by reversal paths such that the number of all signed reversals is minimized.
Functions: Sequence comparison
Topics: DNA, Genomics, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://xungulab.com/software/mgenome/mgenome.html
Documentation: http://xungulab.com/software/mgenome/document/readme.html

name: MAPanalyzer
text_content:
Tool Name: MAPanalyzer
Description: MAP (Microtubule-associated Proteins) analysis tool.
Functions: Data handling, Sequence motif discovery
Topics: Cell biology, Data submission, annotation and curation, Proteins
Homepage: http://systbio.cau.edu.cn/mappred/
Documentation: http://systbio.cau.edu.cn/mappred/about.php

name: PatchD
text_content:
Tool Name: PatchD
Description: Calculates Information statistics for protein sequence alignments to find coevolving residues.
Functions: Alignment, Analysis

Homepage: http://wwwlabs.uhnresearch.ca/tillier/PatchDWEB/PatchDWEP.php
Documentation: http://wwwlabs.uhnresearch.ca/tillier/software.htm#9

name: FSWeight
text_content:
Tool Name: FSWeight
Description: Software for inferring the function of proteins based on its indirect interaction partners. Its sensitivity and precision are superior to Neighbour Counting, Chi2, PRODISTIN, Functional Flow, and Markov Random Field approaches. It can also be used for ranking the reliability of individual protein interactions.
Functions: Protein function prediction, Protein sequence analysis
Topics: Function analysis, Protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~wongls/projects/functionprediction/index.html
Documentation: http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/~wongls/projects/functionprediction/index.html

name: BeAtMuSiC
text_content:
Tool Name: BeAtMuSiC
Description: This program evaluates the change in binding affinity between proteins (or protein chains) caused by single-site mutations in their sequence.
Functions: Protein sequence analysis, Protein-protein interaction prediction
Topics: DNA mutation, Protein interactions, Proteins
Homepage: http://babylone.ulb.ac.be/beatmusic
Documentation: http://babylone.ulb.ac.be/beatmusic/help.php

name: 4peaks
text_content:
Tool Name: 4peaks

Topics: Sequencing

Documentation:

text_content:

Documentation: http://www.iitm.ac.in/bioinfo/PPA_Pred/help.html

text_content:
Tool Name: iPPBS-PseAAC

name: TACT
text_content:
Tool Name: TACT
Description: Automated tool for conducting functional annotation of transcripts that integrates sequence similarity searches and functional motif predictions. It was originally developed as an automatic annotation pipeline for the Human Full-length cDNA Annotation Invitational (H-Inv) project.
Functions: Gene prediction, Protein fold recognition, Protein modelling (mutation), Sequence motif analysis, Sequence similarity search
Topics: DNA polymorphism, Gene expression, Gene transcripts, Genetic variation, Humans
Homepage: http://jbirc.jbic.or.jp/tact/
Documentation:

name: WebGMAP
text_content:
Tool Name: WebGMAP
Description: A web server with a suite of tools for cDNA-genome alignment, visualization and mining. The sequence viewer allows for nucleotide positioning, 6-frame translations, sequence reverse complementation and imperfect motif detection and alignment. Users can also sort, filter and search for individual cDNA sequences or alignments.
Functions: Bisulfite mapping, Filtering, Sequence alignment, Sequence motif recognition
Topics: DNA, Gene transcripts, Mapping, Sequence analysis, Sequencing
Homepage: http://www.bioinfolab.org/software/webgmap
Documentation:

name: Asterias
text_content:
Tool Name: Asterias
Description: Set of tools for the analyses of high throughput genomic data that includes applications for microarray data normalization, filtering, detection of differential gene expression, class and survival prediction model building, and analysis of array CGH data. Most applications use parallel computing resulting in significant increases in speed.
Functions: Differential gene expression analysis, Filtering, Gene expression analysis
Topics: Gene expression, Microarray experiment, Sequencing
Homepage: http://asterias.bioinfo.cnio.es/
Documentation:

name: 3DNALandscapes
text_content:
Tool Name: 3DNALandscapes
Description: Database for exploring the conformational features of DNA. It enables searches of conformational information across multiple structures. The database contains a wide variety of structural parameters and molecular images, computed with the 3DNA software package and known to be useful for characterizing and understanding the sequence-dependent spatial arrangements of the DNA sugar-phosphate backbone, sugar-base side groups, base pairs, base-pair steps, groove structure, etc.
Functions: DNA structure prediction, Deposition, Protein structural motif recognition, Structural similarity search, Structure database search
Topics: DNA, Imaging, Protein structural motifs and surfaces, Structure analysis, Structure prediction
Homepage: http://dcp.rutgers.edu
Documentation:

name: The SBT (Sequencing-based typing) interface
text_content:
Tool Name: The SBT (Sequencing-based typing) interface 
Description: Tool accompanying the NCBI&apos,s Major Histocompatibility Complex database (dbMHC). It identifies the allelic composition of sequence-based typing (SBT) results of cDNA or genomic sequences. Samples are compared with databases containing all known alleles for several human leukocyte antigen (HLA) and killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptors (KIR) loci. An interactive sequence viewer allows inspection of the alignments.
Functions: Alignment
Topics: Gene transcripts, Genetic variation, Humans, Immunoproteins, genes and antigens, Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gv/mhc/sbt.cgi?cmd=main
Documentation:

name: SDRDB
text_content:
Tool Name: SDRDB
Description: Short-chain dehydrogenases/reductases database.

Topics: Sequence analysis
Homepage: http://www.bioinfo.ifm.liu.se/services/sdr/
Documentation:

name: cons WS (husar)

Documentation: http://genius.embnet.dkfz-heidelberg.de/menu/hobit/embdoc/cons.html

Tool Name: supermatcher WS (husar)

name: MisMax
text_content:
Tool Name: MisMax
Description: A tool for the computation of the similarity matrix among a set of sequences. The tool uses an alignment-free approach to compute sequence similarity measures based on shared maximal words allowing mismatches.
Functions: Sequence alignment analysis
Topics: Phylogenetics
Homepage: http://www.dei.unipd.it/~twins/sw/MisMax.html
Documentation:
